excerpts: They have your traditional egg any style breakfast, tasty waffles, and some Mexican style staples.
I will admit that my sausage, although bursting with flavor, was a bit overcooked.
Fair prices and an alternative staff create a well-rounded diner.
Only low point is that it is overrun with Class 5 Hipsters, but sometimes that just adds to the entertainment.
egg any style.author: m p.
egg any style.review: A great little diner that did the retro thing right. They refurbished the existing hardware and recreated your typical decorations and are well stocked in candies from a long ago era. However, atmosphere is not all St. Francis has to offer. They have your traditional egg any style breakfast, tasty waffles, and some Mexican style staples. I will admit that my sausage, although bursting with flavor, was a bit overcooked. Fair prices and an alternative staff create a well-rounded diner. Only low point is that it is overrun with Class 5 Hipsters, but sometimes that just adds to the entertainment.

excerpts: I went with the Cheese Omelet w/ Jack Cheese, Sausage & Spinach ($8.50) and substituted the homefries for fruit.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=8-4ip_RG5nlesdN-19dNog#jgh1aNh3Bw5YrkaQMrXu0w
My fluffy omelet was filled with just the right amount of cheese for that slight oozing effect once cut.
The sausage gave a rich porky bite while the spinach was added just to make me feel better from the cholesterol-filled dish.
Umm, at least it was Atkins-friendly (I didn't eat the bread)? =
cheese omelet.author: Cherylynn N.
cheese omelet.review:
"My family is going to be so happy that you're 'refining' me..."

Attempt #1: Foie gras at Fifth Floor: *disgusted look*

Attempt #2: Sushi at Ino: "So how is this different from Sushi Rock?"

Attempt #3: Wine tasting in Napa: "BIG BOY SHOTS!" *chugs and pounds fist on table*

FAIL. Hey, at least I tried. 

OK, Back to Basics...

Founded in 1918, St. Francis Fountain operated as a candy store and ice cream parlor. 10 years ago, the current owners installed a kitchen turning St. Francis Fountain into a greasy spoon diner while keep the nostalgia of the early 1900s ice cream parlor with swirly retro stools. Serving breakfast ALL day, St. Francis Fountain has an extensive all-American breakfast menu with weekend specials (5 eggs benedict variations), a nice vegan selection, and $4 mimosas! They also have soups, salads, sandwiches and burgers on the menu. Don't forget to stop by their candy counter to revive the fat kid in you (mines never left) with Pop Rocks, Necco Wafers, Ring Pops and Sugar Daddys. 

Since Mr. NSS loves breakfast food, I thought St. Francis Fountain would be a great place to bring him. Do expect a wait on the weekends. On a Sunday afternoon at 2:30 PM, there was still a 10-15 minute wait. On the bright side, parking is much easier in this part of The Mission and Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is just several blocks away.

While enjoying the 80s and 90s throwbacks playing in the background, Mr. NSS had the Chef's Mess ($10) which was an artery-clogging behemoth of a thing in a bowl. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=8-4ip_RG5nlesdN-19dNog#8-4ip_RG5nlesdN-19dNog Crispy homefries with scrambled eggs, bacon, and mushrooms topped with melted cheese, tomatoes & sour cream. If that wasn't enough, he added avocado (+$1.50) and KILLED the entire thing. How he doesn't gain weight is beyond me. *shakes fist* I went with the Cheese Omelet w/ Jack Cheese, Sausage & Spinach ($8.50) and substituted the homefries for fruit. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=8-4ip_RG5nlesdN-19dNog#jgh1aNh3Bw5YrkaQMrXu0w My fluffy omelet was filled with just the right amount of cheese for that slight oozing effect once cut. The sausage gave a rich porky bite while the spinach was added just to make me feel better from the cholesterol-filled dish. Umm, at least it was Atkins-friendly (I didn't eat the bread)? =X

Service was friendly enough and drink refills were promptly made. This is very much a hipster place so make sure to come with your skinny jeans, fedora, and black-rimmed glasses. 

After several FAILED attempts of trying to "refine" Mr. NSS, I've come to terms that guys like and appreciate simplicity. I can't fathom the thought IF I had brought him to The Rotunda for brunch that day. http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-rotunda-san-francisco#hrid:KJ8pg1WEqrfmHuGxan9yiA 

*PINKY UP* anyone?

excerpts: So many vegan options and/or replacements on the menu - tofu scramble, chorizo, sausage, cheese, etc.
I had pesto tofu scramble with non-dairy pepper jack and it was flavorful without being oily or greasy!
My dad had ranchero tofu scramble and raves about it.
We split a side of the chorizo hash - SO GOOD.
Not to mention, the place has an adorable 50's diner vibe: telephone booth, a playlist filled with rolling stones + the beatles, novelty artifacts, etc.
Would recommend to any vegan looking for a hearty and unique breakfast with tons of options!!!
tofu scramble.author: Samantha O.
tofu scramble.review: AMAZING vegan breakfast!!! Breakfast is definitely the hardest meal to get right for vegans - and this place nailed it. So many vegan options and/or replacements on the menu - tofu scramble, chorizo, sausage, cheese, etc. I had pesto tofu scramble with non-dairy pepper jack and it was flavorful without being oily or greasy! My dad had ranchero tofu scramble and raves about it. We split a side of the chorizo hash - SO GOOD. Not to mention, the place has an adorable 50's diner vibe: telephone booth, a playlist filled with rolling stones + the beatles, novelty artifacts, etc. Would recommend to any vegan looking for a hearty and unique breakfast with tons of options!!!

excerpts: We had the tofu scramble with mushroom, green onion and ranchero sauce.
It came with potatoes and toast, and since my girlfriend is vegan they were kind enough to tip her off about asking for vegan butter since the toast usually comes pre-buttered.
The scramble could have had more flavor and pizazz to it, for sure.
The potatoes and veggies were great
tofu scramble.author: Alex K.
tofu scramble.review:
This was my first time and it was honestly a pretty stellar brunch experience! I love the unpretentious and cozy diner-like atmosphere and the service is friendly but quick and no nonsense. It's a small place so they seem to churn through the tables fairly quickly, but we never felt rushed and actually appreciated that we didn't have to spend our whole afternoon there. 

Anyway, on to the good stuff! We had the tofu scramble with mushroom, green onion and ranchero sauce. It came with potatoes and toast, and since my girlfriend is vegan they were kind enough to tip her off about asking for vegan butter since the toast usually comes pre-buttered. The scramble could have had more flavor and pizazz to it, for sure. The potatoes and veggies were great but I think marinating the tofu or throwing some spices on it would have really kicked things up a notch. 

On the sweet side, I had the vegan pancakes with strawberries and I can honestly say they were the best vegan pancakes I've ever had. They stood up to your standard pancake and were clearly made with love! 

I can't wait to go back and try more from the menu, and I love that they have plenty of vegan options without sacrificing diner favorites and classics. They've got something for everyone!

excerpts: My husband and I always order the tofu scramble with vegan soyrizo, spinach, mushrooms and chives.
It's always delicious.
Their house breakfast potatoes are always perfectly seasoned and crisp on the bottom and edges.
tofu scramble.author: Reese E.
tofu scramble.review:
I've come here twice now... both on a weekend around brunch time. I love that this diner has vegan breakfast! And good vegan breakfast. 

My husband and I always order the tofu scramble with vegan soyrizo, spinach, mushrooms and chives. It's always delicious. Their house breakfast potatoes are always perfectly seasoned and crisp on the bottom and edges. We also split a short stack of vegan banana walnut pancakes. I love that also, especially with the hint of cinnamon in it. It's great they give us soy milk with our coffee and vegan butter for our toast and pancakes. 

The service is great, the people that work here have always been accommodating and friendly. If you're looking for a good breakfast joint for carnivores and herbivores, this is the place for you.

excerpts: The tofu scramble is my favorite and the milkshakes are all great!
tofu scramble.author: Rishi S.
tofu scramble.review:
St. Francis Fountain is my favorite diner in the city. The decor offers a sense of nostalgia. For example, there is borax soap in the bathroom. The waitstaff is generally pleasant, especially Carlos. He's the man! 

There are plenty of vegetarian options. On a nice day, it's great to sit outside. The tofu scramble is my favorite and the milkshakes are all great!

excerpts: My friends ordered the breakfast burrito with vegan chorizo, the vegan thing with vegan chorizo and tofu scramble with mushrooms and spinach.
When the food came out and everyone had their first bites of food, we were all raving about how tasty and good everything was.
tofu scramble.author: Rosanne P.
tofu scramble.review:
My mouth is watering just thinking about the Devil's Burger I ordered today at St. Francis Fountain.  The Devil's Burger is not actually a burger but a pile of paper-thin sliced marinated and grilled seitan on burger buns.  It was the best seitan I've ever had and almost tasted like pastrami.  I added grilled onions and avocado to my sandwich it was really one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time!

My friends and I arrived at 11am on a Sunday and we were seated right away and got served coffees almost immediately which was a great way to start our brunch.  Our waitress was great and made good suggestions for my friends while they were deciding on what to order.  My friends ordered the breakfast burrito with vegan chorizo, the vegan thing with vegan chorizo and tofu scramble with mushrooms and spinach.  When the food came out and everyone had their first bites of food, we were all raving about how tasty and good everything was.  Even the coffee, which was replenished quite frequently, was delicious.

I can't wait to come back!  Definitely will be returning!

excerpts: She ended up with a tofu scramble with a ginger peanut sauce, while I opted for the Veggie mess, which was assorted veggies scrambled with eggs and veggie chorizo.
The orders came out in a reasonable time and both were delicious.
Would have liked to order a milkshake, but maybe next time.
Solid choice for a reasonably priced breakfast in the city - we'll be back!!
tofu scramble.author: Paul B.
tofu scramble.review:
We went to the St Francis Soda Fountain for breakfast on a recent visit to San Francisco and was very happy with our choice. Obviously, the diner is really old, but the interior is very clean and the staff was very friendly and attentive. We came in on a Monday morning around 10:00, and took a seat at the counter as all the booths were taken. We were immediately greeted by a server, given menus and water, then approached for our order a few minutes later.

As a vegan, my wife usually has trouble finding anything other than oatmeal or fruit for breakfast at most places. Not so at the St Francis. In addition to Vegan Pancakes(!), there was a vegan scramble with different options for sauces, and tofu could be substituted in on most of their egg dishes. She ended up with a tofu scramble with a ginger peanut sauce, while I opted for the Veggie mess, which was assorted veggies scrambled with eggs and veggie chorizo. The orders came out in a reasonable time and both were delicious. Would have liked to order a milkshake, but maybe next time. Solid choice for a reasonably priced breakfast in the city - we'll be back!!

excerpts: My favorite brunch there: oj + cranberry mimosas, the tofu scramble with pesto, red peppers and feta cheese as well as the veggie mess.
So happy I live close by to this gem.
tofu scramble.author: Cannelle H.
tofu scramble.review: Delicious food. Affordable. Old School. Great people. I love St Francis Fountain. I've been going several times and it's always a great experience. My favorite brunch there: oj + cranberry mimosas, the tofu scramble with pesto, red peppers and feta cheese as well as the veggie mess. So happy I live close by to this gem.

excerpts: I am vegan and tried the tofu  scramble with mushrooms, onions, tomatoes and ranchero sauce and my partner had the tofu scramble with peanut sauce and veggies.
tofu scramble.author: Kelsey M.
tofu scramble.review: This place was amazing! The service was awesome and fast. You do have to write your name on a clipboard out front to wait in line but it's worth it and the line moves fast! I am vegan and tried the tofu  scramble with mushrooms, onions, tomatoes and ranchero sauce and my partner had the tofu scramble with peanut sauce and veggies. They also had a vegan hash and some vegan pancakes on the menu that I will try next time we vacation here! We didn't try it, but they also have vegan soft serve and other desserts! Def a great place for vegans ( there are multiple options) and non vegans alike!

excerpts: I ordered the tofu scramble and got the vegan pancakes on the side.
They were so fluffy with a hint of cinnamon and sweetness.
I can't wait to come back, the place gave the diner's vibe that I love to be a part of.
We were also seated after a quick 10 minute wait.
It was at the bar but the staff were all so friendly and considerate.
tofu scramble.author: Megan T.
tofu scramble.review: I actually came to this spot a couple of weeks ago and fell in love.  As someone now labeled as plant based, it was amazing to be able to eat brunch with my best friend as she is an omnivore.  I ordered the tofu scramble and got the vegan pancakes on the side.  They were so fluffy with a hint of cinnamon and sweetness.  I can't wait to come back, the place gave the diner's vibe that I love to be a part of.  We were also seated after a quick 10 minute wait.  It was at the bar but the staff were all so friendly and considerate.

excerpts: I went for the "griddle combo" 2 vegan pancakes, a tofu scramble and side of fruit.
My boyfriend got the huevos rancheros and side of biscuits and crazy.
Our food came pretty quick for how busy it was, tasty, hot, SUCH BIG PORTIONS.
I was pleasantly surprised with this spot.
The flavor was spot on, service was quick, friendly, and casual.
I wouldn't recommend coming here with a large group, the tables are pretty small and there seems to only be one booth large enough to fit about 6 at once, but overall great
and I will be back!
tofu scramble.author: Kelsey B.
tofu scramble.review:
A solid 4 star experience. 
I am always looking for a place where my meat eater boyfriend and my vegan-self can go enjoy a meal together. Kodus to the server over at Soul Groove who recommended this spot to check out for brunch. St. Francis Fountain is a great little authentic diner, totally separate from pretentious brunch spots you tend to find in the Mission. 
We were seated immediately (no wait for brunch, yay!) when we arrived and greeted with some waters from the server. I went for the "griddle combo" 2 vegan pancakes, a tofu scramble and side of fruit. My boyfriend got the huevos rancheros and side of biscuits and crazy. Our food came pretty quick for how busy it was, tasty, hot, SUCH BIG PORTIONS. I was pleasantly surprised with this spot. The flavor was spot on, service was quick, friendly, and casual. 
I wouldn't recommend coming here with a large group, the tables are pretty small and there seems to only be one booth large enough to fit about 6 at once, but overall great and I will be back!

excerpts: I got the Veggie Mess with tofu scramble and made vegan (if you just ask for a menu item to be vegan they already know what to substitute for you).
Top notch!
The plates look smaller but the portions cover the whole plate to the fullest and I was stuffed.
The service was incredibly fast as well (less than a 10 minute wait for an indoor table at the iconic diner and our food arrived within 15 minutes of ordering).
I'll certainly be back with more friends!
The staff was very attentive as well.
A hidden gem in the Mission.
tofu scramble.author: Sarah E.
tofu scramble.review: Wow this place was delicious! It had a pretty solid 50/50 mix of carnivore and vegan (as well as vegetarian) menu items. I got the Veggie Mess with tofu scramble and made vegan (if you just ask for a menu item to be vegan they already know what to substitute for you). Top notch! The plates look smaller but the portions cover the whole plate to the fullest and I was stuffed. The service was incredibly fast as well (less than a 10 minute wait for an indoor table at the iconic diner and our food arrived within 15 minutes of ordering). I'll certainly be back with more friends! The staff was very attentive as well. A hidden gem in the Mission.

excerpts: Rosanne P. opted for the Devil's Burger (actually not a burger, but thinly sliced seitan), Richard A. got the Vegan Breakfast Burrito, and Laura C. ordered a killer tofu scramble with spinach and mushrooms.
tofu scramble.author: Brandi W.
tofu scramble.review:
Now I see what all the hype is about... this place is top-notch! 

I'm surprised that I have never come here, as I've had it on my list of bookmarks for quite some time, and so many of my friends are fans. I guess I'm just never in that neighborhood, so a few of us East Bay/ Contra Costa County folks hopped in a car and drove to the city specifically to grab their grub.

Surprisingly, we were able to get seated right away. I think we must have just beat the morning rush, since we did leave Walnut Creek at around 10:30 in the morning. A quick drive over the bridge, and we made it to our destination. 

First impression: cute, old-school diner atmosphere. Cozy wooden booths. Hustling and bustling, the place packed full of customers, which is usually a good sign. 

Their coffee is delicious, a mild and tasty brew, and they have soy milk for your dairy-free needs. This started off our meal on a high note, as we ordered 4 coffees and scanned the menu, our little vegan hearts pounding with excitement. 


There are plentiful vegan and vegetarian options for both breakfast and lunch, so we took our time reading over the menu. Everything looked and tasted spectacular!!! We ooh'ed and ahh'ed when the food was brought over, as our dishes were quite aesthetically appealing, especially for diner food.  

Rosanne P. opted for the Devil's Burger (actually not a burger, but thinly sliced seitan), Richard A. got the Vegan Breakfast Burrito, and Laura C. ordered a killer tofu scramble with spinach and mushrooms. 

I was going to get the Vegan Rancheros, but they didn't have vegan cheese, so the waitress suggested getting The Vegan Thing instead ("pile of spuds with vegan jack cheese, fresh salsa, guacamole, and green onions") with added vegan chorizo instead of cheese. Great tip! It was everything a great breakfast should be: starchy, spicy, sweet and savory. The potatoes were cooked so that one side was a little well done crunchy (but not burnt). I thought that really elevated the dish. Even the guac had a good flavor; not sure if it is housemade, but it sure tasted like it was. The chorizo was mighty spicy and set my mouth on fire... I loved every second of it. It hurt so good! 

I tried a bite of Rosie's sandwich... that seitan is phenomenal! It almost had a roast beef, pastrami-esque texture and flavor, without being as overpoweringly salty as its meaty counterpart. I've never seen seitan sliced so thin. I would love to order this on my next visit, as it comes with a heaping side of fries if you so choose. It looks fantastic, especially when you choose to add grilled onions and avocado on top. 

We each must have had at least 2-3 cups of coffee, as they were quick to come by with a fresh pot to give us a warm-up. I really appreciated that! The staff is excellent, very attentive and well-mannered, especially for a Sunday morning (when I know my demeanor can be a little bit cranky). Diane was our main waitress, and she seemed quite knowledgeable about the menu. I hope we weren't bothering her with our demands (more soy milk, please/ a side of jam for my toast, thank you). 

Would I return? Abso-friggin-lutely! This is probably my new favorite brunch joint in all of San Francisco. I left there feeling very full and yet energized, ready to take on the world!...  or at least Rainbow Grocery right down the street.

excerpts: The pancakes were good too and the tofu scramble.
tofu scramble.author: Daryl M.
tofu scramble.review: It was my first time here, a friend of mine suggested this place for breakfast before we headed out of town. I got the potato things with the egg on top. That hit the spot, especially with the Fresh squeezed oj to wash down the food. The pancakes were good too and the tofu scramble.

excerpts: The Tofu Scramble with Ranchero was delicious even though it appeared to be undercooked and not very scrambled.
Since I don't eat with my eyes I dove into the flavors of all the Ranchero sauce mixed with the tofu, mushrooms and green onions.
One of the better tasting scrambles I've had in awhile.
tofu scramble.author: John B.
tofu scramble.review:
While Yelp searching places in the area for a good Vegan breakfast/brunch I found there are several quality options around here. St. Francis Fountain just happened to be the pick of the day. And what a good choice it was...

Old school 50's style dining brought to you by Mission Hipsters. I had read reviews that stated the servers here are aloof or dirty. I found the opposite to be true for the most part. Our coffee and water never got empty without being refilled. The food came out to the table lightning quick as well. 

The only mishap was when our waitress was a bit... ok, very confused while taking our order. Vegan Blueberry Pancakes were repeated back to us twice with "Buttermilk Pancakes". So once that confusion was solved our order came out extremely fast to the point were we thought it wasn't ours. So what did we get instead of Vegan Blueberry Pancakes? That's right, a Vegan Breakfast Burrito... Huh? It turned out to be a good thing since they asked if we would like to keep the burrito while they would whip up the correct pancake order. Free food? Score!

The Tofu Scramble with Ranchero was delicious even though it appeared to be undercooked and not very scrambled. Since I don't eat with my eyes I dove into the flavors of all the Ranchero sauce mixed with the tofu, mushrooms and green onions. One of the better tasting scrambles I've had in awhile. Coupled with a generous portion of tasty spuds along with a few slices of toast, this is a huge shareable dish.  

Those Vegan Blueberry Pancakes that took some haggling to get weren't too bad. I like blueberries as much as anyone but I think they went a little buck wild with the blueberry scooper. The entire center was blueberries. They were good, not great. I would probably get one of the other Vegan options next time.

That free Vegan Breakfast Burrito plate was something I would consider ordering next visit. The black beans on the side had a bit of a chili kick to them. Very tasty. The filling was consisted mostly of a Vegan jack cheese. Not sure what they use but it was a change of pace from the usual burrito. 

A pretty cool atmosphere along with all the great Vegan options makes this a place you should check out at least once to see if it's for you.

excerpts: Tofu scramble onions jalapeno tomato, and the best fried potatoes I've had in my life.
End of story.
The crust on these potatoes was half an inch tick and is possibly most delicious thing I've ever tasted.
|drops mic|
tofu scramble.author: Eric C.
tofu scramble.review: When I walked into this place I didn't know what to expect with the soda fountain and all the ice cream drinks but this is hands-down the best breakfast I've had in San Francisco. Tofu scramble onions jalapeno tomato, and the best fried potatoes I've had in my life. End of story.  The crust on these potatoes was half an inch tick and is possibly most delicious thing I've ever tasted.  |drops mic|

excerpts: I got the tofu scramble and was really satisfied!
Milkshakes are are so really nice!
Seating is at the counter, booths, or outdoors.
tofu scramble.author: Karen J.
tofu scramble.review: There was a waiting list when I went for brunch here on a Saturday, but it was quick. It's an old school diner with a great variety of vegan options- I got the tofu scramble and was really satisfied! Milkshakes are are so really nice! Seating is at the counter, booths, or outdoors.

excerpts: I tried the pesto tofu scramble, which came with potatoes and toast.
I could not finish it for the life of me - portions are humungo!
tofu scramble.author: Megha S.
tofu scramble.review:
This food at this diner is really, really good.  I tried the pesto tofu scramble, which came with potatoes and toast. I could not finish it for the life of me - portions are humungo! All of the flavors blended superbly.

Anyhoo, the service was pleasing and efficient, and the surrounding decor was so fun.  Pez, He-Man, She-Ra cards, anyone?  If you want a dose of your childhood, come here.  You will squeal at all that you thought you forgot.  Good memories and times.

excerpts:
So collectively we had:

Pancakes, Biscuits, home fries, eggs, pesto tofu scramble.
tofu scramble.author: Rinky N.
tofu scramble.review:
Success!  Scored a table for 4 with no wait!

Ate here yesterday with my 4 member Birthday Girl Club.  Every month b-day or not we go for an outing which always includes eating!

I was thwarted in my attempt to eat here last year since there was a humongous line!

We could easily have spent an hour reading their extensive menu.  There is something for everyone.  If you can't find anything to eat from the menu then you must be from another planet.

The breakfast menu has at least 20 different kind of 2 or 3 egg omelets, french toast, pancakes, waffles, 4 kinds of tofu scrambles
and much more.

They have lots of choices for Vegans including Vegan Ruebens!


They also have malts, shakes, sundaes, floats including a Guinness Float!

So collectively we had:

Pancakes, Biscuits, home fries, eggs, pesto tofu scramble.Vegan sausage, Vegan chorizo hash, an omelet, ww toast,Chocolate malt, coffee and tea!

So yummy and filling!  We had little and big tastes of each other's dishes and give St FF 7 thumbs up!

The pancakes were fluffy, the potatoes had crispy edges, the tofu pesto scramble was yummy, the biscuits were light and buttery-mmm,
and the malt was luscious!

We're looking forward to eating here soon and having lunch!

Our server was super sweet and attentive,


The candy counter had wax lips!  Sugar Daddies!  Bubble Gum packs from Three's Company, Bo Derek, to name a few;  Button candy!
Garbage Pail kids candy!  Pop Rocks! 

Talk about Blasts From the Past!

We'll be back again during another hopefully uncrowded time!

excerpts: One day I woke up and was craving tofu scramble and ended up at St. Francis because it's one of the few places in the city that serves it.
I got the Tofu Scramble with ranchera sauce, avocado, tomatoes, onions and goat cheese.
tofu scramble.author: Shreya O.
tofu scramble.review:
One day I woke up and was craving tofu scramble and ended up at St. Francis because it's one of the few places in the city that serves it. 

I got the Tofu Scramble with ranchera sauce, avocado, tomatoes, onions and goat cheese. It came with a side of potatoes (Nebulous Potato Thing style) and cornbread. This was a huge portion of food and could easily have been split by two people. Everything was delicious, service was great (and surprisingly quick).

There's always a wait to get a table so get a milkshake in the meantime. They're some of the best in the city.

excerpts: i ended up with a tofu scramble dressed with spinach, mushrooms and peanut sauce and proceeded to inhale all of it on top of my rye toast.
tofu scramble.author: Jen I.
tofu scramble.review:
oh st. francis, the last time i had set foot inside of you, you did not have outdoor seating and didn't have 1/2 the vegan options you have now.

oh, and i was also an omnivore.

this visit, i had a hard time making up my mind over what to get since you grew your vegan menu since you somehow knew i wanted to fatten up for the winter.  if i eat enough of yout vegan spuds and tofu scrambles and seitan + vegan burger madness i wouldn't need to wear a coat for the next couple of months.

hello cute waitress in the red skirt with short blond hair, thank you for being patient as we asked your opinion on the different veg friendly items on the menu.

did i mention you were cute and ncie?  yes.  thank you.  i would marry you if it meant free vanilla soy shakes for life,  yes, the dr. can marry you too.  

i ended up with a tofu scramble dressed with spinach, mushrooms and peanut sauce and proceeded to inhale all of it on top of my rye toast.  

i will return for your seitan sandwich.  and your vegan thing.  and your vegan sausage.  and your vegan burger with seitan.  and your undying love.

excerpts: I consistently order their Tofu Scramble with Ranchero sauce....comes with amazing skillet fried potatoes and choice of toast, english muffin, etc...
I've never been disappointed..always hits the spot.
Great taste, huge plate of food,
tofu scramble.author: Vanessa B.
tofu scramble.review:
My favorite place for a vegan breakfast.

I consistently order their Tofu Scramble with Ranchero sauce....comes with amazing skillet fried potatoes and choice of toast, english muffin, etc... I've never been disappointed..always hits the spot.  Great taste, huge plate of food, what more could you ask for...

Definitely a hipster joint and I couldnt love it more. Service is great - food is always rockin.

I'll be back over and over and over.

excerpts: Best tofu scramble in the city.
I have tried a lot of places, and this place easily beatsh them all.
The tofu scramble is nicely spiced and add Jalapenos for more kick.
tofu scramble.author: Vinod K.
tofu scramble.review: Best tofu scramble in the city. I have tried a lot of places, and this place easily beatsh them all. The tofu scramble is nicely spiced and add Jalapenos for more kick.

excerpts: I go for the tofu scramble with spinach, mushroom and peanut sauce - plus some added jalapeños for added zing.
I order fruit instead of potatoes and dry whole wheat toast.
Delicious - a yummy big breakfast.
And pretty healthy.
I highly recommend this place for a good vegan breakfast.
tofu scramble.author: Christine S.
tofu scramble.review: This is one of my favorite breakfast places. I go for the tofu scramble with spinach, mushroom and peanut sauce - plus some added jalapeños for added zing. I order fruit instead of potatoes and dry whole wheat toast. Delicious - a yummy big breakfast. And pretty healthy. I highly recommend this place for a good vegan breakfast.

excerpts: I decided to get a vegan entree the day I went there since I like soy chorizo and tofu scramble hash.
But it was bland and not very good.
The tofu scramble/soyrizo ended up being good the next day
and I'm guessing it is because the spices/oils had time to marinate into the tofu.
It didn't seem as bland the next day.
tofu scramble.author: Sabrina A.
tofu scramble.review:
I decided to get a vegan entree the day I went there since I like soy chorizo and tofu scramble hash.  But it was bland and not very good.  Luckily I got a side of pancakes of banana walnut that were delicious.  I imagine this is the type of place you should get traditional egg dishes at.  The tofu scramble/soyrizo ended up being good the next day and I'm guessing it is because the spices/oils had time to marinate into the tofu.  It didn't seem as bland the next day.  Make sure to get the Cherry Cola to ensure your diner experience.

Since this place is just around the corner from my house I'm sure I'll try it again.

excerpts: I've been to SFF a bunch of times now (10+), and each time I've identified myself as a vegan ("Can I get the tofu scramble, vegan style, please?"), and
only yesterday was I informed that the homefries, which come standard with all tofu scrambles, are fried in BUTTER and therefore NOT VEGAN.
Many thanks to the server who finally filled me  in, but it's
too bad nobody mentioned it previously.

Yeah, I know I should have explicitly asked, so it is my fault, but in a city like San Francisco, if you're going to be offering vegan-enticing options like tofu scramble and calling things vegan on your menu, you probably want to be clued in to the fact that vegans don't want to eat butter and that some of them are too hungry or caffeine deprived or just plain stupid* to ask outright if you've put butter in the potatoes.
Anyway, I love the thai tofu scramble (with fruit or beans instead of homefries,
*sniff*), and the coffee is always good, and so is the vegan chorizo and
the veggie burrito swimming in a lake of tasty beans.
tofu scramble.author: Jordan P.
tofu scramble.review:
First things first, I really like St. Francis Fountain. It's an old soda fountain, which is neat, plus, it has counter seating, which is neat, and it has vegan food, which is peachy keen. 

BUT.

I've been to SFF a bunch of times now (10+), and each time I've identified myself as a vegan ("Can I get the tofu scramble, vegan style, please?"), and only yesterday was I informed that the homefries, which come standard with all tofu scrambles, are fried in BUTTER and therefore NOT VEGAN. Many thanks to the server who finally filled me  in, but it's too bad nobody mentioned it previously. Yeah, I know I should have explicitly asked, so it is my fault, but in a city like San Francisco, if you're going to be offering vegan-enticing options like tofu scramble and calling things vegan on your menu, you probably want to be clued in to the fact that vegans don't want to eat butter and that some of them are too hungry or caffeine deprived or just plain stupid* to ask outright if you've put butter in the potatoes. The customer is always dumb, after all. 

Anyway, I love the thai tofu scramble (with fruit or beans instead of homefries, *sniff*), and the coffee is always good, and so is the vegan chorizo and the veggie burrito swimming in a lake of tasty beans. I hear they have soy gelato as well and can whip up some vegan 'shakes, but when I tried to order one, they were sadly out of soy. 

In conclusion, I really do like St. Francis Fountain a lot but wish they would knock it off with the butter potatoes.

*just because we try to eat ethically doesn't mean we're smart!

excerpts: I've finally come to realize that I don't actually enjoy eating eggs (with a few exceptions) and so I am happy that this place does a MEAN tofu scramble.
Tofu scramble w/ ranchero sauce and avocado and tortillas = most awesome brunch of all time.
tofu scramble.author: Maria D.
tofu scramble.review:
Here we go: hipster hipster hipster hipster whine whine whine hipster hipster skinny black jean namedrop some band that hipsters dont even listen to anymore hipster hipster hipster hipster hipster. 

Okay. 

Now we can move on. Did you know they also serve food here? They do and it is wonderful.  The menu is extremely similar to Boogaloo's , unfortunately, it's missing some of the real shining stars of the menu - namely the plantain cake and "fake stake". But, the wait is much shorter. I can live with that compromise.

I've finally come to realize that I don't actually enjoy eating eggs (with a few exceptions) and so I am happy that this place does a MEAN tofu scramble. Tofu scramble w/ ranchero sauce and avocado and tortillas = most awesome brunch of all time. 

I love writing reviews when I'm hungover! Woo!

excerpts: I've had the side platter with soup, mac and cheese, and salad and have also had the tofu scramble and a banana milkshake.
The food was great
BUT the service is lacking.
The staff is unhelpful and act like you should be honored to be at their cool restaurant.
But for good food I can get over bad service sometimes.
tofu scramble.author: Samantha C.
tofu scramble.review: The food here was great. I've had the side platter with soup, mac and cheese, and salad and have also had the tofu scramble and a banana milkshake. The food was great BUT the service is lacking. The staff is unhelpful and act like you should be honored to be at their cool restaurant. But for good food I can get over bad service sometimes.

excerpts: When we were in town looking for a brunch place I was excited to find somewhere that offered me more than a tofu scramble.
tofu scramble.author: Brandi S.
tofu scramble.review: My husband is vegetarian and I'm vegan at the moment. When we were in town looking for a brunch place I was excited to find somewhere that offered me more than a tofu scramble. I had vegan blueberry pancakes and sausage which was delicious and satisfying. My husbands potatoes were amazing. The staff were very friendly and attentive even though we were there during a busy Saturday morning. Looking forward to go back and try a soy milkshake!

excerpts: I ended up with the vegan rancheros, which was tofu scramble with ranchero sauce and vegan cheese (Teese?
Follow Your Heart?
They taste the same to me, so I don't know), black beans, pico, and corn tortillas.
It was all pretty good, but I feel I ordered wrong.
Ordering Mexican-ish food at a non-Mexican establishment in the Mission is stupid, right?
I wasn't thinking.
Plus, they need to figure out how to get that vegan cheese to melt.
I know it's a little tricky, but it can be done.
tofu scramble.author: Ashley P.
tofu scramble.review:
So many vegan options I experienced menu overload. I hate when I want to try everything and can't. 

I ended up with the vegan rancheros, which was tofu scramble with ranchero sauce and vegan cheese (Teese? Follow Your Heart? They taste the same to me, so I don't know), black beans, pico, and corn tortillas. It was all pretty good, but I feel I ordered wrong. Ordering Mexican-ish food at a non-Mexican establishment in the Mission is stupid, right? I wasn't thinking. Plus, they need to figure out how to get that vegan cheese to melt. I know it's a little tricky, but it can be done. It was just shredded and stirred in with the tofu, and while I didn't mind it, I could have done without it altogether.

Next time I'm trying the Vegan Thing, or maybe the vegan pancakes. Vegan pancakes! Nobody ever has vegan pancakes. Definitely should have tried those. I was too full for a soy shake, but that's also on my list for next time. 

Great atmosphere and friendly service, and tons of vegan options. Love it!

excerpts: They offer a vegetarian chorizo w/ either real eggs or a tofu scramble...
I ordered it, with the corn tortillas, and I ate every last piece...
tofu scramble.author: Jess R.
tofu scramble.review:
I've been here twice, once for a milkshake, once for food....

On the first visit, we were ushered to a seat instantly....

On the second visit, we approached and noticed a pretty large crowd waiting outside to be seated...  It was a Saturday morning (afternoon if you want to be a stickler about it), and we were about to give up and go else where...  We decided to find out how long the wait was...  Much to our surprise, he said only about 3 minutes, and I think we were seated before that....

So a star for that...

The milkshakes are amazing and they offer a TON of flavors, and the extra shot of malt might change your life...

So a star for that.

They offer a vegetarian chorizo w/ either real eggs or a tofu scramble...  I ordered it, with the corn tortillas, and I ate every last piece...  I was full about halfway through, but it was too ridiculously good to stop eating.

So a star for delicious food!!!!!!

The staff is really friendly, pretty attentive, and the ambiance of the place is SICK!!!  I mean, COME on...  They sell Michael Jackson Collector cards!!!!  It's heaven for anyone brought up in the late 70s/early 80s...

So another star for that!!!!!!!

Lastly, I award my fifth star to the location....  24th and York isn't necessarily hard to get to, and it is tucked away in a quiet, non-crowded part of the city...  and if you're anything like me, after living in downtown for almost 4 years now, you hate people.

Long review short???  Get your ass here right now.

excerpts: Get the Thai Tofu Scramble and be a happy little soul.
tofu scramble.author: Jill K.
tofu scramble.review:
You should eat here.  No, really, you should.  Cheap and really delicious and very authentically 1950s.  The wait staff is just great - tattooed and friendly..  (Especially that one guy with the beard.  Smiley guy.  I heart him.  I think he genuinely IS that happy.) 

Get the Thai Tofu Scramble and be a happy little soul.

Skip the burger.  It's not that great.

But anything for breakfast will make you happy!

excerpts: I ordered the tofu scramble with "thing" on my spuds.
The tofu scramble was very good.
I've been wanting to have it
and this was a good way to start the tofu scramble experience.
tofu scramble.author: Rommel B.
tofu scramble.review:
After a night of drinking and no limit solider-ing and cash money-ing with some friends, i felt the best way to make it up to my girlfriend was to (attempt to) wake up early and take her out for some sunny saturday breakfast.  so bright and early 09:00am, the adventure started...

in between morning matches of street fighter hd remix, i scoured yelp for the most magical breakfast spot in the surrounding areas.  Basing our decision wiith a telephone, we were  passing up reviews on mama's in san francisco, (we decided to skip out on the 40 minute wait)  MHOP (millbrae's house of pancakes) had a 10 minute wait but an uneventful phone call.  I soon remember a cute, little, malt shoppe-looking place close to my work.

The st. francis fountain.

my new favorite breakfast spot.

We got there around 11-ish ( i REALLY like street fighter) and had about a 20 minute wait for a table.  It would have been a shorter wait if we were willing to perch up on the counter.  We need something more intimate, so we waited patiently for a small table, sandwiched between two other small tables in a kiddie corner at the front of the "fountain."

I ordered the tofu scramble with "thing" on my spuds.  My girlfriend ordered corned beef hash and was over joyed with the quality of the coffee.  

The tofu scramble was very good.  I've been wanting to have it and this was a good way to start the tofu scramble experience.  The potatoes were just as good, if not better.

My girlfriend said that the corn beef hash was alittle lacking in the corn beef department, but was still good nonetheless.

We will be coming back here....alot.

probably me more than her...because i work so close...

sucks for you girlfriend...sucks for you.

excerpts: I can't remember any of the other options besides something like four tofu scramble variations and a huevos rancheros option.
tofu scramble.author: Bryan M.
tofu scramble.review:
Another great yelp vegetarian recommendation and Excellent morning after meal. Two of us had the vegan chorizo scramble breakfast and it was amazing. I only wished I could eat here every day for a week and  try everything. I can't remember any of the other options besides something like four tofu scramble variations and a huevos rancheros option. Gotta go back.

I think we waited about 30 minutes for a table. There was a big crowd outside and a sign up sheet hanging near the door. Willingness to sit outside got our largish group of five sat quickly (for some reason it seems like SF lacks tables). Our server even had a Linda's shirt on (similar eatery here in Seattle). We signed up and walked over to L's for coffee anyways. No problem with the wait or eating outside, it was nice out and well worth it. The server ended up getting off and disappearing but someone else helped us and we weren't in any hurry so no loss there. Having only one bathroom was a little disappointing though.

excerpts: I had a tofu scramble, probably one of the sadder that I've had in SF.
I will give the place credit for having tofu scramble to begin with, so this is a bittersweet review.
I hate to knock a place that has tofu scramble (so few breakfast places for the vegan crowd...), but come on now.
tofu scramble.author: Nelson A.
tofu scramble.review:
Rarely do I have to take such exception to the Yelp crowd.  How can you rate this place this highly?  The staff and the place looks filthy, the booths are made for midgets, and the food is mediocre.

I had a tofu scramble, probably one of the sadder that I've had in SF.  I will give the place credit for having tofu scramble to begin with, so this is a bittersweet review.  I hate to knock a place that has tofu scramble (so few breakfast places for the vegan crowd...), but come on now.

I had a soy-shake which was excellent.  And I mean $5 shake excellent.  So they get bonus points for being so damn vegan friendly.  If only the food and service wasn't so bad.

excerpts: A friend told me that this place had "the best tofu scramble in town," and I'm not one to pass up a tip of that nature.
Turns out that this 50's-style diner (authentically so, minus the cheesy revamping that that phrase might make you think of) has not one but
*four* tofu scrambles on the menu!
The one I tried (Tofu Mex) was great, and came with more potatoes than God.
Wow.
tofu scramble.author: Nori H.
tofu scramble.review: A friend told me that this place had "the best tofu scramble in town," and I'm not one to pass up a tip of that nature.  Turns out that this 50's-style diner (authentically so, minus the cheesy revamping that that phrase might make you think of) has not one but *four* tofu scrambles on the menu!  The one I tried (Tofu Mex) was great, and came with more potatoes than God.  Wow.  Menu also has four different kind of mimosas, all with creative California flower names ("bougainvillea" == champagne + OJ + cranberry juice), and all made with freshly-squeezed orange juice.  Totally unpretentious and yummy food -- this one's a keeper.

excerpts: I got the italian tofu scramble, and my boyfriend got the mexican tofu scramble, and they were both delicious.

One note for other vegans out there, they don't automatically take the butter off the toast (a little dumb considering you are probably vegan if you're ordering a tofu scramble instead of eggs, but it is the mission afterall) and there is no margarine, but you don't really need it if you scoop your scramble on the toast.
They also had a vegan boca burger, a veggie ruben, veggie chili, and soy ice cream shakes, although we didn't try them since we were stuffed.
I was tempted to get a shake, but I proabably would have exploded.
tofu scramble.author: Jeani H.
tofu scramble.review: Yet another fine vegan find. This place has really  yummy tofu scrambles. I got the italian tofu scramble, and my boyfriend got the mexican tofu scramble, and they were both delicious. One note for other vegans out there, they don't automatically take the butter off the toast (a little dumb considering you are probably vegan if you're ordering a tofu scramble instead of eggs, but it is the mission afterall) and there is no margarine, but you don't really need it if you scoop your scramble on the toast. They also had a vegan boca burger, a veggie ruben, veggie chili, and soy ice cream shakes, although we didn't try them since we were stuffed. I was tempted to get a shake, but I proabably would have exploded.

excerpts: It was pretty amazing: in the center, a tofu scramble with ranchero sauce, and surrounding it, vegan chorizo mixed in with diced potatoes, with three soft, hot corn tortillas on the side!
tofu scramble.author: D P.
tofu scramble.review:
This place is so cute! I had it on my list of places to visit in SF mainly because of the vegan shake and ice cream.

My boyfriend and I ended up having lunch here on our last day in town.  The guy next to us had ordered the Vegan Chorizo Hash with Tofu, and it looked sooooo good, we BOTH GOT IT.  

It was pretty amazing: in the center, a tofu scramble with ranchero sauce, and surrounding it, vegan chorizo mixed in with diced potatoes, with three soft, hot corn tortillas on the side! 

It comes with a side: I got mine with a side of veggie chili--it wasn't as good as the Whole Foods canned variety, but was topped with scallions--and my boyfriend got a side of home fries, which were really good, nice and firm, and covered in herbs.

He got the "Dream" shake (orange sherbet and vanilla, topped with whipped cream and a cherry), and I got the vanilla "All Soy" shake.  The ice cream they use (I hear it is a local ice creamery, right?) IS SO GOOD.  I didn't see vanilla beans but would have guessed they were in there.  It was so very vanilla-y, and with a cherry on top.  

The server was staight-up abrasive, very unhelpful.  The bill came out to $43, which I think is kind of expensive for 2 diner-style entrees and a shake.  But the has was very good, and so was my shake, and I'd go back for either!

We ended up getting some 80s trading cards which was fun.  The lock on the bathroom door was broken, which was scary!, but one of my favorite things about the place was the old-school "BORAXO" powder hand soap dispenser in there.

excerpts: A solid four stars for a delicious tofu scramble.
I need to come back to try more of the menu, when I'm not so mercilessly hungover...
I may even enjoy it more.
tofu scramble.author: Beth G.
tofu scramble.review: A solid four stars for a delicious tofu scramble. I need to come back to try more of the menu, when I'm not so mercilessly hungover...I may even enjoy it more.

excerpts: so sweet and there's tofu scramble.
all the waitresses are kind.
soy milkshakes.
something called a 'toasty vegan.' its perfect.
tofu scramble.author: aerin w.
tofu scramble.review: so sweet and there's tofu scramble. all the waitresses are kind. soy milkshakes. something called a 'toasty vegan.' its perfect.

excerpts: I ordered the French Toast Delight that came with yogurt, granola and fruits.
With how it was worded on the menu, I originally assumed the parfait-like portion of this dish would be on the side, INSTEAD it was on TOP of my French toast...
Amongst my fruit, I was lucky to get a nice piece of the apple core, which humans can totally just ingest those apple seeds no problem
(if you didn't get, sarcasm).
Anyway, for $10.50, all I wanted was some good simple French Toast, but got played hard.
The sourness from the yogurt literally overpowered everything and the dryness of the granola ruined the texture I hoped from the fluffy French toast...
The selection of fruit was quite sad, just raisins, apple and cantaloupe chunks, strawberries and grapes, which are some odd pairings with yogurt and toast?
: don't recommend the pancakes and French toast Delight.
However I'm sure their other brunch items may be better.
granola.author: Lisa L.
granola.review:
Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon for a quick brunch with my sister. The wait was around 10 minutes, which we utilized to decide what to order. 

We were seated on the other side of the restaurant which didn't have the best ambiance. They definitely skimped on the lighting, making the entire room feel really dull and uninviting. The water served was lukewarm and tasted funky. 

My sister ordered the buttermilk hot cakes that came with salted butter and one slice of orange garnish. In terms of flavor, although fluffy, we both came to a consensus that it was somewhat off-putting? I wasn't sure if it was the flour they used or their over all pancake batter, but there was this grainy floury aftertaste the more you ate it. 

I ordered the French Toast Delight that came with yogurt, granola and fruits. With how it was worded on the menu, I originally assumed the parfait-like portion of this dish would be on the side, INSTEAD it was on TOP of my French toast... Amongst my fruit, I was lucky to get a nice piece of the apple core, which humans can totally just ingest those apple seeds no problem (if you didn't get, sarcasm). Anyway, for $10.50, all I wanted was some good simple French Toast, but got played hard. The yogurt toppings in my opinion was a terrible pairing. The sourness from the yogurt literally overpowered everything and the dryness of the granola ruined the texture I hoped from the fluffy French toast... The selection of fruit was quite sad, just raisins, apple and cantaloupe chunks, strawberries and grapes, which are some odd pairings with yogurt and toast? As for the toast, I was disappointed.... just didn't satisfy those cravings and wished I walked a bit further or something to go to some other brunch place. 

TL;DR: don't recommend the pancakes and French toast Delight. However I'm sure their other brunch items may be better.

excerpts: The toast was killer, TONS of fresh fruit, granola,  whip cream,all the goods...
The fried egg sammich... was a fried egg sammich
...everything was good but nothing extra...
Chef's mess was a whole bunch of everything omelet, with way to many things to list but it was tasty...
it was definitely a great way to start a busy morning.
Everything has a old school feel including the meals which are built for hearty people.
The portions are generous and delicious.
Service was excellent.
I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone.
granola.author: D I.
granola.review:
Cool little place,  vintage feel to it... didn't try the fountain drinks but i should have. Came in and we were immediately seated.  Customer service was excellent, the guy that helped us was super friendly and made u feel right at home. 
Started off with the french toast, Chef's mess, and, Fried egg sammich.
 The toast was killer, TONS of fresh fruit, granola,  whip cream,all the goods... 
The fried egg sammich... was a fried egg sammich...everything was good but nothing extra...
Chef's mess was a whole bunch of everything omelet, with way to many things to list but it was tasty... it was definitely a great way to start a busy morning. 
Everything has a old school feel including the meals which are built for hearty people. The portions are generous and delicious. Service was excellent. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone.

excerpts: Definitely didn't have room for a parfait but couldn't stop devouring sweet local granola, bananas, pineapple, strawberries, apples and what tasted like nonfat plain yogurt.
granola.author: Jason B.
granola.review:
Good thing going.

Do not underestimate a small "pile of spuds". Part of the Vegan Thing specialty topped with vegan cheese, salsa, guacamole and onions. Added a side of egg whites.

Perhaps they made a large instead because a massive mound of food was delivered. And consumed because each and every bite was outstanding.

Really didn't have room for a vegan chorizo hash side but couldn't say no to the rich delicious flavor.

Definitely didn't have room for a parfait but couldn't stop devouring sweet local granola, bananas, pineapple, strawberries, apples and what tasted like nonfat plain yogurt.

Also good was the enthusiastic and infectious service. And we were equally happy to be eating outside on a warm February Saturday. Wait was a short 15min.

Reasonable $20/person included my dining companion's much enjoyed dish, orange juice, coffee and being so full we didn't need lunch.

More than good. Five star great.

excerpts: A couple pieces of French toast drowned in diced fruit, granola, and a drizzle of yogurt.
Absolutely F#%^ING DELIGHTFUL.
granola.author: Clouob P.
granola.review:
Where do I begin? I've been here 3 separate times and each time I've been more than satisfied, a bit remorseful (gluttony) but satisfied nonetheless.

Vegan Pancakes: Fluffy, soft and flavorful. You have the option of fruit, I opt'd for the strawberries first time and blueberries the next. Each time the fruit is fresh and crisp

French Toast Delight: If you need to make weight for a boxing match or just want to beef up quick, this is the breakfast plate for you. A couple pieces of French toast drowned in diced fruit, granola, and a drizzle of yogurt. Absolutely F#%^ING DELIGHTFUL. You'll feel fat but with a healthy twist.

I wish I would've tried other things besides breakfast but I can only assume that they're just as awesome as their counterparts.

Overall really good food, warm and attentive service (considering how busy and how they're staffed), and just good vibes.

If you live or are in the SF area check them out, you won't be sorry.

excerpts:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt
there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'
granola.author: Michael U.
granola.review:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760 I finally decided to quell my curiosity, a short walk back just one block landing me at a two-top in the 1918 soda fountain.  Kitschy in décor with toys and trading cards from my youth available for purchase in a glass case while booths and tables sat tightly spaced juxtaposing the Formica bar it would be mere moments before I was greeted by the diner's lone server and confirming hopes of an 'all-day' menu my order quickly took shape, a duo of childhood favorites readied at the counter along with French Toast arriving less than ten minutes later.  Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.  Already all smiles as patrons aged five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'

excerpts: I finally chose the French toast with yogurt, granola, and fruit with a side of bacon - it comes to me heaping and plentiful, takes up the whole plate, and a drizzle syrup starts my eating game, all for $10.
My dining partner wasn't so lucky.
granola.author: Jenz y.
granola.review:
God, I would have given St. Francis 4 stars based on my months of experience here, but today really rubbed me the wrong way. I work in the area, so of course I love that St. Francis is there for all times of the day. I've had the omelets for breakfast when I'm a bit early for work, call in for the takeout lunch of the sampler (side salad, cup of mac and cheese, and cup of chili for $8), and have nothin but great things to say about their burgers.

But. Today. I took a man friend here for late breakfast/lunch, and we couldn't decide what to order. I finally chose the French toast with yogurt, granola, and fruit with a side of bacon - it comes to me heaping and plentiful, takes up the whole plate, and a drizzle syrup starts my eating game, all for $10. My dining partner wasn't so lucky. He didn't like some of the breakfast burrito options, so decided to add some extras - bacon, cilantro, avocado, potatoes - to a burrito that was listed on the menu.

My dish was tasty. So was his. But imagine our surprise when the bill comes and his breakfast burrito  - modified, sure, to add some extras - is fucking TWENTY FIVE DOLLARS. I'm sorry, why? Because our smart (I'm obviously being ironic) server added all of the extras for the breakfast burrito a la carte. Here's the thing - we were more than willing to build the burrito on its own, but $25 fucking dollars for one? It was a dick move for the server to charge it all separately, especially since each item wasn't in full on the side and was mixed ultimately for the burrito. Of course, we don't realize this until my credit card is charged, and I had to get back to work.

Dear server at St. Francis: if you're seeing that someone's BURRITO is totaling $25, don't be an ass and bring it to their attention. You can also mod that shit in Aloha. Play fair.

excerpts: The french toast with yogurt and granola on top was excellent, as well as the soup and the huevos rancheros.
I love the old-school feeling of this place, and the "vintage" candy that they sell makes me smile
granola.author: Laura P.
granola.review: This place has a huge menu and awesome food.  The french toast with yogurt and granola on top was excellent, as well as the soup and the huevos rancheros. I love the old-school feeling of this place, and the "vintage" candy that they sell makes me smile :)

excerpts: I was trying to be healthy that day and decided to get the french toast delight with yogurt, fruit & a sprinkle of granola.
The french toast was light and fluffy and had an interesting crunch to it because of the granola.
This place will have a line so prepare to wait.
Service was attentive, decor was amusing, price was decent (under $12-$14) and food was amazing.
I'm a fan now :)
granola.author: Nancy Y.
granola.review: I  LOVE this place not only because it has been around since 1918 but because the food is original and sooooo good. I was trying to be healthy that day and decided to get the french toast delight with yogurt, fruit & a sprinkle of granola. The french toast was light and fluffy and had an interesting crunch to it because of the granola. This place will have a line so prepare to wait. Service was attentive, decor was amusing, price was decent (under $12-$14) and food was amazing. I'm a fan now :)

excerpts: The granola was out of this world.
granola.author: Amy S.
granola.review:
Wow.  I was just poking around on Yelp for a good breakfast place and came across St. Francis Fountain.  It is wonderful.  Everything I read about it in the reviews was true.  The waitstaff is highly tattooed and very friendly.  The place is very vegetarian friendly.  The nebulous potato thing is really good.  The granola was out of this world.  Coffee is strong and flavorful.

The only neg thing anyone at the table said about the breakfast was that the sausage had fennel, which he doesn't like.

excerpts: Anyway, enough of my little tirade... their shakes are amazing and huge, and I especially love their sourdough french toast, which they top with some yogurt and granola, which I've never had before.
I'm more of a meat eater myself, but my husband really likes the veggie food here.
The wait staff has always been very nice and attentive, but then again I tend to avoid weekend brunch times.
granola.author: Nicole A.
granola.review:
I hate to go here on weekends for brunch, only because it is JAM packed with people and impossible to get a table. However, because I live just around the corner, I have the luxury of coming on the weekdays for breakfast or linner- much better. And I'm a bit offended at a previous posters implication that this is a sketchy neighborhood! I walk around by myself at night all the time and have never felt unsafe, much less during broad daylight. Just because this side of the Mission isn't crawling with people in skinny jeans, doesn't mean it's sketchy! 

Anyway, enough of my little tirade... their shakes are amazing and huge, and I especially love their sourdough french toast, which they top with some yogurt and granola, which I've never had before. I'm more of a meat eater myself, but my husband really likes the veggie food here. The wait staff has always been very nice and attentive, but then again I tend to avoid weekend brunch times.

excerpts: The toast was deep in the mountain floor under piles of strawberries, pineapples, nut, apples, raisins and sugar powdered granola.
Ribbons of yogurt lined the lodes of french toast.
I enjoyed it just as much as the 49'ers...
the 1849ers upon discovering gold at Sutter's mill.
granola.author: Mark L.
granola.review:
Finally a place where you can get breakfast all day that beats out the neighborhood Denny's. It's not like it is hard to beat out Denny's but it is hard to find a place that will make breakfast at night, right. 

The place looks much like the way it was opened back in the twenties. All of the booths and counters have to be at least 30-40 years old which gives it character, but with character comes the aging lines of time. It was easy to recognize where to sit in the booth because the butt prints of diners' past marked the landing zone with cracks and holes in the leather. The booths stand up straight like wooden castles that surround your party. 

The food feels like they throw the kitchen sink at you. We had the french toast delight and the chef's mess. The french toast was anything but french and instead resembled the desert mountains of the west right after the first snow storm of the year. The toast was deep in the mountain floor under piles of strawberries, pineapples, nut, apples, raisins and sugar powdered granola. Ribbons of yogurt lined the lodes of french toast. I enjoyed it just as much as the 49'ers... the 1849ers upon discovering gold at Sutter's mill. The contrast between the different textures and flavors, made the whole dish enjoyable with little nuggets of delight in every bite.

The chef's mess was what it claimed to be with eggs, cheese, sour cream, green onions and of course the most important ingredient... bacon. With these ingredients, its like shooting fish in a barrel when it comes to making something tasty. Rather than make your stomach feel like it hits your knees the mess was lighter and energizing.

The food was hearty but not overbearing. It seemed that the waiters were not eating it though because they were both morbidly skinny. I am coming back next time I feel like pancakes late, yet I don't want to feel like a bloated whale afterward. You won't find food that will confuse you, instead it will be as if you are coming back to the family owned diner of your hometown, where everybody knows your name.

excerpts: the french toast + granola/fruit/yogurt combo hit the spot, accompanied by the knife covering jose gonzalez.
gotta love brunch when it comes with new music discoveries.
granola.author: Albert C.
granola.review: you gotta love a place that serves guinness floats for breakfast. service was mission hip (tatted up and glamorous) and food was 1950s stellar.  the french toast + granola/fruit/yogurt combo hit the spot, accompanied by the knife covering jose gonzalez. gotta love brunch when it comes with new music discoveries.

excerpts: The Poor Man Soup and the Country Breakfast are amazing.
country breakfast.author: Marisol R.
country breakfast.review: Local favorite. Great breakfast and brunch spot. The Poor Man Soup and the Country Breakfast are amazing.

excerpts: My wife had the country breakfast and loved it too.
country breakfast.author: Blake B.
country breakfast.review:
Every time I've wanted to eat here the line has been really long so I've always passed.  The gods must have been on my side a few weekends ago though because I got a parking spot right out in front and there was a list but we had a larger group so got sat right away.  It's an awesome diner spot with really good food.  I had the chef's mess and it had everything in it which was exactly what I was looking for.  My wife had the country breakfast and loved it too.

If you can get here and there's not a line check it out.  Heck, even if there is a line, stay in it because it will be worth it.

excerpts: For breakfast, I had a country breakfast with biscuits & gravy while my partner ordered a ham and cheese omlet.
I am very picky about biscuits and gravy and was mildly disappointed.
The biscuits were dense and heavy rather than being light and fluffy.
The gravy was not very tasty.
But the potatoes were good, although a bit charred.
The eggs were fine, but I wasn't that hungry
so I didn't eat much of them.
My partner enjoyed his breakfast very much and nearly finished the whole plate.
After such a big breakfast, we took a stroll down 24th Street to walk off some of the meal.
I would return again, but choose something else from the menu.
country breakfast.author: Philip C.
country breakfast.review:
We dropped by here on Saturday morning, expecting a long wait for a table.  Surprisingly, we got a table in 3 minutes.
My partner likes this place so he was very happy.
For breakfast, I had a country breakfast with biscuits & gravy while my partner ordered a ham and cheese omlet.
I am very picky about biscuits and gravy and was mildly disappointed.  The biscuits were dense and heavy rather than being light and fluffy.  The gravy was not very tasty.  But the potatoes were good, although a bit charred.  The eggs were fine, but I wasn't that hungry so I didn't eat much of them.
My partner enjoyed his breakfast very much and nearly finished the whole plate.
After such a big breakfast, we took a stroll down 24th Street to walk off some of the meal.
I would return again, but choose something else from the menu.

excerpts: The potatoes that came with the country breakfast were *fantastic*!!
country breakfast.author: Michele S.
country breakfast.review:
I came here with my mother while she was visiting me from Washington DC.  I was hoping to give her a great showing of the food offerings of San Francisco.  We came to this diner hoping for some killer country biscuits & gravy and buttermilk pancakes.  The pancakes were pretty good, as was the coffee.  The potatoes that came with the country breakfast were *fantastic*!!  But the biscuits and gravy were awful.

The ambiance was typical for that of a diner, which was exactly what we were expecting and wanted.  The service (at 10am on a Thursday morning) was less than stellar.  The server came only to take our order (late) and deliver our food and check.

Next time I'll stick with what I know...Higher Grounds Coffee House in Glen Park is ahhh-mazing!!!

excerpts: He had the country breakfast which he really enjoyed.
The atmosphere was very hipster and cute old school dinner.
The service was prompt and very friendly.
country breakfast.author: Kim A.
country breakfast.review: The best breakfast that we have ever had!!i got the nebulous potatoes and they were super tasty. He had the country breakfast which he really enjoyed. The atmosphere was very hipster and cute old school dinner. The service was prompt and very friendly.

excerpts: and I must say this place has a kick ass country breakfast.
It came with 2 eggs your way, biscuits, gravy, potatoes... that plus a small OJ was $11... tax and tip brought it to $13.80.
country breakfast.author: ALISHA W.
country breakfast.review:
I'm a brunch kind of gal and I must say this place has a kick ass country breakfast. It came with 2 eggs your way, biscuits, gravy, potatoes... that plus a small OJ was $11... tax and tip brought it to $13.80. It's not bad for brunch, considering how big the portions are.

The wait was about 20 minutes bc the place was packed.... tons of hipsters but that doesn't really bother me lol.

excerpts: Really enjoyed the Country breakfast, especially the biscuits, most places don't seem to know how to make good biscuits.
People here are friendly and quick to serve.
Reasonable prices, you could easily spend the same amount at a fast food restaurant but you wouldn't be getting the same quality of food nor enjoy your meal as much.
Casual dining.
Parking is fairly easy to come by.
country breakfast.author: Ron W.
country breakfast.review: Few places have better milkshakes. That's reason enough to come here. Their food is good too. Really enjoyed the Country breakfast, especially the biscuits, most places don't seem to know how to make good biscuits. People here are friendly and quick to serve. Reasonable prices, you could easily spend the same amount at a fast food restaurant but you wouldn't be getting the same quality of food nor enjoy your meal as much. Casual dining. Parking is fairly easy to come by.

excerpts:
The Order:
I ordered the Country Breakfast with 2 biscuits in sausage gravy, 2 scrambled eggs (you can get them any way you please) and hash browns.
Now these has browns are amazing on their own (big chunky pieces of tater).
country breakfast.author: Patrick R.
country breakfast.review:
Wow....just...wow.

Story:
My band and I were in SF for a show at Slims. We had just finished our soundcheck around 10am, and were hungry as all hell. I searched for all the closest "breakfast" places nearby on my iphone (yelp app =]). This was the closest one that popped up. After finding parking a couple streets down, we turned onto 24th and noticed all of the amazing smells from restaurants from nearby Mexican joints and bakeries. We were almost swayed towards one of these, but decided to check out St Francis since they seemed to have actual breakfast which we were in the mood for. 

We were seated within 15 minutes of arriving, and the place was hoppin'. We read the menu and our mouths started to water, and learned that it was one of, if not the first (I can't quite remember which) ice cream places in SF. The staff was friendly and helpful in making our decisions.

The Order:
I ordered the Country Breakfast with 2 biscuits in sausage gravy, 2 scrambled eggs (you can get them any way you please) and hash browns. Now these has browns are amazing on their own (big chunky pieces of tater). But they have an option to "thing" your spuds. Oh...my god folks...they add sour cream, cheese, chives and their homemade salsa that tastes like it came from a legit Mexican place. Best potatoes I've ever had. The biscuits and gravy were out of this world. While I've had bigger biscuits, these were unbelievably buttery and deliscious, and the gravy was bomb. The guitarist in the band had the exact same breakfast I did and was equally blown away which is a feat considering his food snobbery. Our keyboardist had this awesome breakfast burrito and a coffee shake which was also amazing. 

The Verdict: 
Guys, this was hands down the best plate of biscuits and gravy I've ever had, and I always judge breakfast places by their pancakes or biscuits (usually both). The band has decided to come back here for sure next time we're in SF to try their lunch and dinner offerings. The best place I'd had before this was Ole's Waffle Shop in Alameda, which is also phenomenal.

excerpts: I had the country breakfast and mmm hmmm
I love those biscuits n gravy.
Since I saw those milkshakes I figured I should get one too
and I went for caramel.
country breakfast.author: Maria A.
country breakfast.review:
Hello Milkshake! more specifically Hello Caramel Milkshake!

This was the perfect way to start a new week in San Francisco. We put our name on the list and waited for a total of whopping 5 minutes. I had the country breakfast and mmm hmmm I love those biscuits n gravy. Since I saw those milkshakes I figured I should get one too and I went for caramel. Good choice. 

The staff is funny and personable. Good food and a great staff is definitely a way to keep everyone coming back.

excerpts: I asked him are you having the country breakfast?
He's said
yup, I said me too!
2 eggs your choice, home fries, and biscuits and gravy $7.50.
Are you serious?
What gets me the most is the service.
They must make these hipsters take happy pills.
I have never seen more pleasant, helpful, smiley vintage t wearing kids in my time in SF.
No surly, better than you attitude here!
country breakfast.author: Sarah M.
country breakfast.review:
St Francis is my new favorite-I have no money but still want to eat out-place.  Everything is super affordable, large portioned, and really tasty.
My friend closed his menu after about 30 seconds, and I was not long after.  I asked him are you having the country breakfast?  He's said yup, I said me too!  2 eggs your choice, home fries, and biscuits and gravy $7.50.  Are you serious?
What gets me the most is the service.  They must make these hipsters take happy pills.  I have never seen more pleasant, helpful, smiley vintage t wearing kids in my time in SF.  No surly, better than you attitude here!

excerpts: I keep ordering the Country Breakfast with biscuits and gravy and eggs.
It pretty good.
country breakfast.author: Thanya S.
country breakfast.review:
This is more of a 3.5 stars for me. I'm getting old and hate waiting in lines amongst the hipsters for a brunch. But, it's also fun people-watching and it's a super-cute place.

I like the menu too. It's fun to read and offers some nice diner-style options. I keep ordering the Country Breakfast with biscuits and gravy and eggs. It pretty good. The pancakes were also pretty good.

I've been here for dinner too. It's a good time to go because it's usually pretty empty. However, I don't think the biscuit was as fresh as ordering it earlier in the day. My friends ordered the hamburger, grilled cheese and fries and those looked pretty good.

excerpts: The country breakfast is good.
The hash browns are good.
It's just not worth 9 bucks.
country breakfast.author: Andy L.
country breakfast.review:
