The food is okay. I've had better from other greasy spoon diner joints. There's nothing there that's outstanding if you factor in the price. The country breakfast is good. The hash browns are good. It's just not worth 9 bucks. You should be able to leave a greasy spoon diner for around 10 bucks a person including tip and tax but ended up spending ~15 bucks a head which is insane which one considers the other alternatives in SF.

The wait staff is genuinely nice and friendly but could be faster.

The kitschy souvenirs are contrived and it doesn't seem like there's a genuine enthusiasm in the 50's theme.

excerpts: I scarfed down my country breakfast and was deliciously full all day.
Sad I didn't have the egg cream chocolate float,
I know I would have loved it (mmm egg cream).
country breakfast.author: hello y.
country breakfast.review: This is what diner food should be. Cheap, tasty, and with lots of milkshakes. The line is huge but it moves quick. I scarfed down my country breakfast and was deliciously full all day. Sad I didn't have the egg cream chocolate float, I know I would have loved it (mmm egg cream).

excerpts: Getting to the food, I ordered the vegan chorizo hash and my friend had the country breakfast.
They give good-sized servings here.
I was content with my size and didn't feel cheated at all.
The chorizo hash was really good.
country breakfast.author: Scott L.
country breakfast.review:
I'm a fan.

I just finished eating here last than two hours ago and had to yelp about it (since I tend to forget).  

I definitely think this is a good place.  My friend wanted to come here because he's in search of good diners in SF.  Mel's just doesn't count.  The feel and the service was exceptional.  The wait staff is very laid back yet attentive at the same time.  The whole vibe is very chill and cool.  Parking isn't too much of a problem since it's close to Cesar Chavez which is great.  

Getting to the food, I ordered the vegan chorizo hash and my friend had the country breakfast.  They give good-sized servings here.  I was content with my size and didn't feel cheated at all.  The chorizo hash was really good.  It tastes home-cooked and they don't use a lot of oil at all so I don't feel sick afterwards.   

Overall, I'd highly recommend this place for breakfast/brunch on the weekends.  It's outside of the traditional cow hollow or noe valley turf which is great.  There are much fewer yuppies out here and more laid back people.

excerpts: Their breakfast is great, I've had their country breakfast with bacon (
yum)- and my BF's all time favorite is Hector's Waffles (waffles with orange zest and pecans).
country breakfast.author: Josie W.
country breakfast.review: My boyfriend and I usually go here twice a month on weekend mornings to get some breakfast when we are too lazy to cook.  Their breakfast is great, I've had their country breakfast with bacon (yum)- and my BF's all time favorite is Hector's Waffles (waffles with orange zest and pecans). My only complaint is that Friday mornings aren't considered "weekends," and therefore I can't order my favorite eggs benedict. Overall a great place to eat- but at times (depending on the waiter)- service lacks.

excerpts: Best homemade corned beef hash ever!
Wonderful homemade biscuits with hint of rosemary.
Price is right
homemade corned beef hash.author: Karen E.
homemade corned beef hash.review: Food was fabulous. Service is excellent. Best homemade corned beef hash ever! Wonderful homemade biscuits with hint of rosemary. Price is right

excerpts: I've tried an omelette and the homemade corned beef hash.
Both are great.
Minor complaint is I don't care for the seasoning (it might have rosemary) they put on their breakfast potatoes
but that's just my personal taste.
Wait time seems to be 20-30 min on average during weekend brunch so not bad at all.
Service is pretty quick and friendly once you're seated.
homemade corned beef hash.author: george c.
homemade corned beef hash.review: This is one of my favorite places to go for breakfast on weekends.  I've tried an omelette and the homemade corned beef hash.  Both are great.  Minor complaint is I don't care for the seasoning (it might have rosemary) they put on their breakfast potatoes but that's just my personal taste.  Wait time seems to be 20-30 min on average during weekend brunch so not bad at all.  Service is pretty quick and friendly once you're seated.

excerpts: I ordered the homemade corned beef hash.
I would recommend that you try this place out.
While not everyone is a meat eater, their menu had vegetarian selections as well.
Go ahead spend the roughly 9$ per plate and grub down.
homemade corned beef hash.author: Ryan P.
homemade corned beef hash.review: This breakfast joint was superb. Super friendly service. The food didn't take to long to come out and it was delicious. I ordered the homemade corned beef hash. I would recommend that you try this place out. While not everyone is a meat eater, their menu had vegetarian selections as well. Go ahead spend the roughly 9$ per plate and grub down.

excerpts: I could to omelettes, 2 eggs special, breakfast sandwich, a veggie hash with vegan chorizo, huevos rancheros but the "Nebulous Potato Thing" won this breakfast battle.
It's potatos, salsa, sour cream,
melted cheese tiled with an egg.
nebulous potato thing.author: Carolina S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Diners are one the top Americana icons that comes to mind. It's something that was created in America and holds a piece of my heart tightly.  

I love an old school diner! I am super happy my friends are so cool and they suggested I hit up St. Francis Fountain while I was in San Francisco. It transported me into the 50's era (been around since 1918)  but in liberal SF mental state. It was my last meal on my trip. My friend Susie picked me up from a local brewery and we headed over. We easily found a parking spot and had no problems getting a table for two. This place is long and skinny and it might be tough to have large groups or the weekend wave could also be a damper. 

The prices were so cheap! I really could not believe it. And there was a ton of veggie and vegan options. I could to omelettes, 2 eggs special, breakfast sandwich, a veggie hash with vegan chorizo, huevos rancheros but the "Nebulous Potato Thing" won this breakfast battle. It's potatos, salsa, sour cream, melted cheese tiled with an egg.  I will definitely return on my next trip and try out lunch options too. 

I ordered biscuits because it's a specialty and this spot. It was a great suggestion Susie. They were small, fluffy and the perfect indulgent accompaniment for breakfast!! 

Maybe I will get wild next time and go for a fountain drink. One will never know the levels of crazy brunch I get....tbc.

excerpts: I will be sure to be back to try a vegan version of the Nebulous Potato Thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Shane S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
St. Francis Fountain is a pretty solid brunch spot that has plenty of vegan options which is awesome. There was quite the line when I went there for brunch this afternoon & signed up on the clipboard outside. I was seated fairly soon though as I chose to sit on the counter. 

The vibe here is interesting as is pure hipster w/ a 1980s nostalgia meets a 1950s dinner. They even sell Alf & Garbage Pail Kid Trading cards along w/ Nerds & Twizzlers old school candy.

I have an appreciation for many of the counter culture scenes including the Beats of the 1950s, the hippies of the 1960s, & the punks of the 1970s along w/ the Grunge alternative scene of the 1990s yet never got into the hipster scene.

The vegan brunch here was great though. I went w/ the Devil Burger which is fully vegan as comes w/ lettuce, tomato, onion, & pickle on a sesame bun along w/ veganaise & a pile of marinated & grilled thinly sliced seitan. I added avocado & grilled onions. It comes w/ a choice of a side which I chose the fries.

I will be sure to be back to try a vegan version of the Nebulous Potato Thing. Despite not being into the hipster scene St. Francis Fountain does have plenty of vegan brunch options so recommend it for that alone.

FOMO
Whatevs, if you are a hipster vegan then this place is for you. 
YOLO

excerpts: They have really good vegan options too: I love the banana-walnut vegan pancakes (which come with *vegan* butter!), the tofu rancheros, and the vegan nebulous potato thing.
They have non-vegan stuff too
nebulous potato thing.author: Morgane M.
nebulous potato thing.review:
This place is so good! Really friendly staff, excellent food, cute diner vibes... I love it. They have really good vegan options too: I love the banana-walnut vegan pancakes (which come with *vegan* butter!), the tofu rancheros, and the vegan nebulous potato thing. They have non-vegan stuff too and I'm sure it's good as well.

Portions are very filling and you will leave here satisfied and happy.

excerpts: Nebulous Potato Thing' is delicious!
nebulous potato thing.author: Joanna L.
nebulous potato thing.review:
'Nebulous Potato Thing' is delicious! Pile of baked spuds, melted cheese, fresh salsa, sour cream (I subbed guac though), and chopped green onion. $5.50 for a small; $7.50 for a large. Add an egg for $2. Worth it. All the flavors blend together nicely. 

St. Francis Fountain is an old school diner. You'll get seated quicker if you choose the counter or outdoor option. Lots of good breakfast options here, with an unique, home-comfort twist.

excerpts: The menu has some hilariously named items that I will have to try on another visit such as: nebulous potato thing (I had a good laugh about this one with one of the very friendly waiters).
I will definitely be back to this place
and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a quick lunch or ice cream cone.
nebulous potato thing.author: Amanda G.
nebulous potato thing.review: This place is the awesome sauce!  Everyone who works in this super cool diner/ ice cream parlor is super friendly and on the ball.  I had the Caesar salad with grilled chicken and it was really good and fast and not expensive.  The menu has some hilariously named items that I will have to try on another visit such as: nebulous potato thing (I had a good laugh about this one with one of the very friendly waiters).  I will definitely be back to this place and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a quick lunch or ice cream cone.

excerpts: Nebulous potato thing.
Uhhh, 5 stars alone for that name!
It was like a giant, fully loaded, smashed potato.
nebulous potato thing.author: Susy C.
nebulous potato thing.review:
No frills divey diner American food. It's not complicated. The portions are huge, you get your money's worth and it is damn tasty. 

I was so happy with corned beef hash but of course I couldn't say no when my friend offered me some of his brunch: Nebulous potato thing. Uhhh, 5 stars alone for that name! 
It was like a giant, fully loaded, smashed potato. SO GOOD. 

The wait isn't too bad, everybody's friendly, and the food is good.

excerpts: I've had the milkshakes and the egg scrambles and the vegan sausage and The Nebulous Potato Thing and maybe (maybe!)
one time I had all of it in one sitting.
Maybe.
What can I say?
I live abroad, so when I get back in town
I hoover everything
I know
nebulous potato thing.author: Brittany B.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I'm not a vegan, and I don't have any vegan friends in the neighborhood, but St. Francis Fountain is my favorite brunch spot in the Mission. No contest. 

I've had the milkshakes and the egg scrambles and the vegan sausage and The Nebulous Potato Thing and maybe (maybe!) one time I had all of it in one sitting. Maybe. What can I say? I live abroad, so when I get back in town I hoover everything I know I can't get across the Atlantic - like pancakes and decent avocados. 

There's often a wait to sit, but they have quite a bit of space inside and if the weather's nice, they will sit people along the side of the building right in the sun. I've never waited more than 15-20 minutes which, for brunch in San Francisco, is unheard of. 

The service is friendly, and food comes out quick, and I've never felt rushed out of my booth or table. The menu has a little (or a lot) of something for everyone, so it's a great place to drag friends - even your gluten free, lactose intolerant friends nursing a hangover. 100% satisfaction guaranteed. 

Go here. Eat the things. Get a milkshake with your brunch, there ain't no shame.

excerpts: Nebulous potato thing and the upside down hog cakes were amazing!!
No complaints.
Service was fast and friendly.
nebulous potato thing.author: Samantha C.
nebulous potato thing.review: Nebulous potato thing and the upside down hog cakes were amazing!! No complaints. Service was fast and friendly.

excerpts: The breakfast hash and nebulous potato thing is very filling, The decor is a throwback to the old world soda fountain shops.
I have not had a chance to try the desserts yet.
nebulous potato thing.author: Long C.
nebulous potato thing.review: Finally got a chance to eat at this place. There always seem to be a line on the weekends, so weekdays may be your best best. We were seated promptly. The breakfast hash and nebulous potato thing is very filling, The decor is a throwback to the old world soda fountain shops. I have not had a chance to try the desserts yet.

excerpts: Nebulous Potato Thing
nebulous potato thing.author: Leland S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Story: My friend told me about this place and it's unique old school ambiance. 

Location: Like most restaurants in SF it's on the side of the street so street parking is a must. It can seat about 40 people.

Ambiance: 
This place really does bring an old school feel from the paper straws to the their classic candy. You can sit stool diner style or booth. It seemed like the "Prince" playlist was playing (which is totally fine by me).

Service: 
Our server was quick and attentive. Our orders came in less than 10 minutes. He politely followed up with every now and then.

Food: 
SF Reuben - I honestly thought this would be light especially since there would be no meat but this actually filled me up. I was hesitant at first but this was a tasty alternative to the usual corned beef rueben.

Nebulous Potato Thing - We ordered the small but this small dish was flavorful and surprisingly fulfilling

Old fashioned Vanilla Ice Cream Malt - The taste was rich and the texture of the malt was on point. The paper straw was quite a struggle at first since it would get soggy after quite sometime and it would be hard to suck through the straw. Be sure to stir so the malt is distributed evenly throughout the shake.

Overall: 
I would rate this place 4.5 stars. I honestly can't complain about this place. The music was pleasing, the service was quick, and food was delicious. Their menu was had a wide variety from their breakfast menu to their authentic shakes. Meals ranged from the high $5-10 range and well worth it. Whenever I'm back in town and in need for that old school American feel, this will be the place to be.

excerpts: Everything tasted delicious - we tried both the nebulous potato thing (even the small is huge
nebulous potato thing.author: Sol C.
nebulous potato thing.review:
St. Francis Fountain is a classic, old-fashioned diner. The ambience was great - very low key with big booths and lots of space to sit at the counter. The servers were all very friendly and relaxed. 

The food was overwhelming in an awesome way. Massive plates of spuds and melted cheese and eggs... Everything tasted delicious - we tried both the nebulous potato thing (even the small is huge so no need to order the large, although I recommend adding on some over easy eggs!) and the veggie mess (vegan chorizo is seriously tasty and I'm not even a vegetarian).

Another awesome touch was the fantastic egg cream in an ice cream sundae glass. We loved the old school feel! Great breakfast!

excerpts: I ordered the infamous Nebulous Potato Thing of course.
And it was definitely something I would order.
Potatoes with guac, pico de gallo, and sour cream?
Perfect in my mouth- seriously.
And I'm really glad that they offered it in a smaller order because it was just right.
The boyfriend ordered an omelet and his order was huge.
Also ordered the egg soda thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Dara S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I ordered the infamous Nebulous Potato Thing of course. And it was definitely something I would order. Potatoes with guac, pico de gallo, and sour cream? Perfect in my mouth- seriously. And I'm really glad that they offered it in a smaller order because it was just right. The boyfriend ordered an omelet and his order was huge. Also ordered the egg soda thing. It was okay, like carbonated hot cocoa powder.

I had to knock off a star because our waiter was nowhere to be found. They had one waitress who kept flirting with a customer even when we asked her to get our check. Then after we got our check it took them forever to ring us up. Almost half an hour waiting to pay. Kinda unheard of right? Foods good, they could probably work on their service.

excerpts: We decided to order the Chef's Mess, the Nebulous Potato Thing and a Banana Split.
Everything was delicious.
The Nebulous Potato Thing looked small, but was VERY heavy.
Both dishes had tons of flavor and seems like they were coordinately thrown together.
I'd probably return to this place if I was lucky enough to go back with no line.
nebulous potato thing.author: Christine D.
nebulous potato thing.review: Drove and walked by St. Francis Fountain numerous times wondering what the big deal is with the long lines.  In my mind this was known as the small diner with the long lines in the Mission.  One random weekday while I was off from work, I decided to try this place out because as fate had it there was no line.  We decided to order the Chef's Mess, the Nebulous Potato Thing and a Banana Split.  Everything was delicious.  The Nebulous Potato Thing looked small, but was VERY heavy.  Both dishes had tons of flavor and seems like they were coordinately thrown together.  I'd probably return to this place if I was lucky enough to go back with no line.

excerpts: The portions are quite large so we shared two breakfasts: the French toast and the small nebulous potato thing.
I think this was more than enough food, but she also ordered a shake because they serve Mitchell's ice cream
and she really wanted to try Mitchell's.
nebulous potato thing.author: Rezal G.
nebulous potato thing.review:
My cousin was visiting from out of town and I would like to say that I am hip and with it enough to know to take her to this place, but that would make me a liar. I'm not even sure how she found out about this place, but I'm so happy she did. It's so good and it's just a short bus or BART ride away from my school!

The portions are quite large so we shared two breakfasts: the French toast and the small nebulous potato thing. I think this was more than enough food, but she also ordered a shake because they serve Mitchell's ice cream and she really wanted to try Mitchell's. Everything was amazing!

One tip I will offer is to try to go on a weekday. We went on a Wednesday morning and there was plenty of open seats. We got a booth and it was great, but I could see the experience having been very different if we went on a weekend.

excerpts: Nebulous Potato Thing is something you can only get here, and so, you should.
nebulous potato thing.author: Katie W.
nebulous potato thing.review:
St Francis is an institution, a relic, an antique and a classic.
It is also, a dump.

The food here is clear diner with nostalgic treats and a few twists of this century. You won't come here for the atmosphere - or maybe you will, if you're looking to get down and dirty with the bearded hipsters and just not care if you washed your hair at ALL this...month.

Dishes stand up to anything the grunge detracts. Nebulous Potato Thing is something you can only get here, and so, you should.

Sweet, thoughtful waiters and personality, that's that.

excerpts: Had the Nebulous Potato thing and my other half had the Chefs messy scramble ....HELLA GOOD!
nebulous potato thing.author: Char B.
nebulous potato thing.review: Everything was amazing! Had the Nebulous Potato thing and my other half had the Chefs messy scramble ....HELLA GOOD! Banana Bread was on point ....this is def a must try again and again and AGAIN!

excerpts: Nebulous potato thing -
Uh... it's like potatoes and other stuff
like kinda put together.
You know?
nebulous potato thing.author: Ivan L.
nebulous potato thing.review:
St. Francis Fountain - where the hip come to dine and the tourists come to watch them.

We head to St. Francis @ 9:50 something AM on the weekends and catch an outside table as soon as the open up @ 10 AM.  There's just 4 or 5 of them but there's plenty of space for two people and one dog.  Lately the outside tables are getting claimed by tourists with suit cases and Noe drive-ins with their strollers and SUVs.  Stay away from my table people!

The breakfast food is top notch!  Some favorites include:
* Blueberry pancakes - the wife must have blueberry pancakes fairly frequently or suffer the ills of some unstated dire curse.  Along with a side of eggs, these blueberry pancakes appear to stave off the evil.
* Hogcakes - pancakes with cheese, green onions, and bacon cooked into them.  So very yum!
* Omelets - Big two egg omelets with whatever you want in them.  They come with a side of crispy, spiced, fried potatoes that people who eat potatoes seem to love. 
* Nebulous potato thing - Uh... it's like potatoes and other stuff like kinda put together.  You know?
* Banana bread - sweet and yummy
* Corn beef hash - greasy, with peppers and potatoes and beef.  It'll make your stomach cry out, "No more!" and then "Okay, a little more!"

excerpts: Get the nebulous potato thing - that is all!
Also, be prepared to wait a bit if you are going for breakfast on a weekend after 9:30AM
nebulous potato thing.author: Crystal R.
nebulous potato thing.review: Get the nebulous potato thing - that is all! Also, be prepared to wait a bit if you are going for breakfast on a weekend after 9:30AM

excerpts: The nebulous potato thing with a scrambled egg and side of cornbread will soak up the excess booze and leave you comfy and full for a very reasonable price.
nebulous potato thing.author: Natalie S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Do you know what an egg cream is? I didn't either until I shared one with my mom at St. Francis (it's basically chocolate soda, which is delicious). 

This place is my perfect morning after a too-fun Friday breakfast joint. The nebulous potato thing with a scrambled egg and side of cornbread will soak up the excess booze and leave you comfy and full for a very reasonable price. Plus it's really cute in there. 

Yum.

excerpts: We dropped in from a cold day's walk for a cup of soup and maybe some Nebulous Potato Thing.
I was pretty happy with the Nebulous Potato thing as it has all the nasty stuff you wouldn't expect from a vegetarian friendly restaurant.
I honestly wouldn't eat anything else from this place but their milkshakes and maybe their pie.
They were out.
nebulous potato thing.author: Jessica K.
nebulous potato thing.review:
We dropped in from a cold day's walk for a cup of soup and maybe some Nebulous Potato Thing. We walked in to a time capsule stuck in the 50's with a dash of the 80's helping out the candy section. 

Our server was a late coming of Andrew W. K. and while he was polite enough, it was obvious he didn't want to be there. There was another server who was hardly wearing any clothes and created some popped cherries on children's eyes when she bended over. 

I was pretty happy with the Nebulous Potato thing as it has all the nasty stuff you wouldn't expect from a vegetarian friendly restaurant. I honestly wouldn't eat anything else from this place but their milkshakes and maybe their pie. They were out. Of course.  

The service is a little lacking and I'm not into the hipster thing but if you're one of those people who have to be different and cool, you'd enjoy being seen at St. Francis. Ask Mr. Andrew W. K. look-alike for an autograph while you're there.

excerpts: Must try the Chef's Mess & the Nebulous Potato Thing!
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XAiTKvUQe9ZV1LqCnV8YMQ/l
The Chef's Mess is a scramble with homefries, bacon & mushrooms, topped with cheese, tomato & sour cream.
It was sooooooo good!
The Nebulous Potato Thing is the hearty filling version with solely homefries, cheese, salsa & sourcream.
nebulous potato thing.author: Marti L.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Thanks to Yelp, new awesome brunch place!! From the pictures posted, I saw the long counter, the wooden booths, the decor in general. An old diner style differing from many brunch places here in the Mission. But what surprised me when I got there was the people! Instead of the moms&pops I was expecting, the place was filled with trendy down-to-earth workers. The atmosphere was hip and vibrant! Awesome!

Must try the Chef's Mess & the Nebulous Potato Thing! http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XAiTKvUQe9ZV1LqCnV8YMQ/l The Chef's Mess is a scramble with homefries, bacon & mushrooms, topped with cheese, tomato & sour cream. It was sooooooo good! The bacon & homefries added nice crunch and flavor, while the toppings kept the scramble moist and gooood. *drooooooooools* The Nebulous Potato Thing is the hearty filling version with solely homefries, cheese, salsa & sourcream. Personally, not as satisfying, but nonetheless delicious!

There's always a wait for tables, but never too long. And service may get a bit slow. Can't blame them. They get swamped!! 

Fyi, the menu is very vegan and vegetarian friendly, also heart healthy (ie. egg whites option)

excerpts: I had the Nebulous Potato Thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Gerald S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I had the Nebulous Potato Thing. It was very good with a blend of cold and hot, with the salsa and chives counteracting the sour crème and yellow cheese. 

Before coming here I noticed quite a few reviewers complaining about service. I had great service, I think you have to be proactive about service here. Not to sit and wait like a mushroom on a log waiting for someone to come over.

You merely need to get eye contact and smile first.

I also had a coffee ice cream shake that was very good as well. St. Francis has a bar in which quite a few people would come in just to get the ice cream.

excerpts: I usually can't decide between the Chef's Mess and the Nebulous Potato Thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Sarah D.
nebulous potato thing.review: Hands down my favorite brunch place in San Francisco. Though it's not my partner's favorite---but I'm a lot more down to earth and more food-obsessed. It's total diner food---excellent menu creations of potatoes, cheese, bacon, and sour cream. Big portions. I usually can't decide between the Chef's Mess and the Nebulous Potato Thing. But if you go, you MUST THING YOUR SPUDS, it just makes everything even more delicious. There is usually a wait on weekends, but it's totally worth it. I've also come here on evenings and had a milkshake and those are quite delicious as well. Very fun, diner, hipster vibe. Not the place to go to impress your parents or your boss, but it's a favorite place for friends on the weekend.

excerpts: I ordered the biscuits and sausage gravy with a side of fresh fruit and my boyfriend got the "Nebulous Potato thing" with an egg.
My dish was tasty and the fresh fruit i got was actually fresh and ripe.
I didn't love the biscuit i got
but i think that's more to do with my own expectations of what a biscuit is
then it is due to anything wrong with the one i  got.
The biscuit was very soft and fluffy, kind of like a very light tender roll rather then flaky and crisp like i was expecting.
The potatoes that came on the side of my dish and as the base of my boyfriends were VERY good; spiced right, cooked with onions, and perfectly tender.
I'm going back
but next time i'm definitely getting a milkshake.
nebulous potato thing.author: Sara G.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Got breakfast here and and it was pretty good for what it was. The food here reminds me heavily of east cost dinner food with, of course, a west coast hipster twist. I ordered the biscuits and sausage gravy with a side of fresh fruit and my boyfriend got the "Nebulous Potato thing" with an egg. My dish was tasty and the fresh fruit i got was actually fresh and ripe. I didn't love the biscuit i got but i think that's more to do with my own expectations of what a biscuit is then it is due to anything wrong with the one i  got. The biscuit was very soft and fluffy, kind of like a very light tender roll rather then flaky and crisp like i was expecting. The potatoes that came on the side of my dish and as the base of my boyfriends were VERY good; spiced right, cooked with onions, and perfectly tender. 
I'm going back but next time i'm definitely getting a milkshake.

excerpts: The Nebulous Potato Thing was the jam!!
So stinking yummy!!!
4 of us ate for under 50 bucks and are full!!
nebulous potato thing.author: Jessica G.
nebulous potato thing.review: Amazing food and service! The Nebulous Potato Thing was the jam!! So stinking yummy!!! 4 of us ate for under 50 bucks and are full!!

excerpts: Had the nebulous potato thing and it was super good (if not just a tad bland).
nebulous potato thing.author: Alan J.
nebulous potato thing.review: Sweet little old school diner/soda fountain. Had the nebulous potato thing and it was super good (if not just a tad bland). The dreamsicle soda was AMAZING as was the old-fashioned shake (yeah, i pigged out). My gf liked her reuben but both the soups she tried (brocolli and chicken) were very bland. Loved it though!

excerpts: There are a lot of delicious menu choices but we finally settled on the Corned Beef Hash ($9) which was outstanding, and we LOVED the Nebulous Potato Thing - a half order (which is huge) was only $5!
We heartily recommend both.
Really great house coffee, too!
Can't wait to come back and try one of their delicious looking milkshakes, yum.
nebulous potato thing.author: Athena T.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Absolutely fantastic place to come for breakfast, which is served all day. The retro ambiance was fun, and the waitress was very friendly and helpful. We came on a weekday morning right when the place opened so there was very little traffic and we had none of the issues other yelpers seem to have had with waiting or service.

There are a lot of delicious menu choices but we finally settled on the Corned Beef Hash ($9) which was outstanding, and we LOVED the Nebulous Potato Thing - a half order (which is huge) was only $5! We heartily recommend both. Really great house coffee, too! Can't wait to come back and try one of their delicious looking milkshakes, yum.

excerpts: The nebulous potato thing is the best.
Coffee is decent.
Service is average
nebulous potato thing.author: Zach H.
nebulous potato thing.review: Great food here.  The nebulous potato thing is the best.  Coffee is decent.  Service is average

excerpts: Nebulous potato thing!
It was pretty dang good, but next time I go I am definitely going to get the half order instead of the full.
Service was great.
The atmosphere is really laid back so don't be expected a fancy breakfast place or anything.
My friends and I came in with a pretty big party around 10:30 AM I believe
and we got seated pretty fast.
It's great that they have two spaces to accommodate more guests.
I would definitely come back here when in the area.
nebulous potato thing.author: Jeanette L.
nebulous potato thing.review: Nebulous potato thing! It was pretty dang good, but next time I go I am definitely going to get the half order instead of the full. Service was great. The atmosphere is really laid back so don't be expected a fancy breakfast place or anything. My friends and I came in with a pretty big party around 10:30 AM I believe and we got seated pretty fast. It's great that they have two spaces to accommodate more guests. I would definitely come back here when in the area.

excerpts: I ordered a veggie omelet for myself and also tried a few bites of the nebulous potato thing and my goodness!
Everything about this place was great.
Fluffy eggs, fresh veggies...their avocado melted in my mouth.
Breakfast potatoes were flavored perfectly with a hint of onions.
So glad we tried this place, it was simply amazing.
Even my picky 4 year-old loved it.
Service was great too.
Friendly staff & the food came out fairly quickly once we ordered.
A must try!
nebulous potato thing.author: Darlene R.
nebulous potato thing.review: Came here on a Saturday morning and waited around 20 mins to be seated for a hungry group of 5... and boy was it worth it. I ordered a veggie omelet for myself and also tried a few bites of the nebulous potato thing and my goodness! Everything about this place was great. Fluffy eggs, fresh veggies...their avocado melted in my mouth. Breakfast potatoes were flavored perfectly with a hint of onions. So glad we tried this place, it was simply amazing. Even my picky 4 year-old loved it. Service was great too. Friendly staff & the food came out fairly quickly once we ordered. A must try!

excerpts: I love their corned beef hash and that's all I've tried, but friends have had their eggs florentine and the nebulous potato thing and similarly loved the food.
This is what Mel's should be.
nebulous potato thing.author: Faceless E.
nebulous potato thing.review: These guys are great! We had a party of six, were worried about getting out on time, but they seated us quickly. Super friendly, and the food is tasty. I love their corned beef hash and that's all I've tried, but friends have had their eggs florentine and the nebulous potato thing and similarly loved the food. This is what Mel's should be.

excerpts: Stop worrying about other people's clothing and eat your nebulous potato thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Ginny M.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Everyone who works here is nice as hell and the food is amazing. The fact that they've added even more vegan options to their menu AND opened up that secondary room makes me love them even more. 

But a question for the rest of the Yelpers here: WHY, oh WHY do you feel the need to point out the fact that there are hipsters here? Way to go Captains Obvious! It is really sad that your secret jealously of people with better haircuts AND music taste than you overshadows the delicious meal in front of you. Stop worrying about other people's clothing and eat your nebulous potato thing.

excerpts: It came with a side of potatoes (Nebulous Potato Thing style) and cornbread.
This was a huge portion of food and could easily have been split by two people.
nebulous potato thing.author: Shreya O.
nebulous potato thing.review:
One day I woke up and was craving tofu scramble and ended up at St. Francis because it's one of the few places in the city that serves it. 

I got the Tofu Scramble with ranchera sauce, avocado, tomatoes, onions and goat cheese. It came with a side of potatoes (Nebulous Potato Thing style) and cornbread. This was a huge portion of food and could easily have been split by two people. Everything was delicious, service was great (and surprisingly quick).

There's always a wait to get a table so get a milkshake in the meantime. They're some of the best in the city.

excerpts: I ordered the Nebulous Potato Thing I've heard so much about and it did not disappoint.
If you are craving diner food, don't skip this spot!
nebulous potato thing.author: Vanessa L.
nebulous potato thing.review: This cute diner in the Mission takes you back in time with its vintage vibe.  For Saturday brunch, the hubs and I were seated promptly upon arrival - woohoo!  I ordered the Nebulous Potato Thing I've heard so much about and it did not disappoint.  If you are craving diner food, don't skip this spot!

excerpts: Had the nebulous potato thing with a side of bacon and flour tortillas.
It was delish, however not worth the wait
nebulous potato thing.author: Desiree B.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Solid 3.5 out of 5 stars.

Waited about 45mins to an hour to be seated. 

Had the nebulous potato thing with a side of bacon and flour tortillas. 
It was delish, however not worth the wait OR the drive from Daly City. 

Immediately after devouring all my food I felt the worst case of food coma and even had a slight stomach ache which lasted all day (probably my own fault from eating so damn much).

I can understand why people love this place so much. The food is great...but personally i prefer breakfast food in the comfort of my own home.

excerpts: I ordered the irresistibly named "nebulous potato thing" and enjoyed the homey feel of the dish.
The mac n cheese was okay - it didn't have a sauce to it that I find crucial.
nebulous potato thing.author: Monica L.
nebulous potato thing.review:
A friend of mine insisted that the best mac 'n cheese was at St. Francis Fountain.  What I did find was a busy boy that was a dead ringer for Russell Brand.  Awesome.  

I ordered the irresistibly named "nebulous potato thing" and enjoyed the homey feel of the dish.  The mac n cheese was okay - it didn't have a sauce to it that I find crucial.

excerpts: Perusing the menu, I give in and order the "Nebulous Potato Thing" ($6.75) which is basically home fries
w/ sour cream, salsa, green onions, melted cheese.
It takes about 15-20 mins for the food to come out.
It looks smaller than it is because the plate it comes on is actually a wide bowl.
There is plenty of food there.
nebulous potato thing.author: Angelo F.
nebulous potato thing.review:
After a long night of ringing in another year of Amy goodness. Kristina, Adam, Christopher, Nanako, and I head off to brunch. I had just eaten 4 hours ago so I intended to have some OJ. 

The place is a total throw back to a 1980's burger/malt diner, complete w/ classics like Tron and Garbage Pail Kids trading cards (originals, not reprints!!!). There is a line outside and everyone in the party must be present to be seated, luckily it isn't raining yet. 

We are seated in a comfy booth and are drink orders are taken immediately. Just water for me. 

Perusing the menu, I give in and order the "Nebulous Potato Thing" ($6.75) which is basically home fries w/ sour cream, salsa, green onions, melted cheese. It takes about 15-20 mins for the food to come out. It looks smaller than it is because the plate it comes on is actually a wide bowl. There is plenty of food there. I slather on the ketchup, hot sauce and pepper until I have red hott mess in front of me. 

It was so good and filling, I didn't eat till 10:00 that night, and that is after a hike in Marin. I will definitely come back for the Guinness float or some of the other breakfast dish. Also it's time to start up the Garbage Pail Kids card collection again.

excerpts: C for Nebulous Potato Thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Ezduzit S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
A for eating in an old school diner.
A for fresh squeezed oj.
C for playing old school Happy Days music. Too cheesy.
C for chorizo hash and corned beef hash. All potatoes. Where's the meat?
C for Nebulous Potato Thing. Mound of starch with little taste.

Would've been upset if I had to wait for this, but I slid right in, so it was just an okay breakfast.

excerpts: I had the Nebulous Potato Thing, which has now become my first choice at the fountain.
nebulous potato thing.author: Gina G.
nebulous potato thing.review:
First of all, expect a long wait on Saturday and Sunday.  Its difficult to be seated with larger groups because only 2 booths will fit 6 people at the most. If you do get past this one and only issue you will be rewarded with a fantastic meal, strong coffee and enjoyable wait staff.  

I had the Nebulous Potato Thing, which has now become my first choice at the fountain. 

Look for the great collection of 70's and 80's bubblegum cards.

excerpts: I had studied the menu a few times and couldn't wait to try it after seeing things like shakes, malts, the Nebulous Potato Thing (a large plate of homefries topped with melted cheese, fresh salsa, sour cream & green onions), Chef's Mess (eggs scrambled with homefries, bacon & mushrooms, topped with melted cheese, tomatoes, sour cream & green onions), chili cheese fries, mac and cheese, and a few bomb looking sandwiches.
nebulous potato thing.author: Jenny W.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I was so devastated by this experience that it has taken me a full week to finally write the review.  So Patricia P has been talking about how she's had this place bookmarked for months.  St. Francis Fountain looks/seems like it would be so much better than it actually is! Boo. 

It's a janky, dirty, hipster hangout gone completely wrong with crappy service, crappy food, and crappy bathrooms (broken lock).  Thank god we didn't arrive til 145ish pm, which meant we didn't have to wait in line. 

I had studied the menu a few times and couldn't wait to try it after seeing things like shakes, malts, the Nebulous Potato Thing (a large plate of homefries topped with melted cheese, fresh salsa, sour cream & green onions), Chef's Mess (eggs scrambled with homefries, bacon & mushrooms, topped with melted cheese, tomatoes, sour cream & green onions), chili cheese fries, mac and cheese, and a few bomb looking sandwiches.   

Patty got a turkey sandwich with avocado and I had to go with the Chef's Mess (seems like it could've been one of my own messy concoctions).  The turkey sandwich was on crappy bread that you get at Safeway, the turkey was clearly pre-packaged, and it just didn't look appetizing at all.  The Chef's Mess was gross.  I left at least half of it on my plate.  That partially could've been my fault, ordering something so heavy.   

The shake and malt were way too watery and the cheese fries, which we had ordered with bacon were no bueno.  They didn't get that we wanted bacon bits on the cheese fries, so they brought us a plate of bacon??!! What??? The fries were soggy and not seasoned well.  Yes, I know, we may seem like gluttonous pigs, but we were tired, hungover, and starving...

The service was also annoying.  We had to ask the poor water boy to get our waitress to take our order after 15 mins of being seated.

Gosh, I really didn't want to be disappointed by this place!!!

excerpts: I really want to try the Nebulous Potato Thing and one of their milkshakes next time!
nebulous potato thing.author: Donna K.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I went here for lunch with a coworker. The place is really clean and open. It wasn't too busy, but it was a late lunch (4-ish). We sat at the counter, which was charming. I like how they set the menus and their little container of paper straws (which had red candycane stripes!) on the counter. They had a lot of cute touches, but the atmosphere was a little lacking. I am sure that it was because it was slow when we came in. 

The service was quick and food comes out at a moderate pace. I ended up getting the Poor Man Soup. I have a bit of a cold so it hit the spot. There was a lot of chicken meat and a moderate amount of veggies. The biscuit was pretty much the highlight of soup. It was comforting and exactly what I needed. Beware of the cilantro though. There was lots of it. So if you aren't into that I wouldn't get it.

I really want to try the Nebulous Potato Thing and one of their milkshakes next time!

excerpts: Nebulous potato thing (split with friends
cuz it's huge)
Mitchell's ice cream
nebulous potato thing.author: Melissa Y.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Sorta shocked I haven't reviewed St Francis yet.  I used to live across the street and would occasionally get breakfast to go and have a kickass hipster-free backyard picnic.  Those were the days...

Fast forward to now.  I have to get in a car and drive there.  I have to use their bathroom and I occupy my time on line by pretending I'm going to buy something at Candy Corner just like everyone else.  It all feels so pedestrian.

And yet - I keep coming.  I bring my family here. I bring non-SF friends here. In fact, about 70% of the time when asked the question, "Where do you want to go for brunch?" this is my answer.  

Things I love:
* Veggie chili two egg scramble with a side of cornbread and fruit instead of potatoes (can be a bit tough for the gut if paired with their drip coffee) 
* 3 side meal: mac & cheese, cilantro chicken soup, and a house salad. 
* Tasty drip coffee
* Vegan sausage two egg scramble with a side of toast and fruit instead of potatoes
* Guinness float
* Their breakfast burrito
* MILKSHAKES
* Nebulous potato thing (split with friends cuz it's huge)
* Mitchell's ice cream

excerpts: The food is pretty good, and they have a couple of brilliantly named items on the menu - the Nebulous Potato Thing and the Chef's Mess.
There is a Guiness float on the menu that was much ballyhooed during our wait, but no one ordered one.
Maybe next time.
And maybe I'll don some temporary tattoos
so I can sit inside and actually rate this as a diner.
nebulous potato thing.author: neil c.
nebulous potato thing.review:
We didn't have enough tattoos to sit inside, so we were forced to sit outside. I kid, it was actually a brilliant day, perhaps too warm, and sitting outside under the awning was fun. 

Come here on a Sunday and expect a long wait - but there is no difference between here and any other brunch place in that regard. The food is pretty good, and they have a couple of brilliantly named items on the menu - the Nebulous Potato Thing and the Chef's Mess. There is a Guiness float on the menu that was much ballyhooed during our wait, but no one ordered one. Maybe next time. And maybe I'll don some temporary tattoos so I can sit inside and actually rate this as a diner.

excerpts: A few items that made this place worth the wait were the Nebulous Potato Thing and the old fashioned Dream Shake (complete with paper straws).
nebulous potato thing.author: Chadwick F.
nebulous potato thing.review:
There are a number of reasons why I believe this place to be absolute tops when it comes to Bay Area brunch.  The diner has a traditional aesthetic to love.  Like any true diner, it features a bar that can accommodate lots of customers.  St. Francis is not a large establishment, but even on a busy Sunday the wait was not long at all.  

A few items that made this place worth the wait were the Nebulous Potato Thing and the old fashioned Dream Shake (complete with paper straws).  One thing I just can never turn down are the traditional biscuits and gravy; a dish that St. Francis has perfected seemingly just for me.

St. Francis Fountain earns five stars from me for taking a traditional American diner setting/menu and adding a very genuine dose of creativity to the formula.  They do a great job welcoming the latin flavors and influences from the neighborhood and translating them into a lengthy delicious menu that has something for everyone.  

Thanks for taking credit cards.  Service is fast and friendly.

excerpts: Now that's what I'm talking 'bout!), the large potato dish (similar to the "Nebulous Potato Thing" at Boogaloo's), the eggs, the chili, and the milkshakes.
The milkshakes are truly transcendent.
nebulous potato thing.author: Bryna M.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I'm glad this place rocks because it's my nearest full service breakfast joint.  To say I enjoy the food here is an understatement.  I love their food.  It's good quality and damned tasty.  Plus the staff, despite their hipster clothes and complicated hairdos, is genuinely nice.  Really.

Stand outs for me have been the waffle, the savoury pancakes (How about a little cheddar chive action? Now that's what I'm talking 'bout!), the large potato dish (similar to the "Nebulous Potato Thing" at Boogaloo's), the eggs, the chili, and the milkshakes.  The milkshakes are truly transcendent.  Plus a large one is big enough to share.  

So get yer ass over to the St. Francis, beat the weekend crowds by hitting up for breakfast or lunch during the week.  Although that means you'll miss this little guy with the mullet who is literally my favorite waiter of all time.  He's just nice.  Really truly nice.

excerpts: Oh, and you have to admire a menu that offers you "Nebulous Potato Thing" (their answer to Boogaloos' "Temple of Hash").
St. Francis Fountain is an instant addition to our short list of Sunday brunch haunts.
nebulous potato thing.author: Joe H.
nebulous potato thing.review: I found this place on Yelp while searching for chocolate chip pancakes--and it didn't disappoint!  The menu and atmosphere are similar to Boogaloos, but it's less overrun with hipsters (perhaps owing to its location on the eastern border of the Mission).  As a bonus, Justina was ecstatic to find some Dark Crystal trading cards at the vintage candy/tchotchke counter.  Oh, and you have to admire a menu that offers you "Nebulous Potato Thing" (their answer to Boogaloos' "Temple of Hash").  St. Francis Fountain is an instant addition to our short list of Sunday brunch haunts.

excerpts: The nebulous potato thing rocks my world.
Second the decor...  gd, I love all the old fixtures in this place.
It's like stepping back in time to come in here, despite the uber-hip waitstaff.
Finally, even tho, yes, all the waiters are super hipsters, they're also all really nice.
No one's pissy at this place
, so it must be a decent place to work.
nebulous potato thing.author: Quietine X.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Unnngh...

That's how I usually feel when I head in here for a Sunday hangover brunch.  And in spite of the excruciating wait, I always feel great when I leave, the food is just that good.

It's impossible to list the ways that this place rules, but I'll try - first the food, it comes out fast, hot and always perfect.  The nebulous potato thing rocks my world.  Second the decor...  gd, I love all the old fixtures in this place.  It's like stepping back in time to come in here, despite the uber-hip waitstaff.  Finally, even tho, yes, all the waiters are super hipsters, they're also all really nice.  No one's pissy at this place, so it must be a decent place to work.  The owner is also really cool and down to talk about the place in detail if you catch him at the right time.

This place is good for the heart, wallet and belly - doesn't get better than that.  The only reason I give it four stars is the wait in the mornings, even though it's part of the charm it's not for everyone.

excerpts: The nebulous potato thing is really good.
nebulous potato thing.author: Amy S.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Wow.  I was just poking around on Yelp for a good breakfast place and came across St. Francis Fountain.  It is wonderful.  Everything I read about it in the reviews was true.  The waitstaff is highly tattooed and very friendly.  The place is very vegetarian friendly.  The nebulous potato thing is really good.  The granola was out of this world.  Coffee is strong and flavorful.

The only neg thing anyone at the table said about the breakfast was that the sausage had fennel, which he doesn't like.

excerpts: For non-vegan types, I've heard that the nebulous potato thing is not to be missed.
nebulous potato thing.author: Douglas P.
nebulous potato thing.review:
The quintessential brunch place in my neighbourhood.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The food is good comfort food: not fancy, but sometimes exactly what you want on a Sunday morning.  It is vegan friendly.  It is a real joy of mine to sit outside with friends eating brunch.

If you are coming here for brunch on the weekend, I would recommend arriving before 10 a.m.  The crowds get quite vicious at right about 10 a.m.  This applies for both Saturday and Sunday.

In terms of food, I'd recommend the vegan strawberry soy shake with real strawberries.  For non-vegan types, I've heard that the nebulous potato thing is not to be missed.

excerpts: The chicken,pesto and feta scramble, the Chef's Mess, and the Nebulous Potato thing are among our favorites.
They also have great shakes.
nebulous potato thing.author: Katie V.
nebulous potato thing.review:
We love getting breakfast here!  The chicken,pesto and feta scramble, the Chef's Mess, and the Nebulous Potato thing are among our favorites. 
They also have great shakes.

excerpts: The nebulous potato thing - yum.
nebulous potato thing.author: Nick R.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Ok, so I have been a neighbor of St. Francis for over 4 years now, and I have seen it go up and down with all the local hipsters, bikers and otherwise. I have to agree with the previous post - it's still a great place to go and get some grub. Sure the wait staff can be a bit....um...alternative?, but I always have a good experience. They accommodate just about any request with the menu and even my kids love seeing their favorite waitstaff and asking them all about their tattoos, piercings, etc. I have never EVER seen them act shady - even when they get a difficult customer (it's the mission after all). My only complaint is that I used to love going on the weekends and now I actively avoid it due to the hordes of brunchers waiting outside. Where did you go my cool indie hangout? Ah well, I will still be going back. 

Highly reccommended: The nebulous potato thing - yum.

excerpts: Nebulous Potato Thing?
The cheddar bacon green onion pancakes???!!!
Holy Poopy-Pants.
The shakes??
I damn near ate my own hand with the spoon in it
they were so good.
The service was great for my friend and I. Prompt and with a smile.
I wish I would have caught the dude's name, but he rocked a quasi-Boy Scouts hat.
nebulous potato thing.author: Big W.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I don't understand the 1 and 2 star ratings for St Francis. I absolutely love this place. It just might be my favorite brekky spot in town. The Chef's Mess? Nebulous Potato Thing? The cheddar bacon green onion pancakes???!!! Holy Poopy-Pants. The shakes?? I damn near ate my own hand with the spoon in it they were so good. The service was great for my friend and I. Prompt and with a smile. I wish I would have caught the dude's name, but he rocked a quasi-Boy Scouts hat. He was great. 

Anyone who gets hung up on the whole hipster thing might have a decent complaint if they were eating the staff and not the food. You don't have to eat the skinny pants wearing guy that looks like he rolled out of bed five minutes after he got to work. Hipsters are people too, they just happen to love PBR and silly bikes.

excerpts: Your average run of the mill greasy diner food, but totally worth going to if only to eat the nebulous potato thing.
So good, so, so good!!
nebulous potato thing.author: Kathryn M.
nebulous potato thing.review: Your average run of the mill greasy diner food, but totally worth going to if only to eat the nebulous potato thing. So good, so, so good!!

excerpts: We ordered almost immediately (nebulous potato thing and strawberry waffles).
About 30 minutes later they actually arrived, well after other people who were seated after us were served.
The waffle was soft, not crispy and, aside from the orange zest, pretty boring.
The nebulous potato thing was luke warm, like they'd had it sitting out for 15-20 minutes.
When we were done, we asked the only person who we'd seen in a while for our check, only to be told "You get your check from your server, so you'll just have to wait.
nebulous potato thing.author: Michael D.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Slow, rude service and mediocre food.  

I came to St Francis based on the Yelp! reviews and a friend's recommendation.  When we showed up, there was no one there, but we still had to put our names on a list and wait to be "seated".  When they finally came to seat us, they said "oh, just sit anywhere."

We ordered almost immediately (nebulous potato thing and strawberry waffles).  About 30 minutes later they actually arrived, well after other people who were seated after us were served.  The waffle was soft, not crispy and, aside from the orange zest, pretty boring.  The nebulous potato thing was luke warm, like they'd had it sitting out for 15-20 minutes.  When we were done, we asked the only person who we'd seen in a while for our check, only to be told "You get your check from your server, so you'll just have to wait."

excerpts: I'm in love with the Nebulous Potato Thing with extra sour cream.
Must go back for the hotcakes.
nebulous potato thing.author: Judy L.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Only here at St. Francis Fountain, you can have your ice cream at breakfast, revisit your childhood with Menudo, A-Team and Mork and Mindy cards, and eat a meal with your vegetarian friends, without the guilt of ordering meat.

The best part about St. Francis Fountain, you can substitute, add or change up the menu to your liking. The staff, laid back and extremely generous with the coffee!

Great bacon. I'm in love with the Nebulous Potato Thing with extra sour cream. Must go back for the hotcakes.

excerpts: I'm a firm believer in the power of their "nebulous potato thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Justina K.
nebulous potato thing.review:
I'm married to the son of a preacher man, and he has converted me... to the joys of Sunday brunch.  Of all the places we've sampled, St. Francis Fountain is my favorite.

Yeah, there's a wait, but things move at a good pace and I've never waited longer than 45 minutes.  (If you ask, they'll let you have some coffee to help while away the time.)  The food is always tasty, the milkshakes thick and delicious, and the servers are really sweet.  I've never felt a "cooler than thou" vibe from anyone working there.  The menu has something for everyone, from vegan to carnivore, and the portions are just right.  I'm a firm believer in the power of their "nebulous potato thing."  It'll brighten your day.

Can't finish the review without mentioning the candy counter.  It always gets a smile out of newcomers.

excerpts: Breakfast is best, especially the nebulous potato thing.
Shakes are made with Mitchells, which can't be beat, and the wait is never as long as it seems.
nebulous potato thing.author: cindy p.
nebulous potato thing.review:
First look at the waitstaff and I thought to myself, "Now there's a bucket-full of attitude waiting to happen."  Yes, I was being completely judgmental and classist against some punk-rock hipsters.  And I was so wrong...

I've been there so many times I can no longer count. The staff is all really friendly, willing to talk about their Megadeth t-shirts without a bit of irony, and the food and shakes are rockin'.

Breakfast is best, especially the nebulous potato thing.  Shakes are made with Mitchells, which can't be beat, and the wait is never as long as it seems.

excerpts: The eggs benedict is to die for, and the nebulous potato thing is a deliciously sloppy pile of indulgence.
By far my favorite brunch in the city.
nebulous potato thing.author: A. M.
nebulous potato thing.review:
Hopping with gloriously tattooed hipsters and soothing my Sunday morning hangovers with endless coffee while I wait patiently, lusting over the sexy lingerie in the window next door. I love this place. It has never failed me, not even once. 

The eggs benedict is to die for, and the nebulous potato thing is a deliciously sloppy pile of indulgence. By far my favorite brunch in the city.

excerpts: St. Francis is the place that put "nebulous potato thing" on the map.
nebulous potato thing.author: eliah g.
nebulous potato thing.review:
St. Francis is the place that put "nebulous potato thing" on the map. It's not the place to go for coffee, but it's got your brunch needs covered (plus Philz is only 4 blocks away). 

This place is very hipster and on a weekend around noon you will be waiting. But hey, it's not as bad as Boogaloos. Plus the wait staff is nicer. The food is better too.  Plus there's a new underwear shop next store. Jesus, what more do you want?

excerpts: My roommate swears by the Nebulous Potato Thing.
nebulous potato thing.author: Jeff R.
nebulous potato thing.review:
We live about 100 yards from this place, and that's one of the best parts of living in the Mission. 

There's always a wait for brunch, and there's a good reason for that. Everything is good, especially the pancakes and the corned beef hash. My roommate swears by the Nebulous Potato Thing. 

Also good for ice cream, most notably the brownie sundae and the iconic Guinness Float. Oh and great burgers.

St. Francis is def. a Scene Kid Diner, but the way I see it, that only results in a better soundtrack. Ladytron at brunch? Yes, please.

Great job!

excerpts: I always try to get the nebulous potato thing when I am there and a chocolate coke, because it IS an old school soda fountain.
The service is always nice and the diner looks like you just went through a time warp back to 1950's.
In the evening, I can usually find street parking but parking in the morning is a nightmare.
Still, the food is so great that we manage!
nebulous potato thing.author: Sandi Y.
nebulous potato thing.review: This place is my absolute favorite place in the entire city! I usually go for dinner but they serve breakfast items all day. They have Mitchell's ice cream which is a really good quality ice cream. I always try to get the nebulous potato thing when I am there and a chocolate coke, because it IS an old school soda fountain. The service is always nice and the diner looks like you just went through a time warp back to 1950's. In the evening, I can usually find street parking but parking in the morning is a nightmare. Still, the food is so great that we manage!

excerpts: i tried their NEBULOUS POTATO THING, and it's crazy good that you got to order 1/2 of it when trying it for the first time
(maybe i'll go for the mile later!)
... wasn't in the mood for the classic diner fare such as shakes, but i will most definitely try other selections.
nebulous potato thing.author: Marc K.
nebulous potato thing.review:
let me tell you, this diner, unlike majority of the diners in sf, have more vegetarian/vegan selections than anyone else. i always feel like a loser when ordering from a place that doesn't recognize or respect vegetarians like me. yes, it's sad for me but disappointing for food places.

anyways, fountains is a local gem in the mission and one must consider it done when looking through delectable selections by fountains. i tried their NEBULOUS POTATO THING, and it's crazy good that you got to order 1/2 of it when trying it for the first time (maybe i'll go for the mile later!) ... wasn't in the mood for the classic diner fare such as shakes, but i will most definitely try other selections. sucks that they're not 24 hours, because i would go here and love it as much as i would want to!

oh yea.. the decor and the look of this diner holds a special place in san francisco and the mission district, an institution indeed! one must appreciate the beauty of this dilapidated diner and then eat from this dilapidated diner! no pun intended! =)

excerpts: I was tempted to order a dish called The Nebulous Potato Thing just because of it's name but resisted for fear of overdosing on carbs and fat.
nebulous potato thing.author: Trinh T.
nebulous potato thing.review:
This old-school 1950's style soda shop is a great place for breakfast food. My friends and I headed over around lunchtime on a Saturday absolutely famished. The wait wasn't long at all to be seated at one of their booths. I had the Chef's Mess (scrambled eggs, bacon, tomatoes, potatoes and cheese with a dollip of sour cream on top). The eggs were light and fluffy with just the right amount of the other ingredients as to not overpower the eggs. And it was nicely presented, not messy looking at all. I got the cornbread at my friend's suggestion and wasn't disapointed, although of course it can't beat real southern cornbread. My friends got the huevos rancheros, mixed veggie omelette and corn hash which all looked good. I was tempted to order a dish called The Nebulous Potato Thing just because of it's name but resisted for fear of overdosing on carbs and fat. I hope to come back one of these days with a potato-lover who will order it so I can get a taste.

Oh, maybe just one more thing: I'm a coffee lover (ok, ok, maybe a bit of a coffee snob) and thought my first cup here tasted a little burnt. Subsequent pours were fine.

excerpts: I tried the nebulous potato thing and it lived up to it's name.
the booths weren't the most comfortable, but it was nice enough.
nebulous potato thing.author: Mark H.
nebulous potato thing.review: I tried the nebulous potato thing and it lived up to it's name. the booths weren't the most comfortable, but it was nice enough.

excerpts: I'd have to say the Chefs mess and the nebulous Potato Thing are excellent, but I think I have an obsession for potatoes, if you don't like those probably better try something else probably equally as tastey.
Oh and I thought the icecream was nummy too.
nebulous potato thing.author: Rebecca D.
nebulous potato thing.review: Pretty good!  The breakfast always good, the lunch has been good and the service is pretty nice.  I have seen lines waiting outside the door and have luckily been able to avoid that experience.  I'd have to say the Chefs mess and the nebulous Potato Thing are excellent, but I think I have an obsession for potatoes, if you don't like those probably better try something else probably equally as tastey.  Oh and I thought the icecream was nummy too.

excerpts: Nebulous potato thing = clogged arteries (please have a look at the photo), BLT was good
but you know, can you really make an horrible one?
We also had a gravy-something but , to me, that was worth a thanksgiving dinner table, not a 1st of January morning.
Ok, I'll extrude an opinion now...this kind of food is not for me (even though I really do like Boogaloos on Valencia - lemon cornmeal pancakes, yum!).
nebulous potato thing.author: Dario B.
nebulous potato thing.review: 50/60's diner nostalgia, line of hipsters, hangover clinic, people-watching heaven: all of this and more. But nothing else. Nebulous potato thing = clogged arteries (please have a look at the photo), BLT was good but you know, can you really make an horrible one? We also had a gravy-something but , to me, that was worth a thanksgiving dinner table, not a 1st of January morning. Ok, I'll extrude an opinion now...this kind of food is not for me (even though I really do like Boogaloos on Valencia - lemon cornmeal pancakes, yum!).

excerpts: the nebulous potato thing is a MUST ORDER!!
my girl friends and
i have made this place
our official galentines
day(like valentines day, but ladies only) brunch spot.
i'm actually taking my cousin who's visiting from out of town there this week - i can't wait!
nebulous potato thing.author: kristina h.
nebulous potato thing.review:
this place is by far the best diner i've been to.  it's got old-school charm, great food, excellent service - what else can you ask for?  the staff is always friendly - the few times that i've shown up early to wait for my friends i'm offered a seat at the counter as soon as i walk in, with hot coffee to wake me up while i wait.
the nebulous potato thing is a MUST ORDER!!  my girl friends and i have made this place our official galentines day(like valentines day, but ladies only) brunch spot.  i'm actually taking my cousin who's visiting from out of town there this week - i can't wait!

excerpts: And the Nebulous Potato Thing?
There's a very good reason that they offer a half-portion size.
Unless you're an ambitious sumo-wrestler-in-training, I'd recommend going with the smaller size.

The big one should come with a warning along the lines of "so damn good you'll want to eat the whole thing even after unbuttoning your pants."  Not much else to say except that everything's quite delicious.
Especially their homefries.
nebulous potato thing.author: H K.
nebulous potato thing.review:
If there was one reason to not live in the Mission, this is it:  I'd eat here every freakin' day and they'd need to install a special cargo-sized door to roll me in and out.

Their eggs are always tasty, no matter how they're prepared.  I've had 'em every way imaginable, and they rock.  And the Nebulous Potato Thing?  There's a very good reason that they offer a half-portion size.  Unless you're an ambitious sumo-wrestler-in-training, I'd recommend going with the smaller size.  The big one should come with a warning along the lines of "so damn good you'll want to eat the whole thing even after unbuttoning your pants."  Not much else to say except that everything's quite delicious.  Especially their homefries.  Mmmmm...

Oh, and if the throng of hipsters waiting for a table outside concerns you, don't worry...even though they can't do anything about the hipsters, the wait is never as long as it seems.

excerpts: I recommend the huevos rancheros and the nebulous potato thing.
My mouth is watering just thinking about it...
nebulous potato thing.author: Alexandra K.
nebulous potato thing.review: There is nothing more divine in this city than to eat brunch outside at St. Francis Fountain on a warm, sunny day.  The food is delicious and there are many more vegetarian options than at most restaurants.  I recommend the huevos rancheros and the nebulous potato thing. My mouth is watering just thinking about it...

excerpts: i got something called the nebulous potato thing along with an omlette...
where was the nebula?
it sounded so amazing!
and when i got it, i was so let down.
it's cool that they have guiness floats.
too bad
they're disgusting.
but that could just be because i hate guiness, but
if you like it, i bet it's neat.
the cute lil nostalgia toy stand
is awesome though (^-^)
nebulous potato thing.author: Nicole G.
nebulous potato thing.review:
just okay food for high prices. i got something called the nebulous potato thing along with an omlette...where was the nebula? it sounded so amazing! and when i got it, i was so let down. 
it's cool that they have guiness floats. too bad they're disgusting. but that could just be because i hate guiness, but if you like it, i bet it's neat.
the cute lil nostalgia toy stand is awesome though (^-^)

excerpts: I reccomend getting the Nebulous Potato Thing with added vegan chorizo and avocado and a cup of coffee.
Its the perfect breakfast to mull over last night's hazy memories with friends.
The fact that they sell Magnum P.I. and A-Team trading cards (and so many more) is a huge plus.
The service is always awesome, whether making great reccomendations or keeping me from seeing the botoom of my coffee cup.
Good shit.
nebulous potato thing.author: Gianpaolo P.
nebulous potato thing.review: St. Francis has been part of my weekend routine for quite sometime now, and never fails to deliver an awesome brunch.  I reccomend getting the Nebulous Potato Thing with added vegan chorizo and avocado and a cup of coffee.  Its the perfect breakfast to mull over last night's hazy memories with friends.  The fact that they sell Magnum P.I. and A-Team trading cards (and so many more) is a huge plus.  The service is always awesome, whether making great reccomendations or keeping me from seeing the botoom of my coffee cup.  Good shit.

excerpts: I dig the nebulous potato thing and some of the scrambles as well.
In general, I leave there with a big ( overly-caffeinated ) smile on my face.
nebulous potato thing.author: Tim A.
nebulous potato thing.review: Brunch/ breakfast @ St. Francis- woohoo!  Great tattooed, hipster staff that continually keeps your coffee cup full with high test dark.  Food is generally very good with good pancakes/ sausage combo (the real maple syrup is worth it).  I dig the nebulous potato thing and some of the scrambles as well.  In general, I leave there with a big ( overly-caffeinated ) smile on my face.

excerpts: I laways have the turkey club - and never miss the "nebulous potato thing".
nebulous potato thing.author: Mary N.
nebulous potato thing.review: God, do we love the St. Francis !  Excellent food in an old-time fountain setting.  It's always packed (esp. on weekends), so prepare for a bit of a wait.  They seem to keep things moving, though.  You write your name on a pad outside the door and kind of hang out.  On sunny days, there is some outdoor seating.  Good burgers, sandwiches,  - nice fare for breakfast or lunch.  I laways have the turkey club - and never miss the "nebulous potato thing".  It is to die for : home fry-type spuds w/green onions, sour cream, and salsa -  drenched in 2 types of cheese.  Absolutely amazing.  They also have a cool candy counter with some nostalgic candies and cool trading cards.  A bonus: up and down the street, there are a lot of bakeries to get delicious cookies.

excerpts: i got the nebulous potato thing & it was perfect; the milkshakes are killer too.
a great diner in the true diner tradition.
nebulous potato thing.author: gina e.
nebulous potato thing.review: i love this place & would eat there all the time if i could. i got the nebulous potato thing & it was perfect; the milkshakes are killer too. a great diner in the true diner tradition.

excerpts: Because if that's what's keeping you from you from enjoying a lovely heaping plate of Nebulous Potato Thing, biscuits in country gravy, a vegan Ruben or a Dreamcicle, it's not worth it.
Mmmm, greasy St. Francis,  my one of many vices.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to tuck my jeans into my vintage boots and get myself down to 24th and York, because me and my good-looking friends have to fuel up after another night of drinking PBRs at,
oh I don't know, the Edinburgh.
nebulous potato thing.author: Kiddle L.
nebulous potato thing.review:
If your jeans aren't skinny and your hair isn't asymmetrical and your bike isn't a one speed, don't worry. Just because you're not a hipster doesn't mean you should be intimidated by the scene at St. Francis. Smile. Show no fear. Rock your cargo pants and clean, shiny locks. Remember, real hipsters can't admit they are hipsters and really are defined by the standard accoutrements, ipso facto they can't judge you by your own appearance. I know it's just a technicality, but it's what I kept telling myself when I moved to the Mission. 
That's my advice for those who have mentioned the rather homogenous scene, and for those who have noticed those complaints on Yelp and been turned off. Because if that's what's keeping you from you from enjoying a lovely heaping plate of Nebulous Potato Thing, biscuits in country gravy, a vegan Ruben or a Dreamcicle, it's not worth it. Mmmm, greasy St. Francis,  my one of many vices. 
Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to tuck my jeans into my vintage boots and get myself down to 24th and York, because me and my good-looking friends have to fuel up after another night of drinking PBRs at, oh I don't know, the Edinburgh.

excerpts: Two words: Vegan Thing
but the Vegan Thing aka:
Gut Bomb is my favorite.
vegan thing.author: Brian D.
vegan thing.review:
Counter-Culture

Two words: Vegan Thing 

We try to hit up this old-timey diner every time we're in town.

Situated in the ever-gentrifying Mission district, (the neighborhood used to feel more edgy) the place is a slightly grungy, cool-as-shit spot to enjoy a hearty breakfast. 

It expanded years ago, so snagging a table isn't as tough as it once was. 

The coffee is your typical diner brew. 
The food offerings are suitable for almost anyone's dietary needs. Vegans, vegetarians, and omnivorous are happily commingling. 

I've tried a few things over the years but the Vegan Thing aka: Gut Bomb is my favorite. It's enough food to hold you over until dinner and give you the strength to climb those San Francisco hills. 

The pancakes don't suck. 

The restroom situation isn't pretty. If they offer to sit you in a booth next to the restroom, politely decline and wait for another spot to open up. 

Service has always been spot on.

If you're in the neighborhood, I might suggest you check out the (debated) crookedest street in San Francisco, (possibly the nation's) located on Vermont Street between 20th and 22nd Streets. It's a 15 minute walk from the St. Francis. 
The same neighborhood (Potrero Hill,) was used in the film 1990 thriller, Pacific Heights. 

Bon appétit

excerpts: Too bad they recently discontinued their nacho cheese that's in Vegan Thing and a lot of other dishes you see photos of on Yelp!
vegan thing.author: Katherine G.
vegan thing.review:
I had the vegan rancheros, and they were great. Too bad they recently discontinued their nacho cheese that's in Vegan Thing and a lot of other dishes you see photos of on Yelp! 

Next time, I'll try the soy vanilla milkshake :)

excerpts: A little upset though because I wanted to try the "Vegan Thing" but realized it want on their menu when I went.
although when I asked, they did have it, but they did not have the guacamole
so I decided to pass.
Customer service was great and we waited probably 15 minutes for a spot on a Sunday morning.
I would definitely come again!
vegan thing.author: Cynthia R.
vegan thing.review:
This place is awesome! Obviously came from the Yelp reviews and hype and I must say it's worth it. I got the banana walnut pancakes (vegan) and they were delicious. My friend got the blueberry pancakes which she also loved. 
A little upset though because I wanted to try the "Vegan Thing" but realized it want on their menu when I went. although when I asked, they did have it, but they did not have the guacamole so I decided to pass. 
Customer service was great and we waited probably 15 minutes for a spot on a Sunday morning. I would definitely come again!

excerpts: My friends ordered the breakfast burrito with vegan chorizo, the vegan thing with vegan chorizo and tofu scramble with mushrooms and spinach.
When the food came out and everyone had their first bites of food, we were all raving about how tasty and good everything was.
vegan thing.author: Rosanne P.
vegan thing.review:
My mouth is watering just thinking about the Devil's Burger I ordered today at St. Francis Fountain.  The Devil's Burger is not actually a burger but a pile of paper-thin sliced marinated and grilled seitan on burger buns.  It was the best seitan I've ever had and almost tasted like pastrami.  I added grilled onions and avocado to my sandwich it was really one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time!

My friends and I arrived at 11am on a Sunday and we were seated right away and got served coffees almost immediately which was a great way to start our brunch.  Our waitress was great and made good suggestions for my friends while they were deciding on what to order.  My friends ordered the breakfast burrito with vegan chorizo, the vegan thing with vegan chorizo and tofu scramble with mushrooms and spinach.  When the food came out and everyone had their first bites of food, we were all raving about how tasty and good everything was.  Even the coffee, which was replenished quite frequently, was delicious.

I can't wait to come back!  Definitely will be returning!

excerpts: The Vegan Thing instead ("pile of spuds with vegan jack cheese, fresh salsa, guacamole, and green onions") with added vegan chorizo instead of cheese.
Great tip!
It was everything a great breakfast should be: starchy, spicy, sweet and savory.
The potatoes were cooked so that one side was a little well done crunchy (but not burnt).
I thought that really elevated the dish.
Even the guac had a good flavor; not sure if it is housemade, but it sure tasted like it was.
The chorizo was mighty spicy and set my mouth on fire...
