I loved every second of it.
vegan thing.author: Brandi W.
vegan thing.review:
Now I see what all the hype is about... this place is top-notch! 

I'm surprised that I have never come here, as I've had it on my list of bookmarks for quite some time, and so many of my friends are fans. I guess I'm just never in that neighborhood, so a few of us East Bay/ Contra Costa County folks hopped in a car and drove to the city specifically to grab their grub.

Surprisingly, we were able to get seated right away. I think we must have just beat the morning rush, since we did leave Walnut Creek at around 10:30 in the morning. A quick drive over the bridge, and we made it to our destination. 

First impression: cute, old-school diner atmosphere. Cozy wooden booths. Hustling and bustling, the place packed full of customers, which is usually a good sign. 

Their coffee is delicious, a mild and tasty brew, and they have soy milk for your dairy-free needs. This started off our meal on a high note, as we ordered 4 coffees and scanned the menu, our little vegan hearts pounding with excitement. 


There are plentiful vegan and vegetarian options for both breakfast and lunch, so we took our time reading over the menu. Everything looked and tasted spectacular!!! We ooh'ed and ahh'ed when the food was brought over, as our dishes were quite aesthetically appealing, especially for diner food.  

Rosanne P. opted for the Devil's Burger (actually not a burger, but thinly sliced seitan), Richard A. got the Vegan Breakfast Burrito, and Laura C. ordered a killer tofu scramble with spinach and mushrooms. 

I was going to get the Vegan Rancheros, but they didn't have vegan cheese, so the waitress suggested getting The Vegan Thing instead ("pile of spuds with vegan jack cheese, fresh salsa, guacamole, and green onions") with added vegan chorizo instead of cheese. Great tip! It was everything a great breakfast should be: starchy, spicy, sweet and savory. The potatoes were cooked so that one side was a little well done crunchy (but not burnt). I thought that really elevated the dish. Even the guac had a good flavor; not sure if it is housemade, but it sure tasted like it was. The chorizo was mighty spicy and set my mouth on fire... I loved every second of it. It hurt so good! 

I tried a bite of Rosie's sandwich... that seitan is phenomenal! It almost had a roast beef, pastrami-esque texture and flavor, without being as overpoweringly salty as its meaty counterpart. I've never seen seitan sliced so thin. I would love to order this on my next visit, as it comes with a heaping side of fries if you so choose. It looks fantastic, especially when you choose to add grilled onions and avocado on top. 

We each must have had at least 2-3 cups of coffee, as they were quick to come by with a fresh pot to give us a warm-up. I really appreciated that! The staff is excellent, very attentive and well-mannered, especially for a Sunday morning (when I know my demeanor can be a little bit cranky). Diane was our main waitress, and she seemed quite knowledgeable about the menu. I hope we weren't bothering her with our demands (more soy milk, please/ a side of jam for my toast, thank you). 

Would I return? Abso-friggin-lutely! This is probably my new favorite brunch joint in all of San Francisco. I left there feeling very full and yet energized, ready to take on the world!...  or at least Rainbow Grocery right down the street.

excerpts: Part of the Vegan Thing specialty topped with vegan cheese, salsa, guacamole and onions.
vegan thing.author: Jason B.
vegan thing.review:
Good thing going.

Do not underestimate a small "pile of spuds". Part of the Vegan Thing specialty topped with vegan cheese, salsa, guacamole and onions. Added a side of egg whites.

Perhaps they made a large instead because a massive mound of food was delivered. And consumed because each and every bite was outstanding.

Really didn't have room for a vegan chorizo hash side but couldn't say no to the rich delicious flavor.

Definitely didn't have room for a parfait but couldn't stop devouring sweet local granola, bananas, pineapple, strawberries, apples and what tasted like nonfat plain yogurt.

Also good was the enthusiastic and infectious service. And we were equally happy to be eating outside on a warm February Saturday. Wait was a short 15min.

Reasonable $20/person included my dining companion's much enjoyed dish, orange juice, coffee and being so full we didn't need lunch.

More than good. Five star great.

excerpts: Instead, I decide to get the Vegan Thing.
I really want black beans instead of homefries, but I'd rather have vegan cheese than no sour cream.
vegan thing.author: Natalye R.
vegan thing.review:
St. Francis Fountain is one of those places I've been meaning to go to for the longest time, but for whatever reason, just haven't. 

This past week, that finally changed. After striking out at Golden Era (closed on a Tuesday?!) and Weird Fish (closed for a private party?!), we decided on St. Francis. Since it was a week night, there were a ton of empty tables, which was a nice welcome compared to the last time I tried to eat there (a weekend morning) when we were told our wait would be an hour or two. 

When we walked in we were told to sit wherever we pleased. So we sat at a nice table in the back. "Oh wait, not that one, in case a party of more than four comes in" is what we were told. Oh, okay. So we moved to another table. No big deal, although no larger party did come in during our time there (about an hour before closing).

I get the menu and I'm stoked to see all the vegan options. A bit later our drink orders are taken. A friend gets a Diet Coke. Another gets a Vanilla Coke. I hold off because I'm eyeing the soy milkshakes.

Server comes a bit later. A friend orders first. She wants one of the Things (not certain if she orders the Vegan one or the Nebulous Potato one). Only catch, she wants black beans instead of homefries. We are told that the chef will refuse to make it this way, because the homefries are important for the "structural integrity" of the dish. OK fine. So she orders something else.

I am torn between a few items, so I decide to ask some questions. 

Since the Chorizo and Eggs is calling out my name, I think that maybe I'll get that with tofu instead of eggs, even though that substitution costs an extra dollar or two. So I ask if they have vegan sour cream. The answer of which is no. 

This is surprising to me, because they have vegan cheese and vegan other things. Additionally, anyone who KNOWS breakfast knows that sour cream is an important component in the "structural integrity" of potatoes. So why they cater to the vegan crowd on almost everything else but sour cream is baffling, but again, fine.

Instead, I decide to get the Vegan Thing. I really want black beans instead of homefries, but I'd rather have vegan cheese than no sour cream. I need some kind of fake dairy to satiate my hunger.

Alongside this, I order that shake I've been lusting after since the second we walked in.

Moments later, our server returns to inform me that they're out of soy for the shakes. Insert sad face here. Instead, I decide to get a vanilla coke as well, since I've just tasted my companion's and it's quite good. Server goes to get it and returns shortly, saying they just ran out of vanilla coke - in fact, my friend got the last one. Which is annoying because not only are they out of it, but I'd also assumed that a diner like SFF would make their own - you know, regular coke with vanilla infusion. I mean, even Denny's does this on their own. But oh well, I settle for a diet vanilla coke, which is just fine in my book.

So we're sitting and chatting and waiting for our food when our server returns again to inform me that the chef has just begun making my meal and realizes that they're out of vegan cheese. Uh what?

Begrudgingly, I settle on the Vegan Chorizo Hash & Tofu instead. Which is twice-removed from the meal I really wanted, but whatever, I'm starving.

A minute or two passes and he comes out with my friends' meals. Mine doesn't come out for another 10 or so. So by the time they've finished their meals, I'm less than halfway through. As their plates are being cleared, I just ask for a to-go box, because we have some place we need to get to, and my food just isn't that good anyway.

The check comes, and my coke is comped. That's all. While I'm not expecting handouts, and I don't blame anyone for my subpar dining experience, it was still super disappointing that my entire time there felt more like a hassle than a pleasure. And while any singular instance of what happened wouldn't have bothered me, the fact that so many things went wrong, one after another, was discouraging.

I don't know - call me a cynic, or an asshole, but if a menu boasts having lots of vegan options, I'd think that actually having those vegan ingredients on hand would be important to the "structural integrity" of its claim.

excerpts: Because the Vegan Thing was SO GOOD.
It took a while for me to go here because I heard that the lines were usually stupid long, but both visits proved different.
We were seated almost immediately by opting to sit at the counter.
vegan thing.author: Dee J.
vegan thing.review:
During my last visit to San Francisco I ate here TWICE.  Why you ask?  Because the Vegan Thing was SO GOOD.   It took a while for me to go here because I heard that the lines were usually stupid long, but both visits proved different.  We were seated almost immediately by opting to sit at the counter.  I ordered a side of vegan sausage and the chef masterfully mixed the spuds and sausage together, it was so very tasty, tasty, tasty.  I'm so happy I have another place to go to that is vegan friendly. 
Plus, their trading card collection is BONKERS.

excerpts: I got the "vegan thing" and it was the best vegan dish I've had.
My friend got a two egg scramble which was awesome too.
I will definitely be coming back in the future.
vegan thing.author: Hunter M.
vegan thing.review: This place is awesome! We decided to try it randomly and it was fantastic. I got the "vegan thing" and it was the best vegan dish I've had. My friend got a two egg scramble which was awesome too. I will definitely be coming back in the future.

excerpts: Other great vegan items: milkshakes, the Vegan Thing with potatoes, guac, salsa, and vegan cheese, vegan pancakes, and their black beans.
vegan thing.author: Nick W.
vegan thing.review:
Amazing, vegan friendly restaurant. Come here with a mixed group, please the meat eaters and the vegans all at once. The best vegan item on the menu is by far the Devil Burger. It's the marinated seitan burger with vegan mayo, lettuce, pickles, onion, and tomatoes on a soft bun. I wish there were more items on the menu that use the seitan- it's to die for. Other great vegan items: milkshakes, the Vegan Thing with potatoes, guac, salsa, and vegan cheese, vegan pancakes, and their black beans. Great for brunch, and I recommend sitting outside when it's nice out.

Not great for groups because of limited seating options. They only accept a maximum of two cards per table- so if you're splitting the bill, we recommend that you bring cash to avoid the eye roll.

excerpts: the vegan pancakes, the french toast, the eggs, "the vegan thing" with a bunch of shit, the jam, the soy shakes, everythinggggg!!!!!
vegan thing.author: Samantha S.
vegan thing.review:
OMG

vegan breakfast and non vegan breakfast and old-school fountain shoppe style diner filled with young beautiful babes and of course, delicious food!!!

everything is amazing. the vegan pancakes, the french toast, the eggs, "the vegan thing" with a bunch of shit, the jam, the soy shakes, everythinggggg!!!!!

super popular, expect to wait, but worth it. 
not too pricey, but not cheap.

excerpts: I had the Vegan Thing and my boyfriend had the Veggie Mess.
Both of us were extremely satisfied!
The waitress was attentive and suggested add-ons like soyrizo and guacamole.
My boyfriend and I are homefry/breakfast potato addicts and St. Francis Fountain delivered.
Very affordable and left us full!
vegan thing.author: Bailey B.
vegan thing.review: I had the Vegan Thing and my boyfriend had the Veggie Mess. Both of us were extremely satisfied! The waitress was attentive and suggested add-ons like soyrizo and guacamole. My boyfriend and I are homefry/breakfast potato addicts and St. Francis Fountain delivered. Very affordable and left us full!

excerpts: and your vegan thing.
and your vegan sausage.
and your vegan burger with seitan.
and your undying love.
vegan thing.author: Jen I.
vegan thing.review:
oh st. francis, the last time i had set foot inside of you, you did not have outdoor seating and didn't have 1/2 the vegan options you have now.

oh, and i was also an omnivore.

this visit, i had a hard time making up my mind over what to get since you grew your vegan menu since you somehow knew i wanted to fatten up for the winter.  if i eat enough of yout vegan spuds and tofu scrambles and seitan + vegan burger madness i wouldn't need to wear a coat for the next couple of months.

hello cute waitress in the red skirt with short blond hair, thank you for being patient as we asked your opinion on the different veg friendly items on the menu.

did i mention you were cute and ncie?  yes.  thank you.  i would marry you if it meant free vanilla soy shakes for life,  yes, the dr. can marry you too.  

i ended up with a tofu scramble dressed with spinach, mushrooms and peanut sauce and proceeded to inhale all of it on top of my rye toast.  

i will return for your seitan sandwich.  and your vegan thing.  and your vegan sausage.  and your vegan burger with seitan.  and your undying love.

excerpts: spinach salad, every vegan thing on the menu, and the Guinness float.
vegan thing.author: Kevin C.
vegan thing.review: So Good in so many ways! spinach salad, every vegan thing on the menu, and the Guinness float.

excerpts: Next time I'm trying the Vegan Thing, or maybe the vegan pancakes.
Vegan pancakes!
Nobody ever has vegan pancakes.
Definitely should have tried those.
vegan thing.author: Ashley P.
vegan thing.review:
So many vegan options I experienced menu overload. I hate when I want to try everything and can't. 

I ended up with the vegan rancheros, which was tofu scramble with ranchero sauce and vegan cheese (Teese? Follow Your Heart? They taste the same to me, so I don't know), black beans, pico, and corn tortillas. It was all pretty good, but I feel I ordered wrong. Ordering Mexican-ish food at a non-Mexican establishment in the Mission is stupid, right? I wasn't thinking. Plus, they need to figure out how to get that vegan cheese to melt. I know it's a little tricky, but it can be done. It was just shredded and stirred in with the tofu, and while I didn't mind it, I could have done without it altogether.

Next time I'm trying the Vegan Thing, or maybe the vegan pancakes. Vegan pancakes! Nobody ever has vegan pancakes. Definitely should have tried those. I was too full for a soy shake, but that's also on my list for next time. 

Great atmosphere and friendly service, and tons of vegan options. Love it!

excerpts: Other highlights of the menu: their homemade banana bread, the corned beef hash, and the chefs mess are all great.
chefs mess.author: Thomas R.
chefs mess.review: I love this place. The line's never too long, the eggs Benedict are always well done: I've only had one firm yoke in 5 years of eating here at least monthly. Mimosas are $4.75, and in a real glass instead of a BS Champaign flute, and they make them well (strong). Other highlights of the menu: their homemade banana bread, the corned beef hash, and the chefs mess are all great.

excerpts: Had a "Chefs Mess" with lots of scrambled eggs, bacon, cheese, potatoes, sour cream and avocado.
Large milkshake was far too much.
GF had scrambled with bacon, cheese and green peppers.
Friendly and fast service from the guys here.
Great coffe too.
chefs mess.author: Hans Lukas H.
chefs mess.review: Brilliant place for a great breakfast in Mission. Went here with a hangover and a girlfriend. Had a "Chefs Mess" with lots of scrambled eggs, bacon, cheese, potatoes, sour cream and avocado. Large milkshake was far too much. GF had scrambled with bacon, cheese and green peppers. Friendly and fast service from the guys here. Great coffe too.

excerpts: I like the Chefs Mess (just a bunch of yummy breakfast stuff piled together).
I also enjoy the griddle special (more traditional).
They have a great patty melt as well and the chocolate malt (YIA) is bomb too.
chefs mess.author: Alex C.
chefs mess.review: Great customer service, line is never excessive. I like coming in at 8:45 pm for a scoop of ice cream (mitchell's!). I have eaten breakfast and lunch here. Unlike many people I do not enjoy standing in line for brunch, the line is usually quite fast and the food is good. I like the Chefs Mess (just a bunch of yummy breakfast stuff piled together). I also enjoy the griddle special (more traditional). They have a great patty melt as well and the chocolate malt (YIA) is bomb too.

excerpts: My friends had the chefs mess and they loved it.
We also tried the upside down hog cake, different but surprisingly great!
Savery and sweet at the same time
(: Bill was $58 for four people.
2 drinks, 1 hog cake, and 4 meals.
Definitely a good deal!
chefs mess.author: Leeana B.
chefs mess.review: Came to this place the other day with a few friends. Atmosphere is nice with really cool servers who give great service. Asked for a food recommendation and he gave us a ton! I had the veggie mess and it was delicious. My friends had the chefs mess and they loved it. We also tried the upside down hog cake, different but surprisingly great! Savery and sweet at the same time (: Bill was $58 for four people. 2 drinks, 1 hog cake, and 4 meals. Definitely a good deal!

excerpts: We ordered the Chefs Mess and a spinach omelet and while both were good it didn't stand out from any other breakfast diner.
I'll tryout the burger and shakes.
Maybe we can boost up the review.
chefs mess.author: T L.
chefs mess.review: We ordered the Chefs Mess and a spinach omelet and while both were good it didn't stand out from any other breakfast diner. I'll tryout the burger and shakes. Maybe we can boost up the review.

excerpts: i highly recommend the "chefs mess" with the cornbread.
the chefs mess is a jumble of goodness.
eggs, bacon, potatoes and mushrooms; topped with lots of cheese, sour cream and diced tomatoes.
chefs mess.author: Sally Q.
chefs mess.review:
if i spend the night in SF, i almost always wind up here for breakfast. the food is terrific! i highly recommend the "chefs mess" with the cornbread. the chefs mess is a jumble of goodness. eggs, bacon, potatoes and mushrooms; topped with lots of cheese, sour cream and diced tomatoes. they make their own cornbread so it is very fresh, warm and tasty!

the service here has always been pretty good. well, except for the fact that everybody that works there look like hipsters. ie: looks unhappy/depressed, skinny jeans, fashionable haircuts, tattoos, etc. but that doesn't bother me at all. i just expect it. lol!

the price? pretty fair. i usually walk away with a to-go container with what i can't finish while only paying about $14. not bad.

excerpts: My bf loved his dish as well, the chefs mess with biscuits (which he swooned over)
The shakes were good as well, very thick although a bit expensive ($5 for the large) its a lot of shake.
We will definitely be coming back.
chefs mess.author: Meg L.
chefs mess.review: My boyfriend and I had lunch here on Sunday and it was fabulous. I had the side platter with yummy chili, just spicy enough, Caesar salad and mac and cheese plus cornbread. It was very filling and delicious. My bf loved his dish as well, the chefs mess with biscuits (which he swooned over) The shakes were good as well, very thick although a bit expensive ($5 for the large) its a lot of shake. We will definitely be coming back.

excerpts: I'd have to say the Chefs mess and the nebulous Potato Thing are excellent, but I think I have an obsession for potatoes, if you don't like those probably better try something else probably equally as tastey.
Oh and I thought the icecream was nummy too.
chefs mess.author: Rebecca D.
chefs mess.review: Pretty good!  The breakfast always good, the lunch has been good and the service is pretty nice.  I have seen lines waiting outside the door and have luckily been able to avoid that experience.  I'd have to say the Chefs mess and the nebulous Potato Thing are excellent, but I think I have an obsession for potatoes, if you don't like those probably better try something else probably equally as tastey.  Oh and I thought the icecream was nummy too.

excerpts: We had a friendly server who helped me customize a vegan version of the Veggie Mess, which was delicious, filling, and reasonably priced - especially for SF.
veggie mess.author: Bridget W.
veggie mess.review:
Of course it's a hipster brunch spot. If you don't mind man buns and skinny jeans serving you up plates of scrambles and hash then this place is worth checking out. 

It's definitely not pretentious. A small, 50s-style diner with tiny wooden booths and counter seating complete the vintage appeal. 

We had a friendly server who helped me customize a vegan version of the Veggie Mess, which was delicious, filling, and reasonably priced - especially for SF. 

The menu is a little jumbled for vegan options. They're definitely there, but a lot of things (like vegan chorizo) get mixed in with egg dishes, so it's a little misleading and you have to clarify if you want your plate fully vegan. This is my only gripe about the place and what's preventing the fifth star. 

Bonus: they have soy milkshakes :)

excerpts: I had the Veggie mess and it was SO tasty.
veggie mess.author: Laura T.
veggie mess.review:
AMAZING BREAKFAST SPOT! 
I had the Veggie mess and it was SO tasty. I had the option of a side and chose banana bread. It came out warm and it was mouth watering. Service is super fast and friendly. They get busy so reserve a table for a party of 3 or more. Soooooo good.

excerpts: We ordered the buttermilk pancakes with strawberry, a veggie mess replacing the egg with tofu and a vegan chili bowl.
The pancakes even though good were the last impressive of the lot.
The bowl of chili came with the most delicious cornbread I've eaten.
The vegetarian mess was a winner as well.
This is definitely going to be a regular spot for me when I'm craving a hearty brunch.
veggie mess.author: Jeel J.
veggie mess.review: Went here for a late brunch on a Saturday. I'm a vegetarian and the yelp reviews was what got me here. We had a 20 minute wait before we were seated. The place has s very hipster diner feel. The server was very accommodating of my dietary needs. The best part about the menu is they have a lot of vegetarian options other than the typical pancakes and waffles. We ordered the buttermilk pancakes with strawberry, a veggie mess replacing the egg with tofu and a vegan chili bowl. The pancakes even though good were the last impressive of the lot. The bowl of chili came with the most delicious cornbread I've eaten. The vegetarian mess was a winner as well. This is definitely going to be a regular spot for me when I'm craving a hearty brunch.

excerpts: She ended up with a tofu scramble with a ginger peanut sauce, while I opted for the Veggie mess, which was assorted veggies scrambled with eggs and veggie chorizo.
The orders came out in a reasonable time and both were delicious.
Would have liked to order a milkshake, but maybe next time.
Solid choice for a reasonably priced breakfast in the city - we'll be back!!
veggie mess.author: Paul B.
veggie mess.review:
We went to the St Francis Soda Fountain for breakfast on a recent visit to San Francisco and was very happy with our choice. Obviously, the diner is really old, but the interior is very clean and the staff was very friendly and attentive. We came in on a Monday morning around 10:00, and took a seat at the counter as all the booths were taken. We were immediately greeted by a server, given menus and water, then approached for our order a few minutes later.

As a vegan, my wife usually has trouble finding anything other than oatmeal or fruit for breakfast at most places. Not so at the St Francis. In addition to Vegan Pancakes(!), there was a vegan scramble with different options for sauces, and tofu could be substituted in on most of their egg dishes. She ended up with a tofu scramble with a ginger peanut sauce, while I opted for the Veggie mess, which was assorted veggies scrambled with eggs and veggie chorizo. The orders came out in a reasonable time and both were delicious. Would have liked to order a milkshake, but maybe next time. Solid choice for a reasonably priced breakfast in the city - we'll be back!!

excerpts: My favorite brunch there: oj + cranberry mimosas, the tofu scramble with pesto, red peppers and feta cheese as well as the veggie mess.
So happy I live close by to this gem.
veggie mess.author: Cannelle H.
veggie mess.review: Delicious food. Affordable. Old School. Great people. I love St Francis Fountain. I've been going several times and it's always a great experience. My favorite brunch there: oj + cranberry mimosas, the tofu scramble with pesto, red peppers and feta cheese as well as the veggie mess. So happy I live close by to this gem.

excerpts: I got the Veggie Mess with tofu scramble and made vegan (if you just ask for a menu item to be vegan they already know what to substitute for you).
Top notch!
The plates look smaller but the portions cover the whole plate to the fullest and I was stuffed.
The service was incredibly fast as well (less than a 10 minute wait for an indoor table at the iconic diner and our food arrived within 15 minutes of ordering).
I'll certainly be back with more friends!
The staff was very attentive as well.
A hidden gem in the Mission.
veggie mess.author: Sarah E.
veggie mess.review: Wow this place was delicious! It had a pretty solid 50/50 mix of carnivore and vegan (as well as vegetarian) menu items. I got the Veggie Mess with tofu scramble and made vegan (if you just ask for a menu item to be vegan they already know what to substitute for you). Top notch! The plates look smaller but the portions cover the whole plate to the fullest and I was stuffed. The service was incredibly fast as well (less than a 10 minute wait for an indoor table at the iconic diner and our food arrived within 15 minutes of ordering). I'll certainly be back with more friends! The staff was very attentive as well. A hidden gem in the Mission.

excerpts: I tried their veggie mess which was a VERY decent serving size and VERY delicious.
It had a great number of flavors - from eggs to potato hash and some nice, crispy bread.
veggie mess.author: Raakin H.
veggie mess.review:
I tried their veggie mess which was a VERY decent serving size and VERY delicious. It had a great number of flavors - from eggs to potato hash and some nice, crispy bread. I would definitely come back for it again. 

I would come last year at nighttime for ice cream but they changed their hours such that they close by 3-4pm, which is sad. I hope they change back their hours soon!

excerpts: so no need to order the large, although I recommend adding on some over easy eggs!) and the veggie mess (vegan chorizo is seriously tasty
veggie mess.author: Sol C.
veggie mess.review:
St. Francis Fountain is a classic, old-fashioned diner. The ambience was great - very low key with big booths and lots of space to sit at the counter. The servers were all very friendly and relaxed. 

The food was overwhelming in an awesome way. Massive plates of spuds and melted cheese and eggs... Everything tasted delicious - we tried both the nebulous potato thing (even the small is huge so no need to order the large, although I recommend adding on some over easy eggs!) and the veggie mess (vegan chorizo is seriously tasty and I'm not even a vegetarian).

Another awesome touch was the fantastic egg cream in an ice cream sundae glass. We loved the old school feel! Great breakfast!

excerpts: The Veggie Mess has the best of all worlds: spuds, chorizo, gooey cheeses.
Ask for jalapeños to get that extra kick!
veggie mess.author: Alison R.
veggie mess.review:
Perfect Sunday hangover diner cure for carnivores with veggie/vegan friends!

The Veggie Mess has the best of all worlds: spuds, chorizo, gooey cheeses. Ask for jalapeños to get that extra kick! Order is large enough for 2 ppl or an extra kick in' hangover.

For the bread options, choose cornbread over banana bread... Unless you have a sweet tooth. Nice n toasty, Thick like a brick! 

Espresso milkshake is perfectly executed - vanilla loves cafe. Order the large. Just when you thought the fun was over, the shaker has a whole extra glass of frothy goodness waiting for ya!

excerpts: The veggie mess is also the weirdest clump of egg mass that can be plopped in front of your plate, but once you dig into it, you realize it's a good value at $10.
veggie mess.author: Tony H.
veggie mess.review:
I live about 5 minutes away so this is automatically my default brunch spot in the city since a) it's convenient and b) I am broke as hell and I agree with the prices here.

Seriously, you really can't beat these diner prices compared to other places in the city. Additionally, there's never a super long wait even during their brunch rush from 10am-11:30am here in the city. I don't think I've had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table for 2. The service here is decent, they could be a little more forward with refilling our waters. I do giggle when I think about this place having been open since the early twentieth century and wondering what the original owner would think of this place turning into a typical Mission hipster place. I can see him on his rotary phone complaining to his housewife now.

Food is standard diner brunch fare. For the east coaster in me, I do have a love for their Egg Sandwich, particularly with avocado and that tomato thrown in. That combination is just killer. The veggie mess is also the weirdest clump of egg mass that can be plopped in front of your plate, but once you dig into it, you realize it's a good value at $10. You could split it for 2 if you're not too hungry!

All in all, good food, decent service and I'll roll up here if my friends don't drag me anywhere to brunch first.

excerpts: I got the veggie mess which has vegan chorizo in it.
It was very heavy and can be shared with another person or for 1 very hangry person.
Also tried the Huevos Rancheros which were OK.
The potatoes were probably my favorite because of the herbs they put on it.
Oreo milkshake was heavenly as all milkshakes are.
I'd definitely come back to try their other dishes.
veggie mess.author: Ann P.
veggie mess.review: A charming and casual diner with hipsters behind the counter at your service. They have a fun menu of ice cream drinks and shakes. I saw her make a drink with fudge, milk, and soda. What? For you mimosa seekers, Yelp says they only have beer and wine, but they actually have mimosas too. Came for brunch on a Sunday morning 11am. We had a big group (12) so it took about 45 minutes to get seated. It looked like groups of 2-5 got seated within 10-15 minutes which isn't bad for a Sunday brunch in the city. I got the veggie mess which has vegan chorizo in it. It was very heavy and can be shared with another person or for 1 very hangry person. Also tried the Huevos Rancheros which were OK. The potatoes were probably my favorite because of the herbs they put on it. Oreo milkshake was heavenly as all milkshakes are. I'd definitely come back to try their other dishes.

excerpts: You have to try their veggie mess and milkshakes.
So good.!!
veggie mess.author: Nikka A.
veggie mess.review: The fold was great and the service was excellent. You have to try their veggie mess and milkshakes. So good.!!

excerpts: I had the Vegan Thing and my boyfriend had the Veggie Mess.
Both of us were extremely satisfied!
The waitress was attentive and suggested add-ons like soyrizo and guacamole.
My boyfriend and I are homefry/breakfast potato addicts and St. Francis Fountain delivered.
Very affordable and left us full!
veggie mess.author: Bailey B.
veggie mess.review: I had the Vegan Thing and my boyfriend had the Veggie Mess. Both of us were extremely satisfied! The waitress was attentive and suggested add-ons like soyrizo and guacamole. My boyfriend and I are homefry/breakfast potato addicts and St. Francis Fountain delivered. Very affordable and left us full!

excerpts: I got the veggie mess.
Wow.
Really weird dish.
Delicious though.
veggie mess.author: Gilad P.
veggie mess.review: What an interesting restaurant! 1950's diner like place - but with hipster atmosphere and dishes. I got the veggie mess. Wow. Really weird dish. Delicious though. And definitely try the banana bread. Pretty crowded restaurant too. I got to sit at the bar.

excerpts: I had the veggie mess and it was delicious.
veggie mess.author: Leeana B.
veggie mess.review: Came to this place the other day with a few friends. Atmosphere is nice with really cool servers who give great service. Asked for a food recommendation and he gave us a ton! I had the veggie mess and it was delicious. My friends had the chefs mess and they loved it. We also tried the upside down hog cake, different but surprisingly great! Savery and sweet at the same time (: Bill was $58 for four people. 2 drinks, 1 hog cake, and 4 meals. Definitely a good deal!

excerpts: Well, I had the "Veggie Mess" and it had soooo much cheese on it plus a pile of sour cream, I wasn't quite expecting that.
veggie mess.author: Nicole W.
veggie mess.review:
First time here today.  Service was good, food was good, atmosphere was pretty cool.  Why 3 stars you ask?  Well, I had the "Veggie Mess" and it had soooo much cheese on it plus a pile of sour cream, I wasn't quite expecting that.  It was good once I attempted a little cheese removal.  

Reason #2 for a 3 star rating:  They have a second room for seating that was completely open (only 3 tables sat in there) and yet there was  a wait list.  I get it if they are short staffed but that didn't seem to be the case.  Either way, the wait was only about 10 minutes but it just seemed odd.

Reason #3.  I get that its a place that employ's the hipsters... goes with the whole Mission Schtick... but I have a problem when dudes that are serving food are wearing tank tops.  I have only witnessed such behavior in places like Springfield Missouri where I was surprised they were wearing shirts at all.  But here in SF, I figured even the hipsters would realize I don't want to see an eyeful of armpit hair as you pass a plate across the table.  Also, one of the other servers was wearing his pants way low on his ass so most of his boxer briefs were showing and they did not appear to be brand new.  

So Reason #3 is the main reason for the 3 star rating..... A rule one of my beauty school teachers used to preach should apply here... "No Pits, No Tits, No Butts, and No Guts people... not around food.

excerpts: We got the Side Platter (bowl of mac & cheese, cup of chili, and caesar salad), the Veggie Mess, and the corn bread.

The Veggie Mess should be called Hangover Heaven since it is a heavy pile of starchy potato and faux meat covered in gooey cheese heaped on a plate - complete bliss when you have an insatiable appetite.
Mac and cheese and corn bread were solid and the caesar was a nice complement to the heavier plates.
The only thing on the menu I've had and didn't love was the S.F. Rueben, but then again a veggie Reuben is a hard thing to pull off unless you're Native Foods.
Food coma is imminent so enjoy those cups of Joe the servers pour so generously.
veggie mess.author: Carrie G.
veggie mess.review: Delicious vegetarian options, generous portions, and the relaxed atmosphere were all the reasons we made this our first meal back after being away for a week in the desert. Best decision ever! The hearty comfort food here is a good remedy to placate any hungry beast, and my grumbling belly at the time was a tough contender. It's always so hard to decide on just one thing here, so don't try and instead bring a friend or two and share. We got the Side Platter (bowl of mac & cheese, cup of chili, and caesar salad), the Veggie Mess, and the corn bread. The vegetarian chili was especially delicious since it was on the lighter and healthier side being a three bean chili without fake meat. The chili is NOT another lackluster attempt in the futile fight to make 'meatless' taste 'meaty', so give it a try if you haven't already. The Veggie Mess should be called Hangover Heaven since it is a heavy pile of starchy potato and faux meat covered in gooey cheese heaped on a plate - complete bliss when you have an insatiable appetite. Mac and cheese and corn bread were solid and the caesar was a nice complement to the heavier plates. The only thing on the menu I've had and didn't love was the S.F. Rueben, but then again a veggie Reuben is a hard thing to pull off unless you're Native Foods. Food coma is imminent so enjoy those cups of Joe the servers pour so generously.

excerpts: I had the vegan rancheros, and they were great.
vegan rancheros.author: Katherine G.
vegan rancheros.review:
I had the vegan rancheros, and they were great. Too bad they recently discontinued their nacho cheese that's in Vegan Thing and a lot of other dishes you see photos of on Yelp! 

Next time, I'll try the soy vanilla milkshake :)

excerpts:
I had the vegan rancheros and vegan pancakes..both dishes to DIE FOR!!! 
Great service, prices and nice classic location.
I'll be back!
vegan rancheros.author: David R.
vegan rancheros.review:
I came here Sunday morning around 8:30am and the crowd was very light. I sat at the bar and the waiter was right on it taking my order. I had the vegan rancheros and vegan pancakes..both dishes to DIE FOR!!! 
Great service, prices and nice classic location.
I'll be back!

excerpts: Tried the vegan rancheros and it was just amazing.
Very flavourful with the right blend of spices.
Would strongly recommend it to all vegans.
vegan rancheros.author: Monishika G.
vegan rancheros.review: My first visit to this place. Being a vegetarian I have limited options for food always. But this place turned out to be great. Tried the vegan rancheros and it was just amazing. Very flavourful with the right blend of spices. Would strongly recommend it to all vegans.

excerpts: I was going to get the Vegan Rancheros, but they didn't have vegan cheese, so the waitress suggested getting
vegan rancheros.author: Brandi W.
vegan rancheros.review:
Now I see what all the hype is about... this place is top-notch! 

I'm surprised that I have never come here, as I've had it on my list of bookmarks for quite some time, and so many of my friends are fans. I guess I'm just never in that neighborhood, so a few of us East Bay/ Contra Costa County folks hopped in a car and drove to the city specifically to grab their grub.

Surprisingly, we were able to get seated right away. I think we must have just beat the morning rush, since we did leave Walnut Creek at around 10:30 in the morning. A quick drive over the bridge, and we made it to our destination. 

First impression: cute, old-school diner atmosphere. Cozy wooden booths. Hustling and bustling, the place packed full of customers, which is usually a good sign. 

Their coffee is delicious, a mild and tasty brew, and they have soy milk for your dairy-free needs. This started off our meal on a high note, as we ordered 4 coffees and scanned the menu, our little vegan hearts pounding with excitement. 


There are plentiful vegan and vegetarian options for both breakfast and lunch, so we took our time reading over the menu. Everything looked and tasted spectacular!!! We ooh'ed and ahh'ed when the food was brought over, as our dishes were quite aesthetically appealing, especially for diner food.  

Rosanne P. opted for the Devil's Burger (actually not a burger, but thinly sliced seitan), Richard A. got the Vegan Breakfast Burrito, and Laura C. ordered a killer tofu scramble with spinach and mushrooms. 

I was going to get the Vegan Rancheros, but they didn't have vegan cheese, so the waitress suggested getting The Vegan Thing instead ("pile of spuds with vegan jack cheese, fresh salsa, guacamole, and green onions") with added vegan chorizo instead of cheese. Great tip! It was everything a great breakfast should be: starchy, spicy, sweet and savory. The potatoes were cooked so that one side was a little well done crunchy (but not burnt). I thought that really elevated the dish. Even the guac had a good flavor; not sure if it is housemade, but it sure tasted like it was. The chorizo was mighty spicy and set my mouth on fire... I loved every second of it. It hurt so good! 

I tried a bite of Rosie's sandwich... that seitan is phenomenal! It almost had a roast beef, pastrami-esque texture and flavor, without being as overpoweringly salty as its meaty counterpart. I've never seen seitan sliced so thin. I would love to order this on my next visit, as it comes with a heaping side of fries if you so choose. It looks fantastic, especially when you choose to add grilled onions and avocado on top. 

We each must have had at least 2-3 cups of coffee, as they were quick to come by with a fresh pot to give us a warm-up. I really appreciated that! The staff is excellent, very attentive and well-mannered, especially for a Sunday morning (when I know my demeanor can be a little bit cranky). Diane was our main waitress, and she seemed quite knowledgeable about the menu. I hope we weren't bothering her with our demands (more soy milk, please/ a side of jam for my toast, thank you). 

Would I return? Abso-friggin-lutely! This is probably my new favorite brunch joint in all of San Francisco. I left there feeling very full and yet energized, ready to take on the world!...  or at least Rainbow Grocery right down the street.

excerpts: I have had vegan rancheros (great twist on one of my favorite dishes from back when I was a "regular" vegetarian), the vegan "thing", a banana walnut pancake, and the vegan sausage patties.
I can't complain about any of the above
vegan rancheros.author: Bailey M.
vegan rancheros.review:
One of my favorite breakie spots in the city! 

Perfect for those mornings when your stomach needs to be greased up a bit, if ya know what I mean. I have had vegan rancheros (great twist on one of my favorite dishes from back when I was a "regular" vegetarian), the vegan "thing", a banana walnut pancake, and the vegan sausage patties. I can't complain about any of the above but I'm definitely more of a ranchero kinda lady than I am a potatos-for-breakfast kinda lady! 

I love the vibe, the diner style, and the no-frills service. My dining compadres have all loved their meaty dishes as well. I make it a point to venture here whenever I am in town! YUM.

excerpts: I had the vegan rancheros and it was just 'eh' at best without it.
The menu still says it has vegan jack on it
and it's still $9.75, mind you...for three corn tortillas, some black beans, tofu and ranchero sauce.
I barely ate it.
vegan rancheros.author: Susie D.
vegan rancheros.review:
I have been a happy diner here for years, but they recently took vegan cheese off the menu. Nowhere is that posted and they don't tell you when you order, you find out when you get your meal. 

I had the vegan rancheros and it was just 'eh' at best without it. The menu still says it has vegan jack on it and it's still $9.75, mind you...for three corn tortillas, some black beans, tofu and ranchero sauce. I barely ate it. I don't like wasting calories on mediocre food.

When I asked the waitress she said she just came in one day and it was gone. She said I'm not the only customer who's unhappy either. 

Just seems so bizarre since so many of their menu items are melts or messes. My favorite dish is the Polar Melt. Hello! MELT!

They either need to bring back the vegan cheese or change the menu descriptions and prices. 

They are getting two stars because their staff are always so nice, but I'm not wasting an hour of my life waiting for a table again unless they bring it back. Ridiculous.

excerpts: I ended up with the vegan rancheros, which was tofu scramble with ranchero sauce and vegan cheese (Teese?
Follow Your Heart?
They taste the same to me, so I don't know), black beans, pico, and corn tortillas.
It was all pretty good, but I feel I ordered wrong.
Ordering Mexican-ish food at a non-Mexican establishment in the Mission is stupid, right?
I wasn't thinking.
Plus, they need to figure out how to get that vegan cheese to melt.
I know it's a little tricky, but it can be done.
vegan rancheros.author: Ashley P.
vegan rancheros.review:
So many vegan options I experienced menu overload. I hate when I want to try everything and can't. 

I ended up with the vegan rancheros, which was tofu scramble with ranchero sauce and vegan cheese (Teese? Follow Your Heart? They taste the same to me, so I don't know), black beans, pico, and corn tortillas. It was all pretty good, but I feel I ordered wrong. Ordering Mexican-ish food at a non-Mexican establishment in the Mission is stupid, right? I wasn't thinking. Plus, they need to figure out how to get that vegan cheese to melt. I know it's a little tricky, but it can be done. It was just shredded and stirred in with the tofu, and while I didn't mind it, I could have done without it altogether.

Next time I'm trying the Vegan Thing, or maybe the vegan pancakes. Vegan pancakes! Nobody ever has vegan pancakes. Definitely should have tried those. I was too full for a soy shake, but that's also on my list for next time. 

Great atmosphere and friendly service, and tons of vegan options. Love it!

excerpts: My sister ordered the buttermilk hot cakes that came with salted butter and one slice of orange garnish.
In terms of flavor, although fluffy, we both came to a consensus that it was somewhat off-putting?
buttermilk hot cakes.author: Lisa L.
buttermilk hot cakes.review:
Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon for a quick brunch with my sister. The wait was around 10 minutes, which we utilized to decide what to order. 

We were seated on the other side of the restaurant which didn't have the best ambiance. They definitely skimped on the lighting, making the entire room feel really dull and uninviting. The water served was lukewarm and tasted funky. 

My sister ordered the buttermilk hot cakes that came with salted butter and one slice of orange garnish. In terms of flavor, although fluffy, we both came to a consensus that it was somewhat off-putting? I wasn't sure if it was the flour they used or their over all pancake batter, but there was this grainy floury aftertaste the more you ate it. 

I ordered the French Toast Delight that came with yogurt, granola and fruits. With how it was worded on the menu, I originally assumed the parfait-like portion of this dish would be on the side, INSTEAD it was on TOP of my French toast... Amongst my fruit, I was lucky to get a nice piece of the apple core, which humans can totally just ingest those apple seeds no problem (if you didn't get, sarcasm). Anyway, for $10.50, all I wanted was some good simple French Toast, but got played hard. The yogurt toppings in my opinion was a terrible pairing. The sourness from the yogurt literally overpowered everything and the dryness of the granola ruined the texture I hoped from the fluffy French toast... The selection of fruit was quite sad, just raisins, apple and cantaloupe chunks, strawberries and grapes, which are some odd pairings with yogurt and toast? As for the toast, I was disappointed.... just didn't satisfy those cravings and wished I walked a bit further or something to go to some other brunch place. 

TL;DR: don't recommend the pancakes and French toast Delight. However I'm sure their other brunch items may be better.

excerpts: - This was a sourdough French toast which I thought was ok.
sourdough french toast.author: Spencer Q.
sourdough french toast.review:
Food:

French Toast with Blueberries - This was a sourdough French toast which I thought was ok.  I can't say it was anything to rave about really.  

Service: Staff was friendly but because it was a bit busy we did get forgotten slightly.

Ambiance:  It was a cool neighborhood diner feel to it.  Pretty hipster too.

Overall:  It was ok.  I'd probably give the pancakes a try at some point but if that's a bust then I won't return.

excerpts: The sourdough french toast is off-putting in how sour it is.
The hash was too greasy for my liking.
I could buy better huevos rancheros a couple doors down in either direction.

- I do appreciate there are vegetarian and vegan options. 
- Ice cream is no longer homemade--though they do make an effort to pick local brands like La Copa Loca or Mitchell's. 
- Price point is what I find ridiculous relative to what I'm getting.
sourdough french toast.author: Helen W.
sourdough french toast.review:
Worth coming for the soda fountain atmosphere.

FOOD: I have never eaten anything here I have liked. The sourdough french toast is off-putting in how sour it is. The hash was too greasy for my liking. I could buy better huevos rancheros a couple doors down in either direction. 
- I do appreciate there are vegetarian and vegan options. 
- Ice cream is no longer homemade--though they do make an effort to pick local brands like La Copa Loca or Mitchell's. 
- Price point is what I find ridiculous relative to what I'm getting. I'd feel more satisfied if "cute immersive experience" were a line item on the bill. 

SERVICE: Perfectly polite. It is of course busy in the morning, and I am impressed by how the servers keep their cool in the middle of it. Very easy to go in and buy something from the candy counter if you're not there to stay for the immersive fountain experience.

AMBIANCE: Adorable. Enter the soda fountain of decades ago, with cheery decor, classic candies (Pixie sticks, ring pops), and old school aluminum and felt letterboard with dessert choices :). The kind of place where you want to buy a milkshake in your poodle skirt and ask for two straws to share with a girl :). Let's be clear though--there are no poodle skirts here. It's all about that Mission hipster/grunge look. Seating is limited in the main room but expandable--you need to add your name to a board to be seated, so come on the earlier side if you're a group and enjoy a walk around a vibrant neighborhood pre-meal!

excerpts: The sourdough french toast is absolutely the perfect balance of sweetness tempered by sourdough tartness.
The eggs are great and the potatoes are salty and delicious and addicting.
sourdough french toast.author: Victoria B.
sourdough french toast.review:
This place is amazing! Super cute and funky. The perfect mix of nostalgia and hipness. From the moment I walked in, I loved this place, with its wooden booths and candy counter and old menu items hung on the wall as decoration (the pineapple and cream cheese salad sign is hilarious!).

The service is super friendly. We walked in and were immediately seated (though that was before 10 am. By the time we left shortly after 10, the place was pretty packed) and given water and coffee. Two servers were handling tables, expediting food, taking orders and checking refills, and they were very attentive. Even when most of the booths were filled, our coffee cups were never empty.

And the food is AMAZING. It's what you only dream diner food can be. The sourdough french toast is absolutely the perfect balance of sweetness tempered by sourdough tartness. The eggs are great and the potatoes are salty and delicious and addicting. My only regret is that I got full and couldn't eat more!

Definitely check this place out!

excerpts: She ordered blueberry sourdough French toast after asking the waiter if the blueberries were fresh.
He said yes.
The blueberries may have been fresh days before that, they definitely were not fresh.
The waiter didn't show back up to out table after, I had to grab a different waiter to pay the bill.
I finished my pancakes, her French toast was pretty much left intact.
I lost points that morning.
Fellas, don't take a date there.
sourdough french toast.author: Aaron T.
sourdough french toast.review: Took a friend there the other day. My banana nut pancakes were pretty good. She ordered blueberry sourdough French toast after asking the waiter if the blueberries were fresh. He said yes. The blueberries may have been fresh days before that, they definitely were not fresh. The waiter didn't show back up to out table after, I had to grab a different waiter to pay the bill. I finished my pancakes, her French toast was pretty much left intact. I lost points that morning. Fellas, don't take a date there.

excerpts: Sourdough french toast or vegan banana walnut hot cakes (yes, vegan, though I'm not, is SUPER yummy), everything is tasty.
They have all the original decor (down to the shelves and benches), which is pretty cool and features of old-school candy that you can purchase :).
sourdough french toast.author: Zara S.
sourdough french toast.review: I love this spot, period. Scrumptious breakfast options, fast and friendly service, awesome historic decor and worth the wait. their omelettes are my favorite, their milkshakes satisfy your cravings. Sourdough french toast or vegan banana walnut hot cakes (yes, vegan, though I'm not, is SUPER yummy), everything is tasty.  They have all the original decor (down to the shelves and benches), which is pretty cool and features of old-school candy that you can purchase :).

excerpts: I ordered the sourdough french toast and added strawberries and whipped cream.
The french toast was eggy the way I like it but more salty than sweet
and I really couldn't tell the bread was actually sourdough.
$1 for strawberries and $1 for whipped cream...
I definitely expected more on my plate.
sourdough french toast.author: Maya S.
sourdough french toast.review:
Food: Okay. I ordered the sourdough french toast and added strawberries and whipped cream. The french toast was eggy the way I like it but more salty than sweet and I really couldn't tell the bread was actually sourdough. $1 for strawberries and $1 for whipped cream...I definitely expected more on my plate. However, milkshakes are excellent here. 

Service: Half of the waitstaff is very off-putting. Unfortunately, this half tended to our table. They aren't very friendly and have no sense of urgency to actually wait on you. Plus, of the three tables in our area, we got there first, placed our order first, and received our food last.  

Ambiance: Love the diner feel and all of the 80s stuff they sell behind the counter but with a name like St. Francis Fountain in the Mission District, I just expected the restaurant atmosphere to feel a bit different, more warmer and homey. Fact is, it's definitely not the actual residents of the neighborhood eating at St. Francis Fountain.

excerpts: I had the sourdough french toast with strawberries.
It wasn't dry, but it wasn't too wet either.
It had a really good crunch.
My mom had the hamburger w/ fries.
Which I had a bite of and woah
it was good.
She also said the coffee was really good.
sourdough french toast.author: Tonie F.
sourdough french toast.review:
I love the feeling you get when you first walk in here. Its gives off a 50 era feel. Which I loved! The food wasn't bad either, it was delicious actually! 

I had the sourdough french toast with strawberries. It wasn't dry, but it wasn't too wet either. It had a really good crunch. My mom had the hamburger w/ fries. Which I had a bite of and woah it was good. She also said the coffee was really good. It came with refills too.

I just wish the staff was a little bit nicer. I mean don't get me wrong they weren't rude or anything, but a smile goes a long way. I'll defiantly be back though!

excerpts: (Sourdough french toast?
sourdough french toast.author: Jacqueline M.
sourdough french toast.review:
I'm going to keep this brief. I really REALLY want to love St Francis fountain because it's an old timey soda fountain with pretty decent breakfast food. (Sourdough french toast? The spuds? nomnomnom)
However the service is TERRIBLE.
To qualify, I worked in restaurants for years. I am very forgiving when you're slammed, when things go wrong, etc but it also means I'm fairly unforgiving when you ignore your customers or cop attitude.
The last time I was there was a Saturday morning. It wasn't that crowded. At all. It almost seemed like the staff outnumbered the customers. There were two of us and we sat at the counter. A very harried waitress took our drink order and when I asked for soy for my coffee she pushed the almost empty pitcher from the last customer over to me. (are you f*cking KIDDING me).
We waited to order.
And waited.
And waited.
The staff was bustling around, doing sidework, and talking amongst themselves. Looking busy doing anything OTHER than taking our order.
I asked someone if we could order, without making eye contact I got just a blase "You have to order with a server." 
He didn't tell anyone.
We waited.
And waited.
And asked another staff member working the counter. 
"Oh, this isn't my section but I guess I can take your order."
Thank you so much for inconveniencing yourself by DOING YOUR JOB.
Turns out it was OUR fault for our waitress ignoring us, as we were informed by this server, because we put the menu away. (yeah, I'm rolling my eyes too)
We got the food. It was good. She checked in. Hooray.

I do want to say that this waitress was busting her butt, as she usually does, while most of the other stuff was doing god knows what. However we still got ignored and weren't able to order for almost 20min.

I've been there, serving is rough, especially when hung over, but it feels like the staff that morning thought they were god's gift to the breakfast crowd.
I won't be going back until service improves by hiring servers who actually want to take my money.

(I said I'd keep this brief. Womp womp.)

excerpts: My friend had the sourdough french toast with blueberries (~$6.50).
sourdough french toast.author: Zoom Z.
sourdough french toast.review:
Went here for breakfast around 9AM on Sunday. Had the Hector waffle combo - orange zest and pecan waffles (2), grilled ham (3 pieces), scrambled eggs (2) for $10.50. My friend had the sourdough french toast with blueberries (~$6.50). Both were very good.

However, I thought the original fountain shop diner decor was great. I would definitely go back again.

Friendly service, although at 9AM the outside seating and the side addition were not open yet.

Verdict: Make your homage to St. Francis and leave a happy worshiper.

excerpts: Anyway, enough of my little tirade... their shakes are amazing and huge, and I especially love their sourdough french toast, which they top with some yogurt and granola, which I've never had before.
I'm more of a meat eater myself, but my husband really likes the veggie food here.
The wait staff has always been very nice and attentive, but then again I tend to avoid weekend brunch times.
sourdough french toast.author: Nicole A.
sourdough french toast.review:
I hate to go here on weekends for brunch, only because it is JAM packed with people and impossible to get a table. However, because I live just around the corner, I have the luxury of coming on the weekdays for breakfast or linner- much better. And I'm a bit offended at a previous posters implication that this is a sketchy neighborhood! I walk around by myself at night all the time and have never felt unsafe, much less during broad daylight. Just because this side of the Mission isn't crawling with people in skinny jeans, doesn't mean it's sketchy! 

Anyway, enough of my little tirade... their shakes are amazing and huge, and I especially love their sourdough french toast, which they top with some yogurt and granola, which I've never had before. I'm more of a meat eater myself, but my husband really likes the veggie food here. The wait staff has always been very nice and attentive, but then again I tend to avoid weekend brunch times.

excerpts: I ordered the French Toast Delight that came with yogurt, granola and fruits.
With how it was worded on the menu, I originally assumed the parfait-like portion of this dish would be on the side, INSTEAD it was on TOP of my French toast...
Amongst my fruit, I was lucky to get a nice piece of the apple core, which humans can totally just ingest those apple seeds no problem
(if you didn't get, sarcasm).
Anyway, for $10.50, all I wanted was some good simple French Toast, but got played hard.
The sourness from the yogurt literally overpowered everything and the dryness of the granola ruined the texture I hoped from the fluffy French toast...
The selection of fruit was quite sad, just raisins, apple and cantaloupe chunks, strawberries and grapes, which are some odd pairings with yogurt and toast?
: don't recommend the pancakes and French toast Delight.
However I'm sure their other brunch items may be better.
french toast delight.author: Lisa L.
french toast delight.review:
Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon for a quick brunch with my sister. The wait was around 10 minutes, which we utilized to decide what to order. 

We were seated on the other side of the restaurant which didn't have the best ambiance. They definitely skimped on the lighting, making the entire room feel really dull and uninviting. The water served was lukewarm and tasted funky. 

My sister ordered the buttermilk hot cakes that came with salted butter and one slice of orange garnish. In terms of flavor, although fluffy, we both came to a consensus that it was somewhat off-putting? I wasn't sure if it was the flour they used or their over all pancake batter, but there was this grainy floury aftertaste the more you ate it. 

I ordered the French Toast Delight that came with yogurt, granola and fruits. With how it was worded on the menu, I originally assumed the parfait-like portion of this dish would be on the side, INSTEAD it was on TOP of my French toast... Amongst my fruit, I was lucky to get a nice piece of the apple core, which humans can totally just ingest those apple seeds no problem (if you didn't get, sarcasm). Anyway, for $10.50, all I wanted was some good simple French Toast, but got played hard. The yogurt toppings in my opinion was a terrible pairing. The sourness from the yogurt literally overpowered everything and the dryness of the granola ruined the texture I hoped from the fluffy French toast... The selection of fruit was quite sad, just raisins, apple and cantaloupe chunks, strawberries and grapes, which are some odd pairings with yogurt and toast? As for the toast, I was disappointed.... just didn't satisfy those cravings and wished I walked a bit further or something to go to some other brunch place. 

TL;DR: don't recommend the pancakes and French toast Delight. However I'm sure their other brunch items may be better.

excerpts:
Each time the fruit is fresh and crisp

French Toast Delight: If you need to make weight for a boxing match or just want to beef up quick, this is the breakfast plate for you.
french toast delight.author: Clouob P.
french toast delight.review:
Where do I begin? I've been here 3 separate times and each time I've been more than satisfied, a bit remorseful (gluttony) but satisfied nonetheless.

Vegan Pancakes: Fluffy, soft and flavorful. You have the option of fruit, I opt'd for the strawberries first time and blueberries the next. Each time the fruit is fresh and crisp

French Toast Delight: If you need to make weight for a boxing match or just want to beef up quick, this is the breakfast plate for you. A couple pieces of French toast drowned in diced fruit, granola, and a drizzle of yogurt. Absolutely F#%^ING DELIGHTFUL. You'll feel fat but with a healthy twist.

I wish I would've tried other things besides breakfast but I can only assume that they're just as awesome as their counterparts.

Overall really good food, warm and attentive service (considering how busy and how they're staffed), and just good vibes.

If you live or are in the SF area check them out, you won't be sorry.

excerpts:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt
there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'
french toast delight.author: Michael U.
french toast delight.review:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760 I finally decided to quell my curiosity, a short walk back just one block landing me at a two-top in the 1918 soda fountain.  Kitschy in décor with toys and trading cards from my youth available for purchase in a glass case while booths and tables sat tightly spaced juxtaposing the Formica bar it would be mere moments before I was greeted by the diner's lone server and confirming hopes of an 'all-day' menu my order quickly took shape, a duo of childhood favorites readied at the counter along with French Toast arriving less than ten minutes later.  Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.  Already all smiles as patrons aged five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'

excerpts: Several dishes are great (Toasted Vegan sandwich, Chorizo & Eggs, the oh-my-god French Toast Delight), BUT my absolutely favorite is still the "My Chef Jess:" 2 eggs scrambled with homefries, vegan chorizo and mushrooms, topped with melted cheese, tomato, sour cream & green onions.
WITH A BAKED GOOD OF YOUR CHOICE!
COME ON now, does it get any better than that?!
french toast delight.author: Sam S.
french toast delight.review:
Okay. Okay, okay. I acknowledge that:

1. Not only are most patrons at this fine establishment "effortlessly" hip (at least that's the crowd for weekend brunch, with a few old couples sprinkled in for good measure)... but my date and I simultaneously cringed and laughed last Sunday when we realized that we looked MIGHTY identical to the surrounding hipster couples. Damn.

2. I've only ever chosen to sit outside, actually (which is lovely, and the tables are far enough away from pedestrians that they still feel somehow private) so I can't speak to the indoor seating/service/ambiance...

3. And, yes, it's true that the prices can be a little steep for - let's face it - a greasy neighborhood diner. But since I have yet to be disappointed by the food here (honest!), I'm willing to make some sacrifices.

It's true, dear Yelpers: I have been pleasantly surprised by (enamored of!) many a St. Francis Fountain dish, especially when it comes to breakfast. As a veg, I really appreciate the surprising amount of vegetarian/vegan-friendly options on the menu... and ones that aren't relegated to a fruit cup or a bland veggie plate, either! Several dishes are great (Toasted Vegan sandwich, Chorizo & Eggs, the oh-my-god French Toast Delight), BUT my absolutely favorite is still the "My Chef Jess:" 2 eggs scrambled with homefries, vegan chorizo and mushrooms, topped with melted cheese, tomato, sour cream & green onions. WITH A BAKED GOOD OF YOUR CHOICE! COME ON now, does it get any better than that?! Sure, the servers don't sprinkle goodwill and sunshine everywhere they go, but they are generally attentive enough to consistently refill water/coffee and provide some amusement (intentional or not).

If I could write a love letter to St. Francis Fountain, I surely would. "Dear St. Francis: You are dreamy and a half. Yours, Sam" (Okay, it could use a little work...)

excerpts: I was trying to be healthy that day and decided to get the french toast delight with yogurt, fruit & a sprinkle of granola.
The french toast was light and fluffy and had an interesting crunch to it because of the granola.
This place will have a line so prepare to wait.
Service was attentive, decor was amusing, price was decent (under $12-$14) and food was amazing.
I'm a fan now :)
french toast delight.author: Nancy Y.
french toast delight.review: I  LOVE this place not only because it has been around since 1918 but because the food is original and sooooo good. I was trying to be healthy that day and decided to get the french toast delight with yogurt, fruit & a sprinkle of granola. The french toast was light and fluffy and had an interesting crunch to it because of the granola. This place will have a line so prepare to wait. Service was attentive, decor was amusing, price was decent (under $12-$14) and food was amazing. I'm a fan now :)

excerpts: We had the french toast delight and the chef's mess.
The french toast was anything but french and instead resembled the desert mountains of the west right after the first snow storm of the year.
french toast delight.author: Mark L.
french toast delight.review:
Finally a place where you can get breakfast all day that beats out the neighborhood Denny's. It's not like it is hard to beat out Denny's but it is hard to find a place that will make breakfast at night, right. 

The place looks much like the way it was opened back in the twenties. All of the booths and counters have to be at least 30-40 years old which gives it character, but with character comes the aging lines of time. It was easy to recognize where to sit in the booth because the butt prints of diners' past marked the landing zone with cracks and holes in the leather. The booths stand up straight like wooden castles that surround your party. 

The food feels like they throw the kitchen sink at you. We had the french toast delight and the chef's mess. The french toast was anything but french and instead resembled the desert mountains of the west right after the first snow storm of the year. The toast was deep in the mountain floor under piles of strawberries, pineapples, nut, apples, raisins and sugar powdered granola. Ribbons of yogurt lined the lodes of french toast. I enjoyed it just as much as the 49'ers... the 1849ers upon discovering gold at Sutter's mill. The contrast between the different textures and flavors, made the whole dish enjoyable with little nuggets of delight in every bite.

The chef's mess was what it claimed to be with eggs, cheese, sour cream, green onions and of course the most important ingredient... bacon. With these ingredients, its like shooting fish in a barrel when it comes to making something tasty. Rather than make your stomach feel like it hits your knees the mess was lighter and energizing.

The food was hearty but not overbearing. It seemed that the waiters were not eating it though because they were both morbidly skinny. I am coming back next time I feel like pancakes late, yet I don't want to feel like a bloated whale afterward. You won't find food that will confuse you, instead it will be as if you are coming back to the family owned diner of your hometown, where everybody knows your name.

excerpts: I like sitting at the bar, which usually doesn't have wait, and enjoy the french toast delight or the breakfast burrito.
Perfectly located in 24th St!!
Yeap, I love it.
french toast delight.author: martha s.
french toast delight.review: Saturday morning, tired from friday night... St Francis is always there for us!! Most of the staff is super nice, just one of them looks "too cool" to serve us but does her job alright... I like sitting at the bar, which usually doesn't have wait, and enjoy the french toast delight or the breakfast burrito. Perfectly located in 24th St!! Yeap, I love it.

excerpts: We get the potato hash vegan style with vegan chorizo and avocado and the vegan pancakes.
Yummmmm!
vegan pancakes.author: Megan J.
vegan pancakes.review: We love coming here for a yummy vegan breakfast when staying in SF! We get the potato hash vegan style with vegan chorizo and avocado and the vegan pancakes. Yummmmm!

excerpts: On the sweet side, I had the vegan pancakes with strawberries and I can honestly say they were the best vegan pancakes I've ever had.
vegan pancakes.author: Alex K.
vegan pancakes.review:
This was my first time and it was honestly a pretty stellar brunch experience! I love the unpretentious and cozy diner-like atmosphere and the service is friendly but quick and no nonsense. It's a small place so they seem to churn through the tables fairly quickly, but we never felt rushed and actually appreciated that we didn't have to spend our whole afternoon there. 

Anyway, on to the good stuff! We had the tofu scramble with mushroom, green onion and ranchero sauce. It came with potatoes and toast, and since my girlfriend is vegan they were kind enough to tip her off about asking for vegan butter since the toast usually comes pre-buttered. The scramble could have had more flavor and pizazz to it, for sure. The potatoes and veggies were great but I think marinating the tofu or throwing some spices on it would have really kicked things up a notch. 

On the sweet side, I had the vegan pancakes with strawberries and I can honestly say they were the best vegan pancakes I've ever had. They stood up to your standard pancake and were clearly made with love! 

I can't wait to go back and try more from the menu, and I love that they have plenty of vegan options without sacrificing diner favorites and classics. They've got something for everyone!

excerpts: Do the vegan pancakes still come with vegan butter?
I'm bummed the sausage Patty is gone
and now just a dinner style link is available.
our server today was super nice but didn't have all the answers, I felt bad asking for so many edits.
Please please please, add a few straight vegan sandwiches and breakfast items, and maybe another salad dressing option.
We love you and want to keep coming back.
PS we always have awesome service and the vibe here is great too.
Vegetarians and meat eaters
I'm sure you will love it.
Just a little tricky now for vegans.
vegan pancakes.author: Heather B.
vegan pancakes.review: I love this place and have been coming for years but I feel with the menu change there are less vegan options. No sandwiches are vegan unless you ask for modifications, like the vegan burger but you have to ask for no mayo and no cheese. Or the Oh Hell, but you have to ask for no aioli or cheese. Do the vegan pancakes still come with vegan butter? I'm bummed the sausage Patty is gone and now just a dinner style link is available.   our server today was super nice but didn't have all the answers, I felt bad asking for so many edits. Please please please, add a few straight vegan sandwiches and breakfast items, and maybe another salad dressing option. We love you and want to keep coming back. PS we always have awesome service and the vibe here is great too. Vegetarians and meat eaters I'm sure you will love it. Just a little tricky now for vegans.

excerpts: They have tofu scrambles, vegan chorizo hash, vegan pancakes, vegan sausage patties, veggie chili, garden burgers and seitan melts!
I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash.
The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety.
This is neither better nor worse, just different.
They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat.
The vegan chorizo hash is quite oily (as hash often is), but it's quite tasty.
They served it with the Earth Balance spread, which I had never tried before.
vegan pancakes.author: Ed M.
vegan pancakes.review:
An old-school diner with lots of vegan options? Let's go!

I was amazed by the sheer number of vegetarian and vegan options offered at St. Francis Fountain. They have tofu scrambles, vegan chorizo hash, vegan pancakes, vegan sausage patties, veggie chili, garden burgers and seitan melts! They even have veganaise and Earth Balance Buttery Spread.

I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash. The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety. This is neither better nor worse, just different. They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat. The vegan chorizo hash is quite oily (as hash often is), but it's quite tasty. They served it with the Earth Balance spread, which I had never tried before. It's pretty similar to a salted, whipped butter.

My partner ordered the Polar Melt on light rye. The seitan is well seasoned. If you like patty melts and the like, this is a great veggie option (it came with jack cheese, which you can probably leave off it you want to go vegan). It's one of the best melts I've tasted in a long time!

They carry Mitchell's ice cream and La Copa Loca gelato for desserts and fountain drinks. They also have vanilla soy as a non-dairy option. We didn't try any of these since we were so full from our meals. Maybe next time.
