Their brewed coffee is pleasantly strong and their staff is quite friendly. Combined with a big, tasty meal, it's hard to leave without a smile on your face. It's not the healthiest place to eat (it is an old-school diner after all!), but the veggie and vegan options really show how almost every other restaurant out there is really dropping the ball when it comes to plant-based dining!

excerpts: They have really good vegan options too: I love the banana-walnut vegan pancakes (which come with *vegan* butter!), the tofu rancheros, and the vegan nebulous potato thing.
They have non-vegan stuff too
vegan pancakes.author: Morgane M.
vegan pancakes.review:
This place is so good! Really friendly staff, excellent food, cute diner vibes... I love it. They have really good vegan options too: I love the banana-walnut vegan pancakes (which come with *vegan* butter!), the tofu rancheros, and the vegan nebulous potato thing. They have non-vegan stuff too and I'm sure it's good as well.

Portions are very filling and you will leave here satisfied and happy.

excerpts: Vegan pancakes, vegan butter, vegan sausage, vegan cheese, vegan ice cream!!!!!!
All the best items for a great vegan brunch in the city!
Can't wait to go back!
Oh & they have mimosas .... !!
Thank you for having options for us, and for your amazing staff!
vegan pancakes.author: Kelly W.
vegan pancakes.review: Amazing place for vegans and veggies! Vegan pancakes, vegan butter, vegan sausage, vegan cheese, vegan ice cream!!!!!! All the best items for a great vegan brunch in the city! Can't wait to go back! Oh & they have mimosas .... !! Thank you for having options for us, and for your amazing staff!

excerpts:
I had the vegan rancheros and vegan pancakes..both dishes to DIE FOR!!! 
Great service, prices and nice classic location.
I'll be back!
vegan pancakes.author: David R.
vegan pancakes.review:
I came here Sunday morning around 8:30am and the crowd was very light. I sat at the bar and the waiter was right on it taking my order. I had the vegan rancheros and vegan pancakes..both dishes to DIE FOR!!! 
Great service, prices and nice classic location.
I'll be back!

excerpts: In addition to Vegan Pancakes(!), there was a vegan scramble with different options for sauces, and tofu could be substituted in on most of their egg dishes.
vegan pancakes.author: Paul B.
vegan pancakes.review:
We went to the St Francis Soda Fountain for breakfast on a recent visit to San Francisco and was very happy with our choice. Obviously, the diner is really old, but the interior is very clean and the staff was very friendly and attentive. We came in on a Monday morning around 10:00, and took a seat at the counter as all the booths were taken. We were immediately greeted by a server, given menus and water, then approached for our order a few minutes later.

As a vegan, my wife usually has trouble finding anything other than oatmeal or fruit for breakfast at most places. Not so at the St Francis. In addition to Vegan Pancakes(!), there was a vegan scramble with different options for sauces, and tofu could be substituted in on most of their egg dishes. She ended up with a tofu scramble with a ginger peanut sauce, while I opted for the Veggie mess, which was assorted veggies scrambled with eggs and veggie chorizo. The orders came out in a reasonable time and both were delicious. Would have liked to order a milkshake, but maybe next time. Solid choice for a reasonably priced breakfast in the city - we'll be back!!

excerpts: They also had a vegan hash and some vegan pancakes on the menu that I will try next time we vacation here!
We didn't try it, but they also have vegan soft serve and other desserts!
Def a great place for vegans ( there are multiple options) and non vegans alike!
vegan pancakes.author: Kelsey M.
vegan pancakes.review: This place was amazing! The service was awesome and fast. You do have to write your name on a clipboard out front to wait in line but it's worth it and the line moves fast! I am vegan and tried the tofu  scramble with mushrooms, onions, tomatoes and ranchero sauce and my partner had the tofu scramble with peanut sauce and veggies. They also had a vegan hash and some vegan pancakes on the menu that I will try next time we vacation here! We didn't try it, but they also have vegan soft serve and other desserts! Def a great place for vegans ( there are multiple options) and non vegans alike!

excerpts: I ordered the tofu scramble and got the vegan pancakes on the side.
They were so fluffy with a hint of cinnamon and sweetness.
I can't wait to come back, the place gave the diner's vibe that I love to be a part of.
We were also seated after a quick 10 minute wait.
It was at the bar but the staff were all so friendly and considerate.
vegan pancakes.author: Megan T.
vegan pancakes.review: I actually came to this spot a couple of weeks ago and fell in love.  As someone now labeled as plant based, it was amazing to be able to eat brunch with my best friend as she is an omnivore.  I ordered the tofu scramble and got the vegan pancakes on the side.  They were so fluffy with a hint of cinnamon and sweetness.  I can't wait to come back, the place gave the diner's vibe that I love to be a part of.  We were also seated after a quick 10 minute wait.  It was at the bar but the staff were all so friendly and considerate.

excerpts: I went for the "griddle combo" 2 vegan pancakes, a tofu scramble and side of fruit.
My boyfriend got the huevos rancheros and side of biscuits and crazy.
Our food came pretty quick for how busy it was, tasty, hot, SUCH BIG PORTIONS.
I was pleasantly surprised with this spot.
The flavor was spot on, service was quick, friendly, and casual.
I wouldn't recommend coming here with a large group, the tables are pretty small and there seems to only be one booth large enough to fit about 6 at once, but overall great
and I will be back!
vegan pancakes.author: Kelsey B.
vegan pancakes.review:
A solid 4 star experience. 
I am always looking for a place where my meat eater boyfriend and my vegan-self can go enjoy a meal together. Kodus to the server over at Soul Groove who recommended this spot to check out for brunch. St. Francis Fountain is a great little authentic diner, totally separate from pretentious brunch spots you tend to find in the Mission. 
We were seated immediately (no wait for brunch, yay!) when we arrived and greeted with some waters from the server. I went for the "griddle combo" 2 vegan pancakes, a tofu scramble and side of fruit. My boyfriend got the huevos rancheros and side of biscuits and crazy. Our food came pretty quick for how busy it was, tasty, hot, SUCH BIG PORTIONS. I was pleasantly surprised with this spot. The flavor was spot on, service was quick, friendly, and casual. 
I wouldn't recommend coming here with a large group, the tables are pretty small and there seems to only be one booth large enough to fit about 6 at once, but overall great and I will be back!

excerpts: , I was in the mood for some vegan pancakes.

We found parking right in front and it wasn't super busy, so we took a seat and made our decisions, she got the strawberry vegan pancakes with a side of vegan sausage patties and I got the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of potatoes, we split everything and were stuffed by time we finished.
vegan pancakes.author: Garden R.
vegan pancakes.review:
I had to give St. Francis Fountain a try after so many vegan friends have sworn up and down this is a great place to eat, very much vegan comfort food at it's best. I took one of my daughters and we went for brunch, I was in the mood for some vegan pancakes. We found parking right in front and it wasn't super busy, so we took a seat and made our decisions, she got the strawberry vegan pancakes with a side of vegan sausage patties and I got the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of potatoes, we split everything and were stuffed by time we finished.

Everything tastes so good, I can't believe we ate it all! The blueberry pancakes are loaded with fruit with an option for vegan butter too if you'd like. The potatoes are done perfectly, just enough crispyness and softness inside to make them perfect, plus the herbs in them rock! My daughter ate all the vegan sausage patties, mumbling how good those were too, all in all, it was a great success, we'll definitely be back soon.

Keep up the good work and thanks for offering the non-animal meals, its nice to have those options for the whole family.

excerpts: Vegan Pancakes:
Fluffy, soft and flavorful.
You have the option of fruit, I opt'd for the strawberries first time and blueberries the next.
vegan pancakes.author: Clouob P.
vegan pancakes.review:
Where do I begin? I've been here 3 separate times and each time I've been more than satisfied, a bit remorseful (gluttony) but satisfied nonetheless.

Vegan Pancakes: Fluffy, soft and flavorful. You have the option of fruit, I opt'd for the strawberries first time and blueberries the next. Each time the fruit is fresh and crisp

French Toast Delight: If you need to make weight for a boxing match or just want to beef up quick, this is the breakfast plate for you. A couple pieces of French toast drowned in diced fruit, granola, and a drizzle of yogurt. Absolutely F#%^ING DELIGHTFUL. You'll feel fat but with a healthy twist.

I wish I would've tried other things besides breakfast but I can only assume that they're just as awesome as their counterparts.

Overall really good food, warm and attentive service (considering how busy and how they're staffed), and just good vibes.

If you live or are in the SF area check them out, you won't be sorry.

excerpts: We cannot wait to go back and try a scramble or their vegan pancakes!
vegan pancakes.author: Vrinda S.
vegan pancakes.review:
St. Francis Fountain is one of the best brunch places in the City! It has all types of food that would make any meat-lover, vegetarian or vegan extremely happy. We didn't eat any breakfast foods - but opted for sandwiches instead. I got the Devil's burger and my husband got the polar melt. Both were delicious! For sides - I got the Mac N' Cheese and he got vegetarian chili fries! The food was top notch, and there was so much, we did not get close to finishing off the sides. (Fair to note - we even got small milkshakes.)

Great experience, great food, and awesome diner ambience. We cannot wait to go back and try a scramble or their vegan pancakes!

excerpts: Other great vegan items: milkshakes, the Vegan Thing with potatoes, guac, salsa, and vegan cheese, vegan pancakes, and their black beans.
vegan pancakes.author: Nick W.
vegan pancakes.review:
Amazing, vegan friendly restaurant. Come here with a mixed group, please the meat eaters and the vegans all at once. The best vegan item on the menu is by far the Devil Burger. It's the marinated seitan burger with vegan mayo, lettuce, pickles, onion, and tomatoes on a soft bun. I wish there were more items on the menu that use the seitan- it's to die for. Other great vegan items: milkshakes, the Vegan Thing with potatoes, guac, salsa, and vegan cheese, vegan pancakes, and their black beans. Great for brunch, and I recommend sitting outside when it's nice out.

Not great for groups because of limited seating options. They only accept a maximum of two cards per table- so if you're splitting the bill, we recommend that you bring cash to avoid the eye roll.

excerpts: the vegan pancakes, the french toast, the eggs, "the vegan thing" with a bunch of shit, the jam, the soy shakes, everythinggggg!!!!!
vegan pancakes.author: Samantha S.
vegan pancakes.review:
OMG

vegan breakfast and non vegan breakfast and old-school fountain shoppe style diner filled with young beautiful babes and of course, delicious food!!!

everything is amazing. the vegan pancakes, the french toast, the eggs, "the vegan thing" with a bunch of shit, the jam, the soy shakes, everythinggggg!!!!!

super popular, expect to wait, but worth it. 
not too pricey, but not cheap.

excerpts: My daughter really enjoyed the vegan pancakes, and my son had the French toast.
vegan pancakes.author: Ani M.
vegan pancakes.review: We were told this is a SFO institution that we absolutely should visit, and my family agrees! Two thumbs up. My daughter really enjoyed the vegan pancakes, and my son had the French toast.  I really enjoyed my Devil burger, and the three bean chili soup.  We topped it off with gelato for the kids. If you are a vegetarian or looking for vegan options, this place is heaven sent.

excerpts: They have vegan pancakes as well.
I had the vegan strawberry pancakes there before.
The pancakes were hot and ready to be devoured.
They tasted like victory.
vegan pancakes.author: Jessica C.
vegan pancakes.review:
This restaurant is amazing. Each time I go, I fall more in love with this place. From the coffee, to the waitstaff, to the menu, the ambiance is very nice and settling. The menu offers vegan and vegetarian options as well as meat for the meat loving variety. The last time I went there was last Tuesday, March 1st, I ordered chocolate chip pancakes with blueberries on top. They have vegan pancakes as well. I had the vegan strawberry pancakes there before. The pancakes were hot and ready to be devoured. They tasted like victory. The two flavors, chocolate and blueberry were a great marriage of decadence. The addition of syrup wasn't extremely necessary, but if added, you'd get blasted with a hot and delicious bite of succulence.  Also on the menu are these "potato things" which look amazing, it comes with scrambled eggs and salsa which my sister got. She loved it. My two guy friends loved the burgers that they got and they said "good burgers are hard to find." I highly recommend this place to try. Here is a picture of my blueberry chocolate chip pancakes. You can see my friend's burger lurking in the background.
https://mail-attachment.googleusercontent.com/attachment/?ui=2&ik=26b4a113bf&view=att&th=135e6c8bfb50c243&attid=0.1&disp=inline&safe=1&zw&saduie=AG9B_P-oS00HGU7cP9pl2GgTjJpq&sadet=1331016865828&sads=WhKX9KhBxvmOkQrRoEJmNlWVKIo&sadssc=1

excerpts: Next time I'm trying the Vegan Thing, or maybe the vegan pancakes.
Vegan pancakes!
Nobody ever has vegan pancakes.
Definitely should have tried those.
vegan pancakes.author: Ashley P.
vegan pancakes.review:
So many vegan options I experienced menu overload. I hate when I want to try everything and can't. 

I ended up with the vegan rancheros, which was tofu scramble with ranchero sauce and vegan cheese (Teese? Follow Your Heart? They taste the same to me, so I don't know), black beans, pico, and corn tortillas. It was all pretty good, but I feel I ordered wrong. Ordering Mexican-ish food at a non-Mexican establishment in the Mission is stupid, right? I wasn't thinking. Plus, they need to figure out how to get that vegan cheese to melt. I know it's a little tricky, but it can be done. It was just shredded and stirred in with the tofu, and while I didn't mind it, I could have done without it altogether.

Next time I'm trying the Vegan Thing, or maybe the vegan pancakes. Vegan pancakes! Nobody ever has vegan pancakes. Definitely should have tried those. I was too full for a soy shake, but that's also on my list for next time. 

Great atmosphere and friendly service, and tons of vegan options. Love it!

excerpts:
they serve VEGAN PANCAKES
do u know how happy i was when i saw that?!
i ordered the strawberry vegan pancakes - the pancakes had a hint of cinnamon - yum!
vegan pancakes.author: Janet W.
vegan pancakes.review:
the online menu does not do it justice
theres quite a few things missing on theyre online menu for breakfast
they serve VEGAN PANCAKES
do u know how happy i was when i saw that?!
i ordered the strawberry vegan pancakes - the pancakes had a hint of cinnamon - yum!
you can order REAL Maple syrup - omg drooling just thinking bout it and overused it just a bit when i was there

we ordered a side of fries to share - a lil bit on the salty side but it was purty good
it had the skin on it
the ketchup was not heins - i can tell that much

we sat in the booth - pretty squishy small booth
im uncomfortable hangin my stuff on the coat racks so i kept it on
it wasn't hot anyways so didnt bother me so much
you will definitely touch the arm of the person sitting next to u especially if they are a medium sz guy

there was only one person working in the beginning
(the other one showed up later)
so it took him awhile to take our orders
but otherwise it was all good
food came in moderate time

but they ran out of the only soy ice cream - so i'll get a root beer float next time

they sell candy in the front plus certain trading cards - that was cool
prices were very decent overall

i cant wait to go bk jus a lil inconvenient for me

excerpts: I love their corned beef hash and that's all I've tried, but friends have had their eggs florentine and the nebulous potato thing and similarly loved the food.
This is what Mel's should be.
florentine.author: Faceless E.
florentine.review: These guys are great! We had a party of six, were worried about getting out on time, but they seated us quickly. Super friendly, and the food is tasty. I love their corned beef hash and that's all I've tried, but friends have had their eggs florentine and the nebulous potato thing and similarly loved the food. This is what Mel's should be.

excerpts: The food was good, with the everything scramble and eggs Florentine.
florentine.author: Po L.
florentine.review:
Service, taste, and experience; things that make your food adventure.  This adventure service took a swim with the sharks.

Service: Friendly wait staff, but they forgot about the table once the order was in and the food was delivered.  It took many many minutes to flag someone down for a refill of water and some additional condiments.  The condiments took also took many many minutes.

Food: The food was good, with the everything scramble and eggs Florentine.  The biscuits could have used honey in the batter to sweeten it up, otherwise, the food was good and would come here for food alone.

Experience: 1950's dinner feel; fun atmosphere.

excerpts: I ordered the Eggs Florentine with home fries, a Poinsettia (Cranberry and champagne) and a coffee-
While the coffee is a great drip of Peerless and the poinsettia was well-balanced, the main dish was decidedly lackluster.

The presentation was certainly acceptable, however, the low quality of the foods meant that my yolks had no taste, the hollandaise shouted out it's powdered origins, the spinach tasted misused or perhaps even canned.
florentine.author: Cameo W.
florentine.review:
Excellent (albeit 'hip') service- Lackluster food, unremarkable quality.  

This historic soda shop has signs up that remind one of the idyllic 50s in San Francisco- when a Malt was a staple and comfort foods were still worth advertising on hand painted signs.

I ordered the Eggs Florentine with home fries, a Poinsettia (Cranberry and champagne) and a coffee- While the coffee is a great drip of Peerless and the poinsettia was well-balanced, the main dish was decidedly lackluster.  The presentation was certainly acceptable, however, the low quality of the foods meant that my yolks had no taste, the hollandaise shouted out it's powdered origins, the spinach tasted misused or perhaps even canned.  I had a few bites of my meal, and enjoyed the drinks and company instead.

Based on the other recommendations- I'd suggest one stick to foods that rely less on the quality of the original ingredients, and rely more upon preserved foods and spices.  This place has great ambiance, malts, and sandwiches made of meat, relishes, mustards, and bread.

The handsome and trendy staff and patrons range from my middle-aged Precita Eyes volunteer dining companions at the counter to the gaggles of 20-somethings in Valencia-styled capris and ironic t-shirts.  The gorgeous preserved interior is lovely to gaze at and imagine an earlier time.

excerpts: This place serves up an awesome Weekend Benedict Specials with various toppings--my go to is Bacon (chopped thick cut) and Avocado (fresh and plentiful) which is DELICIOUS--for ~$13.50 (your usual SF prices...).
It comes with your choice of Fruit or Potatoes (the shredded then fried flat kind, not cubed or roasted.)
You can also add bottomless coffee and a Champagne Drink (mimosas!) or Large OJ for $4.
They also have 3-4 other types of champagne "mimosas" and a large menu of Egg breakfasts, omlettes, french toasts, and tons of other carnivous, herbavorious, and vegan options.
benedict.author: Nerissa C.
benedict.review:
Food: WORTH IT.

My friends and I used to go to this other AMAZING brunch spot that experienced a fire and hasn't opened up over 1+ years since :( so we're doing our due diligence to find a comparable "replacement" (in our stomachs, not our hearts) to bring back the brunch bash. All I need in life is eggs bennie and finally, we've found a worthy opponent.

This place serves up an awesome Weekend Benedict Specials with various toppings--my go to is Bacon (chopped thick cut) and Avocado (fresh and plentiful) which is DELICIOUS--for ~$13.50 (your usual SF prices...). It comes with your choice of Fruit or Potatoes (the shredded then fried flat kind, not cubed or roasted.) You can also add bottomless coffee and a Champagne Drink (mimosas!) or Large OJ for $4. They also have 3-4 other types of champagne "mimosas" and a large menu of Egg breakfasts, omlettes, french toasts, and tons of other carnivous, herbavorious, and vegan options. Great for the diverse group of friends!

Came on a Sunday and there was a couple other groups in front of us--someone hunching near the door said they were me and took my table :( but the server was quick to fix that. There's actually 2 food sections and an outdoor section but they might've been short staffed because service was really slow (-1 star) and only half of the inside tables were full.

However, this is the next best thing for my friends and I at the moment so we'll be back for those bennies! Don't you dare leave us hanging!!!

excerpts: I had the eggs benedict and they were delicious.
Long story short, we went back the next day
and I know we will definitely be back on our next SF trip.
benedict.author: Ellie V.
benedict.review:
Looking for a place to have breakfast for a vegan and non-vegan? THIS is the place! After Herbivore closed its last location, my boyfriend (vegan) was devastated. It's one of the only places we always go to when visiting San Francisco, which is often. After searching around, we found St Francis on Yelp and decided to give it a try. There was a short line outside the door but it was only a 15-20 min wait and it was well worth it.
They had several vegan options including a vegan pesto scramble the boyfriend got and loved. I had the eggs benedict and they were delicious. Long story short, we went back the next day and I know we will definitely be back on our next SF trip.

excerpts: The eggs Benedict are never over cooked and the floats and shakes are very good.
benedict.author: Julia S.
benedict.review:
Amazing weekend brunch. The eggs Benedict are never over cooked and the floats and shakes are very good. 

Brunch seating is a bit annoying. Sometimes they do not have the kitchen or wait staff to have all tables full in both rooms so you wait outside looking at empty tables (at least I assume that is the issue as it is so common). Once seated there can be a bit of a wait again. Not for those in a rush. 

However the food is great and the staff are very good once you start ordering. I appreciate that twice they have not served guacamole or avocado because of last summers avocado shortage. Far better than the places that gave you gross avocado.  The staff is happy to make alterations for picky kids and always keeps your coffee full. 

Never been here for dinner but the sandwich I had once for lunch was as good as their brunch food.

excerpts: The line's never too long, the eggs Benedict are always well done: I've only had one firm yoke in 5 years of eating here at least monthly.
Mimosas are $4.75, and in a real glass instead of a BS Champaign flute, and they make them well (strong).
benedict.author: Thomas R.
benedict.review: I love this place. The line's never too long, the eggs Benedict are always well done: I've only had one firm yoke in 5 years of eating here at least monthly. Mimosas are $4.75, and in a real glass instead of a BS Champaign flute, and they make them well (strong). Other highlights of the menu: their homemade banana bread, the corned beef hash, and the chefs mess are all great.

excerpts: The Chef's Mess is awesome and the eggs benedict is tasty also.
I'll have to stop in and try a shake sometime.
The street parking is ok in the mornings, but gets worse and worse throughout the day
benedict.author: Ken P.
benedict.review: This is a great place.  Wonderful traditional breakfasts with some interesting twists.  Good service, and while not inexpensive, in the SF context, especially the Mission, not too outrageous.  There are some vegan and vegetarian options, and I see a lot of complaints on Yelp from vegans, but c'mon - it's a 50's style diner that's been open 99 years.  Do you really expect it to be a vegan haven?  I swear, in SF Speak, Vegan translates into, "listen to me whine".  They give it a try to have something for everyone, but leave them alone when they don't meet your all-veggie menu standards, Princess.  The Chef's Mess is awesome and the eggs benedict is tasty also.  I'll have to stop in and try a shake sometime.  The street parking is ok in the mornings, but gets worse and worse throughout the day

excerpts: You would be stupid to pass up any of their weekend Benedict special.
benedict.author: Jackie Z.
benedict.review:
You would be stupid to pass up any of their weekend Benedict special. It's one of those local treasures that makes you value local eateries. 

We came with our dog, and had a wonderful table outside. We were even offered water for our dog, SUPER PLUS. 

THe bitch next to us was the only problem....so I obviously can't dock the restaurant for that. 

I will never, ever, EVER, eat at a Denny's/IHOP because restaurants like this exist.

excerpts: Everything I had was so delicious: the Benedict, chicken cilantro soup, spinach salad, and fruit.
The staff was so accommodating and friendly.
Honestly such a cute atmosphere..
the server and the host both treated me
like I was their friend.
I had to write a yelp review for them
and this is the first one I've ever written
I think so.. pretty cool.
benedict.author: Gwendelyn R.
benedict.review: Everything I had was so delicious: the Benedict, chicken cilantro soup, spinach salad, and fruit. The staff was so accommodating and friendly. Honestly such a cute atmosphere.. the server and the host both treated me like I was their friend. I had to write a yelp review for them and this is the first one I've ever written I think so.. pretty cool.

excerpts: While the brunch partner-in-crime is partial to the eggs benedict (and its variations), I love the Chef's Mess.
benedict.author: Nancy C.
benedict.review:
St. Francis Fountain is good for those days when you: (1) want a low-key brunch, (2) are feeling lazy and don't feel like eating more than one meal that day, and (3) are channeling your 5-year-old self and want an ice cream soda.  

Sometimes I wake up on a Sunday feeling like 1, 2, and 3.  So I drag myself out of bed, drag my brunch partner-in-crime with me, and go to St. Francis Fountain. As I sip happily on my ice cream soda, along comes the Chef's Mess, my favorite item on the menu.  While the brunch partner-in-crime is partial to the eggs benedict (and its variations), I love the Chef's Mess.  It has everything  delicious in it, all mixed together.

Bacon? Check.  Mushrooms? Check. Spuds? Check.  Bacon? Check again.  Yes, if you are a bacon lover, you'll love the ample amount of Bacon in the Chef's Mess.  Don't forget it also comes with cheese, sour cream, and green onion.  

The best part about something so delicious is that there's so much of it that you can make two meals out of it if you want. Nom and nom.

excerpts: Loved the diner style eggs Benedict with tomato and bacon.
Potatoes are delicious too!
benedict.author: Archana P.
benedict.review: Loved the diner style eggs Benedict with tomato and bacon. Potatoes are delicious too!

excerpts: - Sandhya benedict (on the weekend specials list) -

the English muffin base is homemade, like a tender juicy savory pancake-crumpet
-
benedict.author: Megan G.
benedict.review:
This is our home away from home!

It surprised me to discover that the huevos rancheros here are out-of-this-world... like, best-of-the-Mission quality. Add jalapeños and avocado and you've got yourself an amazing share.

Other faves:
- Sandhya benedict (on the weekend specials list) - the English muffin base is homemade, like a tender juicy savory pancake-crumpet
- Thing your spuds... it is good
- Side salads are crunchy and delish. Caesar is dressing-heavy. Italian vin is awesome.
- Biscuits, banana bread (not too sweet), and toast... all yum.

Things I'd not necessarily recommend: the mac 'n' cheese, the veggie reuben, veggie chili (which is real sweet). None's a bad choice, just not as relatively special as the true stars here.

excerpts: Serving breakfast ALL day, St. Francis Fountain has an extensive all-American breakfast menu with weekend specials (5 eggs benedict variations), a nice vegan selection, and $4 mimosas!
They also have soups, salads, sandwiches and burgers on the menu.
benedict.author: Cherylynn N.
benedict.review:
"My family is going to be so happy that you're 'refining' me..."

Attempt #1: Foie gras at Fifth Floor: *disgusted look*

Attempt #2: Sushi at Ino: "So how is this different from Sushi Rock?"

Attempt #3: Wine tasting in Napa: "BIG BOY SHOTS!" *chugs and pounds fist on table*

FAIL. Hey, at least I tried. 

OK, Back to Basics...

Founded in 1918, St. Francis Fountain operated as a candy store and ice cream parlor. 10 years ago, the current owners installed a kitchen turning St. Francis Fountain into a greasy spoon diner while keep the nostalgia of the early 1900s ice cream parlor with swirly retro stools. Serving breakfast ALL day, St. Francis Fountain has an extensive all-American breakfast menu with weekend specials (5 eggs benedict variations), a nice vegan selection, and $4 mimosas! They also have soups, salads, sandwiches and burgers on the menu. Don't forget to stop by their candy counter to revive the fat kid in you (mines never left) with Pop Rocks, Necco Wafers, Ring Pops and Sugar Daddys. 

Since Mr. NSS loves breakfast food, I thought St. Francis Fountain would be a great place to bring him. Do expect a wait on the weekends. On a Sunday afternoon at 2:30 PM, there was still a 10-15 minute wait. On the bright side, parking is much easier in this part of The Mission and Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is just several blocks away.

While enjoying the 80s and 90s throwbacks playing in the background, Mr. NSS had the Chef's Mess ($10) which was an artery-clogging behemoth of a thing in a bowl. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=8-4ip_RG5nlesdN-19dNog#8-4ip_RG5nlesdN-19dNog Crispy homefries with scrambled eggs, bacon, and mushrooms topped with melted cheese, tomatoes & sour cream. If that wasn't enough, he added avocado (+$1.50) and KILLED the entire thing. How he doesn't gain weight is beyond me. *shakes fist* I went with the Cheese Omelet w/ Jack Cheese, Sausage & Spinach ($8.50) and substituted the homefries for fruit. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=8-4ip_RG5nlesdN-19dNog#jgh1aNh3Bw5YrkaQMrXu0w My fluffy omelet was filled with just the right amount of cheese for that slight oozing effect once cut. The sausage gave a rich porky bite while the spinach was added just to make me feel better from the cholesterol-filled dish. Umm, at least it was Atkins-friendly (I didn't eat the bread)? =X

Service was friendly enough and drink refills were promptly made. This is very much a hipster place so make sure to come with your skinny jeans, fedora, and black-rimmed glasses. 

After several FAILED attempts of trying to "refine" Mr. NSS, I've come to terms that guys like and appreciate simplicity. I can't fathom the thought IF I had brought him to The Rotunda for brunch that day. http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-rotunda-san-francisco#hrid:KJ8pg1WEqrfmHuGxan9yiA 

*PINKY UP* anyone?

excerpts: That time we came, they said they run out of eggs benedict, only 1 portion left, cool, we ordered 3 others, and eventually last eggs benedict didnt arrive as well...
Oh sorry, i thought u ordered this.
Always a situation with seating.
They have this list,
but oh well, enforced it!
When some ppl walk in and seat, they did nothing, just let them be there.
That time when we arrived and asked for table, they give the table to the one who arrived after us, because they just feel like it.

Disclosure, it happed today, at closing, when the place was half full, and it was raining, we were by the door, so yes, we asjed to seat, they like dont u want to seat at counter, why would we if so many tae are open?!
Then they say wait, then a couple came in and they seated them.
Occasionaly forgeting you ordered a milkshake.
It's done, leaving, then i need to take my milk shake to go.
Constantly making you wait forever to order.
Just being transparent there.
Then offer free 1 dish for apology, i dont need that, i came to have brunch, with line, wait and eat
i want it to be in 1.5 hrs, never come at times when the line is super long.
But it takes 2-2 hrs 15 mins, cuz they dont seat you, they seat someone else, they dont serve you or they forget the order!
Havent visited here for a year, went back today, again dissapointment.
I guess no more.
The food isnt that good either, worth than before, so overrated.
benedict.author: Nataly S.
benedict.review:
This was one of my favorite spots, this was the first brunch spot we visited with my bf together. 
This might be last time visiting this place. Many many times in the past, i had terrible service experience. 
That time we came, they said they run out of eggs benedict, only 1 portion left, cool, we ordered 3 others, and eventually last eggs benedict didnt arrive as well... Oh sorry, i thought u ordered this. 
Always a situation with seating. They have this list, but oh well, enforced it! When some ppl walk in and seat, they did nothing, just let them be there. That time when we arrived and asked for table, they give the table to the one who arrived after us, because they just feel like it. Disclosure, it happed today, at closing, when the place was half full, and it was raining, we were by the door, so yes, we asjed to seat, they like dont u want to seat at counter, why would we if so many tae are open?! Then they say wait, then a couple came in and they seated them.  
Occasionaly forgeting you ordered a milkshake. It's done, leaving, then i need to take my milk shake to go. Constantly making you wait forever to order. Just being transparent there. 
Then offer free 1 dish for apology, i dont need that, i came to have brunch, with line, wait and eat i want it to be in 1.5 hrs, never come at times when the line is super long. But it takes 2-2 hrs 15 mins, cuz they dont seat you, they seat someone else, they dont serve you or they forget the order! 
Havent visited here for a year, went back today, again dissapointment. I guess no more. The food isnt that good either, worth than before, so overrated.

excerpts:
Ask to add crispy bacon!
~ Huevos Rancheros: 2 eggs over-easy (I ask for over-medium) on a corn tortilla with jack cheese, ranchero sauce, salsa salad, black beans, sour cream & cilantro. 
~ EGGS BENEDICT: my favorite dish in the world:
Folks, I'm a Benedict FIEND.
A Connoisseur, if you will.
Hollandaise sauce is the make or break, and St. Francis has got it right.
benedict.author: Meredith S.
benedict.review:
Little bites of heaven...

I just tried the Hogcakes this time... Meredith, meet heaven. Heaven, meet Meredith's mouth. I'm super into savory cuisine, but tend to always want pancakes when I'm at a yummy breakfast diner. This is my PERFECT dish. You can choose from 2 or 3 cakes (2 is enough) and I asked for an over medium egg on the side. When it all came out, I threw the egg on top of the pancakes prior to diving in. The yolk was the perfect savory syrup for my savory cakes, which are filled with shredded cheese, chopped green onions, and... of course... CRISPY BACON!!! Yum-mah!

I'm a regular at St. Francis, so other delicious dishes that keep me coming back are: 
~ Chef's Mess: It's a whole scrambambled mess! Scrambled eggs with homefries, bacon, mushrooms, melted cheese, tomatoes, sour cream & green onions, your choice of toast on the side. 
~ Fried Egg Sandwich: 2 eggs over-hard (I ask for over-medium) & cheddar on grilled sourdough. Meat eater? Ask to add crispy bacon!
~ Huevos Rancheros: 2 eggs over-easy (I ask for over-medium) on a corn tortilla with jack cheese, ranchero sauce, salsa salad, black beans, sour cream & cilantro. 
~ EGGS BENEDICT: my favorite dish in the world: Folks, I'm a Benedict FIEND. A Connoisseur, if you will. Hollandaise sauce is the make or break, and St. Francis has got it right. Trust.   

I love their breakfast menu so much, I haven't even gotten to their lunches, dinners or ICE CREAM! Before it gets too cold out, I'll be headed there for a milkshake. I'll be sure to tell you all about it!

The menu is seemingly endless and full of all flavors you fancy and for any time of day, many vegetarian AND VEGAN options, sweet treats, and a display case full of candy for sale; makes you feel like a kid again! Adorable, old-time diner vibe, great atmosphere and outdoor seating. Weekend brunch time? Expect a short wait. The wait used to be pretty long, but they recently took over the small room next door to their main dining room which has improved the wait. It's a shorter now, most recently I had a 15 minute wait.

excerpts: The eggs benedict (weekends only) with avocado and tomato is amaze.
benedict.author: Priscilla M.
benedict.review:
One of my favorite places to go in the Mission. Great atmosphere and vibe. It def can get a bit hipster, but nice hipster, not annoying over-achiever Williamsburg hipster. 

With that being said, I love going early on the weekends. The eggs benedict (weekends only) with avocado and tomato is amaze.

excerpts: Along side fatty slabs of bacon, eggs benedict and breakfast burritos laced with hunks of pig rump, you'll find enough meals made with soyrizo and tofu scrambles to make even Sir Ben Kingsley proud he stopped in for breakfast.
benedict.author: Ruggy J.
benedict.review:
If you're a hipster kid living in San Francisco and you've yet to have brunch at St. Francis, you haven't lived.

While I think the term "hipster" is about as watered down as a buxom female in a Jay Z music video, I've accepted the fact that I dress like one and I enjoy the things in life that are consistent with a hipster counter culture. So sue me if I like Jon Stewart and a $2.00 PBR from time-to-time! If you can't get down on arguably the smartest man to ever grace the silver screen and affordable American lager, then spend your potential 401k money as you please. 

St. Francis gives greasy spoons a good name. They've got all the markings of a truck stop diner, but with features suitable for even the pickiest of bleeding heart liberals in the Mission. Along side fatty slabs of bacon, eggs benedict and breakfast burritos laced with hunks of pig rump, you'll find enough meals made with soyrizo and tofu scrambles to make even Sir Ben Kingsley proud he stopped in for breakfast. 

Get there early (and by early, I mean roughly 10:00am), as the place gets jam packed once 20-somethings in the 'hood stumble out of bed with a raging hangover from last night's Busch-a-thon on Valencia.

excerpts: The bacon and avo egg's benedict w holl sauce lunch special ($12, $14 if you want to add coffe
+ oj or champange) was dericious and probably one of the best i had.
it definitely hit the spot of my morning hunger and even had enough leftovers for next days bfast!
benedict.author: Shirley L.
benedict.review:
In a bright sunny place around the mission district, this is THE cafe that you want to dine at with in and out door seating. 

the scene: Atmosphere is busy but was seated right away on a busy Saturday morning. Right when I stepped in it felt like i reversed in a time machine and was giddy to see the cool oldies toys and memorabilia's  on the wall, now and later candy, and Mitchell's ice cream. tables all around and tall chairs at the bar area. Friendly hipster/fixie, band/art crowd, and cute waiters is a plus. 

the eats: breakfast buritto with a side of black beans and rice was healthy and a good portion size that wont get you too overstuffed. The bacon and avo egg's benedict w holl sauce lunch special ($12, $14 if you want to add coffe + oj or champange) was dericious and probably one of the best i had. it definitely hit the spot of my morning hunger and even had enough leftovers for next days bfast!

excerpts: Last time I we went we had the Griddle Combos, and Eggs Benedict.
benedict.author: Wel S.
benedict.review:
I give this place a 4, and I'll tell you why it didnt make the cut on 5.

My wife and I went here after eating dinner next door, and got a milk shake.  Awesome Dream Shake by the way (your "old school" straw will fall apart... as for a 2!).  However, our server (who was a brunette with a symmetrical bob hair cut) was rude and not that engaging, and looked at us weird after we ordered only ONE milk shake for the both of us.  We were being romantic you stooge hipster.  LOL

HOWEVER!!!  Don't let that fool you.  We went for breakfast and the service was AMAZING!!!  We had a server who took our order, and he was SO... SOOOOOO enthusiastic that it was like talking to one of my close friends!  I recommend them for breakfast on the weekends.  And don't sit outside (  cus that's where we sit!  pppppt!!!  :)p  )

Their menu is extensive.  What we ordered was AMAZING... I had veggie chorizo with poached egges and she had corn beef and hash with biscuits and the biscuits were AMAZING! Fresh O.J. too!!! Definitely, we are now local patrons of this place.  THANK YOU MORNING STAFF!!!  You guys were wonderful!!!  But to the girl, who seemed to be having a bad night... I'm sorry to have made you look like you just discovered poopie on your shoes.  Still... suck it up.

It could very well have been that at breakfast we were dressed a little more street/hipsterish, which in our case is more cholo mexicano style (since we are mexican americans - thanks hipsters for stealing our cultural style!!!) and for dessert we were a little more dressed up  (my wife is a fashion instructor at a local college).  Still, just because the mission is half Hipster, half Mexican community, doesn't give this PARTICULAR waitress the right to be an elitist or even act like one for that matter.  I've read some other reviews and she seems to be the odd one out.  It's unfortunate, but the service staff in the morning are worth one bad apple.

This is now our regular dining spot on Sunday mornings, and living only 4 blocks away helps.  Last time I we went we had the Griddle Combos, and Eggs Benedict.  BOTH WONDERFULLY DELICIOUS!!!

Note to staff and owner:  Remember, this is our neighborhood, respect that we are not tourists.  YOU NEVER KNOW!!!!!

excerpts: My fiance and I went to St. Francis one morning on the weekend to get some Eggs Benedict for her.
benedict.author: Josh C.
benedict.review:
My fiance and I went to St. Francis one morning on the weekend to get some Eggs Benedict for her. I am always up for a new restaurant, so I went along.

I got the Huevos Rancheros which are a personal favorite of mine. Loved them! They are delicious, the tortillas are yummy, the beans are very flavorful and the side salsa salad (try saying that 3 times fast) is good too, and I don't even like any salads.

I can also report that the EB are really good too. 

The only issues I have with this place is the wait (but where isn't there a wait on a Sunday brunch) and the cost. It is a little pricey for a brunch menu.

The servers are good, although sometimes I can't figure out which one is actually mine since they all help out. But that's a good thing.

Also, I grabbed a Reuben last time I was there. It was also quite tasty. Now the hard part will be deciding between the HR and the Reuben. :(

excerpts: and they have the Benedict special.
I got the egg benedict with bacon and avocado.
It was sooo good!
My friend got the green onion, bacon, and cheese pancake.
I thought it was gonna be weird
but I was wrong!
It's delicious!
I'm usually picky with Chai drinks cause I don't like them to be really spicy but their chai was perfect.
benedict.author: Perry S.
benedict.review:
I think this is one of my favorite places for breakfast. It's conveniently located across from Pop's. I like the atmosphere and the booths. The service was great and the food was yummy!!!

Come on the weekend and they have the Benedict special. I got the egg benedict with bacon and avocado. It was sooo good! My friend got the green onion, bacon, and cheese pancake. I thought it was gonna be weird but I was wrong! It's delicious! I'm usually picky with Chai drinks cause I don't like them to be really spicy but their chai was perfect. Spicy and sweet.

Oh, have I mentioned the boys are cute?

excerpts: The Benedict is really awesome.
I usually avoid anything with bacon as it's always burned almost past recognition.
There's also a lot of vegan options which I'm not interested in
but I'm sure many others will be.
I've come here for lunch and the sandwiches are good, and there are yummy sides like mac and cheese and soup and chilli - true diner style.
benedict.author: Jane F.
benedict.review:
This place has totally grown on me.
The first time I tried it, I was kind of, what's all the fuss?  A few more tries and it's deservedly on my list of regular places.  I instantly loved the decor - old fashion soda fountain with booths and a big long counter at which to consume your malted milkshake or your banana split.  Lots of hipsters of course, but lots of other people too.  It feels nice and homey, the staff are always nice if not always super attentive.
I usually go for brunch and it's always pretty damn good.  Weekend brunch specials excite me - The Benedict is really awesome.  I usually avoid anything with bacon as it's always burned almost past recognition.  There's also a lot of vegan options which I'm not interested in but I'm sure many others will be.  
I've come here for lunch and the sandwiches are good, and there are yummy sides like mac and cheese and soup and chilli - true diner style.  I've also come here late at night to sit at the counter and get a banana split and I'll admit it - I felt special.
Be prepared to wait on the weekends - they've recently taken over the space next door to deal with their high weekend volume but its not always in use.  Grab a cup of Philz on the way, write your name down, and enjoy the weekend bustle as you wait for a damn good brunch.

excerpts: While having all your diner favorites like eggs Benedict and piled high French toast, they also have all your favorite veg options for the most discerning of palates.
So, next time you're on 24th street, stop by St. Francis and enjoy one of their lovely milkshakes, but get there early or be prepared to wait, this place is always packed.
One last thing, this place is stocked with your old school favorites like garbage pale kids trading cards, bazooka gum, and cry babies!
Enjoy!
benedict.author: David M.
benedict.review: If you haven't enjoyed brunch at St. Francis, you're missing out.  This place is more than your neighborhood diner, it is an institution, similar to Tadich Grill and the House of Prime Rib, and maybe one of the oldest diners around.  And while diner offerings stir up memories of eggs, bacon, potatoes and white toast, St. Francis does that and more.  While having all your diner favorites like eggs Benedict and piled high French toast, they also have all your favorite veg options for the most discerning of palates.  So, next time you're on 24th street, stop by St. Francis and enjoy one of their lovely milkshakes, but get there early or be prepared to wait, this place is always packed.  One last thing, this place is stocked with your old school favorites like garbage pale kids trading cards, bazooka gum, and cry babies!  Enjoy!

excerpts: The eggs benedict is to die for, and the nebulous potato thing is a deliciously sloppy pile of indulgence.
By far my favorite brunch in the city.
benedict.author: A. M.
benedict.review:
Hopping with gloriously tattooed hipsters and soothing my Sunday morning hangovers with endless coffee while I wait patiently, lusting over the sexy lingerie in the window next door. I love this place. It has never failed me, not even once. 

The eggs benedict is to die for, and the nebulous potato thing is a deliciously sloppy pile of indulgence. By far my favorite brunch in the city.

excerpts: we used to come here about every weekend because, quite frankly, i love eggs benedict.
their eggs benedict is quite tasty.
but, be warned, it's only offered on weekends, it is not served after 3pm and it's one of the most pricey things on the menu.
once we discovered how to make delicious eggs benedict at home, however, i became less inclined to spend 11$ every sunday.
benedict.author: Lily B.
benedict.review:
we used to come here about every weekend because, quite frankly, i love eggs benedict. 

their eggs benedict is quite tasty.  but, be warned, it's only offered on weekends, it is not served after 3pm and it's one of the most pricey things on the menu.  once we discovered how to make delicious eggs benedict at home, however, i became less inclined to spend 11$ every sunday.  

we stopped in again last weekend and i opted for the lunch food over the breakfast food.  my tuna melt was indeed melt-in-your-mouth and the side of mac and cheese was perfectly cheesy and had a nice crispy layer of crunch on top.  not sure it's a reason to make this my weekly brunch stop, but it was satisfying enough to keep me coming back.

rather long lines on weekends at brunch time.  kind of scattered wait service (friendly .. but sometimes just confusing..).  they also apparently serve mitchell's ice cream so that's cool too.

excerpts: (eggs benedict but with avocado and bacon v. the ham--so good).
benedict.author: Julia W.
benedict.review:
Love it here. Get up early and hit it or stop complaining about breakfast/lunch lines in the Mission. 

St. Francis: 

HOME of Eggs Sandia (sp? should I buy a "y? is there an "h?" can't recall) (eggs benedict but with avocado and bacon v. the ham--so good). 

HOME of "Honey, for some reason, I woke up craving the St. Francis waffle" waffle.  

HOME of a truly nice Reuben that hits the spot. 

HOME of the Dreamsicle. An object deserving of its name.

And, sure, sure, HOME of Central Casting for Mission Hipsters. What are you doing there? Not beating but joining? Not waving but drowning in St. Francis' gravy??? It's. So. Good. Besides, you look cute so early in the morning! 

And the light in St. Francis bouncing off those beautiful booths is so lovely.  And the staff really is a group of good-natured people. You can feel that. Nice way to wake up.

excerpts: I had a version of their eggs benedict, though it had tomatoes and fried bacon instead of the ham.
Quite good actually.
I also had an order of the biscuits and gravy...pretty good, though the biscuits were super dry, dense and kinda powdery (even with the gravy, my mouth was drying up) and the gravy itself...
there was something in it that made it taste weird...not sweet or hot or anything...
but it was off...
like someone threw in a few too many ingredients.
benedict.author: Nicolas H.
benedict.review:
My friend tells me "Let's go to St. Francis for brunch." I'm wearing some sneakers and a hoody and some jeans, and I say "Uhm...I don't think that I am dressed appropriately for the St. Francis." He gives me this weird look, shrugs his shoulders and tells me to come along anyways.

To those that are new to San Francisco, you might want to remember to include the word "Fountain" at the end...because most of the people that I've mentioned "St. Francis" instantly think (like me) about the hotel. Oye...

Anyways, we went here for Sunday brunch and it was mondo tasty. I had a version of their eggs benedict, though it had tomatoes and fried bacon instead of the ham. Quite good actually. I also had an order of the biscuits and gravy...pretty good, though the biscuits were super dry, dense and kinda powdery (even with the gravy, my mouth was drying up) and the gravy itself...there was something in it that made it taste weird...not sweet or hot or anything...but it was off...like someone threw in a few too many ingredients. Hmm...

Otherwise, the food was tasty. So, now let me explain my "only 3 stars" rating. (1) We sat at the counter, because we could care less where we sat...we were hungry. So we were able to hear a few of the conversations from the employees. One was an arguement over who got to take the counter. After a few moments of watching the two girls arguing, I came very close to saying, "OYE! BITCHES! Shut up and just take our order and serve us! GEEZ! Why don't you just go up to every customer, look them in the eye and say 'I could care less if you eat or not today because I'm a bitch.'" Because that's kinda what it felt like. (2) I ordered coffee, because it's how I roll. I couldn't get anyone's attention to refill my coffee, and had about a cup and a half of it the entire time. Ask my friends...they will tell you that a cup and a half is not even near enough to satisfy me. Better yet, since I'm sitting at the counter, you would have thought that perhaps they might have been better at refills. Oye again...

While this has nothing to do with my rating, my friend and I were giggling about this...ok, it was more me giggling than anything...they still have the original neon signs above the door, and one of them says something about they make their own candy locally and fresh or some junk. But, the candy they sell is all Wonka stuff. I kept saying, "Where are the Umpa Loompas in the back making it?"

Oh...and another cool thing...they have Duran Duran trading cards from like...the 1800's...that's kinda cool...I think...

excerpts: Kate loves the eggs benedict, M loves the hash-- gravy and biscuits.
The service has gotten better.
THere is really nothing bad I could think of saying about this fabulous place.
THANK GOD
IT'S HERE!
benedict.author: Princess P.
benedict.review: Not sure why I haven't written a review of this great, great find.  It's been around for several years and keeps getting better.  I think that the old spagetti western folks own this place.  all I can tell you is that it ROCKS-- Our family goes here every chance we get.  my new favorite is the chirzo scramble-- vegan of course.  The portions are a little too big for me, but I always take left-overs.  Kate loves the eggs benedict, M loves the hash-- gravy and biscuits.  The service has gotten better.  THere is really nothing bad I could think of saying about this fabulous place.  THANK GOD IT'S HERE!

excerpts: My only complaint is that Friday mornings aren't considered "weekends," and therefore I can't order my favorite eggs benedict.
Overall a great place to eat- but at times (depending on the waiter)- service lacks.
benedict.author: Josie W.
benedict.review: My boyfriend and I usually go here twice a month on weekend mornings to get some breakfast when we are too lazy to cook.  Their breakfast is great, I've had their country breakfast with bacon (yum)- and my BF's all time favorite is Hector's Waffles (waffles with orange zest and pecans). My only complaint is that Friday mornings aren't considered "weekends," and therefore I can't order my favorite eggs benedict. Overall a great place to eat- but at times (depending on the waiter)- service lacks.

excerpts: The benedict is excellent and one of the few places in the city where you can get a really good waffle.
This place has been around since 1918, and has warmly improved over the years without losing the retro feel.
benedict.author: Paul S.
benedict.review: I used to come here for lunch about 12 years ago. I would get an egg salad sandwich and some ice cream, or maybe just ice cream. I even remember getting a cottage cheese/pineapple wedge salad once.  Since then the ownership has changed from the original family to some folks well versed in the restaurant business.  If you like those cheap and good brunch places in the mission, but have cast them out for the 30-40 minute wait, St. Francis Fountain is your answer. The benedict is excellent and one of the few places in the city where you can get a really good waffle. This place has been around since 1918, and has warmly improved over the years without losing the retro feel.

excerpts: I have tried real hard to find eggs benedict that can top theirs (or at least be comparable), with no succes so far.
They have the best hollandaise sauce period.
benedict.author: Laure b.
benedict.review:
I am NOT a hipster.
I have a thick french accent that definitively doesn't sound cool nor local.
Yet Saint Francis is and has been remaining my favorite place for brunch in 4 years now.

I've seen waiters come and go, but the food has stayed immutably good and satisfying. I have tried real hard to find eggs benedict that can top theirs (or at least be comparable), with no succes so far. They have the best hollandaise sauce period. And I make hollandaise, so I know what it should taste like!

If you want fancy (=not much on your plate) don't come here. That'll leave more banana bread for me! (Ha)
One disappointing dish (cause you have to complain huh?): the mac&cheese. But I read how people love it, must be done right then.

excerpts: I ordered the Eggs Valerie (avocado & fried tomato) with a side of sausage patty.
The hollandaise sauce was perfect, the pan-fried potatoes yummy.
valerie.author: Nifer K.
valerie.review:
I went here today for a Sunday morning brunch with friends.  I ordered the Eggs Valerie (avocado & fried tomato) with a side of sausage patty. The hollandaise sauce was perfect, the pan-fried potatoes yummy. The sausage was a wee bit over cooked, but tasted great (was it in-house made?). 

My veggie friends got the veggie chorizo scramble & some mac-n-cheese. I sampled it and was surprised that I would actually order the scramble on purpose despite being a meat eater. It was that good! Oh, and they make the man-n-cheese with onion--noms! So creamy too!

Service was great. The staff found a table for the 6 of us relatively quickly. The server was nice & accommodating for my friends' baby. Also a added bonus: as we were wrapping up our meal, they happened to have an extra meal that was made by mistake, as asked if we wanted to take it home for later. So nice!

Anyways, this was my first time here, but they certainly made a good impression.

excerpts: - Sandhya benedict (on the weekend specials list) -

the English muffin base is homemade, like a tender juicy savory pancake-crumpet
-
sandhya.author: Megan G.
sandhya.review:
This is our home away from home!

It surprised me to discover that the huevos rancheros here are out-of-this-world... like, best-of-the-Mission quality. Add jalapeños and avocado and you've got yourself an amazing share.

Other faves:
- Sandhya benedict (on the weekend specials list) - the English muffin base is homemade, like a tender juicy savory pancake-crumpet
- Thing your spuds... it is good
- Side salads are crunchy and delish. Caesar is dressing-heavy. Italian vin is awesome.
- Biscuits, banana bread (not too sweet), and toast... all yum.

Things I'd not necessarily recommend: the mac 'n' cheese, the veggie reuben, veggie chili (which is real sweet). None's a bad choice, just not as relatively special as the true stars here.

excerpts: The Eggs Sandhya (poached on an English muffin with hollandaise, avocado and bacon) is excellent every time (except one, when the bacon was overdone, but this was by far the exception to the rule of excellent food).
sandhya.author: N M.
sandhya.review:
Every time I've been here, I've been very impressed.  The Eggs Sandhya (poached on an English muffin with hollandaise, avocado and bacon) is excellent every time (except one, when the bacon was overdone, but this was by far the exception to the rule of excellent food).  Service is quick and not unfriendly.

I don't live in the Mission anymore, so regrettably I won't frequent St. Francis Fountain as often, but I tell my friends about it now.

Be sure to thing your spuds when you go!

excerpts: and I'm particularly fond of eggs Sandhya.
And the staff has been nothing but pleasant, even making nice with the young 'uns.
Maybe they are surly only to those of their own kind.
Alas, the time came when the wait to be seated became longer and longer, and finally, the death knell, the little yellow wait list pad, appeared.
So, we don't usually go anymore on week-ends, but we get the same food without the wait at other times of the week.
sandhya.author: Kara P.
sandhya.review: St. Francis has been around a long while though it's been through a few owners. Hubby has fond  memories of going there for ice cream when he was a wee lad, back in the halcyon days when if was safe for elementary school age kids in the Mission to walked to their neighborhood school on their own. I believe there was a slump in the 90's. I remember a local family ran it for a while, but it never took off, probably because the food was  ordinary and the atmosphere dead. When we heard there were new owners, we decided to try St. Francis again. When our happy little family of four walked in, I could immediately feel the hipness quotient drop several notches. And this was when you could still walk in at 11:30am and have your pick of tables. The food kept us coming back - ice cream mocha- yum! and I'm particularly fond of eggs Sandhya. And the staff has been nothing but pleasant, even making nice with the young 'uns. Maybe they are surly only to those of their own kind. Alas, the time came when the wait to be seated became longer and longer, and finally, the death knell, the little yellow wait list pad, appeared. So, we don't usually go anymore on week-ends, but we get the same food without the wait at other times of the week.

excerpts: The Poor Man Soup and the Country Breakfast are amazing.
the poor man.author: Marisol R.
the poor man.review: Local favorite. Great breakfast and brunch spot. The Poor Man Soup and the Country Breakfast are amazing.

excerpts: Loved their soup, "the Poor Man" that came with a biscuit in the middle of a nice broth souop.
The buttery biscuit complimented the hot steaming veggies nicely and turned into the perfect concoction for a cold San Franciscan summer night.
the poor man.author: Sue Y.
the poor man.review:
Came to this neighborhood on a late weekend  and most everything was closed for food (at 10pm, really?). 

Loved their soup, "the Poor Man" that came with a biscuit in the middle of a nice broth souop. The buttery biscuit complimented the hot steaming veggies nicely and turned into the perfect concoction for a cold San Franciscan summer night.

excerpts:
There are TWO items on the online menu called "The Poor Man" 

1) is chicken veggie soup with a biscuit

2) is veggie chili with corn bread
the poor man.author: Alexis W.
the poor man.review:
This review is for the take-out only. Because we thought that by calling our order in, we would avoid the clustercluck that is St.F.F. 

First: There is an issue with the menu here kids. There are TWO items on the online menu called "The Poor Man" 

1) is chicken veggie soup with a biscuit

2) is veggie chili with corn bread

Why do you do this St. Francis Fountain? Why do you have two completely different food items called the same exact thing? So my co-worker, in her infinite wisdom (adhering to the "anti-stupidity clause") ordered me a "chili with corn bread." She did NOT call it the "Poor Man" she literally said "chili with corn bread."

Upon their return to the office, what do I have? Chicken soup with a biscuit. Not the nommy fried delicious cornbread. I am saddened because we did everything in our immediate power short of opening up the containers to ensure that we had "chili with cornbread". 

I'd also like to point out that while I am not vegetarian, this could have posed a problem for someone that was. Pretty insensitive guys. I don't know who you have taking your phone orders and you probably won't care that you didn't get my order right. I'm just sad I'm not eating chili. But I thwarted your system and got 1/2 my co-worker's cornbread cause she felt bad. So now you have also deprived someone of 1/2 their cornbread out of sheer guilt. 

The soup is pretty good. The biscuit is pretty damn good. The cornbread is lovely. Your online order taking skills to the execution of said order? Needs some work to stop blowing.

excerpts: I ended up getting the Poor Man Soup.
I have a bit of a cold
so it hit the spot.
There was a lot of chicken meat and a moderate amount of veggies.
The biscuit was pretty much the highlight of soup.
It was comforting and exactly what I needed.
Beware of the cilantro though.
There was lots of it.
the poor man.author: Donna K.
the poor man.review:
I went here for lunch with a coworker. The place is really clean and open. It wasn't too busy, but it was a late lunch (4-ish). We sat at the counter, which was charming. I like how they set the menus and their little container of paper straws (which had red candycane stripes!) on the counter. They had a lot of cute touches, but the atmosphere was a little lacking. I am sure that it was because it was slow when we came in. 

The service was quick and food comes out at a moderate pace. I ended up getting the Poor Man Soup. I have a bit of a cold so it hit the spot. There was a lot of chicken meat and a moderate amount of veggies. The biscuit was pretty much the highlight of soup. It was comforting and exactly what I needed. Beware of the cilantro though. There was lots of it. So if you aren't into that I wouldn't get it.

I really want to try the Nebulous Potato Thing and one of their milkshakes next time!

excerpts: We ordered the side platter and a grilled cheese to share.
the side platter.author: Morgan B.
the side platter.review:
I've been wanting to come here for a while. I came with my best friend at about 7:15 on a Thursday night, and the place was practically empty.

The menu looked promising, full of delicious American food with lots of vegetarian options.

We ordered the side platter and a grilled cheese to share. I also ordered a chocolate milkshake.

Food was pretty good. Not incredible, but no major complaints. Milkshake was awesome if not a little grainy. Service was subpar, we were not asked if everything was okay with our meal until we were finished with it.

The place is full of flies, which isn't the biggest issue but when one landed in my friend's water we got kind of grossed out.

I probably won't come back here as a special trip, but perhaps if I'm in the neighborhood and having a milkshake craving, maybe.

excerpts: I tried the side platter which was a cup of chilli, a garden salad, and a cup of Mac n cheese, its a good deal.
The Mac n cheese was really good.
Then I tried what tasted like a chocolate soda, delicious!!
I forgot what is was called
but it was so good
, it was their basic ice cream soda..
the side platter.author: S F.
the side platter.review:
The feel of the place is cool, they have super old school candy for sale, mostly just to have.. not to eat, it's that old school. The customer service that night was not too great though. The servers were very inattentive, but friendly at the same time. 

The food was not anything special for a diner. I tried the side platter which was a cup of chilli, a garden salad, and a cup of Mac n cheese, its a good deal. The Mac n cheese was really good. Then I tried what tasted like a chocolate soda, delicious!! I forgot what is was called but it was so good, it was their basic ice cream soda.. Must try!

The chocolate ice cream soda is what really won me over and made it possible to give them 4 stars.

excerpts: Now on to my GF order she had the side platter, the salad was fine on the top but on the bottom the lettuce was not fresh and they forgot our dressing, the mac n cheese had onions in it(?)
She's allergic to onions.
She orders mac n cheese at alot of places and we've never seen it w/onions.
The chili beans could have been better.
Bottom line if your going to charge outrageous prices (which I don't mind paying) at least have good food and generous portions!
the side platter.author: chris c.
the side platter.review:
I was so upset that I got off my butt and went out of my way to write this review!   By the way this order was to go!
Well let's start with the very very small $4.50 milk shake, that's half the size of every other place I've ever ordered a milk shake! Their straws don't work, the cup was about as big as my balled up fist, I have pics.  I've also tasted better! Now on to the burger, well I ordered a bacon cheese burger that came out to about $12 which is a little high for a burger that has old reddish lettuce ends. Now on to my GF order she had the side platter, the salad was fine on the top but on the bottom the lettuce was not fresh and they forgot our dressing, the mac n cheese had onions in it(?) She's allergic to onions. She orders mac n cheese at alot of places and we've never seen it w/onions. The chili beans could have been better. Bottom line if your going to charge outrageous prices (which I don't mind paying) at least have good food and generous portions!

excerpts: I've had the side platter with soup, mac and cheese, and salad and have also had the tofu scramble and a banana milkshake.
The food was great
BUT the service is lacking.
The staff is unhelpful and act like you should be honored to be at their cool restaurant.
But for good food I can get over bad service sometimes.
the side platter.author: Samantha C.
the side platter.review: The food here was great. I've had the side platter with soup, mac and cheese, and salad and have also had the tofu scramble and a banana milkshake. The food was great BUT the service is lacking. The staff is unhelpful and act like you should be honored to be at their cool restaurant. But for good food I can get over bad service sometimes.

excerpts: We got the Side Platter (bowl of mac & cheese, cup of chili, and caesar salad), the Veggie Mess, and the corn bread.

The Veggie Mess should be called Hangover Heaven since it is a heavy pile of starchy potato and faux meat covered in gooey cheese heaped on a plate - complete bliss when you have an insatiable appetite.
Mac and cheese and corn bread were solid and the caesar was a nice complement to the heavier plates.
The only thing on the menu I've had and didn't love was the S.F. Rueben, but then again a veggie Reuben is a hard thing to pull off unless you're Native Foods.
Food coma is imminent so enjoy those cups of Joe the servers pour so generously.
the side platter.author: Carrie G.
the side platter.review: Delicious vegetarian options, generous portions, and the relaxed atmosphere were all the reasons we made this our first meal back after being away for a week in the desert. Best decision ever! The hearty comfort food here is a good remedy to placate any hungry beast, and my grumbling belly at the time was a tough contender. It's always so hard to decide on just one thing here, so don't try and instead bring a friend or two and share. We got the Side Platter (bowl of mac & cheese, cup of chili, and caesar salad), the Veggie Mess, and the corn bread. The vegetarian chili was especially delicious since it was on the lighter and healthier side being a three bean chili without fake meat. The chili is NOT another lackluster attempt in the futile fight to make 'meatless' taste 'meaty', so give it a try if you haven't already. The Veggie Mess should be called Hangover Heaven since it is a heavy pile of starchy potato and faux meat covered in gooey cheese heaped on a plate - complete bliss when you have an insatiable appetite. Mac and cheese and corn bread were solid and the caesar was a nice complement to the heavier plates. The only thing on the menu I've had and didn't love was the S.F. Rueben, but then again a veggie Reuben is a hard thing to pull off unless you're Native Foods. Food coma is imminent so enjoy those cups of Joe the servers pour so generously.

excerpts: The side platter was invented for me.
I love lots of items and usually end up ordering too much.
the side platter.author: Jill N.
the side platter.review:
I am so lucky that this place its so close to my house.  Otherwise I may have never discovered it and by default neither would any of my friends.

The chocolate milkshake will cure ANYTHING that may be wrong with you.  

Breakfast is worth the wait, coffee is really good, they do eggs right and try the waffle!

The side platter was invented for me.  I love lots of items and usually end up ordering too much.  But with this I get soup, salad and mac and cheese.  

I want to go there right now but they are sadly closed at this hour.

Totally recommended.

excerpts: I had the side platter with yummy chili, just spicy enough, Caesar salad and mac and cheese plus cornbread.
It was very filling and delicious.
the side platter.author: Meg L.
the side platter.review: My boyfriend and I had lunch here on Sunday and it was fabulous. I had the side platter with yummy chili, just spicy enough, Caesar salad and mac and cheese plus cornbread. It was very filling and delicious. My bf loved his dish as well, the chefs mess with biscuits (which he swooned over) The shakes were good as well, very thick although a bit expensive ($5 for the large) its a lot of shake. We will definitely be coming back.

excerpts: I like my spuds extra crispy, and they delivered.
The spuds weren't the hash brown type of spuds.
These were more like
country fried potatoes that were spiced and had onions in them.
Very, very goodd.
Le bf "thinged" his spuds, and that was a good call.
I regret not "thinging" my spuds.
When you "thing" spuds, they add cheese, scallion, salsa, and sour cream on top.
The biscuits and gravy were really good, although Pork Store Cafe's are still better.
He got his eggs poached and they were poached perfectly.
spuds.author: Carolyn Z.
spuds.review:
Came here on a Saturday morning around 9:15. Le bf and I were promptly seated in a booth. 

We always study the menu before going to a place, and this time was no different. We read on Yelp that the pancakes were good so we knew we had to get them. Le bf also enjoys his biscuits and gravy so we knew we needed to get those as well. I was contemplating a milkshake the night before we went, but decided against it once we were there.

The pancakes were really good. Would highly recommend them. I got mine as part of the pancakes+2 eggs+spuds. I like my spuds extra crispy, and they delivered. The spuds weren't the hash brown type of spuds. These were more like country fried potatoes that were spiced and had onions in them. Very, very goodd. Le bf "thinged" his spuds, and that was a good call. I regret not "thinging" my spuds. When you "thing" spuds, they add cheese, scallion, salsa, and sour cream on top. The biscuits and gravy were really good, although Pork Store Cafe's are still better. He got his eggs poached and they were poached perfectly. Total price was under $30 before tip which is great for SF. 

This place has a lot of character and the staff were super nice and provided excellent service. We will be back. Next time, I will get my milkshake.

excerpts: Pile of baked spuds, melted cheese, fresh salsa, sour cream (I subbed guac though), and chopped green onion.
$5.50 for a small; $7.50 for a large.
Add an egg for $2.
Worth it.
spuds.author: Joanna L.
spuds.review:
'Nebulous Potato Thing' is delicious! Pile of baked spuds, melted cheese, fresh salsa, sour cream (I subbed guac though), and chopped green onion. $5.50 for a small; $7.50 for a large. Add an egg for $2. Worth it. All the flavors blend together nicely. 

St. Francis Fountain is an old school diner. You'll get seated quicker if you choose the counter or outdoor option. Lots of good breakfast options here, with an unique, home-comfort twist.

excerpts: The Vegan Thing instead ("pile of spuds with vegan jack cheese, fresh salsa, guacamole, and green onions") with added vegan chorizo instead of cheese.
Great tip!
It was everything a great breakfast should be: starchy, spicy, sweet and savory.
The potatoes were cooked so that one side was a little well done crunchy (but not burnt).
I thought that really elevated the dish.
Even the guac had a good flavor; not sure if it is housemade, but it sure tasted like it was.
The chorizo was mighty spicy and set my mouth on fire...
I loved every second of it.
spuds.author: Brandi W.
spuds.review:
Now I see what all the hype is about... this place is top-notch! 

I'm surprised that I have never come here, as I've had it on my list of bookmarks for quite some time, and so many of my friends are fans. I guess I'm just never in that neighborhood, so a few of us East Bay/ Contra Costa County folks hopped in a car and drove to the city specifically to grab their grub.

Surprisingly, we were able to get seated right away. I think we must have just beat the morning rush, since we did leave Walnut Creek at around 10:30 in the morning. A quick drive over the bridge, and we made it to our destination. 

First impression: cute, old-school diner atmosphere. Cozy wooden booths. Hustling and bustling, the place packed full of customers, which is usually a good sign. 

Their coffee is delicious, a mild and tasty brew, and they have soy milk for your dairy-free needs. This started off our meal on a high note, as we ordered 4 coffees and scanned the menu, our little vegan hearts pounding with excitement. 


There are plentiful vegan and vegetarian options for both breakfast and lunch, so we took our time reading over the menu. Everything looked and tasted spectacular!!! We ooh'ed and ahh'ed when the food was brought over, as our dishes were quite aesthetically appealing, especially for diner food.  

Rosanne P. opted for the Devil's Burger (actually not a burger, but thinly sliced seitan), Richard A. got the Vegan Breakfast Burrito, and Laura C. ordered a killer tofu scramble with spinach and mushrooms. 

I was going to get the Vegan Rancheros, but they didn't have vegan cheese, so the waitress suggested getting The Vegan Thing instead ("pile of spuds with vegan jack cheese, fresh salsa, guacamole, and green onions") with added vegan chorizo instead of cheese. Great tip! It was everything a great breakfast should be: starchy, spicy, sweet and savory. The potatoes were cooked so that one side was a little well done crunchy (but not burnt). I thought that really elevated the dish. Even the guac had a good flavor; not sure if it is housemade, but it sure tasted like it was. The chorizo was mighty spicy and set my mouth on fire... I loved every second of it. It hurt so good! 

I tried a bite of Rosie's sandwich... that seitan is phenomenal! It almost had a roast beef, pastrami-esque texture and flavor, without being as overpoweringly salty as its meaty counterpart.
