I've never seen seitan sliced so thin. I would love to order this on my next visit, as it comes with a heaping side of fries if you so choose. It looks fantastic, especially when you choose to add grilled onions and avocado on top. 

We each must have had at least 2-3 cups of coffee, as they were quick to come by with a fresh pot to give us a warm-up. I really appreciated that! The staff is excellent, very attentive and well-mannered, especially for a Sunday morning (when I know my demeanor can be a little bit cranky). Diane was our main waitress, and she seemed quite knowledgeable about the menu. I hope we weren't bothering her with our demands (more soy milk, please/ a side of jam for my toast, thank you). 

Would I return? Abso-friggin-lutely! This is probably my new favorite brunch joint in all of San Francisco. I left there feeling very full and yet energized, ready to take on the world!...  or at least Rainbow Grocery right down the street.

excerpts: Spuds?
Check.
Bacon?
Check again.
Yes, if you are a bacon lover, you'll love the ample amount of Bacon in the Chef's Mess.
spuds.author: Nancy C.
spuds.review:
St. Francis Fountain is good for those days when you: (1) want a low-key brunch, (2) are feeling lazy and don't feel like eating more than one meal that day, and (3) are channeling your 5-year-old self and want an ice cream soda.  

Sometimes I wake up on a Sunday feeling like 1, 2, and 3.  So I drag myself out of bed, drag my brunch partner-in-crime with me, and go to St. Francis Fountain. As I sip happily on my ice cream soda, along comes the Chef's Mess, my favorite item on the menu.  While the brunch partner-in-crime is partial to the eggs benedict (and its variations), I love the Chef's Mess.  It has everything  delicious in it, all mixed together.

Bacon? Check.  Mushrooms? Check. Spuds? Check.  Bacon? Check again.  Yes, if you are a bacon lover, you'll love the ample amount of Bacon in the Chef's Mess.  Don't forget it also comes with cheese, sour cream, and green onion.  

The best part about something so delicious is that there's so much of it that you can make two meals out of it if you want. Nom and nom.

excerpts: The server was nice enough to let us substitute our spuds/bread for a bowl of fresh fruit!
It was a generous portion as well!
The food was decent
but I think I'd like to try their spuds and gluten-filled meals the next time I come back!
spuds.author: Michelle L.
spuds.review:
The bf and I went to St Francis Fountain on Sat for brunch and it was a full house. There was a small crowd outside but the wait wasn't too bad. They started seating next door which made the waiting period go by even faster! Sadly- I think it took longer for a server to come take our order than it did waiting for a table.. :/ 

We're back on trying to eat "healthy" so we both created our own scrambles and said no toast and no potatoes. Boo dieting! BUT! We added vegetarian chorizo to make it not so healthy and that was deadly! The server was nice enough to let us substitute our spuds/bread for a bowl of fresh fruit! It was a generous portion as well! The food was decent but I think I'd like to try their spuds and gluten-filled meals the next time I come back!

excerpts: The spuds were incredibly tasty, I could've easily had a second plate.
We were seated quickly, had great service from their staff as well, and the food came out fast.
Loved the retro diner atmosphere and location.
Will definitely return when in the area.
spuds.author: Olga G.
spuds.review: Awesome breakfast food! I am already looking forward to going back bc I had such a hard time choosing what to get. The spuds were incredibly tasty, I could've easily had a second plate. We were seated quickly, had great service from their staff as well, and the food came out fast. Loved the retro diner atmosphere and location. Will definitely return when in the area.

excerpts: Massive plates of spuds and melted cheese and eggs...
spuds.author: Sol C.
spuds.review:
St. Francis Fountain is a classic, old-fashioned diner. The ambience was great - very low key with big booths and lots of space to sit at the counter. The servers were all very friendly and relaxed. 

The food was overwhelming in an awesome way. Massive plates of spuds and melted cheese and eggs... Everything tasted delicious - we tried both the nebulous potato thing (even the small is huge so no need to order the large, although I recommend adding on some over easy eggs!) and the veggie mess (vegan chorizo is seriously tasty and I'm not even a vegetarian).

Another awesome touch was the fantastic egg cream in an ice cream sundae glass. We loved the old school feel! Great breakfast!

excerpts: Thing your spuds...

it is good
- Side salads are crunchy and delish.
Caesar is dressing-heavy.
Italian vin is awesome.
spuds.author: Megan G.
spuds.review:
This is our home away from home!

It surprised me to discover that the huevos rancheros here are out-of-this-world... like, best-of-the-Mission quality. Add jalapeños and avocado and you've got yourself an amazing share.

Other faves:
- Sandhya benedict (on the weekend specials list) - the English muffin base is homemade, like a tender juicy savory pancake-crumpet
- Thing your spuds... it is good
- Side salads are crunchy and delish. Caesar is dressing-heavy. Italian vin is awesome.
- Biscuits, banana bread (not too sweet), and toast... all yum.

Things I'd not necessarily recommend: the mac 'n' cheese, the veggie reuben, veggie chili (which is real sweet). None's a bad choice, just not as relatively special as the true stars here.

excerpts: Do not underestimate a small "pile of spuds".
spuds.author: Jason B.
spuds.review:
Good thing going.

Do not underestimate a small "pile of spuds". Part of the Vegan Thing specialty topped with vegan cheese, salsa, guacamole and onions. Added a side of egg whites.

Perhaps they made a large instead because a massive mound of food was delivered. And consumed because each and every bite was outstanding.

Really didn't have room for a vegan chorizo hash side but couldn't say no to the rich delicious flavor.

Definitely didn't have room for a parfait but couldn't stop devouring sweet local granola, bananas, pineapple, strawberries, apples and what tasted like nonfat plain yogurt.

Also good was the enthusiastic and infectious service. And we were equally happy to be eating outside on a warm February Saturday. Wait was a short 15min.

Reasonable $20/person included my dining companion's much enjoyed dish, orange juice, coffee and being so full we didn't need lunch.

More than good. Five star great.

excerpts: Comes with spuds and toast and you're done til dinner.
spuds.author: Leigh W.
spuds.review:
It's a long walk from the 24th street BART station but it's well worth it for these yummy breakfasts. Get there early to avoid the lines (there's a bench outside if you don't) and indulge in hefty portions for bargain prices. My fave? The scramble with green onions, cheddar and bacon. Comes with spuds and toast and you're done til dinner.

Oh, and super veggie/vegan friendly!

excerpts: An amazing fluffy omelette and dressed spuds are the way to go.
spuds.author: Sabah R.
spuds.review: What a great breakfast joint! Being new to the Bay Area, I have been craving a greasy spoon dinner that takes me back home. Oh man did this place exceed expectations. An amazing fluffy omelette and dressed spuds are the way to go.

excerpts: Coupled with a generous portion of tasty spuds along with a few slices of toast, this is a huge shareable dish.
spuds.author: John B.
spuds.review:
While Yelp searching places in the area for a good Vegan breakfast/brunch I found there are several quality options around here. St. Francis Fountain just happened to be the pick of the day. And what a good choice it was...

Old school 50's style dining brought to you by Mission Hipsters. I had read reviews that stated the servers here are aloof or dirty. I found the opposite to be true for the most part. Our coffee and water never got empty without being refilled. The food came out to the table lightning quick as well. 

The only mishap was when our waitress was a bit... ok, very confused while taking our order. Vegan Blueberry Pancakes were repeated back to us twice with "Buttermilk Pancakes". So once that confusion was solved our order came out extremely fast to the point were we thought it wasn't ours. So what did we get instead of Vegan Blueberry Pancakes? That's right, a Vegan Breakfast Burrito... Huh? It turned out to be a good thing since they asked if we would like to keep the burrito while they would whip up the correct pancake order. Free food? Score!

The Tofu Scramble with Ranchero was delicious even though it appeared to be undercooked and not very scrambled. Since I don't eat with my eyes I dove into the flavors of all the Ranchero sauce mixed with the tofu, mushrooms and green onions. One of the better tasting scrambles I've had in awhile. Coupled with a generous portion of tasty spuds along with a few slices of toast, this is a huge shareable dish.  

Those Vegan Blueberry Pancakes that took some haggling to get weren't too bad. I like blueberries as much as anyone but I think they went a little buck wild with the blueberry scooper. The entire center was blueberries. They were good, not great. I would probably get one of the other Vegan options next time.

That free Vegan Breakfast Burrito plate was something I would consider ordering next visit. The black beans on the side had a bit of a chili kick to them. Very tasty. The filling was consisted mostly of a Vegan jack cheese. Not sure what they use but it was a change of pace from the usual burrito. 

A pretty cool atmosphere along with all the great Vegan options makes this a place you should check out at least once to see if it's for you.

excerpts: I ordered a side of vegan sausage and the chef masterfully mixed the spuds and sausage together, it was so very tasty, tasty, tasty.
I'm so happy I have another place to go to that is vegan friendly.
Plus, their trading card collection is BONKERS.
spuds.author: Dee J.
spuds.review:
During my last visit to San Francisco I ate here TWICE.  Why you ask?  Because the Vegan Thing was SO GOOD.   It took a while for me to go here because I heard that the lines were usually stupid long, but both visits proved different.  We were seated almost immediately by opting to sit at the counter.  I ordered a side of vegan sausage and the chef masterfully mixed the spuds and sausage together, it was so very tasty, tasty, tasty.  I'm so happy I have another place to go to that is vegan friendly. 
Plus, their trading card collection is BONKERS.

excerpts: The Veggie Mess has the best of all worlds: spuds, chorizo, gooey cheeses.
Ask for jalapeños to get that extra kick!
spuds.author: Alison R.
spuds.review:
Perfect Sunday hangover diner cure for carnivores with veggie/vegan friends!

The Veggie Mess has the best of all worlds: spuds, chorizo, gooey cheeses. Ask for jalapeños to get that extra kick! Order is large enough for 2 ppl or an extra kick in' hangover.

For the bread options, choose cornbread over banana bread... Unless you have a sweet tooth. Nice n toasty, Thick like a brick! 

Espresso milkshake is perfectly executed - vanilla loves cafe. Order the large. Just when you thought the fun was over, the shaker has a whole extra glass of frothy goodness waiting for ya!

excerpts: But if you go, you MUST THING YOUR SPUDS, it just makes everything even more delicious.
There is usually a wait on weekends, but it's totally worth it.
I've also come here on evenings and had a milkshake and those are quite delicious as well.
Very fun, diner, hipster vibe.
Not the place to go to impress your parents or your boss, but it's a favorite place for friends on the weekend.
spuds.author: Sarah D.
spuds.review: Hands down my favorite brunch place in San Francisco. Though it's not my partner's favorite---but I'm a lot more down to earth and more food-obsessed. It's total diner food---excellent menu creations of potatoes, cheese, bacon, and sour cream. Big portions. I usually can't decide between the Chef's Mess and the Nebulous Potato Thing. But if you go, you MUST THING YOUR SPUDS, it just makes everything even more delicious. There is usually a wait on weekends, but it's totally worth it. I've also come here on evenings and had a milkshake and those are quite delicious as well. Very fun, diner, hipster vibe. Not the place to go to impress your parents or your boss, but it's a favorite place for friends on the weekend.

excerpts: I was with ordered the breakfast special with "thinged" spuds and loved their meals
spuds.author: Raina D.
spuds.review: The perfect place for a hangover curing brunch/lunch. The menu has so many options from the standard breakfast fate to their more creative options (many of which are vegan/vegetarian friendly).  Everyone in the group I was with ordered the breakfast special with "thinged" spuds and loved their meals (no one was able to finish completely) and I was in a mid-day crisis where I couldnt decide between breakfast or lunch, so I ordered the Baltimore (BLT with Avocado, but they forgot the avocado and brought a side out after the order) and split the pancakes (which were pretty good but nothing amazing).  The milkshakes were what pushed this from a 3 to a 4 star review.  So many options & I ordered the gelato milkshake with strawberry that had soooo many delicious chunks (ha) and was the perfect ending to a great Sunday morning brunch.

excerpts: Some of the best breakfast spuds in the city.
I judge a good breakfast spot by their potatoes.

:)
Vegan options are awesome.
The people who work here are normal and laid back - makes dining out not awkward.
Come during off times cause this place gets slammed.
All in all, my fiance and I love coming here for a no frills, good cheap eats.
spuds.author: S. M.
spuds.review:
Yum. Everything I've had here is delicious. Some of the best breakfast spuds in the city. I judge a good breakfast spot by their potatoes. :)
Vegan options are awesome. The people who work here are normal and laid back - makes dining out not awkward. 
Come during off times cause this place gets slammed. All in all, my fiance and I love coming here for a no frills, good cheap eats.

excerpts: The spuds?
nomnomnom)
However the service is TERRIBLE.
To qualify, I worked in restaurants for years.
I am very forgiving when you're slammed, when things go wrong, etc but it also means I'm fairly unforgiving when you ignore your customers or cop attitude.
The last time I was there was a Saturday morning.
It wasn't that crowded.
At all.
It almost seemed like the staff outnumbered the customers.
There were two of us and we sat at the counter.
A very harried waitress took our drink order and when I asked for soy for my coffee she pushed the almost empty pitcher from the last customer over to me.
(are you f*cking KIDDING me).
We waited to order.
And waited.
And waited.
The staff was bustling around, doing sidework, and talking amongst themselves.
Looking busy doing anything OTHER than taking our order.
I asked someone if we could order, without making eye contact
I got just a blase "You have to order with a server.
He didn't tell anyone.
We waited.
And waited.
And asked another staff member working the counter.
Oh, this isn't my section
but I guess I can take your order.
Thank you so much for inconveniencing yourself by DOING YOUR JOB.
Turns out it was OUR fault for our waitress ignoring us, as we were informed by this server, because we put the menu away.
(yeah, I'm rolling my eyes too)
We got the food.
It was good.
She checked in.
spuds.author: Jacqueline M.
spuds.review:
I'm going to keep this brief. I really REALLY want to love St Francis fountain because it's an old timey soda fountain with pretty decent breakfast food. (Sourdough french toast? The spuds? nomnomnom)
However the service is TERRIBLE.
To qualify, I worked in restaurants for years. I am very forgiving when you're slammed, when things go wrong, etc but it also means I'm fairly unforgiving when you ignore your customers or cop attitude.
The last time I was there was a Saturday morning. It wasn't that crowded. At all. It almost seemed like the staff outnumbered the customers. There were two of us and we sat at the counter. A very harried waitress took our drink order and when I asked for soy for my coffee she pushed the almost empty pitcher from the last customer over to me. (are you f*cking KIDDING me).
We waited to order.
And waited.
And waited.
The staff was bustling around, doing sidework, and talking amongst themselves. Looking busy doing anything OTHER than taking our order.
I asked someone if we could order, without making eye contact I got just a blase "You have to order with a server." 
He didn't tell anyone.
We waited.
And waited.
And asked another staff member working the counter. 
"Oh, this isn't my section but I guess I can take your order."
Thank you so much for inconveniencing yourself by DOING YOUR JOB.
Turns out it was OUR fault for our waitress ignoring us, as we were informed by this server, because we put the menu away. (yeah, I'm rolling my eyes too)
We got the food. It was good. She checked in. Hooray.

I do want to say that this waitress was busting her butt, as she usually does, while most of the other stuff was doing god knows what. However we still got ignored and weren't able to order for almost 20min.

I've been there, serving is rough, especially when hung over, but it feels like the staff that morning thought they were god's gift to the breakfast crowd.
I won't be going back until service improves by hiring servers who actually want to take my money.

(I said I'd keep this brief. Womp womp.)

excerpts: The mimosas are crazy cheap and my favorite thing is the "nebulous pile of spuds" which is basically a giant pile of breakfast potatoes with peppers, cheese, onions, sour cream, tomatoes, etc.
and you can add an egg for a dollar.
It's nothing fancy, but it's the perfect hangover brunch and definitely a place I'd recommend.
spuds.author: Will A.
spuds.review:
Really great low-key brunch place. I've been twice and once we were seated right away, another time we had to wait about 40 minutes-- not sure why there was a huge difference between the two times, but it was worth it the second time. 

The mimosas are crazy cheap and my favorite thing is the "nebulous pile of spuds" which is basically a giant pile of breakfast potatoes with peppers, cheese, onions, sour cream, tomatoes, etc. and you can add an egg for a dollar. It's nothing fancy, but it's the perfect hangover brunch and definitely a place I'd recommend.

excerpts: if i eat enough of yout vegan spuds and tofu scrambles and seitan
spuds.author: Jen I.
spuds.review:
oh st. francis, the last time i had set foot inside of you, you did not have outdoor seating and didn't have 1/2 the vegan options you have now.

oh, and i was also an omnivore.

this visit, i had a hard time making up my mind over what to get since you grew your vegan menu since you somehow knew i wanted to fatten up for the winter.  if i eat enough of yout vegan spuds and tofu scrambles and seitan + vegan burger madness i wouldn't need to wear a coat for the next couple of months.

hello cute waitress in the red skirt with short blond hair, thank you for being patient as we asked your opinion on the different veg friendly items on the menu.

did i mention you were cute and ncie?  yes.  thank you.  i would marry you if it meant free vanilla soy shakes for life,  yes, the dr. can marry you too.  

i ended up with a tofu scramble dressed with spinach, mushrooms and peanut sauce and proceeded to inhale all of it on top of my rye toast.  

i will return for your seitan sandwich.  and your vegan thing.  and your vegan sausage.  and your vegan burger with seitan.  and your undying love.

excerpts: I ordered the fried egg sandwhich with no cheese and a side of home-fries (or "spuds") which were both awesome.
My S.O. had the Chef's Mess, which I gladly helped him finish!
Glass of O.J. was fresh-queezed but on the tiny side.
Shakes looked good
(I was too full to have one), but will definitely be back to have one!
Bill came to $28 for two with tax and tip.
spuds.author: Stacey H.
spuds.review:
The short:
-Great food and atmosphere
-Shakes are made with Mitchell's
-Fairly cheap and breakfast all day!

The long:
Got here on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm and got sat immediately at the counter.  I ordered the fried egg sandwhich with no cheese and a side of home-fries (or "spuds") which were both awesome.  My S.O. had the Chef's Mess, which I gladly helped him finish!  Glass of O.J. was fresh-queezed but on the tiny side.  Shakes looked good (I was too full to have one), but will definitely be back to have one!  Bill came to $28 for two with tax and tip.

excerpts: Not to mention, I just discovered that I can sub my "thing my spuds" for some vegetarian chili cheese fries, and this makes me happy.
spuds.author: Melissa M.
spuds.review:
This has become my default breakfast spot for the past several weekends.  The wait isn't ridiculously long, there's a nice covered, outdoor seating area for when the sun is shining, and the tofu scrambles are to die for.  Not to mention, I just discovered that I can sub my "thing my spuds" for some vegetarian chili cheese fries, and this makes me happy.

If that's not enough to keep me coming back, then the Three's Company and Alf collectors cards will!!

excerpts: I had the veggie ruben with a side of mac and cheese, and I also tried the side of spuds.
The spuds were more flavorful than the mac and cheese and much better.
spuds.author: Angela T.
spuds.review:
St. Francis Fountain has the charm of an old school diner, the booth seats and counter does at least. They have cool retro candy too. As some of the other reviews have mentioned, this place is full of hipsters. I don't have an issue with hipster but it does disrupt the old school diner vibe.

The food here is good fatty diner food, lots of veggie options too. I had the veggie ruben with a side of mac and cheese, and I also tried the side of spuds. The spuds were more flavorful than the mac and cheese and much better. Nice greasy diner food, don't go if you're in a healthy mood. 

A couple things didn't make me happy, we ordered 2 plates and a coffee for 3 people and they still charged us 1.50 to split, unless they charged us the 1.50 for something else that they didn't feel like telling us about. Service was a bit slow, didn't get the refill on my water, which makes me sad because I was really thirsty.

excerpts: But they have an option to "thing" your spuds.
Oh...my god folks...they add sour cream, cheese, chives and their homemade salsa that tastes like it came from a legit Mexican place.
Best potatoes I've ever had.
The biscuits and gravy were out of this world.
While I've had bigger biscuits, these were unbelievably buttery and deliscious, and the gravy was bomb.
The guitarist in the band had the exact same breakfast I did and was equally blown away which is a feat considering his food snobbery.
spuds.author: Patrick R.
spuds.review:
Wow....just...wow.

Story:
My band and I were in SF for a show at Slims. We had just finished our soundcheck around 10am, and were hungry as all hell. I searched for all the closest "breakfast" places nearby on my iphone (yelp app =]). This was the closest one that popped up. After finding parking a couple streets down, we turned onto 24th and noticed all of the amazing smells from restaurants from nearby Mexican joints and bakeries. We were almost swayed towards one of these, but decided to check out St Francis since they seemed to have actual breakfast which we were in the mood for. 

We were seated within 15 minutes of arriving, and the place was hoppin'. We read the menu and our mouths started to water, and learned that it was one of, if not the first (I can't quite remember which) ice cream places in SF. The staff was friendly and helpful in making our decisions.

The Order:
I ordered the Country Breakfast with 2 biscuits in sausage gravy, 2 scrambled eggs (you can get them any way you please) and hash browns. Now these has browns are amazing on their own (big chunky pieces of tater). But they have an option to "thing" your spuds. Oh...my god folks...they add sour cream, cheese, chives and their homemade salsa that tastes like it came from a legit Mexican place. Best potatoes I've ever had. The biscuits and gravy were out of this world. While I've had bigger biscuits, these were unbelievably buttery and deliscious, and the gravy was bomb. The guitarist in the band had the exact same breakfast I did and was equally blown away which is a feat considering his food snobbery. Our keyboardist had this awesome breakfast burrito and a coffee shake which was also amazing. 

The Verdict: 
Guys, this was hands down the best plate of biscuits and gravy I've ever had, and I always judge breakfast places by their pancakes or biscuits (usually both). The band has decided to come back here for sure next time we're in SF to try their lunch and dinner offerings. The best place I'd had before this was Ole's Waffle Shop in Alameda, which is also phenomenal.

excerpts:
I was smart and avoided the spuds on things, and instead chose a two egg scramble and french fries.
Delicious!
One extra star for FINALLY finding something worth coming back for.
One extra star for the awesome staff.
spuds.author: Meh M.
spuds.review:
Whoa whoa whoa.  What happened here?
I was out with my two vegan friends and in order to avoid another meal at Herbivore, I suggested this place so I could eat my bacon and sausage and so they could eat their "soyrizo" or whatever it is they call it.
This place has won a place in my heart.
The asshat servers from my previous experience were no longer there.  Everyone was GENUINELY friendly and welcoming.  Maybe this is the morning crew?  I remember only coming in the afternoons.  Hmm.
I was smart and avoided the spuds on things, and instead chose a two egg scramble and french fries.
Delicious!
One extra star for FINALLY finding something worth coming back for.
One extra star for the awesome staff.

excerpts: I highly recommend having your spuds "thinged" which means country style potatoes with melted cheese, tomatoes, sour cream, and salsa.
They went so well mixed together with my bacon and eggs.
I will definitely order the sausage patty again.
It tasted homemade and almost had a soy sauce flavor to it.
It's a little on the saltier side
so if you're sensitive to saltiness you might want to pass.
spuds.author: Katie J.
spuds.review:
I love trying new restaurants and St. Francis proves exactly why-  It was amazing!  It's a cute spot, holding on to it's old-school-50's-ice-cream-shop type of thing.  They even give you paper straws with your soda!  Not a fan but it's a nice touch.  The staff seemed genuinely nice which added to the laid back feel of the place.

I highly recommend having your spuds "thinged" which means country style potatoes with melted cheese, tomatoes, sour cream, and salsa.  They went so well mixed together with my bacon and eggs.  I will definitely order the sausage patty again.  It tasted homemade and almost had a soy sauce flavor to it.  It's a little on the saltier side so if you're sensitive to saltiness you might want to pass.  But then again most breakfast meats are salty, right?

If you go to St. Francis, promise me you won't leave without ordering the waffle.  They are perfectly spongy and moist.  And if you find yourself closing your eyes while your chewing, don't worry.  That's perfectly normal.

St. Francis, you are going in to my permanent breakfast spot rotation.

excerpts: For the ambitious, you can "thing" your spuds (homefries) with cheese, salsa, sour cream, and green onions.
With my breakfast, I had a very smooth large espresso shake!
Perfect!
Prices are hearty-
spuds.author: Leroid D.
spuds.review:
The fam and I have found another good local breakfast spot to add to my list. St. Francis may be old-fashioned, but their new-school menu caters to all- even "veg-heads." We've ordered a vegan chorizo 2-egg scramble and a chicken, avocado, and jack 3-egg omelette. The vegan chorizo is even more tasty than regular chorizo! For the ambitious, you can "thing" your spuds (homefries) with cheese, salsa, sour cream, and green onions. With my breakfast, I had a very smooth large espresso shake! Perfect! Prices are hearty- fortunately so is the food! 

As first-timers, service was good overall. And yes, as mentioned in all other reviews, you'll find a hip all-female wait staff with ink galore. Hate 'em or love 'em, try the food first.

excerpts: Be sure to thing your spuds when you go!
spuds.author: N M.
spuds.review:
Every time I've been here, I've been very impressed.  The Eggs Sandhya (poached on an English muffin with hollandaise, avocado and bacon) is excellent every time (except one, when the bacon was overdone, but this was by far the exception to the rule of excellent food).  Service is quick and not unfriendly.

I don't live in the Mission anymore, so regrettably I won't frequent St. Francis Fountain as often, but I tell my friends about it now.

Be sure to thing your spuds when you go!

excerpts: I ordered french toast with 2 eggs and spuds and i "thing"-ed my spuds which means adding sour cream, tomatoes, and green onions.
For only about 12 bucks, I got 2 plates of food.
The french toast was delicious, the eggs (simple, sunny side eggs) were also fantastic and the "thing"-ed spuds?
So decadent!
A flavor explosion.
This place not only uses incredible ingredients, the portions are huge and the prices are great.
LOVE LOVE LOVE!
spuds.author: Hanan H.
spuds.review: OH MY GOD! OHMYGOD! This place is my new favorite brunch place. I had never heard of it before I went today. We waited in the rain for about 20 minutes and when we were finally seated, we were NOT disappointed. My hubby ordered an oreo milkshake which my husband, myself and our friend all attacked like vultures. Everything from the ice cream to the whipped cream was to die for. I ordered french toast with 2 eggs and spuds and i "thing"-ed my spuds which means adding sour cream, tomatoes, and green onions. For only about 12 bucks, I got 2 plates of food. The french toast was delicious, the eggs (simple, sunny side eggs) were also fantastic and the "thing"-ed spuds? So decadent! A flavor explosion. This place not only uses incredible ingredients, the portions are huge and the prices are great. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

excerpts: I ordered the tofu scramble with "thing" on my spuds.
The tofu scramble was very good.
I've been wanting to have it
and this was a good way to start the tofu scramble experience.
spuds.author: Rommel B.
spuds.review:
After a night of drinking and no limit solider-ing and cash money-ing with some friends, i felt the best way to make it up to my girlfriend was to (attempt to) wake up early and take her out for some sunny saturday breakfast.  so bright and early 09:00am, the adventure started...

in between morning matches of street fighter hd remix, i scoured yelp for the most magical breakfast spot in the surrounding areas.  Basing our decision wiith a telephone, we were  passing up reviews on mama's in san francisco, (we decided to skip out on the 40 minute wait)  MHOP (millbrae's house of pancakes) had a 10 minute wait but an uneventful phone call.  I soon remember a cute, little, malt shoppe-looking place close to my work.

The st. francis fountain.

my new favorite breakfast spot.

We got there around 11-ish ( i REALLY like street fighter) and had about a 20 minute wait for a table.  It would have been a shorter wait if we were willing to perch up on the counter.  We need something more intimate, so we waited patiently for a small table, sandwiched between two other small tables in a kiddie corner at the front of the "fountain."

I ordered the tofu scramble with "thing" on my spuds.  My girlfriend ordered corned beef hash and was over joyed with the quality of the coffee.  

The tofu scramble was very good.  I've been wanting to have it and this was a good way to start the tofu scramble experience.  The potatoes were just as good, if not better.

My girlfriend said that the corn beef hash was alittle lacking in the corn beef department, but was still good nonetheless.

We will be coming back here....alot.

probably me more than her...because i work so close...

sucks for you girlfriend...sucks for you.

excerpts: Thing your spuds.
You'll thank me later.
spuds.author: Danyell K.
spuds.review:
I fall back in-love with this place every time I eat there. It's THAT good.

First, understand that the waitresses are bitches. It's a fact of life...get over it. They can be bitches because they're cute and work at one of the most-popular spots in the Mission for their breed. They can afford to scowl at you and roll their eyes when you request anything special. Get past this, and your dining experience will be stellar. (They are good at giving you attitude, but even better at keeping your glasses full with water and coffee.)

This is one of the best places to take a vegan/vegetarian friend in the city. Hands-down. They have a ridiculously extensive menu and the prices are about on-par with what it is in San Francisco. (Anywhere else and it'd be overpriced, though.) I've had a pretty big portion of the menu and everything is good, which is key in a place that you choose to dine at with a group. I've taken several people here and they all loved it. The location is a little harsh (24th and York ain't exactly the safest spot in the City) and the wait can be pretty intense on weekend mornings, but all of this is waived when you take your first bite of their biscuits'n'gravy or a sip of a Guinness (yes, the beer) float. 

And, ho-hah, you can have vegan shakes/ice cream and they have vegan sausages and the like! (And the shakes are done the old-fashioned way. Makes it even better!)

Also neat: the collectible toys and candies and cards. This place is a mecca for anyone obsessed with pop culture.

Thing your spuds. You'll thank me later.

excerpts: Mom had something with spuds & corn bread.
i had 2 eggs with corned beef hash.
final verdict:
spuds.author: Lito S.
spuds.review:
Ok, have to totally change my review here, will leave my original below.  Just goes to show good service goes a long way. 

My Tia was visiting on a Sunday.  She's vegan. Not much vegan within walking distance from my apt. So i bit the bullet and said let's go to St Francis.  I'm glad the bullet was bit.   The service was a complete turn around from my previous experience.

We went later in the afternoon and only waited 5-10 minutes.  Very friendly service from the moment we walked in the door.  It didn't hurt that our waiter had a Cheap Trick t-shirt (my Tia was/is a huge CT fan).

Next hurdle:  the food.  Tia had a vegan sammich and ordered one to go for lunch the following day.  My niece had a pesto chicken sandwhich she enjoyed.  Mom had something with spuds & corn bread.  i had 2 eggs with corned beef hash.  final verdict:  All so damn yummy.

So all in all, improvement beyond improvement!


 ===

Snotty service from hipsters.  Crappy attitude from hipster clientele.  And they crowd here on weekends despite the food that is as mediocre as that other crap joint, boogaloos. oh u evil harbingers of gentrification!

excerpts: It is to die for : home fry-type spuds w/green onions, sour cream, and salsa -  drenched in 2 types of cheese.
Absolutely amazing.
They also have a cool candy counter with some nostalgic candies and cool trading cards.
A bonus: up and down the street, there are a lot of bakeries to get delicious cookies.
spuds.author: Mary N.
spuds.review: God, do we love the St. Francis !  Excellent food in an old-time fountain setting.  It's always packed (esp. on weekends), so prepare for a bit of a wait.  They seem to keep things moving, though.  You write your name on a pad outside the door and kind of hang out.  On sunny days, there is some outdoor seating.  Good burgers, sandwiches,  - nice fare for breakfast or lunch.  I laways have the turkey club - and never miss the "nebulous potato thing".  It is to die for : home fry-type spuds w/green onions, sour cream, and salsa -  drenched in 2 types of cheese.  Absolutely amazing.  They also have a cool candy counter with some nostalgic candies and cool trading cards.  A bonus: up and down the street, there are a lot of bakeries to get delicious cookies.

excerpts: They have tofu scrambles, vegan chorizo hash, vegan pancakes, vegan sausage patties, veggie chili, garden burgers and seitan melts!
I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash.
The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety.
This is neither better nor worse, just different.
They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat.
The vegan chorizo hash is quite oily (as hash often is), but it's quite tasty.
They served it with the Earth Balance spread, which I had never tried before.
vegan sausage patties.author: Ed M.
vegan sausage patties.review:
An old-school diner with lots of vegan options? Let's go!

I was amazed by the sheer number of vegetarian and vegan options offered at St. Francis Fountain. They have tofu scrambles, vegan chorizo hash, vegan pancakes, vegan sausage patties, veggie chili, garden burgers and seitan melts! They even have veganaise and Earth Balance Buttery Spread.

I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash. The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety. This is neither better nor worse, just different. They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat. The vegan chorizo hash is quite oily (as hash often is), but it's quite tasty. They served it with the Earth Balance spread, which I had never tried before. It's pretty similar to a salted, whipped butter.

My partner ordered the Polar Melt on light rye. The seitan is well seasoned. If you like patty melts and the like, this is a great veggie option (it came with jack cheese, which you can probably leave off it you want to go vegan). It's one of the best melts I've tasted in a long time!

They carry Mitchell's ice cream and La Copa Loca gelato for desserts and fountain drinks. They also have vanilla soy as a non-dairy option. We didn't try any of these since we were so full from our meals. Maybe next time.

Their brewed coffee is pleasantly strong and their staff is quite friendly. Combined with a big, tasty meal, it's hard to leave without a smile on your face. It's not the healthiest place to eat (it is an old-school diner after all!), but the veggie and vegan options really show how almost every other restaurant out there is really dropping the ball when it comes to plant-based dining!

excerpts: Amazing pancakes, potatoes and vegan sausage patties.
vegan sausage patties.author: Katie B.
vegan sausage patties.review:
When you are a sad vegan because you can't get "normal" breakfast anywhere, come here to get your world rocked! Amazing pancakes, potatoes and vegan sausage patties. You don't need to eat an overpriced fruit bowl with black coffee here!

Worth the wait!!

EDIT: Knocking off two stars since I found out after coming back the French toast is not vegan, which was what we were told.

excerpts: We found parking right in front and it wasn't super busy, so we took a seat and made our decisions, she got the strawberry vegan pancakes with a side of vegan sausage patties and I got the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of potatoes, we split everything and were stuffed by time we finished.
The blueberry pancakes are loaded with fruit with an option for vegan butter too if you'd like.
The potatoes are done perfectly, just enough crispyness and softness inside to make them perfect, plus the herbs in them rock!
My daughter ate all the vegan sausage patties, mumbling how good those were too, all in all, it was a great success, we'll definitely be back soon.
vegan sausage patties.author: Garden R.
vegan sausage patties.review:
I had to give St. Francis Fountain a try after so many vegan friends have sworn up and down this is a great place to eat, very much vegan comfort food at it's best. I took one of my daughters and we went for brunch, I was in the mood for some vegan pancakes. We found parking right in front and it wasn't super busy, so we took a seat and made our decisions, she got the strawberry vegan pancakes with a side of vegan sausage patties and I got the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of potatoes, we split everything and were stuffed by time we finished.

Everything tastes so good, I can't believe we ate it all! The blueberry pancakes are loaded with fruit with an option for vegan butter too if you'd like. The potatoes are done perfectly, just enough crispyness and softness inside to make them perfect, plus the herbs in them rock! My daughter ate all the vegan sausage patties, mumbling how good those were too, all in all, it was a great success, we'll definitely be back soon.

Keep up the good work and thanks for offering the non-animal meals, its nice to have those options for the whole family.

excerpts: Get some vegan chocolate chip or maybe vegan sausage patties up in here
and I'll be here every day.
My omni brother and his vegetarian friend also really enjoyed their dishes and we had a quick walk around Mission afterward to help us digest.
10/10 will go back soon with friends.
PANCAKES
vegan sausage patties.author: Danica N.
vegan sausage patties.review: Vegan service industry vet here. Quick, efficient, but still warm and friendly service! I love pancakes but it's so hard to find vegan ones! The strawberry ones were the bees knees. Get some vegan chocolate chip or maybe vegan sausage patties up in here and I'll be here every day. My omni brother and his vegetarian friend also really enjoyed their dishes and we had a quick walk around Mission afterward to help us digest. 10/10 will go back soon with friends. PANCAKES

excerpts: I have had vegan rancheros (great twist on one of my favorite dishes from back when I was a "regular" vegetarian), the vegan "thing", a banana walnut pancake, and the vegan sausage patties.
I can't complain about any of the above
vegan sausage patties.author: Bailey M.
vegan sausage patties.review:
One of my favorite breakie spots in the city! 

Perfect for those mornings when your stomach needs to be greased up a bit, if ya know what I mean. I have had vegan rancheros (great twist on one of my favorite dishes from back when I was a "regular" vegetarian), the vegan "thing", a banana walnut pancake, and the vegan sausage patties. I can't complain about any of the above but I'm definitely more of a ranchero kinda lady than I am a potatos-for-breakfast kinda lady! 

I love the vibe, the diner style, and the no-frills service. My dining compadres have all loved their meaty dishes as well. I make it a point to venture here whenever I am in town! YUM.

excerpts: They have tofu scrambles, vegan chorizo hash, vegan pancakes, vegan sausage patties, veggie chili, garden burgers and seitan melts!
I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash.
The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety.
This is neither better nor worse, just different.
They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat.
The vegan chorizo hash is quite oily (as hash often is), but it's quite tasty.
They served it with the Earth Balance spread, which I had never tried before.

excerpts: He gave me corn beef hash with eggs Instead of vegan chorizo hash.
I haven't ate animal products in over a year.
When I told him he gave me the wrong thing he kept asking what kind of eggs I wanted on my VEGAN chorizo hash.
I told him it's not vegan if you're adding eggs.
Then he said he would comp my meal but actually only gave me the difference.
It also came with bread with regular butter
but I didn't know that it was regular butter or meat
I thought they just accidentally put egg.
So now I'm disappointed
and I have a stomach ache.
And to top it off
I'm late for work.
Smh I was telling all my friends about this place too.
Oh well
vegan chorizo hash.author: Mishaune G.
vegan chorizo hash.review: Today was the second day I came here. I am a Vegan and They have vegan options on the menu. they are really good. The first time I came in the service and food was prompt and perfect. The second time I had a different server and he messed up my order. He gave me corn beef hash with eggs Instead of vegan chorizo hash. I haven't ate animal products in over a year. When I told him he gave me the wrong thing he kept asking what kind of eggs I wanted on my VEGAN chorizo hash. I told him it's not vegan if you're adding eggs. Then he said he would comp my meal but actually only gave me the difference. It also came with bread with regular butter but I didn't know that it was regular butter or meat I thought they just accidentally put egg. So now I'm disappointed and I have a stomach ache. And to top it off I'm late for work. Smh I was telling all my friends about this place too. Oh well

excerpts: Really didn't have room for a vegan chorizo hash side but couldn't say no to the rich delicious flavor.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Jason B.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
Good thing going.

Do not underestimate a small "pile of spuds". Part of the Vegan Thing specialty topped with vegan cheese, salsa, guacamole and onions. Added a side of egg whites.

Perhaps they made a large instead because a massive mound of food was delivered. And consumed because each and every bite was outstanding.

Really didn't have room for a vegan chorizo hash side but couldn't say no to the rich delicious flavor.

Definitely didn't have room for a parfait but couldn't stop devouring sweet local granola, bananas, pineapple, strawberries, apples and what tasted like nonfat plain yogurt.

Also good was the enthusiastic and infectious service. And we were equally happy to be eating outside on a warm February Saturday. Wait was a short 15min.

Reasonable $20/person included my dining companion's much enjoyed dish, orange juice, coffee and being so full we didn't need lunch.

More than good. Five star great.

excerpts: Begrudgingly, I settle on the Vegan Chorizo Hash & Tofu instead.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Natalye R.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
St. Francis Fountain is one of those places I've been meaning to go to for the longest time, but for whatever reason, just haven't. 

This past week, that finally changed. After striking out at Golden Era (closed on a Tuesday?!) and Weird Fish (closed for a private party?!), we decided on St. Francis. Since it was a week night, there were a ton of empty tables, which was a nice welcome compared to the last time I tried to eat there (a weekend morning) when we were told our wait would be an hour or two. 

When we walked in we were told to sit wherever we pleased. So we sat at a nice table in the back. "Oh wait, not that one, in case a party of more than four comes in" is what we were told. Oh, okay. So we moved to another table. No big deal, although no larger party did come in during our time there (about an hour before closing).

I get the menu and I'm stoked to see all the vegan options. A bit later our drink orders are taken. A friend gets a Diet Coke. Another gets a Vanilla Coke. I hold off because I'm eyeing the soy milkshakes.

Server comes a bit later. A friend orders first. She wants one of the Things (not certain if she orders the Vegan one or the Nebulous Potato one). Only catch, she wants black beans instead of homefries. We are told that the chef will refuse to make it this way, because the homefries are important for the "structural integrity" of the dish. OK fine. So she orders something else.

I am torn between a few items, so I decide to ask some questions. 

Since the Chorizo and Eggs is calling out my name, I think that maybe I'll get that with tofu instead of eggs, even though that substitution costs an extra dollar or two. So I ask if they have vegan sour cream. The answer of which is no. 

This is surprising to me, because they have vegan cheese and vegan other things. Additionally, anyone who KNOWS breakfast knows that sour cream is an important component in the "structural integrity" of potatoes. So why they cater to the vegan crowd on almost everything else but sour cream is baffling, but again, fine.

Instead, I decide to get the Vegan Thing. I really want black beans instead of homefries, but I'd rather have vegan cheese than no sour cream. I need some kind of fake dairy to satiate my hunger.

Alongside this, I order that shake I've been lusting after since the second we walked in.

Moments later, our server returns to inform me that they're out of soy for the shakes. Insert sad face here. Instead, I decide to get a vanilla coke as well, since I've just tasted my companion's and it's quite good. Server goes to get it and returns shortly, saying they just ran out of vanilla coke - in fact, my friend got the last one. Which is annoying because not only are they out of it, but I'd also assumed that a diner like SFF would make their own - you know, regular coke with vanilla infusion. I mean, even Denny's does this on their own. But oh well, I settle for a diet vanilla coke, which is just fine in my book.

So we're sitting and chatting and waiting for our food when our server returns again to inform me that the chef has just begun making my meal and realizes that they're out of vegan cheese. Uh what?

Begrudgingly, I settle on the Vegan Chorizo Hash & Tofu instead. Which is twice-removed from the meal I really wanted, but whatever, I'm starving.

A minute or two passes and he comes out with my friends' meals. Mine doesn't come out for another 10 or so. So by the time they've finished their meals, I'm less than halfway through. As their plates are being cleared, I just ask for a to-go box, because we have some place we need to get to, and my food just isn't that good anyway.

The check comes, and my coke is comped. That's all. While I'm not expecting handouts, and I don't blame anyone for my subpar dining experience, it was still super disappointing that my entire time there felt more like a hassle than a pleasure. And while any singular instance of what happened wouldn't have bothered me, the fact that so many things went wrong, one after another, was discouraging.

I don't know - call me a cynic, or an asshole, but if a menu boasts having lots of vegan options, I'd think that actually having those vegan ingredients on hand would be important to the "structural integrity" of its claim.

excerpts: Vegan sausage, Vegan chorizo hash, an omelet, ww toast,Chocolate malt, coffee and tea!
vegan chorizo hash.author: Rinky N.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
Success!  Scored a table for 4 with no wait!

Ate here yesterday with my 4 member Birthday Girl Club.  Every month b-day or not we go for an outing which always includes eating!

I was thwarted in my attempt to eat here last year since there was a humongous line!

We could easily have spent an hour reading their extensive menu.  There is something for everyone.  If you can't find anything to eat from the menu then you must be from another planet.

The breakfast menu has at least 20 different kind of 2 or 3 egg omelets, french toast, pancakes, waffles, 4 kinds of tofu scrambles
and much more.

They have lots of choices for Vegans including Vegan Ruebens!


They also have malts, shakes, sundaes, floats including a Guinness Float!

So collectively we had:

Pancakes, Biscuits, home fries, eggs, pesto tofu scramble.Vegan sausage, Vegan chorizo hash, an omelet, ww toast,Chocolate malt, coffee and tea!

So yummy and filling!  We had little and big tastes of each other's dishes and give St FF 7 thumbs up!

The pancakes were fluffy, the potatoes had crispy edges, the tofu pesto scramble was yummy, the biscuits were light and buttery-mmm,
and the malt was luscious!

We're looking forward to eating here soon and having lunch!

Our server was super sweet and attentive,


The candy counter had wax lips!  Sugar Daddies!  Bubble Gum packs from Three's Company, Bo Derek, to name a few;  Button candy!
Garbage Pail kids candy!  Pop Rocks! 

Talk about Blasts From the Past!

We'll be back again during another hopefully uncrowded time!

excerpts: The tofu rancheros is very tasty, and they have a really nice vegan chorizo hash.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Marla W.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
The Devil Burger is the best vegan sandwich I've ever had. I don't know how they do it. I keep going back, waiting to have one be a little underwhelming, and it's never happened. The side salad that you can get with the sandwich is lovely and substantial. 

I like the breakfasts, too, though those are little more inconsistent. The tofu rancheros is very tasty, and they have a really nice vegan chorizo hash. 

The service is great! They get slammed on the weekends for brunch, so be prepared to put your name on the list and run to Dynamo Donuts for a quick coffee while you wait.

excerpts:
I went with the vegan chorizo hash and tofu ...
Delicious.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Trey F.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
Honesty, retro diners kind of depress me. Not sure why, but they always remind me of sad little towns in the Midwest.

They also usually have nothing good for a vegan to eat.

4 stars for St. Francis though... I opened up the menu and had one of those overwhelmed moments where there were an unexpectedly high amount of veggie friendly choices. Too many choices!

I went with the vegan chorizo hash and tofu ...
Delicious.

Plus, no wait at all for a booth at 9AM on a Saturday morning.

excerpts: I had the vegan chorizo hash.
Yum.
I've always wanted to try chorizo but not being a pig or cow eater, I haven't taken the plunge.
My friend also ordered the vegan chorizo hash and said it tasted very close to the real thing.
The serving was big, but not too big and was coated with the perfect amount of grease.
Everyone at the table was satisfied with their meals.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Zoe H.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
The food and service is fabulous.  The wait, not so fabulous.  But that is to be expected on a Sunday at 11:30 am.  They were able to accommodate 6 of us with an outside table and a 45 minute wait.  I didn't mind it so much.  The sun was shining and I was with good company.  The other 5 were suffering mild to severe hangovers and neither the sunshine nor the company seemed to lift their moods.

When we got seated and were all served our drinks from coffees to milkshakes, and pitchers of water, spirits were lifted.  I'm picky about my coffee and was craving philz down the block, but was pleasantly surprised by their coffee (it was probably Folgers.  When I lived in Florida, we used to always go to this breakfast spot for their incredible coffee.  I moved to Chicago and visited Florida a few months after the move.  My friend and I went to the breakfast place and I asked the server about the coffee.  Sure enough, it was Folgers.  At least I admit to it.  Maybe I'm not so picky after all.).  Our server was both attentive and adorable.  Even if the food and coffee were terrible, I'd go back for him.

I had the vegan chorizo hash.  Yum.  I've always wanted to try chorizo but not being a pig or cow eater, I haven't taken the plunge.  My friend also ordered the vegan chorizo hash and said it tasted very close to the real thing.  The serving was big, but not too big and was coated with the perfect amount of grease.  Everyone at the table was satisfied with their meals.  A few had different scramble combinations, one breakfast burrito, and a burger.

I really would like to give this place 5 stars, but being another blown up Mission brunch spot with entirely too long of a wait, I have to drop it to 4.  Oh, and if you get there and would like to wait with booze, you can go across the street to Pop's and have a mimosa and the restaurant will call you when your table is ready.

excerpts: We went on a sunny day and sat outside, had mimosas, and tasty breakfasts (burrito, vegan chorizo hash, crazy omelet).
Yum.
And the servers were all really sweet.
After all of that goodness, we went inside and bought genuine Cyndi Lauper, Duran Duran, and E.T. trading cards/stickers.
I was a happy camper, to say the least.
Oh, and we had a bacon donut from the place across the street pre-brunch.
Oh man, oh man, whatta day.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Rikki D.
vegan chorizo hash.review: Oh man, I loved this place. We went on a sunny day and sat outside, had mimosas, and tasty breakfasts (burrito, vegan chorizo hash, crazy omelet). Yum. And the servers were all really sweet. After all of that goodness, we went inside and bought genuine Cyndi Lauper, Duran Duran, and E.T. trading cards/stickers. I was a happy camper, to say the least. Oh, and we had a bacon donut from the place across the street pre-brunch. Oh man, oh man, whatta day.

excerpts: The guy next to us had ordered the Vegan Chorizo Hash with Tofu, and it looked sooooo good
vegan chorizo hash.author: D P.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
This place is so cute! I had it on my list of places to visit in SF mainly because of the vegan shake and ice cream.

My boyfriend and I ended up having lunch here on our last day in town.  The guy next to us had ordered the Vegan Chorizo Hash with Tofu, and it looked sooooo good, we BOTH GOT IT.  

It was pretty amazing: in the center, a tofu scramble with ranchero sauce, and surrounding it, vegan chorizo mixed in with diced potatoes, with three soft, hot corn tortillas on the side! 

It comes with a side: I got mine with a side of veggie chili--it wasn't as good as the Whole Foods canned variety, but was topped with scallions--and my boyfriend got a side of home fries, which were really good, nice and firm, and covered in herbs.

He got the "Dream" shake (orange sherbet and vanilla, topped with whipped cream and a cherry), and I got the vanilla "All Soy" shake.  The ice cream they use (I hear it is a local ice creamery, right?) IS SO GOOD.  I didn't see vanilla beans but would have guessed they were in there.  It was so very vanilla-y, and with a cherry on top.  

The server was staight-up abrasive, very unhelpful.  The bill came out to $43, which I think is kind of expensive for 2 diner-style entrees and a shake.  But the has was very good, and so was my shake, and I'd go back for either!

We ended up getting some 80s trading cards which was fun.  The lock on the bathroom door was broken, which was scary!, but one of my favorite things about the place was the old-school "BORAXO" powder hand soap dispenser in there.

excerpts: The waitress said, "the vegans seem to like this", it was vegan chorizo hash & tofu, we chuckled because of the way she said it.
Anyway, it was really delicious, thanks waitress person!
My friend, not vegan, got the porta-melt, and she really like it.
We both got our own - no sharing - all soy-shake, this is one rich drink, very tasty.
I recommend this place, it is really awesome, no doubt.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Brian S.
vegan chorizo hash.review: A  friend and I went here for breakfast. Since my diet is vegan, we asked what was good that was vegan on the menu. The waitress said, "the vegans seem to like this", it was vegan chorizo hash & tofu, we chuckled because of the way she said it. Anyway, it was really delicious, thanks waitress person!  My friend, not vegan, got the porta-melt, and she really like it. We both got our own - no sharing - all soy-shake, this is one rich drink, very tasty. I recommend this place, it is really awesome, no doubt.

excerpts: Getting to the food, I ordered the vegan chorizo hash and my friend had the country breakfast.
They give good-sized servings here.
I was content with my size and didn't feel cheated at all.
The chorizo hash was really good.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Scott L.
vegan chorizo hash.review:
I'm a fan.

I just finished eating here last than two hours ago and had to yelp about it (since I tend to forget).  

I definitely think this is a good place.  My friend wanted to come here because he's in search of good diners in SF.  Mel's just doesn't count.  The feel and the service was exceptional.  The wait staff is very laid back yet attentive at the same time.  The whole vibe is very chill and cool.  Parking isn't too much of a problem since it's close to Cesar Chavez which is great.  

Getting to the food, I ordered the vegan chorizo hash and my friend had the country breakfast.  They give good-sized servings here.  I was content with my size and didn't feel cheated at all.  The chorizo hash was really good.  It tastes home-cooked and they don't use a lot of oil at all so I don't feel sick afterwards.   

Overall, I'd highly recommend this place for breakfast/brunch on the weekends.  It's outside of the traditional cow hollow or noe valley turf which is great.  There are much fewer yuppies out here and more laid back people.

excerpts: Vegan chorizo hash was just ok for me though, the fennel seeds added a nice flavor but it could've used some salt.
vegan chorizo hash.author: Linda L.
vegan chorizo hash.review: Great atmosphere.  I love it here.  Waffles are yummy, nebulous potatoes are fantastic.  Vegan chorizo hash was just ok for me though, the fennel seeds added a nice flavor but it could've used some salt.

excerpts: Loved the bird hamburger with sum bacon, guac and chedda cheese n the employees are real nice
the bird.author: Jess L.
the bird.review: Loved the bird hamburger with sum bacon, guac and chedda cheese n the employees are real nice

excerpts: The Bird is hands down the  best chicken burger I've ever had, well worth the money.
Additionally, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu involving grilled chicken.
Their fries are tasty - and ice cream sodas are great too, the soy ice cream they serve is delicious.
My only culinary disappointment there came with one of the combo breakfasts, which was just too messy and didn't have enough flavor.
However, I just went back today for scrambled eggs and pancakes with a fruit cup (again, fresh, delicious produce) and loved it.
Great pancakes are HARD to find in a diner, but these guys know what it's all about.
the bird.author: Jasper L.
the bird.review:
I can't believe the beating this place is getting on Yelp lately. I moved a block away from here a few months ago, and this place (and Taqueria San Francisco) is my standby!

Hipsters? Yes. Crowded? Yes (at the predictable times, duh). Cheap ingredients? Sometimes - the syrup is Jemima knockoff and my iced tea comes from a soda fountain. On the other hand, they have the freshest, best veggies I've seen for their sides; in fact, the very best side salads I've had in a diner. Try the Caesar - real Parmesan (which almost never happens) with romaine! Delicious!

In terms of food, I stick to a couple favs. The Bird is hands down the  best chicken burger I've ever had, well worth the money. Additionally, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu involving grilled chicken. Their fries are tasty - and ice cream sodas are great too, the soy ice cream they serve is delicious. My only culinary disappointment there came with one of the combo breakfasts, which was just too messy and didn't have enough flavor. However, I just went back today for scrambled eggs and pancakes with a fruit cup (again, fresh, delicious produce) and loved it. Great pancakes are HARD to find in a diner, but these guys know what it's all about. Even the fakey syrup couldn't fuck 'em up.

In terms of these service complaints, I don't know what other yelpers are talking about. I guess first impressions are everything - and mine was charming and delicious. The service was sweet without being condescending, not to mention attentive. (Kids come here all the time, after all) I never leave the place without being thanked on the way out, and I always get my order taken within a couple minutes of walking in the door - and the food about 10 minutes max afterwards.

Listen, LA would KILL for a place like this. St. Francis is what a diner should be, the perfect balance of cheap and chic, and I'm happy to be a repeat customer.

excerpts: I also had the The Bird Burger.
Which is grilled chicken with lettuce, tomato, onions, and mayo.
I had my burger with home fries.
The burger was alright but my fries were too much for me at time of night.
I can see myself eating the home fries at breakfast.
I love how the restaurant had vintage posters and oldies but goodies snacks.
the bird.author: JACLYN T.
the bird.review:
St.Francis is the best place for a milkshake!!! Actually I had a Chocolate Malt. It was soooo yummy!!!! I also had the The Bird Burger. Which is grilled chicken with lettuce, tomato, onions, and mayo. I had my burger with home fries. The burger was alright but my fries were too much for me at time of night. I can see myself eating the home fries at breakfast. 
I love how the restaurant had vintage posters and oldies but goodies snacks. They even had big chew chewing gum, shirts, and some old baseball cards for sale. 

I gave it four stars because my burger could have been better. But I'm totally coming back for the shakes and sundaes!!!! 

Oh...and the staff there were really upbeat!!! :)

excerpts: I went w/ the Devil Burger which is fully vegan as comes w/ lettuce, tomato, onion, & pickle on
a sesame bun along w/ veganaise & a pile of marinated & grilled thinly sliced seitan.
I added avocado & grilled onions.
It comes w/
devil burger.author: Shane S.
devil burger.review:
St. Francis Fountain is a pretty solid brunch spot that has plenty of vegan options which is awesome. There was quite the line when I went there for brunch this afternoon & signed up on the clipboard outside. I was seated fairly soon though as I chose to sit on the counter. 

The vibe here is interesting as is pure hipster w/ a 1980s nostalgia meets a 1950s dinner. They even sell Alf & Garbage Pail Kid Trading cards along w/ Nerds & Twizzlers old school candy.

I have an appreciation for many of the counter culture scenes including the Beats of the 1950s, the hippies of the 1960s, & the punks of the 1970s along w/ the Grunge alternative scene of the 1990s yet never got into the hipster scene.

The vegan brunch here was great though. I went w/ the Devil Burger which is fully vegan as comes w/ lettuce, tomato, onion, & pickle on a sesame bun along w/ veganaise & a pile of marinated & grilled thinly sliced seitan. I added avocado & grilled onions. It comes w/ a choice of a side which I chose the fries.

I will be sure to be back to try a vegan version of the Nebulous Potato Thing. Despite not being into the hipster scene St. Francis Fountain does have plenty of vegan brunch options so recommend it for that alone.

FOMO
Whatevs, if you are a hipster vegan then this place is for you. 
YOLO

excerpts: The Devil Burger destroyed my soul, had me reciting Anton LaVey in an ancient tongue of R'lyeh, my head spinning around, and the earth combusting around me.
When I awoke, I was pregnant with the harbinger of the end times and I was seited.
devil burger.author: Mark B.
devil burger.review: The Devil Burger destroyed my soul, had me reciting Anton LaVey in an ancient tongue of R'lyeh, my head spinning around, and the earth combusting around me. When I awoke, I was pregnant with the harbinger of the end times and I was seited.

excerpts: The best vegan item on the menu is by far the Devil Burger.
It's the marinated seitan burger with vegan mayo, lettuce, pickles, onion, and tomatoes on a soft bun.
I wish there were more items on the menu that use the seitan-
it's to die for.
devil burger.author: Nick W.
devil burger.review:
Amazing, vegan friendly restaurant. Come here with a mixed group, please the meat eaters and the vegans all at once. The best vegan item on the menu is by far the Devil Burger. It's the marinated seitan burger with vegan mayo, lettuce, pickles, onion, and tomatoes on a soft bun. I wish there were more items on the menu that use the seitan- it's to die for. Other great vegan items: milkshakes, the Vegan Thing with potatoes, guac, salsa, and vegan cheese, vegan pancakes, and their black beans. Great for brunch, and I recommend sitting outside when it's nice out.

Not great for groups because of limited seating options. They only accept a maximum of two cards per table- so if you're splitting the bill, we recommend that you bring cash to avoid the eye roll.

excerpts: The devil burger is on my mind most days...
devil burger.author: Avery M.
devil burger.review:
Seriously delish and they have a really good little area that sells vintage cards and candy... Quality stuff. The devil burger is on my mind most days...

My bf go on dates here frequently it's cute

excerpts: Actually none of the times I've been here had anything to do with hangovers, just fun, sunny cheerful afternoons on a fun block, with good conversation over the devil burger.
The decor is also pretty amusing.
Because this place is so good, however, it is also popular, so the wait can be long on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon.
(I don't recommend the milkshake.
Everything else is yummy though.)
devil burger.author: Bean H.
devil burger.review:
Thank you, Vegan Saurus, for letting me know that there is, in fact, a place to go for vegan hangover food (note: it has a lot of vegan options, but is not all vegan). Actually none of the times I've been here had anything to do with hangovers, just fun, sunny cheerful afternoons on a fun block, with good conversation over the devil burger. The decor is also pretty amusing. Because this place is so good, however, it is also popular, so the wait can be long on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon. 
(I don't recommend the milkshake. Everything else is yummy though.)

excerpts: I really enjoyed my Devil burger, and the three bean chili soup.
We topped it off with gelato for the kids.
If you are a vegetarian or looking for vegan options, this place is heaven sent.
devil burger.author: Ani M.
devil burger.review: We were told this is a SFO institution that we absolutely should visit, and my family agrees! Two thumbs up. My daughter really enjoyed the vegan pancakes, and my son had the French toast.  I really enjoyed my Devil burger, and the three bean chili soup.  We topped it off with gelato for the kids. If you are a vegetarian or looking for vegan options, this place is heaven sent.

excerpts: The Devil Burger is the best vegan sandwich I've ever had.
I don't know how they do it.
I keep going back, waiting to have one be a little underwhelming, and it's never happened.
devil burger.author: Marla W.
devil burger.review:
The Devil Burger is the best vegan sandwich I've ever had. I don't know how they do it. I keep going back, waiting to have one be a little underwhelming, and it's never happened. The side salad that you can get with the sandwich is lovely and substantial. 

I like the breakfasts, too, though those are little more inconsistent. The tofu rancheros is very tasty, and they have a really nice vegan chorizo hash. 

The service is great! They get slammed on the weekends for brunch, so be prepared to put your name on the list and run to Dynamo Donuts for a quick coffee while you wait.

excerpts: I almost always get a Devil Burger or Phil's Grill and am always satisfied.
devil burger.author: Mike F.
devil burger.review:
Love St Francis Fountain. One of my favorite San Francisco establishments.

The atmosphere is really cool with a blast from the past quality but with only the cool parts (except for the creepy mannequin at the candy counter that scares me half to death every time I'm leaving...). 

Servers are all really relaxed and courteous and seem to have fun rotating between iPods as there is always some cool music (to my untrained ears) being played. 

Food is the clincher. Seitan (wheat gluten) has became one of my favorites since discovering it here. I almost always get a Devil Burger or Phil's Grill and am always satisfied. 

Only warning is be prepared to get desert regardless of your best intentions.

Really great, unique restaurant worth checking out.

excerpts: I will never be able to stomach the Devil Burger (seitan sandwich) again...
devil burger.author: Unfriendly V.
devil burger.review:
Due to the Lunch Rush that never materialized, the waitperson insisted I leave 4 adjacent seats at the counter open (me sitting in the 5th), thus forcing me to sit  next to an all-elbows woman who was hacking up a lung. 

I will never be able to stomach the Devil Burger (seitan sandwich) again... but I will be back for the vegan banana walnut pancakes with real maple syrup.

excerpts: (no one was able to finish completely) and I was in a mid-day crisis where I couldnt decide between breakfast or lunch, so I ordered the Baltimore (BLT with Avocado, but they forgot the avocado and brought a side out after the order) and split the pancakes (which were pretty good but nothing amazing).
The milkshakes were what pushed this from a 3 to a 4 star review.
So many options & I ordered the gelato milkshake with strawberry that had soooo many delicious chunks (ha) and was the perfect ending to a great Sunday morning brunch.
baltimore.author: Raina D.
baltimore.review: The perfect place for a hangover curing brunch/lunch. The menu has so many options from the standard breakfast fate to their more creative options (many of which are vegan/vegetarian friendly).  Everyone in the group I was with ordered the breakfast special with "thinged" spuds and loved their meals (no one was able to finish completely) and I was in a mid-day crisis where I couldnt decide between breakfast or lunch, so I ordered the Baltimore (BLT with Avocado, but they forgot the avocado and brought a side out after the order) and split the pancakes (which were pretty good but nothing amazing).  The milkshakes were what pushed this from a 3 to a 4 star review.  So many options & I ordered the gelato milkshake with strawberry that had soooo many delicious chunks (ha) and was the perfect ending to a great Sunday morning brunch.

excerpts: it's fun to take a surreal trip back in time to a soda fountain where they are playing indie music and order a fantastic burger and fries or the super yummy baltimore.
the shakes are exquisite, and ohhhhh my lucky stars when they've got pumpkin shakes, i'm so happy.
Update: 4/2/06
Oh my god it still rocks.
i always yearn to go back here.
and there is nothing like trying to slurp a rocky road shake thru a straw.
rad.
the reuben is super super duper tasty.
yum.
baltimore.author: sarah C.
baltimore.review:
St Francis Fountain makes me so happy. it's fun to take a surreal trip back in time to a soda fountain where they are playing indie music and order a fantastic burger and fries or the super yummy baltimore. the shakes are exquisite, and ohhhhh my lucky stars when they've got pumpkin shakes, i'm so happy.
Update: 4/2/06 
Oh my god it still rocks.   i always yearn to go back here.   and there is nothing like trying to slurp a rocky road shake thru a straw. rad. the reuben is super super duper tasty.  yum.

excerpts: As for my entree, I had the Modesto Pesto with grilled chicken, tomato, red onion & pesto and additional avocado.
What can I say, i'm an addict for avocado.
Chicken WAS grilled just right.
The sandwich was DARN good, I devoured the whole thing before my stomach told me I was full!
modesto pesto.author: Josie H.
modesto pesto.review:
It was 12pm on a Friday and I had a sudden craving for milkshake....so I headed over to St. Francis.

Like any typical diner, this place has the sandwiches, burgers, fries, and most importantly MILKSHAKE. They had the classic, then the ONES made with MITCHELL's ice cream! I obviously got the mitchell's ice cream shake, and it was bomb diggity!

As for my entree, I had the Modesto Pesto with grilled chicken, tomato, red onion & pesto and additional avocado. What can I say, i'm an addict for avocado. Chicken WAS grilled just right. The sandwich was DARN good, I devoured the whole thing before my stomach told me I was full! They also gave a huge portion of fries, which I shamelessly finished too. 

Best of all, it was decently priced! I'm stroked this is walking distance from my work AND can't wait to DRINK more milkshakes!

excerpts: I had the Modesto pesto sandwich with fries.
Toasted bread with pesto spread on both slices, chicken, tomato, onion.
Yum.
The fries were also nice and crispy.
Bomb.
Coffee was great.
My GF had a sandwich with side salad.
She liked it.
They made someone a shake and gave us the leftovers.
modesto pesto.author: Marty J.
modesto pesto.review:
I am on a streak of giving out 5 stars, but this place deserves nothing less. It doesn't look super welcoming from the outside but maybe because it's so old fashioned. Good thing I don't judge a book by its cover because this place is great. It's like a time warp. Metered parking outside, $2 an hour.

Water was served right away. I appreciate this because a lot of places you have to request it. I had the Modesto pesto sandwich with fries. Toasted bread with pesto spread on both slices, chicken, tomato, onion. Yum. The fries were also nice and crispy. Bomb. Coffee was great. My GF had a sandwich with side salad. She liked it. They made someone a shake and gave us the leftovers. How nice.

Best of all, the price: something like $22 for 2 people. I gave them a decent tip for the pleasurable experience.

excerpts: The Modesto Pesto sandwich was really good and their fries were awesome.
I love the small booths.
They have a candy counter which
modesto pesto.author: Lizzie D.
modesto pesto.review:
This place is really cool. Old school feel and their food is pretty good too. They have Italian Sodas (I got a pinapple soda) and my husband got a Guiness float. The Modesto Pesto sandwich was really good and their fries were awesome. I love the small booths. They have a candy counter which I think kids would really enjoy. 

This is not an awesome place to bring all your friends all at once. Its a small place and they do have bar seating but its more for the small groups and locals.

excerpts: My Modesto pesto tasted liked frozen chicken.
I like the space, the staff and the hood.
Food is not Much to talk about
modesto pesto.author: Sean H.
modesto pesto.review: The easy things they do well, like Mac and cheese and vegan chilly. My Modesto pesto tasted liked frozen chicken. I like the space, the staff and the hood. Food is not Much to talk about

excerpts: After all, it's not like they didn't have the ingredients... or the blender because I wound up ordering a chocolate shake with my Modesto Pesto chicken sandwich.
modesto pesto.author: Timothy O.
modesto pesto.review:
It's Sunday afternoon. I'm on the couch at my friend's place, and we both realize that we've slept in. I mean we've seriously slept in. She wants breakfast; I just want something to eat. So we walk the six blocks or so to St. Francis Fountain and add our names to the tiny (for this time of day) waiting list.

We get a seat, and I'm happy I decided to wear my beard today. Checking out the wait staff, I would have felt naked without one. Looking over the menu, I saw lots of egg dishes, which led me to think I really wanted lunch. Plus, they had a large fountain menu with Mitchell's ice cream. I actually wanted a blended root beer float (sometimes known as a frozen root beer or a root beer freeze). That was too "off the menu" for them, which was disappointing. After all, it's not like they didn't have the ingredients... or the blender because I wound up ordering a chocolate shake with my Modesto Pesto chicken sandwich.
