(By the way, I regularly drive through Modesto, and there aren't as many hipsters or as much pesto as the menu here would suggest.)

Anyway, my friend swore that the best huevos rancheros in the City can be found here. I was skeptical, but then again, I'm not an egg man. While I appreciated both the sentiment and the sentimentality of the red-and-white paper straws mentioned by other reviewers, I was delighted on my second visit to discover a plastic straw came with my milkshake. Now unencumbered by 1930's technology, I declare their straight chocolate milkshake the best ever.

Prices were reasonable for the value.

excerpts: I ordered the Modesto Pesto sandwich, nothing special, I can make better pesto & the chicken was pretty dry but that won't deter me from coming back.
Their chicken cilantro soup was absolutely delicious and
next time I'll order a whole bowl, not just a cup.
I love the authentic retro ambiance and there are fun trading cards and gum
(21 Jump Street anyone?) and paraphenalia to add to the old school vibe.
If you're in the 24th & mission area, this is a definitely a great place to grab some lunch or just a sweet snack and relax.
modesto pesto.author: Suzanne V.
modesto pesto.review: This place is a gem!  Open since 1918, this old-school soda fountain/ice cream shop/diner is a delight.  The staff is fast and friendly (and tatted up and hipster-y if you're into that kind of thing ;)) and they offer a great selection of breakfast fare, sandwiches & diner food.  I'm an omnivore but I love the fact that they are so veggie friendly here, there are plenty of tofu or seitan options (and I don't mean that in the "there are 1-2 options" kind of way) and even even soy milkshakes!  I ordered the Modesto Pesto sandwich, nothing special, I can make better pesto & the chicken was pretty dry but that won't deter me from coming back.  Their chicken cilantro soup was absolutely delicious and next time I'll order a whole bowl, not just a cup.  I love the authentic retro ambiance and there are fun trading cards and gum (21 Jump Street anyone?) and paraphenalia to add to the old school vibe.  If you're in the 24th & mission area, this is a definitely a great place to grab some lunch or just a sweet snack and relax.

excerpts: Don't miss the Modesto Pesto grilled chicken sandwich.
modesto pesto.author: Aaron Z.
modesto pesto.review: Fast, tasty comfort food in a clean, cozy diner.  The waiters are friendly, efficient, and total studs.  Don't miss the Modesto Pesto grilled chicken sandwich.

excerpts: Love their sides, especially the fresh fruit cup, french fries, and 3 bean chili, can't  go wrong wit the sides.
The sides are the bonuses.
Hamberger was great, old fashion.
bean chili.author: Helen L.
bean chili.review: Booths, tall shakes with whipped cream, patty and tuna melt make this place an iconic.  We need an old man serving.  But this place is too hip.  Great fast service.  Love their sides, especially the fresh fruit cup, french fries, and 3 bean chili, can't  go wrong wit the sides. The sides are the bonuses.  Hamberger was great, old fashion.

excerpts: I really enjoyed my Devil burger, and the three bean chili soup.
We topped it off with gelato for the kids.
If you are a vegetarian or looking for vegan options, this place is heaven sent.
bean chili.author: Ani M.
bean chili.review: We were told this is a SFO institution that we absolutely should visit, and my family agrees! Two thumbs up. My daughter really enjoyed the vegan pancakes, and my son had the French toast.  I really enjoyed my Devil burger, and the three bean chili soup.  We topped it off with gelato for the kids. If you are a vegetarian or looking for vegan options, this place is heaven sent.

excerpts: The vegetarian chili was especially delicious since it was on the lighter and healthier side being a three bean chili without fake meat.
The chili is NOT another lackluster attempt in the futile fight to make 'meatless' taste 'meaty', so give it a try if you haven't already.
bean chili.author: Carrie G.
bean chili.review: Delicious vegetarian options, generous portions, and the relaxed atmosphere were all the reasons we made this our first meal back after being away for a week in the desert. Best decision ever! The hearty comfort food here is a good remedy to placate any hungry beast, and my grumbling belly at the time was a tough contender. It's always so hard to decide on just one thing here, so don't try and instead bring a friend or two and share. We got the Side Platter (bowl of mac & cheese, cup of chili, and caesar salad), the Veggie Mess, and the corn bread. The vegetarian chili was especially delicious since it was on the lighter and healthier side being a three bean chili without fake meat. The chili is NOT another lackluster attempt in the futile fight to make 'meatless' taste 'meaty', so give it a try if you haven't already. The Veggie Mess should be called Hangover Heaven since it is a heavy pile of starchy potato and faux meat covered in gooey cheese heaped on a plate - complete bliss when you have an insatiable appetite. Mac and cheese and corn bread were solid and the caesar was a nice complement to the heavier plates. The only thing on the menu I've had and didn't love was the S.F. Rueben, but then again a veggie Reuben is a hard thing to pull off unless you're Native Foods. Food coma is imminent so enjoy those cups of Joe the servers pour so generously.

excerpts:
Food: 
SF Reuben - I honestly thought this would be light especially since there would be no meat
but this actually filled me up.
sf reuben.author: Leland S.
sf reuben.review:
Story: My friend told me about this place and it's unique old school ambiance. 

Location: Like most restaurants in SF it's on the side of the street so street parking is a must. It can seat about 40 people.

Ambiance: 
This place really does bring an old school feel from the paper straws to the their classic candy. You can sit stool diner style or booth. It seemed like the "Prince" playlist was playing (which is totally fine by me).

Service: 
Our server was quick and attentive. Our orders came in less than 10 minutes. He politely followed up with every now and then.

Food: 
SF Reuben - I honestly thought this would be light especially since there would be no meat but this actually filled me up. I was hesitant at first but this was a tasty alternative to the usual corned beef rueben.

Nebulous Potato Thing - We ordered the small but this small dish was flavorful and surprisingly fulfilling

Old fashioned Vanilla Ice Cream Malt - The taste was rich and the texture of the malt was on point. The paper straw was quite a struggle at first since it would get soggy after quite sometime and it would be hard to suck through the straw. Be sure to stir so the malt is distributed evenly throughout the shake.

Overall: 
I would rate this place 4.5 stars. I honestly can't complain about this place. The music was pleasing, the service was quick, and food was delicious. Their menu was had a wide variety from their breakfast menu to their authentic shakes. Meals ranged from the high $5-10 range and well worth it. Whenever I'm back in town and in need for that old school American feel, this will be the place to be.

excerpts: My partner ordered the Polar Melt on light rye.
The seitan is well seasoned.
If you like patty melts and the like, this is a great veggie option
(it came with jack cheese, which you can probably leave off it you want to go vegan).
polar melt.author: Ed M.
polar melt.review:
An old-school diner with lots of vegan options? Let's go!

I was amazed by the sheer number of vegetarian and vegan options offered at St. Francis Fountain. They have tofu scrambles, vegan chorizo hash, vegan pancakes, vegan sausage patties, veggie chili, garden burgers and seitan melts! They even have veganaise and Earth Balance Buttery Spread.

I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash. The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety. This is neither better nor worse, just different. They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat. The vegan chorizo hash is quite oily (as hash often is), but it's quite tasty. They served it with the Earth Balance spread, which I had never tried before. It's pretty similar to a salted, whipped butter.

My partner ordered the Polar Melt on light rye. The seitan is well seasoned. If you like patty melts and the like, this is a great veggie option (it came with jack cheese, which you can probably leave off it you want to go vegan). It's one of the best melts I've tasted in a long time!

They carry Mitchell's ice cream and La Copa Loca gelato for desserts and fountain drinks. They also have vanilla soy as a non-dairy option. We didn't try any of these since we were so full from our meals. Maybe next time.

Their brewed coffee is pleasantly strong and their staff is quite friendly. Combined with a big, tasty meal, it's hard to leave without a smile on your face. It's not the healthiest place to eat (it is an old-school diner after all!), but the veggie and vegan options really show how almost every other restaurant out there is really dropping the ball when it comes to plant-based dining!

excerpts: I got the Devil's burger and my husband got the polar melt.
Both were delicious!
For sides - I got the Mac N' Cheese and he got vegetarian chili fries!
The food was top notch, and there was so much
, we did not get close to finishing off the sides.
polar melt.author: Vrinda S.
polar melt.review:
St. Francis Fountain is one of the best brunch places in the City! It has all types of food that would make any meat-lover, vegetarian or vegan extremely happy. We didn't eat any breakfast foods - but opted for sandwiches instead. I got the Devil's burger and my husband got the polar melt. Both were delicious! For sides - I got the Mac N' Cheese and he got vegetarian chili fries! The food was top notch, and there was so much, we did not get close to finishing off the sides. (Fair to note - we even got small milkshakes.)

Great experience, great food, and awesome diner ambience. We cannot wait to go back and try a scramble or their vegan pancakes!

excerpts: My favorite dish is the Polar Melt.
Hello!
polar melt.author: Susie D.
polar melt.review:
I have been a happy diner here for years, but they recently took vegan cheese off the menu. Nowhere is that posted and they don't tell you when you order, you find out when you get your meal. 

I had the vegan rancheros and it was just 'eh' at best without it. The menu still says it has vegan jack on it and it's still $9.75, mind you...for three corn tortillas, some black beans, tofu and ranchero sauce. I barely ate it. I don't like wasting calories on mediocre food.

When I asked the waitress she said she just came in one day and it was gone. She said I'm not the only customer who's unhappy either. 

Just seems so bizarre since so many of their menu items are melts or messes. My favorite dish is the Polar Melt. Hello! MELT!

They either need to bring back the vegan cheese or change the menu descriptions and prices. 

They are getting two stars because their staff are always so nice, but I'm not wasting an hour of my life waiting for a table again unless they bring it back. Ridiculous.

excerpts: * Dreamsicle (milk, oj, vanilla syrup, vanilla ice cream, orange sherbet, whipped cream, cherry.

$5.75) - 4 stars
Tasty, thick, not too sweet!
dreamsicle.author: Ziyan C.
dreamsicle.review:
No wait for six of us around 1pm on a Saturday! At first we were split between a booth and a couple seats at the bar. After a few minutes, we were all able to sit together at the bar.

They did mess up a couple of our orders and were a little slow to get them out, but we did end up with a free scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream! You can also personalize whether you want ice cream or cream on top of your floats, and what topping to get on your banana split (caramel, chocolate, etc). 

The ice cream is not my favorite in the city, could be more creamy, but it's still good.

FOUNTAIN CLASSICS
* Dreamsicle (milk, oj, vanilla syrup, vanilla ice cream, orange sherbet, whipped cream, cherry. $5.75) - 4 stars
Tasty, thick, not too sweet! Like an orange soda with vanilla.

* Guiness Float ($7.25) - 4 stars
My boyfriend really liked this!

We also got a banana split in the group. This was a monster of a dish, delicious!

excerpts: Less time to Dreamsicle-time.
dreamsicle.author: Amy C.
dreamsicle.review:
Why I Heart Burning Man:

1)  Rockstar parking.

2)  No wait.  At St. Francis Fountain.  At 11am.  On a Sunday. (!!!)

3)  Less time to Dreamsicle-time.

4)  Less time to Grilled Buttered Banana Bread time.

5)  Less time to Ranchero-Sauced-Breakfast-Burrito-Food-Coma time.

6)  Less time to Extra-Crispy-Hash-Browns time.

(More time while waiting a long time for the check though.  Go figure!)

excerpts:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt
there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'
dreamsicle.author: Michael U.
dreamsicle.review:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760 I finally decided to quell my curiosity, a short walk back just one block landing me at a two-top in the 1918 soda fountain.  Kitschy in décor with toys and trading cards from my youth available for purchase in a glass case while booths and tables sat tightly spaced juxtaposing the Formica bar it would be mere moments before I was greeted by the diner's lone server and confirming hopes of an 'all-day' menu my order quickly took shape, a duo of childhood favorites readied at the counter along with French Toast arriving less than ten minutes later.  Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.  Already all smiles as patrons aged five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'

excerpts: That's right the Dreamsicle combo.
dreamsicle.author: Wilhelm Y.
dreamsicle.review:
I love the extensive menu at St. Francis Fountain filled with assorted egg combinations and different breakfast choices along with great burgers and of course, ice cream treats.  I have yet to try anything bad at this restaurant.  In order to be thorough they also have soups, salads and some vegetarian items on the menu that I have never tried.

On my most recent visit I ordered one of my menu favorites, the Chef's Mess (pictured).  This is an egg scrambler that combines their homefries, bacon pieces and sliced mushrooms.  Cheddar and jack cheese are melted on top of the scrambler then diced tomatoes, a dollop of sour cream and chopped green onions finish the dish.  Your choice of toast comes with this selection.

On my second most recent visit I had the Hamburger with Bacon and Cheddar (also pictured).  All of their burgers are cooked medium well unless of course you ask otherwise, and these are thick, lean, beefy patties.  The menu states that they are 6 oz. patties.  The base burger comes with shredded lettuce, sliced tomato, a few thin strings of red onion and a couple of pickle chips.  The burger had a thick slice of cheddar melted on top of the patty along with two thick strips of crispy bacon that I had to crumble in half in order to make it fit.  The price is on the steeper side, but the burger is delicious.

Burgers and sandwiches come with French Fries on the side.  I like how they are fried up crispy with the skin intact.  If you are not into the fried potatoes however, there are several other sides you can choose from including salad, soup, chili, mac and cheese or fruit.

They serve Mitchell's ice cream at St. Francis Fountain with about a dozen flavors.  I don't let my lactose intolerance bother me ever.  I carry Lactaid tablets with me at all times, and I enjoy ordering ice cream items.  My favorite flavor combination has always been vanilla ice cream with orange sherbet.  That's right the Dreamsicle combo.  Perhaps that is why I love the Dream Shake (pictured) so much.

I sit at the counter most of the time because I enjoy watching the waitress make my shake with a light pour of whole milk, a shot of Torani vanilla syrup, orange sherbet and vanilla ice cream.  One of the waitresses with short dark hair makes a real kick ass milkshake.  Sorry but I always forget to ask her name.  She leaves the shake on the mixer for a super long time and the result is a shake so thick the long metal spoon will stand up in the middle of the glass for a good half hour after the shake has been made.  Don't ask why, but I tried it once (the spoon caper, that is).

The service is usually pretty good as the wait staff are really cool.

Although I have a long time to go before I can exercise the ten percent senior discount here I'm hopeful that San Francisco's oldest ice cream parlor will still be here serving up a great menu and delicious ice cream treats.

excerpts: The dreamsicle soda was AMAZING as was the old-fashioned shake (
yeah, i pigged out).
My gf liked her reuben but both the soups she tried (brocolli and chicken) were very bland.
Loved it though!
dreamsicle.author: Alan J.
dreamsicle.review: Sweet little old school diner/soda fountain. Had the nebulous potato thing and it was super good (if not just a tad bland). The dreamsicle soda was AMAZING as was the old-fashioned shake (yeah, i pigged out). My gf liked her reuben but both the soups she tried (brocolli and chicken) were very bland. Loved it though!

excerpts: I loved the fried egg sandwich with vegan sausage and the dreamsicle orange sherbet float that I got.
Did I mention the menu is very Vegan and Vegetarian friendly?!
I'll have to go back several times to try all the other things they have.
dreamsicle.author: Kaushal P.
dreamsicle.review:
So many options!! Not to mention the cute wait staff ;)

I loved the fried egg sandwich with vegan sausage and the dreamsicle orange sherbet float that I got. Did I mention the menu is very Vegan and Vegetarian friendly?! I'll have to go back several times to try all the other things they have.

excerpts: Much love for the dreamsicle milkshake, though depending on the maker, can be kind of uneven.
But the perfect blend of milk sorbet and whatever else is in there is delightful.
On a somewhat unrelated note, my ex hated this place cuz he got extreme food poisoning at least a couple of times...
but I've never gotten sick
and I know
at least a dozen other ppl who haven't.
Oh well, he can rot in davis, I'll be enjoying the hipster cuties here...
dreamsicle.author: Marie W.
dreamsicle.review:
love this place and the fact it's within walking distance from my house...plus you run into so many colorful characters from general (no wait that's riding on the 9) anyway good sandwiches and the array of side orders is amazing (mac and cheese, salad, homefries etc) Much love for the dreamsicle milkshake, though depending on the maker, can be kind of uneven. But the perfect blend of milk sorbet and whatever else is in there is delightful. 
On a somewhat unrelated note, my ex hated this place cuz he got extreme food poisoning at least a couple of times...but I've never gotten sick and I know at least a dozen other ppl who haven't.  Oh well, he can rot in davis, I'll be enjoying the hipster cuties here...

excerpts: Especially their dreamsicle.
dreamsicle.author: Jon G.
dreamsicle.review:
I don't like their biscuits or anything they make with potatoes. 

However, everything else there is pretty damn awesome. Especially their dreamsicle.

excerpts: HOME of the Dreamsicle.
dreamsicle.author: Julia W.
dreamsicle.review:
Love it here. Get up early and hit it or stop complaining about breakfast/lunch lines in the Mission. 

St. Francis: 

HOME of Eggs Sandia (sp? should I buy a "y? is there an "h?" can't recall) (eggs benedict but with avocado and bacon v. the ham--so good). 

HOME of "Honey, for some reason, I woke up craving the St. Francis waffle" waffle.  

HOME of a truly nice Reuben that hits the spot. 

HOME of the Dreamsicle. An object deserving of its name.

And, sure, sure, HOME of Central Casting for Mission Hipsters. What are you doing there? Not beating but joining? Not waving but drowning in St. Francis' gravy??? It's. So. Good. Besides, you look cute so early in the morning! 

And the light in St. Francis bouncing off those beautiful booths is so lovely.  And the staff really is a group of good-natured people. You can feel that. Nice way to wake up.

excerpts: This is the first time I have had ice cream for breakfast because the soda drink "Dreamsicle" sounded too good to pass.
And I am glad I didn't!
The place is a hipster magnet but good breakfast joint.
I liked the interior.
And anyone who has a garbage pail poster is awesome in my book.
dreamsicle.author: Jessica C.
dreamsicle.review: This is the first time I have had ice cream for breakfast because the soda drink "Dreamsicle" sounded too good to pass. And I am glad I didn't! The place is a hipster magnet but good breakfast joint. I liked the interior. And anyone who has a garbage pail poster is awesome in my book.

excerpts: We split a Buster Brownie and a Dreamsicle milkshake (two paper straws!), both classically delicious.
But for added coolness, take note of the candy display.
Knight Rider trading cards!
dreamsicle.author: Maximillian M.
dreamsicle.review: Just came here for dessert. Yes, they've been around forever, and the decor will absolutely remind you of that, right down to the graphic design in the signage and menus. We split a Buster Brownie and a Dreamsicle milkshake (two paper straws!), both classically delicious. But for added coolness, take note of the candy display. Knight Rider trading cards!

excerpts: the dreamsicle shake was great.
service so-so, took 10 plus minutes to flag our waitress down to get the bill.
worth another shot, but bummed it did not meet the standards i had set for it on round one.
dreamsicle.author: Adrienne G.
dreamsicle.review:
disappointing, worth a second try. had been excited to try this place. 
first off annoyed, we got there and requested a table and were told this was the busy time so we had to sit at the bar, 3/4 of the tables were empty the entire time we were there. next i am allergic to bell peppers, i ordered the corned beef hash......with  per the menu "green onions" meal arrived and was 40% bell pepper, and i could not eat it. if you are going to stress there are green onions stress bell peppers also, hash is typically potatoes and onions only. the dreamsicle shake was great. service so-so, took 10 plus minutes to flag our waitress down to get the bill. 
worth another shot, but bummed it did not meet the standards i had set for it on round one.

excerpts: Recommended item: Chef's Mess and a root beer float for dessert.
root beer float.author: Joy A.
root beer float.review:
Recommended item: Chef's Mess and a root beer float for dessert. 

Good for brunch, good service, nice place.

excerpts: Straws positioned in root beer float positioned so that pushing down ice cream causes root beer to shoot out in a high arc.
Snarky hipsters I can do without.
Wannabe lumber jack manager (Really you can sit at the bar... (only to me, nobody else there) oddly disturbing., though probably the nicest of the oh so cool bunch.
Somebody give those puppies a copy of Danny Meyers' book.
root beer float.author: Otto S.
root beer float.review:
might be great if you are in the fold of the desired customer - ie hip, not over about 40 old and in a group.  I cannot remember being made to feel so  out of place, so admonished (re asking for white bread toast) and so insignificant (I don't tell guests what the sides are. I can show you where to read them().  Food is OK (BLT with julienned lettuce..how precious) to sub mediocre (fading fruit salad..how hard is that to make?Bacon overcooked)  Straws positioned in root beer float positioned so that pushing down ice cream causes root beer to shoot out in a high arc. 
Snarky hipsters I can do without.Wannabe lumber jack manager (Really you can sit at the bar... (only to me, nobody else there) oddly disturbing., though probably the nicest of the oh so cool bunch. Somebody give those puppies a copy of Danny Meyers' book.

excerpts: She also had a root beer float.
root beer float.author: Rebecca S.
root beer float.review:
This place was a fountain for many years, and still sells sodas and shakes, but it's mainly a vegan/vegetarian resturant still trying to masquerade as an old fashioned fountain/diner.  They need to change their name.

Went there for breakfast and ordered sausage and biscuits. They said the biscuits were homemade, but they would have been better off using Pillsbury. The biscuits were heavy, starchy and undercooked. The sausage gravy had a weird herbal taste to it. Fine if that is what you are expecting.

My friend had vegan chorizo and eggs, which really was pretty good (the reason for the three stars).

She also had a root beer float. $4.35 for a tablespoon of tasteless ice cream in the bottom of a glass only 3/4 filled with root beer.

If you're a vegan/vegetarian you will like this place, but you won't if you're expecting a diner.

excerpts: Root beer float.
That'd be swell.
aw shucks
root beer float.author: Joshua K.
root beer float.review:
Stoked, brah! 80's Topps collectors' cards.  Alf? Bmx? Knight Rider? Tron? YES. aside from food and drink, you can come here as if you were going to an old tyme soda fountain (turns out they are one) and get random old candy (probably actually old) and cool packs of trading cards (you will pay way more than you did in 1982-7).  

Experience:  Yeah, yeah hipster this, fixie that.  I already knew going in that I would probably see/talk to/overhear/smell the b.o. of a dozen of 'em.  It's all good, you know why?  These were the nicest people I've ever been served by.  Who knows what they were saying when they went back to the kitchen, but who cares?  When it came to actual customer service, they killed it.  Absolutely killed.  Better service than I've had in this great food city, or any other.  Sounds unbelievable, I know.  I happen to be a customer service expert.  I could run circles around any service person.  These dudes were amazing.  I honestly feel the main reason I am gushing about this, is simply because they all took really good care of my kids, their twin cousins- who had their own table.  If you can nail that aspect of serving diners, you will have customers for generations.  Obviously, they have done so before me.  

Food:  Deeeeeelicious hotcakes.  I love hotcakes/pancakes.  The kids all had Kiddie cakes, which came out like a famous looking mouse.  Wonderful idea, they all loved 'em.  I had hog cakes, which is pancakes with green onions and bacon in the batter.  OINK.  devoured.  We also had some medium sized plates stuffed with large sized portions, which is kinda good, kinda bad, but in the end turns out to be way more than it looks like it's gonna be.  Great food.  I also had an espresso malted milkshake with an added shot (of espresso, ya big dummy!).  Waker upper!  These dudes also got skills making coffee drinks, which is a huge plus on an early Sunday morning after a really late Saturday night.  big plus for me and the lady.  

Outcome: We made it in close to when they opened, so we were able to sit right away at two adjacent booths.  When we left, the place was packed all over, with a long wait outside.  We won!  We will for sure be back, just as long as we go early.  Them hipsters like to wake up late!

Note: watch what you add on, the prices will creep up on the bill if you're not careful...  (something like a city health tax? extra bacon?) either way, you should be cautious wherever you dine I guess.  

Maybe I'll come get an actual fountain drink next time.  Root beer float.  That'd be swell.  aw shucks

excerpts: I actually wanted a blended root beer float (sometimes known as a frozen root beer or a root beer freeze).
That was too "off the menu" for them, which was disappointing.
root beer float.author: Timothy O.
root beer float.review:
It's Sunday afternoon. I'm on the couch at my friend's place, and we both realize that we've slept in. I mean we've seriously slept in. She wants breakfast; I just want something to eat. So we walk the six blocks or so to St. Francis Fountain and add our names to the tiny (for this time of day) waiting list.

We get a seat, and I'm happy I decided to wear my beard today. Checking out the wait staff, I would have felt naked without one. Looking over the menu, I saw lots of egg dishes, which led me to think I really wanted lunch. Plus, they had a large fountain menu with Mitchell's ice cream. I actually wanted a blended root beer float (sometimes known as a frozen root beer or a root beer freeze). That was too "off the menu" for them, which was disappointing. After all, it's not like they didn't have the ingredients... or the blender because I wound up ordering a chocolate shake with my Modesto Pesto chicken sandwich. (By the way, I regularly drive through Modesto, and there aren't as many hipsters or as much pesto as the menu here would suggest.)

Anyway, my friend swore that the best huevos rancheros in the City can be found here. I was skeptical, but then again, I'm not an egg man. While I appreciated both the sentiment and the sentimentality of the red-and-white paper straws mentioned by other reviewers, I was delighted on my second visit to discover a plastic straw came with my milkshake. Now unencumbered by 1930's technology, I declare their straight chocolate milkshake the best ever.

Prices were reasonable for the value.

excerpts: so i'll get a root beer float next time
root beer float.author: Janet W.
root beer float.review:
the online menu does not do it justice
theres quite a few things missing on theyre online menu for breakfast
they serve VEGAN PANCAKES
do u know how happy i was when i saw that?!
i ordered the strawberry vegan pancakes - the pancakes had a hint of cinnamon - yum!
you can order REAL Maple syrup - omg drooling just thinking bout it and overused it just a bit when i was there

we ordered a side of fries to share - a lil bit on the salty side but it was purty good
it had the skin on it
the ketchup was not heins - i can tell that much

we sat in the booth - pretty squishy small booth
im uncomfortable hangin my stuff on the coat racks so i kept it on
it wasn't hot anyways so didnt bother me so much
you will definitely touch the arm of the person sitting next to u especially if they are a medium sz guy

there was only one person working in the beginning
(the other one showed up later)
so it took him awhile to take our orders
but otherwise it was all good
food came in moderate time

but they ran out of the only soy ice cream - so i'll get a root beer float next time

they sell candy in the front plus certain trading cards - that was cool
prices were very decent overall

i cant wait to go bk jus a lil inconvenient for me

excerpts: They also have a Guinness float!
I usually go there for lunch when I'm at work.
guinness float.author: Eugenia W.
guinness float.review:
I love that they serve breakfast during lunch and I can get a milk shake for breakfast. They also have a Guinness float! I usually go there for lunch when I'm at work. Parking is not bad, street parking. 

They have these old school collectible cards like garbage pail kids... old school candies too.

excerpts:
Under Red & White Stripe Awning & Chocolate Brown Walls
Service:  Nice & Friendly Hipsters
Imbibe:  Egg-Cream Soda & Guinness Float
Devour:

The Griddle & Breakfast Burrito
Total:  $27.48
 Note:
Happy Labor Day, Everybody!!!
guinness float.author: Genevieve Y.
guinness float.review:
Date & Time:  Monday September 7, 2009 @ 1:30pm
Company:  Michael & Jack
Crowd:  Groups of Hipsters
Vibe:  Nostalgic
Decor:  Charming Old-Fashioned Soda Fountain & Ice Cream Parlor.  Counter-Seating for Burgers & Shakes, Wooden Booths & Al Fresco Under Red & White Stripe Awning & Chocolate Brown Walls
Service:  Nice & Friendly Hipsters
Imbibe:  Egg-Cream Soda & Guinness Float
Devour:  The Griddle & Breakfast Burrito
Total:  $27.48
 Note:  Happy Labor Day, Everybody!!!

excerpts: Next time I'm having the Guinness Float for breakfast.
guinness float.author: Justin S.
guinness float.review:
The breakfast here is five star.   Go here today.

This is the true old school 1950's coffee shop from the movies. Bursting with charm and appeal  with wax-paper straws and an old wooden phone booth. Come for the breakfast, it is not to be missed.

This hipster run coffee shop is extremely friendly and makes the dinning experience wonderful with their attentive manner but the coffee is absolutely horrific. The coffee is bad, just don't drink it. Next time I'm having the Guinness Float for breakfast.

Total: $27. for two great breakfast and a really bad coffee.

excerpts: They also have malts, shakes, sundaes, floats including a Guinness Float!
guinness float.author: Rinky N.
guinness float.review:
Success!  Scored a table for 4 with no wait!

Ate here yesterday with my 4 member Birthday Girl Club.  Every month b-day or not we go for an outing which always includes eating!

I was thwarted in my attempt to eat here last year since there was a humongous line!

We could easily have spent an hour reading their extensive menu.  There is something for everyone.  If you can't find anything to eat from the menu then you must be from another planet.

The breakfast menu has at least 20 different kind of 2 or 3 egg omelets, french toast, pancakes, waffles, 4 kinds of tofu scrambles
and much more.

They have lots of choices for Vegans including Vegan Ruebens!


They also have malts, shakes, sundaes, floats including a Guinness Float!

So collectively we had:

Pancakes, Biscuits, home fries, eggs, pesto tofu scramble.Vegan sausage, Vegan chorizo hash, an omelet, ww toast,Chocolate malt, coffee and tea!

So yummy and filling!  We had little and big tastes of each other's dishes and give St FF 7 thumbs up!

The pancakes were fluffy, the potatoes had crispy edges, the tofu pesto scramble was yummy, the biscuits were light and buttery-mmm,
and the malt was luscious!

We're looking forward to eating here soon and having lunch!

Our server was super sweet and attentive,


The candy counter had wax lips!  Sugar Daddies!  Bubble Gum packs from Three's Company, Bo Derek, to name a few;  Button candy!
Garbage Pail kids candy!  Pop Rocks! 

Talk about Blasts From the Past!

We'll be back again during another hopefully uncrowded time!

excerpts: I will definitely come back for the Guinness float or some of the other breakfast dish.
Also it's time to start up the Garbage Pail Kids card collection again.
guinness float.author: Angelo F.
guinness float.review:
After a long night of ringing in another year of Amy goodness. Kristina, Adam, Christopher, Nanako, and I head off to brunch. I had just eaten 4 hours ago so I intended to have some OJ. 

The place is a total throw back to a 1980's burger/malt diner, complete w/ classics like Tron and Garbage Pail Kids trading cards (originals, not reprints!!!). There is a line outside and everyone in the party must be present to be seated, luckily it isn't raining yet. 

We are seated in a comfy booth and are drink orders are taken immediately. Just water for me. 

Perusing the menu, I give in and order the "Nebulous Potato Thing" ($6.75) which is basically home fries w/ sour cream, salsa, green onions, melted cheese. It takes about 15-20 mins for the food to come out. It looks smaller than it is because the plate it comes on is actually a wide bowl. There is plenty of food there. I slather on the ketchup, hot sauce and pepper until I have red hott mess in front of me. 

It was so good and filling, I didn't eat till 10:00 that night, and that is after a hike in Marin. I will definitely come back for the Guinness float or some of the other breakfast dish. Also it's time to start up the Garbage Pail Kids card collection again.

excerpts: spinach salad, every vegan thing on the menu, and the Guinness float.
guinness float.author: Kevin C.
guinness float.review: So Good in so many ways! spinach salad, every vegan thing on the menu, and the Guinness float.

excerpts:
* Guinness float
Their breakfast burrito
* MILKSHAKES
guinness float.author: Melissa Y.
guinness float.review:
Sorta shocked I haven't reviewed St Francis yet.  I used to live across the street and would occasionally get breakfast to go and have a kickass hipster-free backyard picnic.  Those were the days...

Fast forward to now.  I have to get in a car and drive there.  I have to use their bathroom and I occupy my time on line by pretending I'm going to buy something at Candy Corner just like everyone else.  It all feels so pedestrian.

And yet - I keep coming.  I bring my family here. I bring non-SF friends here. In fact, about 70% of the time when asked the question, "Where do you want to go for brunch?" this is my answer.  

Things I love:
* Veggie chili two egg scramble with a side of cornbread and fruit instead of potatoes (can be a bit tough for the gut if paired with their drip coffee) 
* 3 side meal: mac & cheese, cilantro chicken soup, and a house salad. 
* Tasty drip coffee
* Vegan sausage two egg scramble with a side of toast and fruit instead of potatoes
* Guinness float
* Their breakfast burrito
* MILKSHAKES
* Nebulous potato thing (split with friends cuz it's huge)
* Mitchell's ice cream

excerpts: They serve a Guinness float.
I'm inspired to have a party here poodle-skirts and letterman jackets required. . .
guinness float.author: Kia B.
guinness float.review:
Yummmy, yummmy.
Had a wholesome malt-shop date on friday night and I loved it.
This is the place to swoon and make "googly-eyes" at each other while sharing a classic hot fudge sundae generously topped with whipped cream nuts and yes a cherry. 
*AND* They have an all soy shake.
*AND* They serve a Guinness float.
I'm inspired to have a party here poodle-skirts and letterman jackets required. . .

excerpts: Also good for ice cream, most notably the brownie sundae and the iconic Guinness Float.
guinness float.author: Jeff R.
guinness float.review:
We live about 100 yards from this place, and that's one of the best parts of living in the Mission. 

There's always a wait for brunch, and there's a good reason for that. Everything is good, especially the pancakes and the corned beef hash. My roommate swears by the Nebulous Potato Thing. 

Also good for ice cream, most notably the brownie sundae and the iconic Guinness Float. Oh and great burgers.

St. Francis is def. a Scene Kid Diner, but the way I see it, that only results in a better soundtrack. Ladytron at brunch? Yes, please.

Great job!

excerpts: Malts, ice cream, beer, Guinness float all excellent.
But, if you're here on Saturday or Sunday morning it is packed with aging hipsters that didn't realize the early '00s are over.
These are the types that still listen to Postal Service and Death Cab.
I once spit on one of these hipsters because they looked prettier than me.
I'm a guy, and don't look pretty, so I had to spit.
guinness float.author: Ben H.
guinness float.review: Food = Excellent.  Shakes = Excellent.  Malts, ice cream, beer, Guinness float all excellent.  But, if you're here on Saturday or Sunday morning it is packed with aging hipsters that didn't realize the early '00s are over.  These are the types that still listen to Postal Service and Death Cab.  I once spit on one of these hipsters because they looked prettier than me.  I'm a guy, and don't look pretty, so I had to spit.

excerpts: But this review is dedicated for their old fashioned milkshake!

I found milkshakes are sometimes too sweet or too thick, but this one is just perfect :)
Lastly, love love love the paper straw for several reasons...
old fashioned milkshake.author: Verena S.
old fashioned milkshake.review:
"Sweet"

I haven't tried any of their food...But this review is dedicated for their old fashioned milkshake!
I found milkshakes are sometimes too sweet or too thick, but this one is just perfect :)
Lastly, love love love the paper straw for several reasons...

excerpts: I also got a strawberry straight shake.
The burgers were very diner-esque, perfect portion, and tasty tasty tasty.
The buns were just the right softness, and the cheese was melted fine.
The fries were pretty good (medium thickness and crispy enough) and the homefries had good seasoning.
straight shake.author: Angela H.
straight shake.review:
We've come here twice in the past two weeks.

First time, my boyfriend and I got burgers with cheese and/or avocado with a side of fries and homefries. I also got a strawberry straight shake. The burgers were very diner-esque, perfect portion, and tasty tasty tasty. The buns were just the right softness, and the cheese was melted fine. The fries were pretty good (medium thickness and crispy enough) and the homefries had good seasoning. My strawberry shake definitely hit the spot.

For our second trip there, we got a chicken salad and a reuben with chicken vegetable soup. I loved how the soup was served piping hot. It was a little salty though. The reuben was very good, not too salty, not too greasy. Bread was perfected toasted with just enough butter and went well with the melted cheese and just the right amount of pastrami. My boyfriend's chicken salad was good enough (not disgusting and not amazing). We also got a mint ice cream for dessert. I like softer ice cream, so I thought the texture was great.

Both time we spent between $26-32. Service is a little on the slow side, but still quite friendly.

excerpts: Perhaps that is why I love the Dream Shake (pictured) so much.
dream shake.author: Wilhelm Y.
dream shake.review:
I love the extensive menu at St. Francis Fountain filled with assorted egg combinations and different breakfast choices along with great burgers and of course, ice cream treats.  I have yet to try anything bad at this restaurant.  In order to be thorough they also have soups, salads and some vegetarian items on the menu that I have never tried.

On my most recent visit I ordered one of my menu favorites, the Chef's Mess (pictured).  This is an egg scrambler that combines their homefries, bacon pieces and sliced mushrooms.  Cheddar and jack cheese are melted on top of the scrambler then diced tomatoes, a dollop of sour cream and chopped green onions finish the dish.  Your choice of toast comes with this selection.

On my second most recent visit I had the Hamburger with Bacon and Cheddar (also pictured).  All of their burgers are cooked medium well unless of course you ask otherwise, and these are thick, lean, beefy patties.  The menu states that they are 6 oz. patties.  The base burger comes with shredded lettuce, sliced tomato, a few thin strings of red onion and a couple of pickle chips.  The burger had a thick slice of cheddar melted on top of the patty along with two thick strips of crispy bacon that I had to crumble in half in order to make it fit.  The price is on the steeper side, but the burger is delicious.

Burgers and sandwiches come with French Fries on the side.  I like how they are fried up crispy with the skin intact.  If you are not into the fried potatoes however, there are several other sides you can choose from including salad, soup, chili, mac and cheese or fruit.

They serve Mitchell's ice cream at St. Francis Fountain with about a dozen flavors.  I don't let my lactose intolerance bother me ever.  I carry Lactaid tablets with me at all times, and I enjoy ordering ice cream items.  My favorite flavor combination has always been vanilla ice cream with orange sherbet.  That's right the Dreamsicle combo.  Perhaps that is why I love the Dream Shake (pictured) so much.

I sit at the counter most of the time because I enjoy watching the waitress make my shake with a light pour of whole milk, a shot of Torani vanilla syrup, orange sherbet and vanilla ice cream.  One of the waitresses with short dark hair makes a real kick ass milkshake.  Sorry but I always forget to ask her name.  She leaves the shake on the mixer for a super long time and the result is a shake so thick the long metal spoon will stand up in the middle of the glass for a good half hour after the shake has been made.  Don't ask why, but I tried it once (the spoon caper, that is).

The service is usually pretty good as the wait staff are really cool.

Although I have a long time to go before I can exercise the ten percent senior discount here I'm hopeful that San Francisco's oldest ice cream parlor will still be here serving up a great menu and delicious ice cream treats.

excerpts: Awesome Dream Shake by the way (your "old school" straw will fall apart... as for a 2!).
However, our server (who was a brunette with a symmetrical bob hair cut) was rude and not that engaging, and looked at us weird after we ordered only ONE milk shake for the both of us.
We were being romantic you stooge hipster.
dream shake.author: Wel S.
dream shake.review:
I give this place a 4, and I'll tell you why it didnt make the cut on 5.

My wife and I went here after eating dinner next door, and got a milk shake.  Awesome Dream Shake by the way (your "old school" straw will fall apart... as for a 2!).  However, our server (who was a brunette with a symmetrical bob hair cut) was rude and not that engaging, and looked at us weird after we ordered only ONE milk shake for the both of us.  We were being romantic you stooge hipster.  LOL

HOWEVER!!!  Don't let that fool you.  We went for breakfast and the service was AMAZING!!!  We had a server who took our order, and he was SO... SOOOOOO enthusiastic that it was like talking to one of my close friends!  I recommend them for breakfast on the weekends.  And don't sit outside (  cus that's where we sit!  pppppt!!!  :)p  )

Their menu is extensive.  What we ordered was AMAZING... I had veggie chorizo with poached egges and she had corn beef and hash with biscuits and the biscuits were AMAZING! Fresh O.J. too!!! Definitely, we are now local patrons of this place.  THANK YOU MORNING STAFF!!!  You guys were wonderful!!!  But to the girl, who seemed to be having a bad night... I'm sorry to have made you look like you just discovered poopie on your shoes.  Still... suck it up.

It could very well have been that at breakfast we were dressed a little more street/hipsterish, which in our case is more cholo mexicano style (since we are mexican americans - thanks hipsters for stealing our cultural style!!!) and for dessert we were a little more dressed up  (my wife is a fashion instructor at a local college).  Still, just because the mission is half Hipster, half Mexican community, doesn't give this PARTICULAR waitress the right to be an elitist or even act like one for that matter.  I've read some other reviews and she seems to be the odd one out.  It's unfortunate, but the service staff in the morning are worth one bad apple.

This is now our regular dining spot on Sunday mornings, and living only 4 blocks away helps.  Last time I we went we had the Griddle Combos, and Eggs Benedict.  BOTH WONDERFULLY DELICIOUS!!!

Note to staff and owner:  Remember, this is our neighborhood, respect that we are not tourists.  YOU NEVER KNOW!!!!!

excerpts: A few items that made this place worth the wait were the Nebulous Potato Thing and the old fashioned Dream Shake (complete with paper straws).
dream shake.author: Chadwick F.
dream shake.review:
There are a number of reasons why I believe this place to be absolute tops when it comes to Bay Area brunch.  The diner has a traditional aesthetic to love.  Like any true diner, it features a bar that can accommodate lots of customers.  St. Francis is not a large establishment, but even on a busy Sunday the wait was not long at all.  

A few items that made this place worth the wait were the Nebulous Potato Thing and the old fashioned Dream Shake (complete with paper straws).  One thing I just can never turn down are the traditional biscuits and gravy; a dish that St. Francis has perfected seemingly just for me.

St. Francis Fountain earns five stars from me for taking a traditional American diner setting/menu and adding a very genuine dose of creativity to the formula.  They do a great job welcoming the latin flavors and influences from the neighborhood and translating them into a lengthy delicious menu that has something for everyone.  

Thanks for taking credit cards.  Service is fast and friendly.

excerpts: Espresso milkshake is perfectly executed - vanilla loves cafe.
Order the large.
Just when you thought the fun was over, the shaker has a whole extra glass of frothy goodness waiting for ya!
espresso milkshake.author: Alison R.
espresso milkshake.review:
Perfect Sunday hangover diner cure for carnivores with veggie/vegan friends!

The Veggie Mess has the best of all worlds: spuds, chorizo, gooey cheeses. Ask for jalapeños to get that extra kick! Order is large enough for 2 ppl or an extra kick in' hangover.

For the bread options, choose cornbread over banana bread... Unless you have a sweet tooth. Nice n toasty, Thick like a brick! 

Espresso milkshake is perfectly executed - vanilla loves cafe. Order the large. Just when you thought the fun was over, the shaker has a whole extra glass of frothy goodness waiting for ya!

excerpts: so I can enjoy the Coffee/Espresso Milkshake.
espresso milkshake.author: Matt G.
espresso milkshake.review:
Have you ever feel imminent and in-demand to try a restaurant, but for some reason your proposed target spot(s) is/are closed and/or crowded with a "long" wait. We all experienced that many times, have we? "Stop lying and admit it that we all been through that!" 

Whenever I've needed to work in the 24th Street area, I've been here nearly a dozen times on my quick break; just for the milkshakes. But when I'm hungry, this 50's-like corner-diner has a long wait. So I ended up eating elsewhere for my lunch intermission. You want to talk about perfect-timing in desires and apathy. Go figure! 

Today and with the recent nice weather, lunchtime at noon was crowded with a long wait. So I, like I aforementioned, ate elsewhere. I did came back like around three o'clock where everybody is working or enjoying the weather elsewhere so I can enjoy the Coffee/Espresso Milkshake. For $5.00, the milkshake is made with coffee ice cream and espresso shots and other dairy mixture with a cloud of whipped cream and a cute maraschino cherry on top for that perfect shake. (I get too overwhelmed by saying "cute maraschino cherry"). 

I also got a $3.00 bowl of fruit that has sliced apples, pineapple, strawberries, grapes and cantaloupes to complete my snack on my break. I actually enjoy the variety of milkshakes made at this diner, but my review is incomplete until I eat something from here. 

Paid my meal in cash and a favorite of Yelp too.

excerpts: The espresso milkshake w coffee ice cream cannot be beat.
espresso milkshake.author: Willow B.
espresso milkshake.review:
Delicious. 

The espresso milkshake w coffee ice cream cannot be beat. 

I can't believe I live 5minutes from this place & just found out about it.  Good hangover food, large portions, good vibe & friendly staff. So many great choices on the menu, especially for breakfast.  

I will definitely be returning. again & again & again.

excerpts: I decided on the vegan blueberry pancakes and thought they were okay, but not worth coming back for.
I'm pretty sure I could make something equally good at home if I tried.
My mom isn't vegan, so got a standard breakfast of eggs, fried potatoes, and toast.
She seemed fairly satisfied with her breakfast, so maybe this place is a-okay for omnivores.
blueberry.author: Regina W.
blueberry.review:
I came here on a Saturday morning with my mom after I heard you could get vegan brunch here even though overall it was a non-vegan place. 

First of all, I thought this place was going to be a little more upscale, but found out instead that it's a dive that's been around for a very long time. While the menu had a few vegan options, it seems to cater more to vegetarians than to vegans. I didn't actually see too many clearly marked vegan dishes and felt that I had to scan the menu a bit to see what I could actually order. 

I decided on the vegan blueberry pancakes and thought they were okay, but not worth coming back for. I'm pretty sure I could make something equally good at home if I tried. My mom isn't vegan, so got a standard breakfast of eggs, fried potatoes, and toast. She seemed fairly satisfied with her breakfast, so maybe this place is a-okay for omnivores. On the plus side, I thought the prices were reasonable and appreciated not getting ripped off. 

Overall, I won't come back unless they create a separate vegan menu and up their game on quality.

excerpts: I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash.
The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety.
This is neither better nor worse, just different.
They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat.
blueberry.author: Ed M.
blueberry.review:
An old-school diner with lots of vegan options? Let's go!

I was amazed by the sheer number of vegetarian and vegan options offered at St. Francis Fountain. They have tofu scrambles, vegan chorizo hash, vegan pancakes, vegan sausage patties, veggie chili, garden burgers and seitan melts! They even have veganaise and Earth Balance Buttery Spread.

I ordered the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of vegan chorizo hash. The pancakes are more dense and chewy than your typical buttermilk variety. This is neither better nor worse, just different. They were bursting with blueberries, which was a treat. The vegan chorizo hash is quite oily (as hash often is), but it's quite tasty. They served it with the Earth Balance spread, which I had never tried before. It's pretty similar to a salted, whipped butter.

My partner ordered the Polar Melt on light rye. The seitan is well seasoned. If you like patty melts and the like, this is a great veggie option (it came with jack cheese, which you can probably leave off it you want to go vegan). It's one of the best melts I've tasted in a long time!

They carry Mitchell's ice cream and La Copa Loca gelato for desserts and fountain drinks. They also have vanilla soy as a non-dairy option. We didn't try any of these since we were so full from our meals. Maybe next time.

Their brewed coffee is pleasantly strong and their staff is quite friendly. Combined with a big, tasty meal, it's hard to leave without a smile on your face. It's not the healthiest place to eat (it is an old-school diner after all!), but the veggie and vegan options really show how almost every other restaurant out there is really dropping the ball when it comes to plant-based dining!

excerpts: My friend got the blueberry pancakes which she also loved.
blueberry.author: Cynthia R.
blueberry.review:
This place is awesome! Obviously came from the Yelp reviews and hype and I must say it's worth it. I got the banana walnut pancakes (vegan) and they were delicious. My friend got the blueberry pancakes which she also loved. 
A little upset though because I wanted to try the "Vegan Thing" but realized it want on their menu when I went. although when I asked, they did have it, but they did not have the guacamole so I decided to pass. 
Customer service was great and we waited probably 15 minutes for a spot on a Sunday morning. I would definitely come again!

excerpts: She ordered blueberry sourdough French toast after asking the waiter if the blueberries were fresh.
He said yes.
The blueberries may have been fresh days before that, they definitely were not fresh.
The waiter didn't show back up to out table after, I had to grab a different waiter to pay the bill.
I finished my pancakes, her French toast was pretty much left intact.
I lost points that morning.
Fellas, don't take a date there.
blueberry.author: Aaron T.
blueberry.review: Took a friend there the other day. My banana nut pancakes were pretty good. She ordered blueberry sourdough French toast after asking the waiter if the blueberries were fresh. He said yes. The blueberries may have been fresh days before that, they definitely were not fresh. The waiter didn't show back up to out table after, I had to grab a different waiter to pay the bill. I finished my pancakes, her French toast was pretty much left intact. I lost points that morning. Fellas, don't take a date there.

excerpts: We found parking right in front and it wasn't super busy, so we took a seat and made our decisions, she got the strawberry vegan pancakes with a side of vegan sausage patties and I got the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of potatoes, we split everything and were stuffed by time we finished.
The blueberry pancakes are loaded with fruit with an option for vegan butter too if you'd like.
The potatoes are done perfectly, just enough crispyness and softness inside to make them perfect, plus the herbs in them rock!
My daughter ate all the vegan sausage patties, mumbling how good those were too, all in all, it was a great success, we'll definitely be back soon.
blueberry.author: Garden R.
blueberry.review:
I had to give St. Francis Fountain a try after so many vegan friends have sworn up and down this is a great place to eat, very much vegan comfort food at it's best. I took one of my daughters and we went for brunch, I was in the mood for some vegan pancakes. We found parking right in front and it wasn't super busy, so we took a seat and made our decisions, she got the strawberry vegan pancakes with a side of vegan sausage patties and I got the vegan blueberry pancakes with a side of potatoes, we split everything and were stuffed by time we finished.

Everything tastes so good, I can't believe we ate it all! The blueberry pancakes are loaded with fruit with an option for vegan butter too if you'd like. The potatoes are done perfectly, just enough crispyness and softness inside to make them perfect, plus the herbs in them rock! My daughter ate all the vegan sausage patties, mumbling how good those were too, all in all, it was a great success, we'll definitely be back soon.

Keep up the good work and thanks for offering the non-animal meals, its nice to have those options for the whole family.

excerpts: Vegan Blueberry Pancakes were repeated back to us twice with "Buttermilk Pancakes".
So once that confusion was solved our order came out extremely fast to the point were we thought it wasn't ours.
So what did we get instead of Vegan Blueberry Pancakes?
That's right,
a Vegan Breakfast Burrito...
Huh?
It turned out to be a good thing since they asked if we would like to keep the burrito while they would whip up the correct pancake order.
Free food?
Those Vegan Blueberry Pancakes that took some haggling to get weren't too bad.
I like blueberries as much as anyone
but I think they went a little buck wild with the blueberry scooper.
The entire center was blueberries.
They were good, not great.
blueberry.author: John B.
blueberry.review:
While Yelp searching places in the area for a good Vegan breakfast/brunch I found there are several quality options around here. St. Francis Fountain just happened to be the pick of the day. And what a good choice it was...

Old school 50's style dining brought to you by Mission Hipsters. I had read reviews that stated the servers here are aloof or dirty. I found the opposite to be true for the most part. Our coffee and water never got empty without being refilled. The food came out to the table lightning quick as well. 

The only mishap was when our waitress was a bit... ok, very confused while taking our order. Vegan Blueberry Pancakes were repeated back to us twice with "Buttermilk Pancakes". So once that confusion was solved our order came out extremely fast to the point were we thought it wasn't ours. So what did we get instead of Vegan Blueberry Pancakes? That's right, a Vegan Breakfast Burrito... Huh? It turned out to be a good thing since they asked if we would like to keep the burrito while they would whip up the correct pancake order. Free food? Score!

The Tofu Scramble with Ranchero was delicious even though it appeared to be undercooked and not very scrambled. Since I don't eat with my eyes I dove into the flavors of all the Ranchero sauce mixed with the tofu, mushrooms and green onions. One of the better tasting scrambles I've had in awhile. Coupled with a generous portion of tasty spuds along with a few slices of toast, this is a huge shareable dish.  

Those Vegan Blueberry Pancakes that took some haggling to get weren't too bad. I like blueberries as much as anyone but I think they went a little buck wild with the blueberry scooper. The entire center was blueberries. They were good, not great. I would probably get one of the other Vegan options next time.

That free Vegan Breakfast Burrito plate was something I would consider ordering next visit. The black beans on the side had a bit of a chili kick to them. Very tasty. The filling was consisted mostly of a Vegan jack cheese. Not sure what they use but it was a change of pace from the usual burrito. 

A pretty cool atmosphere along with all the great Vegan options makes this a place you should check out at least once to see if it's for you.

excerpts:
Some favorites include:
* Blueberry pancakes - the wife must have blueberry pancakes fairly frequently or suffer the ills of some unstated dire curse.
Along with a side of eggs, these blueberry pancakes appear to stave off the evil.
* Hogcakes - pancakes with cheese, green onions, and bacon cooked into them.
So very yum!
* Omelets - Big two egg omelets with whatever you want in them.
They come with a side of crispy, spiced, fried potatoes that people who eat potatoes seem to love.
blueberry.author: Ivan L.
blueberry.review:
St. Francis Fountain - where the hip come to dine and the tourists come to watch them.

We head to St. Francis @ 9:50 something AM on the weekends and catch an outside table as soon as the open up @ 10 AM.  There's just 4 or 5 of them but there's plenty of space for two people and one dog.  Lately the outside tables are getting claimed by tourists with suit cases and Noe drive-ins with their strollers and SUVs.  Stay away from my table people!

The breakfast food is top notch!  Some favorites include:
* Blueberry pancakes - the wife must have blueberry pancakes fairly frequently or suffer the ills of some unstated dire curse.  Along with a side of eggs, these blueberry pancakes appear to stave off the evil.
* Hogcakes - pancakes with cheese, green onions, and bacon cooked into them.  So very yum!
* Omelets - Big two egg omelets with whatever you want in them.  They come with a side of crispy, spiced, fried potatoes that people who eat potatoes seem to love. 
* Nebulous potato thing - Uh... it's like potatoes and other stuff like kinda put together.  You know?
* Banana bread - sweet and yummy
* Corn beef hash - greasy, with peppers and potatoes and beef.  It'll make your stomach cry out, "No more!" and then "Okay, a little more!"

excerpts: This last time, we split a Chef's Mess and Blueberry Pancakes.
Both were outstanding.
I loved that the pancakes actually had blueberries in the batter as opposed to just compote on the top, which so many places are doing these days.
blueberry.author: Tara M.
blueberry.review:
We've been here twice for breakfast, and both times we've loved it. 

This last time, we split a Chef's Mess and Blueberry Pancakes. Both were outstanding. I loved that the pancakes actually had blueberries in the batter as opposed to just compote on the top, which so many places are doing these days. I also ordered a side of bacon which was cooked perfectly.

The staff is always super friendly and attentive.

I'd love to go back here for dessert - some of their sundaes and banana splits sound amazing!

I will definitely go out of my way to come here and highly recommend it.

excerpts: Blueberry hot cakes were also fantastic.
Their hot cakes taste really fresh and you can really taste the blueberry in em.
blueberry.author: Gloria C.
blueberry.review:
I got major food coma post St. Francis Fountain lunch BUT I think it was worth it.  

Little hipster joint in the mission with some bomb breakfast food that really hits the spot. Got the Chef's Mess which was great. Blueberry hot cakes were also fantastic. Their hot cakes taste really fresh and you can really taste the blueberry in em. 

A few things about this place that I did not like:
-It's a cute diner, but the booth seats are very small.  I consider myself a pretty regular sized asian girl and I fit just right in the booth. It may be uncomfortable if you are a larger sized person!
-The food takes a while. And service is also slow. My waiter was pretty nice but he kept forgetting or mixing up things we asked. For example, we asked him to put our shakes in to-go cups but they came in glasses. I asked for jam but he never got around to bringing it. I wanted a vanilla shake but he kept asking me what flavor I want to put in it, and I ended up with a rocky road shake. 
-Ugh the STRAWS! I love the planet. I love being green but for goodness sake's, the straws are made of paper and mine pretty much flattened and wilted to a deflated wet newspaper texture after a few sips of my shake. How do I enjoy the delicious shake if it refuses to be sipped through the straw?
-They did not have tabasco. Only tapatio... 

These things aside, the food was satisfying and ingredients fresh.  It's not at the top of my list of favorite lunch spots in the mission, but it's definitely a unique hiptastic diner! 

3.5 stars!

excerpts: We shared vegan blueberry pancakes, also scrumptious.
Cool neighborhood with decent parking, good prices, yummy coffee, and we also didn't have to wait too long.
Service was friendly and quick.
blueberry.author: Jenn H.
blueberry.review: Delicious. I had a cheddar veggie scramble, beau had something similar. Bit too much cheese on mine but hey, all good. We shared vegan blueberry pancakes, also scrumptious. Cool neighborhood with decent parking, good prices, yummy coffee, and we also didn't have to wait too long. Service was friendly and quick.

excerpts: The Vegan Blueberry Pancakes, the Vegan Breakfast Burrito, and the Vegan Chorizo Scramble with Tofu was our favorite, (after Hector's).
blueberry.author: Kai S.
blueberry.review:
This place is officially (to us) called Hector's. Due to the irresistible Hector's Waffles. We were in SF for 4 days and we ate here every morning. The vegetarian/vegan options are out of this world... especially for breakfast. The service was amazing, the music was super chill, and everything we ordered was incredible. The Vegan Blueberry Pancakes, the Vegan Breakfast Burrito, and the Vegan Chorizo Scramble with Tofu was our favorite, (after Hector's). 

Support your local businesses people. Even if your an out of towner. The experience is well worth it.

excerpts:
Must try:
- Chef's Mess
- Corned Beef Hash
- Hot Cakes (chocolate chip & blueberry)

Pros:
- Good food!
- Good service
- Clean

Cons:
- Wait is usually long
- Tables are small
blueberry.author: Lisa S.
blueberry.review:
I usually don't have an appetite for breakfast/brunch, but since I was visiting SF my friend took me to this diner that's located around the corner from where she lives.

OMG! They're food is sooo good! I never thought breakfast/brunch could taste sooo good! I always thought: eggs are eggs and pancakes are pancakes. Nothing special. But I was wrong! If I lived in SF I would eat breakfast/brunch all the time!

Must try:
- Chef's Mess
- Corned Beef Hash
- Hot Cakes (chocolate chip & blueberry)

Pros:
- Good food!
- Good service
- Clean

Cons:
- Wait is usually long
- Tables are small

excerpts: Food wise pancakes are good (blueberry)
omelettes are decent fried egg sandwich was ok ...
all in all its a decent little breakfast spot for me and for something sweet there are plenty of great places right at walking distance if your not in a mood for a shake or ice cream.
blueberry.author: Anthony S.
blueberry.review:
Its ok ... cool little hipster/retro kinda place to go. They do serve egg cream sodas which is great, they also have cool milkshakes ... espresso shake, guinniess float and things of that nature ... I been here for nothing but breakfast or brunch .. I never arrived later then 10am and I have never had trouble getting a table or even waiting for that matter .. 
Food wise pancakes are good (blueberry) omelettes are decent fried egg sandwich was ok ...  all in all its a decent little breakfast spot for me and for something sweet there are plenty of great places right at walking distance if your not in a mood for a shake or ice cream. :)

excerpts: Loved the blueberry pancakes - real Maine-style wild blueberries, not those fat tasteless ones from Chile - and thin cakes that I like, not the huge thick ones that will make you full after two bites.
Yeah the booths are small, but they are real wood -
this place has been there for fifty years -
blueberry.author: Joe D.
blueberry.review:
I didn't see any Mission hipsters but then again my friends dragged me out of bed at 8AM to beat the crowd. I guess our waiter was kind of hipsterey but I'm sure he couldn't help it. 

Loved the blueberry pancakes - real Maine-style wild blueberries, not those fat tasteless ones from Chile - and thin cakes that I like, not the huge thick ones that will make you full after two bites. Yeah the booths are small, but they are real wood - this place has been there for fifty years - it's like stepping into a wonderful time machine and going back to 1947. 

I loved the sign on the wall that said "Ice cream is only served in dishes for here, and only in cones to go; NO EXCEPTIONS!"

excerpts: The two flavors, chocolate and blueberry were a great marriage of decadence.
The addition of syrup wasn't extremely necessary, but if added, you'd get blasted with a hot and delicious bite of succulence.
Also on the menu are these "potato things" which look amazing, it comes with scrambled eggs and salsa which my sister got.
She loved it.
My two guy friends loved the burgers that they got and
they said "good burgers are hard to find.
I highly recommend this place to try.
Here is a picture of my blueberry chocolate chip pancakes.
You can see my friend's burger lurking in the background.

blueberry.author: Jessica C.
blueberry.review:
This restaurant is amazing. Each time I go, I fall more in love with this place. From the coffee, to the waitstaff, to the menu, the ambiance is very nice and settling. The menu offers vegan and vegetarian options as well as meat for the meat loving variety. The last time I went there was last Tuesday, March 1st, I ordered chocolate chip pancakes with blueberries on top. They have vegan pancakes as well. I had the vegan strawberry pancakes there before. The pancakes were hot and ready to be devoured. They tasted like victory. The two flavors, chocolate and blueberry were a great marriage of decadence. The addition of syrup wasn't extremely necessary, but if added, you'd get blasted with a hot and delicious bite of succulence.  Also on the menu are these "potato things" which look amazing, it comes with scrambled eggs and salsa which my sister got. She loved it. My two guy friends loved the burgers that they got and they said "good burgers are hard to find." I highly recommend this place to try. Here is a picture of my blueberry chocolate chip pancakes. You can see my friend's burger lurking in the background.

excerpts: I have tried the blueberry, banana walnut, and chocolate chip pancakes.
The chocolate chip pancakes were my favorite!
blueberry.author: Meg P.
blueberry.review:
Awesome selection of vegan brunch food!

I have tried the blueberry, banana walnut, and chocolate chip pancakes. The chocolate chip pancakes were my favorite!

The vegan huevos rancheros and the vegan chorizo dishes were also really good.

The service is also great!

excerpts: I had vegan blueberry pancakes and sausage which was delicious and satisfying.
My husbands potatoes were amazing.
The staff were very friendly and attentive even though we were there during a busy Saturday morning.
Looking forward to go back and try a soy milkshake!
blueberry.author: Brandi S.
blueberry.review: My husband is vegetarian and I'm vegan at the moment. When we were in town looking for a brunch place I was excited to find somewhere that offered me more than a tofu scramble. I had vegan blueberry pancakes and sausage which was delicious and satisfying. My husbands potatoes were amazing. The staff were very friendly and attentive even though we were there during a busy Saturday morning. Looking forward to go back and try a soy milkshake!

excerpts: Service was friendly, attentive, and our server didn't think twice when I ask for whipped cream to go on my blueberry pancakes.
One problem though....
Second time here, I brought Melissa H. with me based on my fond memories of the blueberry pancakes.
Wow! what a difference inebriation makes!
The food was very average and the service was BAD.
What!?!?!
Is there a blueberry shortage?
blueberry.author: Ed V.
blueberry.review:
Ok. As an extreme breakfast connoseuir this place has a certain appeal. It's close to my house and has bacon tasty enough to cure most hangovers.

My first time here the breakfast was excellent! Service was friendly, attentive, and our server didn't think twice when I ask for whipped cream to go on my blueberry pancakes. One problem though.... I was still drunk from the night's debauchery and anything with whipped cream is special to drunk people.

Second time here, I brought Melissa H. with me based on my fond memories of the blueberry pancakes. Wow! what a difference inebriation makes! The food was very average and the service was BAD. What!?!?! Is there a blueberry shortage? These are not the pancakes I remember :-)

Third time! Yes. I'm a glutton for punishment but I had to know the truth. So I decided to use my monk-like patience and brave the saturday morning pile-up. I put on a plain old t-shirt and some regular old jeans. Dressed like this, I am basically invisible. I certainly can't be pegged as a hipster, yuppie, geek (well maybe...),  or any other classification. 
The verdict? Long wait, friendly hipster crowd, great service, average to below averae food (bacon was still good though). It's not worth the wait on weekend mornings but I would definitely check it out at a slower time just to try the creamsicle shake. MMMMMMM.

excerpts: I had the vegan blueberry pancakes which was soooo delicious!
blueberry.author: Liane E.
blueberry.review: I came here after finding it on yelp and decided to give it a try. My friend and I absolutely loved this place! It really is a 50's style diner/malt shop. I decided to come here because of how vegan friendly it seemed to be. The menu is a couple pages and it truly is vegan/vegetarian friendly. My friend had vegetarian chili which she thought was really good. I had the vegan blueberry pancakes which was soooo delicious! I also ordered a vegan butterscotch milkshake. It took a very long time for the shake to come out so they didn't charge us and I ended up. Tip: Ask for a couple straws because the straws are cool looking paper ones which end up being useless after a few sips. I'm really bummed I didn't find out about this place until the day before we left SF :(  I will definitely come back here!

excerpts: Had the blueberry pancakes and they didnt taste all heavy and wheaty like the ones at dharmas in capitola.
These were awesome.
Wife had the french toast which she liked, daughter had the kids grilled cheese and fries, both were very good as well.
Grilled cheese had a yellow and white cheese and loaded with butter.
Perfect.
Will definitely come back to try the potato plate which i kept eying on another table.
Very friendly staff, even when very busy.
blueberry.author: Rav R.
blueberry.review: 5 stars for having vegan options especially pancakes. Had the blueberry pancakes and they didnt taste all heavy and wheaty like the ones at dharmas in capitola. These were awesome. Wife had the french toast which she liked, daughter had the kids grilled cheese and fries, both were very good as well. Grilled cheese had a yellow and white cheese and loaded with butter. Perfect. Will definitely come back to try the potato plate which i kept eying on another table. Very friendly staff, even when very busy.

excerpts: * Dreamsicle (milk, oj, vanilla syrup, vanilla ice cream, orange sherbet, whipped cream, cherry.

$5.75) - 4 stars
Tasty, thick, not too sweet!
cherry.author: Ziyan C.
cherry.review:
No wait for six of us around 1pm on a Saturday! At first we were split between a booth and a couple seats at the bar. After a few minutes, we were all able to sit together at the bar.
