They did mess up a couple of our orders and were a little slow to get them out, but we did end up with a free scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream! You can also personalize whether you want ice cream or cream on top of your floats, and what topping to get on your banana split (caramel, chocolate, etc). 

The ice cream is not my favorite in the city, could be more creamy, but it's still good.

FOUNTAIN CLASSICS
* Dreamsicle (milk, oj, vanilla syrup, vanilla ice cream, orange sherbet, whipped cream, cherry. $5.75) - 4 stars
Tasty, thick, not too sweet! Like an orange soda with vanilla.

* Guiness Float ($7.25) - 4 stars
My boyfriend really liked this!

We also got a banana split in the group. This was a monster of a dish, delicious!

excerpts: It was delicious, dripping in chocolate, whipped cream, almonds and with a cherry on the top.
The people who run the place are really really nice.
I was here for a birthday party and they handled every one so well and with a smile.
The place itself is like a old diner and they sell some cool things like old tattoos etc.
Food is great, people are awesome, place is spacious, i would want to visit here again.
cherry.author: Shreyas P.
cherry.review: So many many vegan option. I had the devils burger. They even use veganise in it. I saw the server making an amazing ice cream for a kid with using the cone as a hat and the scoop as the face. It looked awesome. I make him create a Sundae for me the way he wants with butter scotch ice cream. It was delicious, dripping in chocolate, whipped cream, almonds and with a cherry on the top. The people who run the place are really really nice. I was here for a birthday party and they handled every one so well and with a smile. The place itself is like a old diner and they sell some cool things like old tattoos etc. Food is great, people are awesome, place is spacious, i would want to visit here again.

excerpts:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt
there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'
cherry.author: Michael U.
cherry.review:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760 I finally decided to quell my curiosity, a short walk back just one block landing me at a two-top in the 1918 soda fountain.  Kitschy in décor with toys and trading cards from my youth available for purchase in a glass case while booths and tables sat tightly spaced juxtaposing the Formica bar it would be mere moments before I was greeted by the diner's lone server and confirming hopes of an 'all-day' menu my order quickly took shape, a duo of childhood favorites readied at the counter along with French Toast arriving less than ten minutes later.  Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.  Already all smiles as patrons aged five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'

excerpts: For $5.00, the milkshake is made with coffee ice cream and espresso shots and other dairy mixture with a cloud of whipped cream and a cute maraschino cherry on top for that perfect shake.
(I get too overwhelmed by saying "cute maraschino cherry").
cherry.author: Matt G.
cherry.review:
Have you ever feel imminent and in-demand to try a restaurant, but for some reason your proposed target spot(s) is/are closed and/or crowded with a "long" wait. We all experienced that many times, have we? "Stop lying and admit it that we all been through that!" 

Whenever I've needed to work in the 24th Street area, I've been here nearly a dozen times on my quick break; just for the milkshakes. But when I'm hungry, this 50's-like corner-diner has a long wait. So I ended up eating elsewhere for my lunch intermission. You want to talk about perfect-timing in desires and apathy. Go figure! 

Today and with the recent nice weather, lunchtime at noon was crowded with a long wait. So I, like I aforementioned, ate elsewhere. I did came back like around three o'clock where everybody is working or enjoying the weather elsewhere so I can enjoy the Coffee/Espresso Milkshake. For $5.00, the milkshake is made with coffee ice cream and espresso shots and other dairy mixture with a cloud of whipped cream and a cute maraschino cherry on top for that perfect shake. (I get too overwhelmed by saying "cute maraschino cherry"). 

I also got a $3.00 bowl of fruit that has sliced apples, pineapple, strawberries, grapes and cantaloupes to complete my snack on my break. I actually enjoy the variety of milkshakes made at this diner, but my review is incomplete until I eat something from here. 

Paid my meal in cash and a favorite of Yelp too.

excerpts: They have vanilla and cherry syrup to add to sodas, and they have lots of vegetarian/vegan options.
This provides flexibility when you have friends with restrictions.
- The location is great.
It's a 10-15 minute walk from my house, but you're in the middle of the 24th street corridor.
- The place is a landmark, been in existence since 1920 or something.
cherry.author: Tom P.
cherry.review:
I think St. Francis Fountain is just fine, though it has plenty of room for improvement. 

Let's start with the good: 
- The food is really solid. The Reuben is a great sandwich, and they have great hand-cut fries. They have vanilla and cherry syrup to add to sodas, and they have lots of vegetarian/vegan options. This provides flexibility when you have friends with restrictions. 
- The location is great. It's a 10-15 minute walk from my house, but you're in the middle of the 24th street corridor. 
- The place is a landmark, been in existence since 1920 or something. The decor is very old-timey and true to its original form and purpose. 

Overall, I think these are the ingredients for a solid experience.

But there are some bad things: 
- The crowd and waiters are too cool for school. Oh my goodness, the entire place is filled with ironic hipsters. 
- The prices are kind of high for diner food. $6 for a milkshake is a bit much. 
- To get very nitpicky: GET RID OF THOSE ANNOYING STRAWS. They have paper straws, perhaps in an attempt to seem authentic and "green." Authenticity I don't give one whit about, and for "green"ness just buy normal compostable straws. I go through 2-3 of those dumb paper straws in a meal, and it's annoying as heck. 
- I don't think they do a very good job of clearing out tables or getting new folks in tables on the weekend. There can be 15 people waiting for a table, with three tables empty and three yet to have the previous occupants' dishes cleared. 

Overall, I really do like this place. With a few changes, it could earn 4 stars. With a few changes and a couple of bucks off each menu item, it could easily earn 5 stars.

excerpts: Make sure to get the Cherry Cola to ensure your diner experience.
cherry.author: Sabrina A.
cherry.review:
I decided to get a vegan entree the day I went there since I like soy chorizo and tofu scramble hash.  But it was bland and not very good.  Luckily I got a side of pancakes of banana walnut that were delicious.  I imagine this is the type of place you should get traditional egg dishes at.  The tofu scramble/soyrizo ended up being good the next day and I'm guessing it is because the spices/oils had time to marinate into the tofu.  It didn't seem as bland the next day.  Make sure to get the Cherry Cola to ensure your diner experience.

Since this place is just around the corner from my house I'm sure I'll try it again.

excerpts: BLT and and Egg Cream, followed by a piece of cherry pie?
cherry.author: Liz S.
cherry.review:
I'm pretty sure that diners are my favorite places to eat in the world.  They are such a staple in American culture, the 2nd home of locals and travelers alike, places where you can sit at the counter with a piece of pie and a thick-rimmed cup of coffee and hang your hat for a while.  

St. Francis fountain is representative of my favorite type of diner - one with real history, and with a menu that addresses today's dietary preferences without getting too far away from the Blue Plate Special of decades past.   

Breakfast?  Yep.  Burger and a shake? Yep, yep.  BLT and and Egg Cream, followed by a piece of cherry pie?  Yep, yep, yep.

OK, if all of the above has sold you, I do have to disclose one caveat.  SFF is a Hipster Mecca.  It's the St. Francis Fountain of the Tragically Hip - they runneth over and spilleth onto the street.  That factor can range from slightly to extremely annoying, depending on the length the line and your level of hunger and tolerance.  Since my level of hunger is always at a 10 and tolerance at a 3-4, this would usually keep me away.  However, I like it so much that I find ways to go at off hours in order to avoid killing everyone.  So, this means 11:30am, 3pm, or some such similar hour.

OK!  Back to the positive - GREAT candy counter.  One of the best I have seen.  Hours are just what you want them to be - 8 to 10 - time for breakfast, lunch and supper, and not conducive to late night munchies.  

Burgers and shakes rock, which is the test of diner-worthiness in my book.  Booths are small and date or gossip-session perfect.

excerpts: This is the place to swoon and make "googly-eyes" at each other while sharing a classic hot fudge sundae generously topped with whipped cream nuts and yes a cherry.
AND
They have an all soy shake.
AND
cherry.author: Kia B.
cherry.review:
Yummmy, yummmy.
Had a wholesome malt-shop date on friday night and I loved it.
This is the place to swoon and make "googly-eyes" at each other while sharing a classic hot fudge sundae generously topped with whipped cream nuts and yes a cherry. 
*AND* They have an all soy shake.
*AND* They serve a Guinness float.
I'm inspired to have a party here poodle-skirts and letterman jackets required. . .

excerpts: The small was plenty big (enough for a regular fountain glass) and came with a very generous amount of whipped cream topped with a maraschino cherry.
cherry.author: Katie I.
cherry.review:
I'm Lorelai Gilmore and I approve this breakfast: mint chip milkshake and french fries.

I'm Katie and I disapprove of this breakfast: mint chip milkshake and french fries; however, it sure was tasty. I chose to get a milkshake with flavored ice cream, but you can also go with the vanilla + flavored syrup combination if that's what floats your boat. The small was plenty big (enough for a regular fountain glass) and came with a very generous amount of whipped cream topped with a maraschino cherry. 

Any milkshake made with Mitchell's ice cream is bound to be good, and this one was quite good, but it could have used a few more seconds in the blender. Also, I love that they are trying to keep as many things from the old days as possible, but the paper straws are awful. (If you want to be eco-conscious, use compostable straws made from cornstarch.)

Milkshake scale: Most of the boys to the yard (http://www.yelp.com/list/how-many-boys-do-their-milkshakes-bring-to-the-yard-san-francisco)

P.S. The fries were pretty tasty.
P.P.S. I really want to go back for a real breakfast--their menu is extensive and has a whole lot of delicious-sounding options.

excerpts: He got the "Dream" shake (orange sherbet and vanilla, topped with whipped cream and a cherry), and I got the vanilla
"All Soy" shake.
The ice cream they use
(I hear it is a local ice creamery, right?)
IS SO GOOD.
I didn't see vanilla beans but would have guessed they were in there.
It was so very vanilla-y, and with a cherry on top.
cherry.author: D P.
cherry.review:
This place is so cute! I had it on my list of places to visit in SF mainly because of the vegan shake and ice cream.

My boyfriend and I ended up having lunch here on our last day in town.  The guy next to us had ordered the Vegan Chorizo Hash with Tofu, and it looked sooooo good, we BOTH GOT IT.  

It was pretty amazing: in the center, a tofu scramble with ranchero sauce, and surrounding it, vegan chorizo mixed in with diced potatoes, with three soft, hot corn tortillas on the side! 

It comes with a side: I got mine with a side of veggie chili--it wasn't as good as the Whole Foods canned variety, but was topped with scallions--and my boyfriend got a side of home fries, which were really good, nice and firm, and covered in herbs.

He got the "Dream" shake (orange sherbet and vanilla, topped with whipped cream and a cherry), and I got the vanilla "All Soy" shake.  The ice cream they use (I hear it is a local ice creamery, right?) IS SO GOOD.  I didn't see vanilla beans but would have guessed they were in there.  It was so very vanilla-y, and with a cherry on top.  

The server was staight-up abrasive, very unhelpful.  The bill came out to $43, which I think is kind of expensive for 2 diner-style entrees and a shake.  But the has was very good, and so was my shake, and I'd go back for either!

We ended up getting some 80s trading cards which was fun.  The lock on the bathroom door was broken, which was scary!, but one of my favorite things about the place was the old-school "BORAXO" powder hand soap dispenser in there.

excerpts: francis has yummy french fries, milkshakes, and cherry cokes which is what matters most to me.
i also enjoy their veggie offerings and i am always tempted to buy some pee wee cards or 20 year old candy bars.
plus, everyone is always nice.
if i opened up my own restaurant (and i will one day) st.
francis would definitely be a mild influence except mine would have veggie sausage!
cherry.author: Kristie P.
cherry.review: st. francis has yummy french fries, milkshakes, and cherry cokes which is what matters most to me.  i also enjoy their veggie offerings and i am always tempted to buy some pee wee cards or 20 year old candy bars.  plus, everyone is always nice.  if i opened up my own restaurant (and i will one day) st. francis would definitely be a mild influence except mine would have veggie sausage!

excerpts: Banana bread is really good!
A must try!
Also love the mess and omelettes.
Can get really busy after 10:30am on weekends, so get there early if you could.
banana.author: Allan B.
banana.review: Banana bread is really good! A must try! Also love the mess and omelettes. Can get really busy after 10:30am on weekends, so get there early if you could.

excerpts: We also split a short stack of vegan banana walnut pancakes.
I love that also, especially with the hint of cinnamon in it.
banana.author: Reese E.
banana.review:
I've come here twice now... both on a weekend around brunch time. I love that this diner has vegan breakfast! And good vegan breakfast. 

My husband and I always order the tofu scramble with vegan soyrizo, spinach, mushrooms and chives. It's always delicious. Their house breakfast potatoes are always perfectly seasoned and crisp on the bottom and edges. We also split a short stack of vegan banana walnut pancakes. I love that also, especially with the hint of cinnamon in it. It's great they give us soy milk with our coffee and vegan butter for our toast and pancakes. 

The service is great, the people that work here have always been accommodating and friendly. If you're looking for a good breakfast joint for carnivores and herbivores, this is the place for you.

excerpts: They have really good vegan options too: I love the banana-walnut vegan pancakes (which come with *vegan* butter!), the tofu rancheros, and the vegan nebulous potato thing.
They have non-vegan stuff too
banana.author: Morgane M.
banana.review:
This place is so good! Really friendly staff, excellent food, cute diner vibes... I love it. They have really good vegan options too: I love the banana-walnut vegan pancakes (which come with *vegan* butter!), the tofu rancheros, and the vegan nebulous potato thing. They have non-vegan stuff too and I'm sure it's good as well.

Portions are very filling and you will leave here satisfied and happy.

excerpts: A friend suggested the banana bread, and I made the mistake of getting cornbread instead.
Don't get me wrong, the cornbread was still good!
But his banana bread was better.
banana.author: Nikhil S.
banana.review:
Pretty good, pretty good. I've come by a few times and been turned away by the long wait. This past weekend, the line wasn't too long so we got in quickly.

St Francis has a nice old-timey diner feel to it, and there's a large variety of options on the menu. A friend suggested the banana bread, and I made the mistake of getting cornbread instead. Don't get me wrong, the cornbread was still good! But his banana bread was better. Live and learn.

My bacon, cheddar, and green onion scramble was pretty good, and the side of potatoes added to the heartiness. My knock is the time it took before the waiter came around to take our order. I hear it's an anomaly though, so maybe they'll get 5 stars if they're faster next time!

excerpts: You can also personalize whether you want ice cream or cream on top of your floats, and what topping to get on your banana split (caramel, chocolate, etc).
We also got a banana split in the group.
This was a monster of a dish, delicious!
banana.author: Ziyan C.
banana.review:
No wait for six of us around 1pm on a Saturday! At first we were split between a booth and a couple seats at the bar. After a few minutes, we were all able to sit together at the bar.

They did mess up a couple of our orders and were a little slow to get them out, but we did end up with a free scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream! You can also personalize whether you want ice cream or cream on top of your floats, and what topping to get on your banana split (caramel, chocolate, etc). 

The ice cream is not my favorite in the city, could be more creamy, but it's still good.

FOUNTAIN CLASSICS
* Dreamsicle (milk, oj, vanilla syrup, vanilla ice cream, orange sherbet, whipped cream, cherry. $5.75) - 4 stars
Tasty, thick, not too sweet! Like an orange soda with vanilla.

* Guiness Float ($7.25) - 4 stars
My boyfriend really liked this!

We also got a banana split in the group. This was a monster of a dish, delicious!

excerpts: I also had the vegan banana and walnut pancakes, which were fantastic!!!
banana.author: Melissa P.
banana.review: There was a crowd outside when we arrived. We were told the wait was about 10-15 min for a party of 5 over the phone. When we saw the crowds of people waiting outside, I can tell that my bf's mother was a bit anxious Bc she had work too. Luckily, you can see that they were moving along fast tho. We got seated within 30 min. by 12:15pm. We ordered by 12:20pm and we was served our food by 12:40 and we were out of there by 1pm. I guess we eat fast lol. We all enjoyed our food. I ordered the vegan hash and added avocado and rancheros sauce to it and it was amaze balls!!!!!! I thought the place would have had more vegan options but I was still very happy with the vegan hash. It was actually on the sides menu tho, so I kind of had to put my meal together. I also had the vegan banana and walnut pancakes, which were fantastic!!!

excerpts: Hands down the best banana walnut pancakes
I've had in my life!
These were so good and deliciously perfect!
Plus it comes with a side of eggs (the spinach feta is my fav) and some fruits !
Refill on coffee free
What more can you want ?
Oh and the staff are super nice!
banana.author: Balqis A.
banana.review:
Hands down the best banana walnut pancakes I've had in my life! These were so good and deliciously perfect! Plus it comes with a side of eggs (the spinach feta is my fav) and some fruits !
Refill on coffee free
What more can you want ? Oh and the staff are super nice!

excerpts: They had vegan banana pancakes that I liked!
And I also got a scramble and added soyrizo, yum!
banana.author: Laure D.
banana.review: They had vegan banana pancakes that I liked!  And I also got a scramble and added soyrizo, yum!

excerpts: Other highlights of the menu: their homemade banana bread, the corned beef hash, and the chefs mess are all great.
banana.author: Thomas R.
banana.review: I love this place. The line's never too long, the eggs Benedict are always well done: I've only had one firm yoke in 5 years of eating here at least monthly. Mimosas are $4.75, and in a real glass instead of a BS Champaign flute, and they make them well (strong). Other highlights of the menu: their homemade banana bread, the corned beef hash, and the chefs mess are all great.

excerpts: I had the option of a side and chose banana bread.
It came out warm and it was mouth watering.
Service is super fast and friendly.
They get busy so reserve a table for a party of 3 or more.
Soooooo good.
banana.author: Laura T.
banana.review:
AMAZING BREAKFAST SPOT! 
I had the Veggie mess and it was SO tasty. I had the option of a side and chose banana bread. It came out warm and it was mouth watering. Service is super fast and friendly. They get busy so reserve a table for a party of 3 or more. Soooooo good.

excerpts: I got the banana walnut pancakes (vegan) and they were delicious.
banana.author: Cynthia R.
banana.review:
This place is awesome! Obviously came from the Yelp reviews and hype and I must say it's worth it. I got the banana walnut pancakes (vegan) and they were delicious. My friend got the blueberry pancakes which she also loved. 
A little upset though because I wanted to try the "Vegan Thing" but realized it want on their menu when I went. although when I asked, they did have it, but they did not have the guacamole so I decided to pass. 
Customer service was great and we waited probably 15 minutes for a spot on a Sunday morning. I would definitely come again!

excerpts: The banana walnut pancakes had everything right and nothing wrong!
I also ordered the vegan chorizo as a side.
It was pretty good.
Food sizes are super generous and the service was quick and friendly.
Highly recommend!
Go early and avoid the crowds especially on the weekend
banana.author: Katie R.
banana.review: Was in SF for business and tried this spot because of its vegan options. The banana walnut pancakes had everything right and nothing wrong! I also ordered the vegan chorizo as a side. It was pretty good. Food sizes are super generous and the service was quick and friendly. Highly recommend! Go early and avoid the crowds especially on the weekend

excerpts: The banana walnut pancakes
banana.author: Walter H.
banana.review: Their flexibility to create plant-based (Vegan a Term I don't like LoL) options is awesome. The banana walnut pancakes

excerpts: The banana bread was burnt - literally one side of it was completely black, how do you serve that?!
banana.author: Stephanie C.
banana.review:
I didn't get the hype here. Granted, I did not try their ice cream or shakes, but I came here for brunch. Their french toast was nothing special. The banana bread was burnt - literally one side of it was completely black, how do you serve that?! The omelette that my boyfriend had was smothered in sour cream. 

Maybe I'll need to come back to try their shakes, but the food here was mediocre.

excerpts: Also got their banana shake
but I would order it 5 minutes before asking for the bill so it doesn't melt while you're enjoying your food.
I would highly recommend
banana.author: Frank S.
banana.review:
Had the chef's mess even though it was past lunch time because that's supposedly what they are known for... And I can see why! It was absolutely amazing, just enough cheese with the blends of eggs, potatoes, bacon, and so much more. Basically like a chicken pie that you open and dig through. 
Also got their banana shake but I would order it 5 minutes before asking for the bill so it doesn't melt while you're enjoying your food. 
I would highly recommend

excerpts: My banana nut pancakes were pretty good.
banana.author: Aaron T.
banana.review: Took a friend there the other day. My banana nut pancakes were pretty good. She ordered blueberry sourdough French toast after asking the waiter if the blueberries were fresh. He said yes. The blueberries may have been fresh days before that, they definitely were not fresh. The waiter didn't show back up to out table after, I had to grab a different waiter to pay the bill. I finished my pancakes, her French toast was pretty much left intact. I lost points that morning. Fellas, don't take a date there.

excerpts: Less time to Grilled Buttered Banana Bread time.
banana.author: Amy C.
banana.review:
Why I Heart Burning Man:

1)  Rockstar parking.

2)  No wait.  At St. Francis Fountain.  At 11am.  On a Sunday. (!!!)

3)  Less time to Dreamsicle-time.

4)  Less time to Grilled Buttered Banana Bread time.

5)  Less time to Ranchero-Sauced-Breakfast-Burrito-Food-Coma time.

6)  Less time to Extra-Crispy-Hash-Browns time.

(More time while waiting a long time for the check though.  Go figure!)

excerpts: Sourdough french toast or vegan banana walnut hot cakes (yes, vegan, though I'm not, is SUPER yummy), everything is tasty.
They have all the original decor (down to the shelves and benches), which is pretty cool and features of old-school candy that you can purchase :).
banana.author: Zara S.
banana.review: I love this spot, period. Scrumptious breakfast options, fast and friendly service, awesome historic decor and worth the wait. their omelettes are my favorite, their milkshakes satisfy your cravings. Sourdough french toast or vegan banana walnut hot cakes (yes, vegan, though I'm not, is SUPER yummy), everything is tasty.  They have all the original decor (down to the shelves and benches), which is pretty cool and features of old-school candy that you can purchase :).

excerpts: I am definitely gonna go back for their ice cream and banana sundaes
banana.author: Jerianne G.
banana.review:
I've been wanting to try this place out since it's been on my bookmarks for a while, and my bf and i had time to finally go and try it out! I guess we were pretty lucky, since the place was pretty empty. 

I love creamsicle! And their make of it in the form of a shake was superb :) Very orangey and creamy, especially with the vanilla ice cream nommmm. We ordered their 24th street special, which is basically hash browns, two eggs, and biscuits with sausage gravy. It was okay, to be honest. But i give the stars for the creamsicles.

I am definitely gonna go back for their ice cream and banana sundaes :).

excerpts: I definitely recommend this place, especially the banana bread mmmm
banana.author: Karina E.
banana.review:
Great food, great environment, and great prices....that's all I need!

I definitely recommend this place, especially the banana bread mmmm

excerpts: - Biscuits, banana bread (not too sweet), and toast... all yum.
banana.author: Megan G.
banana.review:
This is our home away from home!

It surprised me to discover that the huevos rancheros here are out-of-this-world... like, best-of-the-Mission quality. Add jalapeños and avocado and you've got yourself an amazing share.

Other faves:
- Sandhya benedict (on the weekend specials list) - the English muffin base is homemade, like a tender juicy savory pancake-crumpet
- Thing your spuds... it is good
- Side salads are crunchy and delish. Caesar is dressing-heavy. Italian vin is awesome.
- Biscuits, banana bread (not too sweet), and toast... all yum.

Things I'd not necessarily recommend: the mac 'n' cheese, the veggie reuben, veggie chili (which is real sweet). None's a bad choice, just not as relatively special as the true stars here.

excerpts: If you like flavorful breakfast you must order one of their omelettes or their potato dishes-- and definitely get banana bread on the side.
Overall, this is one my favorite breakfast places in the city!
banana.author: Reina C.
banana.review: I've been here about 3 times now I must say each time gets better!! This place is one of those places that surprises you with what's inside. If you like flavorful breakfast you must order one of their omelettes or their potato dishes-- and definitely get banana bread on the side. Overall, this is one my favorite breakfast places in the city!

excerpts: In lieu of toast, you have your choice of English muffin, homemade biscuits, cornbread, or banana bread.
banana.author: Vincci L.
banana.review:
Love the whole atmosphere of this place, I really wished there was something like this in Vancouver. The classic booths, posters, candy shop near the front, and the retro style menu completes the whole place. 

Menu consists of lots of great choices for breakfast food, eggs, tofu scrambles, potatoes...After much deliberation, I settle on a scramble with avocado, cilantro, cheddar & salsa. In lieu of toast, you have your choice of English muffin, homemade biscuits, cornbread, or banana bread. Of course, I choose the homemade biscuit. 

Coffee served in one of those classic style cups and handwritten bills make this place even cooler. 

My scramble was delicious. Lots of avocado, and a fresh cilantro salsa, all within the eggs. Biscuits were warm and soft, and the homefries were crispy enough and not too oily. It was also a generous portion.

Watching them make the sundaes almost tempted me to have one with my breakfast. The large dallop of whipped cream at the top was almost too hard to say no to. With a full stomach from the food, I simply had to refuse. 

Their candy collection is also impressive- Nerds, Bazooka bubble gum, pop rocks, jawbreakers; it brings me right back to my childhood days. 

If I lived here, I'm sure I'd be a regular patron, even if it's just for the ice cream.

excerpts: We decided to order the Chef's Mess, the Nebulous Potato Thing and a Banana Split.
Everything was delicious.
The Nebulous Potato Thing looked small, but was VERY heavy.
Both dishes had tons of flavor and seems like they were coordinately thrown together.
I'd probably return to this place if I was lucky enough to go back with no line.
banana.author: Christine D.
banana.review: Drove and walked by St. Francis Fountain numerous times wondering what the big deal is with the long lines.  In my mind this was known as the small diner with the long lines in the Mission.  One random weekday while I was off from work, I decided to try this place out because as fate had it there was no line.  We decided to order the Chef's Mess, the Nebulous Potato Thing and a Banana Split.  Everything was delicious.  The Nebulous Potato Thing looked small, but was VERY heavy.  Both dishes had tons of flavor and seems like they were coordinately thrown together.  I'd probably return to this place if I was lucky enough to go back with no line.

excerpts: I have had vegan rancheros (great twist on one of my favorite dishes from back when I was a "regular" vegetarian), the vegan "thing", a banana walnut pancake, and the vegan sausage patties.
I can't complain about any of the above
banana.author: Bailey M.
banana.review:
One of my favorite breakie spots in the city! 

Perfect for those mornings when your stomach needs to be greased up a bit, if ya know what I mean. I have had vegan rancheros (great twist on one of my favorite dishes from back when I was a "regular" vegetarian), the vegan "thing", a banana walnut pancake, and the vegan sausage patties. I can't complain about any of the above but I'm definitely more of a ranchero kinda lady than I am a potatos-for-breakfast kinda lady! 

I love the vibe, the diner style, and the no-frills service. My dining compadres have all loved their meaty dishes as well. I make it a point to venture here whenever I am in town! YUM.

excerpts: My friend subbed her toast for banana bread, please do this!
Higher prices simply because they give you great portions!
banana.author: Morgan R.
banana.review: The corn beef hash is out of this world! Was craving pancakes and simple eggs... Lets just say it was ALL gone and I was stuffed to the max. My friend subbed her toast for banana bread, please do this! Higher prices simply because they give you great portions!

excerpts:
You can get it as a side order, too: awesome
+Got the banana bread with my corned beef because why not?
+Good coffee
+Tasty jam
Diner prices without having to deal with Flo as your server
banana.author: Adena B.
banana.review:
+Breakfast served ALL DAY
+Got a full order of corned beef hash. You can get it as a side order, too: awesome
+Got the banana bread with my corned beef because why not?
+Good coffee
+Tasty jam
+Diner prices without having to deal with Flo as your server

excerpts: Banana Bread was on point ....
this is def
a must try again and again and AGAIN!
banana.author: Char B.
banana.review: Everything was amazing! Had the Nebulous Potato thing and my other half had the Chefs messy scramble ....HELLA GOOD! Banana Bread was on point ....this is def a must try again and again and AGAIN!

excerpts: For the bread options, choose cornbread over banana bread...
Unless you have a sweet tooth.
Nice n toasty,
banana.author: Alison R.
banana.review:
Perfect Sunday hangover diner cure for carnivores with veggie/vegan friends!

The Veggie Mess has the best of all worlds: spuds, chorizo, gooey cheeses. Ask for jalapeños to get that extra kick! Order is large enough for 2 ppl or an extra kick in' hangover.

For the bread options, choose cornbread over banana bread... Unless you have a sweet tooth. Nice n toasty, Thick like a brick! 

Espresso milkshake is perfectly executed - vanilla loves cafe. Order the large. Just when you thought the fun was over, the shaker has a whole extra glass of frothy goodness waiting for ya!

excerpts: Banana bread - sweet and yummy
Corn beef hash - greasy, with peppers and potatoes and beef.
It'll make your stomach cry out,
"No more!" and then "Okay, a little more!
banana.author: Ivan L.
banana.review:
St. Francis Fountain - where the hip come to dine and the tourists come to watch them.

We head to St. Francis @ 9:50 something AM on the weekends and catch an outside table as soon as the open up @ 10 AM.  There's just 4 or 5 of them but there's plenty of space for two people and one dog.  Lately the outside tables are getting claimed by tourists with suit cases and Noe drive-ins with their strollers and SUVs.  Stay away from my table people!

The breakfast food is top notch!  Some favorites include:
* Blueberry pancakes - the wife must have blueberry pancakes fairly frequently or suffer the ills of some unstated dire curse.  Along with a side of eggs, these blueberry pancakes appear to stave off the evil.
* Hogcakes - pancakes with cheese, green onions, and bacon cooked into them.  So very yum!
* Omelets - Big two egg omelets with whatever you want in them.  They come with a side of crispy, spiced, fried potatoes that people who eat potatoes seem to love. 
* Nebulous potato thing - Uh... it's like potatoes and other stuff like kinda put together.  You know?
* Banana bread - sweet and yummy
* Corn beef hash - greasy, with peppers and potatoes and beef.  It'll make your stomach cry out, "No more!" and then "Okay, a little more!"

excerpts: Best corn beef hash and banana bread
I've ever had!
Great to explore the Mission district afterwords as well.
Next time ill be sure to have an ice cream Sunday here!
banana.author: Clare R.
banana.review: Best corn beef hash and banana bread I've ever had! Great to explore the Mission district afterwords as well. Next time ill be sure to have an ice cream Sunday here!

excerpts: We only ordered ice cream ---a Busta Brown and Hot Fudge Banana Split with the bananas on the side (yep...I'm allergic to bananas).
It was a pretty mixed crowd of young to old.
And GOSH darn it!
banana.author: Troy R.
banana.review:
I'm a huge diner/soda shop fan. Saw this place on Saturday when I went to Dynamo Donuts. Wanted ice cream yesterday so we thought we'd give them a try. 


Really cool retro 50's diner look with a very laid back vibe. Got good service by the laid back hipster staff. As soon as we walked in the door, we were acknowledged and pointed to a seat. 

We only ordered ice cream ---a Busta Brown and Hot Fudge Banana Split with the bananas on the side (yep...I'm allergic to bananas). It was a pretty mixed crowd of young to old. And GOSH darn it! If this crew doesn't make a yummy sundae. 

We saw other dishes they brought out which looked pretty good. Unfortunately we already had lunch so ice cream was all we had room for BUT I'm sure we'll be back to try some of their other diner fare.

excerpts: And definitely try the banana bread.
Pretty crowded restaurant too.
I got to sit at the bar.
banana.author: Gilad P.
banana.review: What an interesting restaurant! 1950's diner like place - but with hipster atmosphere and dishes. I got the veggie mess. Wow. Really weird dish. Delicious though. And definitely try the banana bread. Pretty crowded restaurant too. I got to sit at the bar.

excerpts: I selected their banana nut bread instead of their regular toast.
I didn't care for the potatoes
but I did love their banana nut bread.
It was moist and not too sweet.
Their scramble was great too.
We sat at their counter table and it can get a little squishy
but overall it wasn't a bad experience.
I think aside from the wait time and the lack of parking, I would come back.
banana.author: Anh W.
banana.review: Was here on a weekday and there was still a short wait--unbelievable! This place is small and so I don't think I would ever try to come here on a weekend. I had their scramble with spinach, cheese, and sausage. I selected their banana nut bread instead of their regular toast. I didn't care for the potatoes but I did love their banana nut bread. It was moist and not too sweet. Their scramble was great too. We sat at their counter table and it can get a little squishy but overall it wasn't a bad experience. I think aside from the wait time and the lack of parking, I would come back.

excerpts: Soda's, milkshakes, malts, sundaes, banana splits and egg cremes round out the menu.
They have lots of regular menu options (including several vegan ones), but why waste time on those when you can go straight for a good dessert.
banana.author: Nicole M.
banana.review:
Stepping into The St. Francis Fountain is like taking a step back in time. The decor probably hasn't changed much in over 50 years. But, that's ok. It's a clean, cheerful space with a counter, glass serving bowls, padded bar stools and quaint wooden booths. It all the servers wern't cute hipsters, and Pat Benetar wasn't playing it would be easy to think the 50's were alive and well.

My friend and I went for The ice cream (courtesy of Mitchell's) and we amply rewarded. They have soy flavors available, but go for The dairy. I really loved The fresh flakes of coconut in my coconut ice cream, and it worked perfectly with The hot fudge and walnuts in my brownie sundae. Now That's The way to break a vegan fast!

Soda's, milkshakes, malts, sundaes, banana splits and egg cremes round out the menu. They have lots of regular menu options (including several vegan ones), but why waste time on those when you can go straight for a good dessert.

excerpts: Had the 2 eggs any style with potatoes and banana bread.
I highly recommend the banana bread!
Also you can order lunch anytime which was perfect for us!
I will be returning for breakfast very soon!
banana.author: Victoria M.
banana.review: Went for breakfast and it was excellent. The staff are very friendly! Had the 2 eggs any style with potatoes and banana bread. I highly recommend the banana bread! Also you can order lunch anytime which was perfect for us! I will be returning for breakfast very soon!

excerpts: I got the banana bread too, which initially seemed a little under sweetened for my taste, but with a little butter added it really got it to "like mom used to make" status.
Def worth it for a breakfast run, especially if you want something hearty but better and less greasy than a typical corner diner.
banana.author: Rylan C.
banana.review: I came here for breakfast on a Monday, after reading the reviews. I wouldn't say I was blown away, but it was definitely strong and lived up to a solid review. The corned beef hash is fresh and herby and not very greasy and the egg inside was cooked perfectly. I got the banana bread too, which initially seemed a little under sweetened for my taste, but with a little butter added it really got it to "like mom used to make" status. Def worth it for a breakfast run, especially if you want something hearty but better and less greasy than a typical corner diner.

excerpts: - some of their sundaes and banana splits sound amazing!
banana.author: Tara M.
banana.review:
We've been here twice for breakfast, and both times we've loved it. 

This last time, we split a Chef's Mess and Blueberry Pancakes. Both were outstanding. I loved that the pancakes actually had blueberries in the batter as opposed to just compote on the top, which so many places are doing these days. I also ordered a side of bacon which was cooked perfectly.

The staff is always super friendly and attentive.

I'd love to go back here for dessert - some of their sundaes and banana splits sound amazing!

I will definitely go out of my way to come here and highly recommend it.

excerpts: My chocolate banana shake was perfection.
banana.author: Megan J.
banana.review: Authentic and delicious. My chocolate banana shake was perfection.

excerpts: It doesn't take much more than that to get me excited about "hip" little diners like this; you already have a pretty clear idea of what is being served up at the St. Francis: Breakfast, Burgers, Coffee - Oh, and a selection of Mitchell's Ice Cream, so Milkshakes, Banana Splits and Hot Fudge Sundaes (if that's what you want for lunch!).
banana.author: Christian H.
banana.review:
Welcome to the St. Francis Fountain.  Here exists a place where you can step out of everyday, busy life in 2010 and set foot into a 1950's time-warp.  If there was a television in this place, I would have expected to see a black and white episode of "I Love Lucy" playing in the background.  From what I understand, this establishment was already old-school by the 1950's, and actually is closer to 100 years old!  

It doesn't take much more than that to get me excited about "hip" little diners like this; you already have a pretty clear idea of what is being served up at the St. Francis: Breakfast, Burgers, Coffee - Oh, and a selection of Mitchell's Ice Cream, so Milkshakes, Banana Splits and Hot Fudge Sundaes (if that's what you want for lunch!).  I went with the Turkey Bacon Club on Sliced Sourdough with Cheddar and a Caesar Salad...not one bit disappointed by my decision at all.  

Surprisingly the parking is pretty easy here, considering that this part of San Francisco can be a little challenging at times (and many spaces limited to 1 hour only).  Just bring a handful of change ($2/hr...wow San Francisco!), and be ready to sidestep the panhandler with the shopping cart after you feed the meter.  Really, though, it actually is a pretty nice neighborhood!

Also be prepared to "chat it up" with the person sitting next to you if you come alone and sit at the counter: the place fills up quick, and the "hip-girl" with the Oversized sunglasses (which never came off) sitting next to me wanted some conversation in addition to me passing her the sugar for her soy-infused coffee.  

"What was I doing in the neighborhood?" was the general tone of the conversation.  

Just passing through...and I will be sure to do that here again sometime soon!

excerpts: But the portions for lunch were small - and my side order of banana bread was ridiculously small given the price.
I should've gone with a breakfast meal, but it's two stars for lunch here.
banana.author: Shannon N.
banana.review: Meh.  I really wanted to like this place - I do love little diners.  But the portions for lunch were small - and my side order of banana bread was ridiculously small given the price.  I should've gone with a breakfast meal, but it's two stars for lunch here.

excerpts:
+banana malt was delicious - creamy; rich; banana-y enough - appreciated being able to order a small 
+prices - very reasonable; good portions
+décor/ambiance - cozy, old-school; dug the counter and booths
+fried
banana.author: Carson R.
banana.review:
3.5
Finally went here after living in SF for about 25 years! 
I had a hankering for an old-fashion fried egg or grilled cheese sando, malt, and fries. Not my typical fare but sometimes you need that comfort food.
hi-lights:
+banana malt was delicious - creamy; rich; banana-y enough - appreciated being able to order a small 
+prices - very reasonable; good portions
+décor/ambiance - cozy, old-school; dug the counter and booths
+fried egg sando- eggs perfectly cooked;  they use shredded lettuce instead of leaf lettuce which was a nice surprise
+French toast  - just right - classic - good egg wash/bread ratio 


lo-lights:
+service - slow despite not being too crowded
+fries - just ok - not worth the waistline - maybe slightly over-cooked 

and I really wanted a classic grilled cheese w/ American cheese on white bread - they didn't seem to have either American cheese or white bread -- I didn't ask ---
I tell ya it's hard to find a real old-fashioned grilled cheese in SF - everyone wants to give you fancy cheeses; multiple cheeses; extra ingredients; and "healthy" bread....

excerpts: After a little bit of playing around, I have now found my standard, which is with strawberry ice cream and banana flavouring.
The large will come in a pretty diner glass, with the leftovers in the metal tin.
banana.author: Mariko F.
banana.review:
Oh I love this place. I discovered it not through Yelp (shocker!) but rather by walking by, seeing a huge crowd, and figuring it was worth the wait. I'm so glad that I put my name up on that sheet. 

I was there with 4 people and waited for a good 45min to get a table on a Saturday morning. Totally worth it though. The waiters are nice, fun and quirky and will tell you exactly what they think about certain dishes if you ask them. Ask them their opinion and tell you and not settle for the annoying "it's all good!" 

Get a milkshake. They are fantastic. My boyfriend and I shared a large (around $5.50, i think) and struggled to finish it. After a little bit of playing around, I have now found my standard, which is with strawberry ice cream and banana flavouring. The large will come in a pretty diner glass, with the leftovers in the metal tin. Basically you will never run out. 

The breakfast menu is fantastic and I usually order off there. The chorizo, although fake meat, tastes really good! Breakfast burrito is solid. I have now had the burger and it's actually good. I don't know why I am surprised, but it was good. I don't even know what to tell you to order. Everything that I have had here has been good. 

If it wasn't for the insane wait that you have to endure on the weekends, I could possibly make St. Francis an even more frequent stop. But if you want to avoid the line, go in the early afternoon of the weekend and you might get a table almost right away!

excerpts: We sat outside, and after ordering - and lovin' - the banana pancakes, we ordered a feast: B&G, black beans, breakfast burritos!
banana.author: Simone W.
banana.review:
Came here twice. 

First time, months ago on a warm sunny Sunday with my friend. We sat outside, and after ordering - and lovin' - the banana pancakes, we ordered a feast: B&G, black beans, breakfast burritos! It was amazing and I registered in my brain that was a fair priced, full of flavor, casual brunch spot in the middle of hipster land.

Second time, rainy Sunday post loooooong wine tasting the night before. In serious need of good confort food + coffee to balance out the headache. After trying different places with long lines, St Francis' 15 minute wait didn't seem so bad. 

We were sat at the counter and I was enchanted by the old diner vibe, the 80's candy bar and the 60's music they were playing. The menu, again, made me dizzy with so many options, and we both went for the vegan chorizo - I got the chorizo and eggs, he got the chorizo hash. And, of course, the fabulous B&G!

The food took a while, but when it came it was a fabulous experience! The service was friendly and they refilled our coffee and water promptly. I saw lots of dishes that looked delicious passing by me, and thought I need to come back many times to try them all. By the end of two hours, I was happy and even my headache was gone.

St Francis is the case of appreciating something for what it is - hipster crowd, good food, casual fun vibe, and yes:  usual lines + pricey.....like EVERY good brunch place in SF. I will keep coming back!

excerpts: The banana or corn bread that you can choose to accompany your dish is heavenly as well.
banana.author: Justin L.
banana.review:
"Breakfast is the most important meal of the day"..Don't know exactly what nutritional authority came up with that notion...but since that gives me an excuse to start the day by chowin' down like a madman, no debate over here.

To help fulfill my absolute need for scrambles, omelettes and hash...St. Francis Fountain is high on the list.  The surroundings may make you feel like you've entered the Twilight Zone and  time-traveled into another era...but the food is what really knocks you out-of-the-park!  The tofu scrambles are absolutely perfect.  The banana or corn bread that you can choose to accompany your dish is heavenly as well.

Since this is a fountain, you're obligated to get some sort of ice creamery goodness.  My poison is the malted shake made with Mitchell's ice cream...elixir of the food gods.

St. Francis Fountain...does a body good!

excerpts: The freaking banana bread.

Amazing.
4.
Borax soap in the bathroom.
You know, the dry, gritty powder.
I love it.
They bought the space next door.
Which means more tables.
And shorter waits.
banana.author: Kelli R.
banana.review:
After a dozen visits, I need to update and upgrade.  A few reasons:
1.  Updated menu.  They ditched the ortega chiles for jalapenos.  I'm giddy.
2.  We dine-with-baby and the people that work here are fantastically friendly and accommodating.  
3.  The freaking banana bread.  Amazing.
4.  Borax soap in the bathroom.  You know, the dry, gritty powder.  I love it.
5.  They bought the space next door.  Which means more tables.  And shorter waits.

excerpts: It's comfort food done right, and when you have a yearning for a banana split or egg cream
this is the place you should be.
They also have a candy counter where you can pick up some Tron, Alf, and Buck Rogers trading cards among others.
The place is almost 100 years old, so check out the prices on one of the old menus now hanging in the bathroom.
banana.author: Jason D.
banana.review:
I've been eating here since birth. In fact, since before birth. Luckily, even with the change of ownership, it still feels like the old St. Francis. 
They may have added tofu scrambles to make the hipster crowd feel at home, and gotten rid of the tall glasses in favor of plastic ones, but you can still sit in the booth where the 49'ers were founded. It's a great place for the old that want to remember and the young to see what the missed.
It's comfort food done right, and when you have a yearning for a banana split or egg cream this is the place you should be.
They also have a candy counter where you can pick up some Tron, Alf, and Buck Rogers trading cards among others.
The place is almost 100 years old, so check out the prices on one of the old menus now hanging in the bathroom.

excerpts: $7 for a banana split?
$4 for a milkshake?
What if it doesn't bring all the boys to the yard?
Instead I opted for a single scoop of Rocky Road, which set me back $3.
The marshmallows were a slightly orange hue, but the ice cream was the most ethreal scoop of ice cream that I've ever tasted.
banana.author: Amy Z.
banana.review:
I was looking for the new ice cream joint in this part of town, you know the one with the weird name.  The one that everyone is talking about.  I found it, that Slocombe one, but a tourist bus full of Frenchies was unloading right out front, and there were no haute, lithe French men in site.  That and I spent my last bit of cash on produce at the local market and the Slocombe place only takes cash.  So I decided to save Slocombe for another day and move on.  I remembered that the St. Francis Fountain was nearby so I headed over there.

When I stepped into the restaurant, I felt like I had stepped into the set of Back to the Future.  Total 50s  vibe plus your standard quotient of hipsters.  After all this is the Mission.  The menus even look like they date back to the 50s..except when you look at the prices.  It never ceases to amaze me what people will charge for ice cream.  $7 for a banana split?  $4 for a milkshake?  What if it doesn't bring all the boys to the yard?  Instead I opted for a single scoop of Rocky Road, which set me back $3.  The marshmallows were a slightly orange hue, but the ice cream was the most ethreal scoop of ice cream that I've ever tasted.  Very rich in flavor and not the slightest hint of freezer burn.  

I'm not really a Mission chic, and I'm surprised that something this charming exists in the Mission, but I would definitely stop back on a spectacular sunny day for some more Rocky Road.

excerpts: I have tried the blueberry, banana walnut, and chocolate chip pancakes.
The chocolate chip pancakes were my favorite!
banana.author: Meg P.
banana.review:
Awesome selection of vegan brunch food!

I have tried the blueberry, banana walnut, and chocolate chip pancakes. The chocolate chip pancakes were my favorite!

The vegan huevos rancheros and the vegan chorizo dishes were also really good.

The service is also great!

excerpts: Luckily I got a side of pancakes of banana walnut that were delicious.
I imagine this is the type of place you should get traditional egg dishes at.
banana.author: Sabrina A.
banana.review:
I decided to get a vegan entree the day I went there since I like soy chorizo and tofu scramble hash.  But it was bland and not very good.  Luckily I got a side of pancakes of banana walnut that were delicious.  I imagine this is the type of place you should get traditional egg dishes at.  The tofu scramble/soyrizo ended up being good the next day and I'm guessing it is because the spices/oils had time to marinate into the tofu.  It didn't seem as bland the next day.  Make sure to get the Cherry Cola to ensure your diner experience.

Since this place is just around the corner from my house I'm sure I'll try it again.

excerpts: That particular day, I tried banana walnut, at her suggestion.
banana.author: Lisa T.
banana.review:
Okay. Now is when I reveal what a huge hypocrite I am. 

Boogaloo's is the devil's den, but St. Francis Fountain -- that OTHER hipster breakfast enclave in the Mission -- isn't so bad. In fact, it's pretty good. I like it, and when it's not busy, I'll sneak in for a vegan peanut butter milkshake and I will REALLY ENJOY IT.

Damn it. 

The difference between this place and Boogaloo's is... They have good food. Duh. They have good VEGAN food, too. I mean, man -- their vegan milkshakes are awesomely delicious. And I've always had good service here. 

My friend Sara and I boldly journeyed here for brunch in a torrential downpour when our office out on ends-of-the-earth-Marin-Headlands Beach was closed during the big storms at the beginning of January. We basically had the place to ourselves (only a torrential downpour and 60-mile-an-hour winds could keep the hipsters away; they're like the Wicked Witch of the West, you know; they melt in water!). And as pretty much the only customers, we had a great time with the servers. 

They taught me a thing or two about my new (psychotic) CrackBerry (further evidence that hipsters are hypocrites themselves when it comes to technology; see my Boogaloo's review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/boogaloos-san-francisco#hrid:Z9uvuBpgNtfjQWRsq6YABQ).   They served us delicious vegan sammies and fries that left me NOT complaining about wanting REAL diner food. AND...

I met the milkshake alchemist. 

On first glance, you'd never know the depth of skill this girl possesses. But she can make you any kind of milkshake under the sun -- totally vegan, and you'd never know it. The flavors she concocts, back in her wood-paneled kitchen laboratory... Hot damn. That particular day, I tried banana walnut, at her suggestion. Oh yeah.

So my beef with St. Francis is, of course, that we really only get downpours torrential enough to keep the hipsters away about once every couple months. So I'm usually passing the Fountain by, groaning at all the skinny jeans lined up outside as I move on to the Sun Rise a few blocks up 24th.

Therefore I can only give them three stars. And yes, I'm punishing them for their clientele. But just know that I really want to give them more, and be satisfied that I realize I'm a hypocrite. 

Hipsters make the best vegan milkshakes. There. I said it.

excerpts:
For your "toast" you can opt for corn bread, biscuit (bomb!), banana bread, or a wide variety of toast. 

Let me repeat that: banana bread, corn bread or biscuit!
banana.author: Gabe b.
banana.review:
No, I do not think ordering a chocolate milkshake at breakfast is "aggressive." 

I love when you look at a menu and there are so many tasty vittles on there that the excite just overwhelms you like a tidal wave of deliciousness and good vibes. 

That is how I feel about St. Francis. You can opt for every egg dish as either a 2 egg scramble or a 3 egg omelet. Seriously, why is this the first time I've seen this! 
Does this kind of breakfast related ingenuity only live South of Mission? 

For your "toast" you can opt for corn bread, biscuit (bomb!), banana bread, or a wide variety of toast. 

Let me repeat that: banana bread, corn bread or biscuit! 

Man, how many people's Nanas do they have chained up back there baking this stuff! 

Absolutely delicious. I'll be back.

excerpts: I've had the side platter with soup, mac and cheese, and salad and have also had the tofu scramble and a banana milkshake.
The food was great
BUT the service is lacking.
The staff is unhelpful and act like you should be honored to be at their cool restaurant.
But for good food I can get over bad service sometimes.
banana.author: Samantha C.
banana.review: The food here was great. I've had the side platter with soup, mac and cheese, and salad and have also had the tofu scramble and a banana milkshake. The food was great BUT the service is lacking. The staff is unhelpful and act like you should be honored to be at their cool restaurant. But for good food I can get over bad service sometimes.

excerpts: My mouth was watering for the ice cream treats to follow, but my hot fudge banana split did not have enough fudge, yo.
banana.author: Karen W.
banana.review:
S'alright.  I had very high hopes for this place because it's so cute and I just love me some All American Fountain Food, but it fell short.  Very short.

I do have to say the macaroni and cheese was very good, but the sandwiches we tasted were just OK.  My mouth was watering for the ice cream treats to follow, but my hot fudge banana split did not have enough fudge, yo. My dining companion had selected the brownie sundae, but dang- that brownie was hard.

I'm going to stick to Swenson's in SF, and when I'm away from home I'll always be true to Vic's ice cream in Sac-o-Tomatoes; it's truly the best fountain I've found.

excerpts: The Chef's Mess with Banana Bread is my go to order.
For lunch any of the burgers or chicken sandwiches are great except every now
and then my fries have been cold
banana.author: Jason S.
banana.review:
I'm sure a lot of people think they live on the best block in SF but if they don't live near 24th and Bryant they are halfway retarded.  Either that or they haven't been here.  Which is a good thing because one of the best things about the block is it's never crowded.  You can always get a seat at any of the awesome places right on this little patch of hipster heaven.  Shit maybe I shouldn't give this place 5 stars or more people will come and I won't be able to get a seat!

Anyways back to the review --- This is seriously the best breakfast I've had anywhere in the Bay.  If I was a world class athlete or didn't care if I weighed 500 lbs I'd eat breakfast here everyday.  Seriously it's that good and I don't even eat breakfast during the week.

I've tried most of the things on the menu and for breakfast you really can't go wrong.  The Chef's Mess with Banana Bread is my go to order.  For lunch any of the burgers or chicken sandwiches are great except every now and then my fries have been cold but you don't have to put up with what David Foster Wallace calls the Professional Smile or the opposite Professional Scowl.

Then of course there's the ice cream and shakes which are classic and delicious.  Take my advice and just get the small shake.  It's so good you can get by on quality not quantity.

When Adam Richman from Man-vs-Food comes to SF he should definitely stop here.

About the only improvement I'd make is ditching the Tapatio for Red Hot.

excerpts: I get the breakfast burrito, my boyfriend always gets the banana bread-
BE SURE TO GET THE BANANA BREAD-
banana.author: Rebecca L.
banana.review:
This place is so delicious and yummy and affordable... and did I mention delicious? I get the breakfast burrito, my boyfriend always gets the banana bread- BE SURE TO GET THE BANANA BREAD- and always, a milkshake. 

A hint: DO NOT consume all of this while in the restaurant. Get your milkshake to-go, and perhaps share a plate. They fill their plates to the brim which is amazing and it's all so good. Friendly staff, too. I love this place. Tell only who you must. It's a bit hard to get a table on the weekends but it's worth the wait!

excerpts: either a side of cornbread, banana bread, white or wheat!
banana.author: AhLin C.
banana.review:
The Chef's Mess is def. what St. Francis Fountain is all about. It's like a scramble w/ cheese and sour cream on top!  
And get this, it comes w/ either a side of cornbread, banana bread, white or wheat! 

Everything there was great.  Service was fast and efficient!  When we got there, it seemed like we were going to be waiting for an hour, since we placed our name on the second sign sign in sheet.  But surprise surprise, it was just a bit over 30 minutes for the wait.  
Also tried their pancakes, which was just ok.  But it wasn't bad either.  

Everything on the menu wasn't really expensive either.  $7-10, which is average.

excerpts: I of course got the hash with two eggs and a side of cornbread, and my wife got the Chef's Mess (2 eggs scrambled with homefries, bacon & mushrooms, topped with melted cheese, tomatoes, sour cream & green onions) and a piece of banana bread.
banana.author: Michael W.
banana.review:
So... continuing the sage of our mini vacation to San Francisco, we explored the streets around the Mission district after enjoying our stop at Dynamo Donuts.  We'd decided we wanted lunch but didn't have our hearts set on anything in particular.  

After wandering a bit we noticed a little place called St. Francis Fountain on the corner with a grip of hipsters waiting to be seated and some great music playing in the background.  We figured any place with this many people waiting must be good, so we put our names on the list.  We checked out the menu while we waited and my eyes were immediately drawn to the Corned Beef Hash.  My mind was made before we even sat down, I LOVE good hash and its been awhile since I've had any.  We only waited about 10 minutes despite the line and were seated at the counter which only added to the cool vibe.  The inside looks like an old-school fountain shop with church pews for seats in the booths.  I of course got the hash with two eggs and a side of cornbread, and my wife got the Chef's Mess (2 eggs scrambled with homefries, bacon & mushrooms, topped with melted cheese, tomatoes, sour cream & green onions) and a piece of banana bread.

This is some of the best hash I've had in a long time.  My personal favorite is the corned beef hash from Harris Ranch but this is a close second.  Oh and the Chef's Mess was delicious as well.  There must have been 3-4 slices of bacon in there, they definitely didn't skimp.

I wanted to take some pictures of the food but my wife informed me that "cool people" wouldn't do that lol.  Even though I'm not a hipster, if I lived in San Francisco I'd make this a regular breakfast stop.

excerpts: and I ordered the "Chef's Mess" (a concoction of eggs, cheese, bacon and other veggies in scrambled form--somewhat like an omelet but more mixed up) and the Banana & Walnut pancakes.
The Chef's Mess was fantastic, all of the flavors being perfectly balanced and complementary with one another (creamy cheese with salty bacon, etc).
The Banana & Walnut pancakes were great, although a tad on the dry side, as pancakes tend to be.
I would get both again, however they had many varieties of pancakes
and I would probably try a different kind next time, perhaps with whipped cream to up my calorie intake.
The Chef's Mess was $8 while the stack of three Banana & Walnut pancakes was around $7.
banana.author: Benjamin L.
banana.review:
FOOD: FOUR STARS (* * * *)
My boyfriend and I ordered the "Chef's Mess" (a concoction of eggs, cheese, bacon and other veggies in scrambled form--somewhat like an omelet but more mixed up) and the Banana & Walnut pancakes.  The Chef's Mess was fantastic, all of the flavors being perfectly balanced and complementary with one another (creamy cheese with salty bacon, etc).  The Banana & Walnut pancakes were great, although a tad on the dry side, as pancakes tend to be.  I would get both again, however they had many varieties of pancakes and I would probably try a different kind next time, perhaps with whipped cream to up my calorie intake.  The coffee was pleasantly strong and tasty.

ENVIRONMENT/SERVICE: THREE STARS (* * *)
Despite a multitude of hipsters in front of the restaurant, presumably waiting to get in (or congregating to head to the nearest American Apparel?), we didn't have to wait long, probably 10 minutes at most, and we were there at the prime-time brunch hour of 11:00am.  The service inside the restaurant was average--I felt it took a bit too long to have anybody come by for the drink orders, but other than that, it was fine.

VALUE: FOUR STARS (* * * *)
The prices are certainly reasonable for what you get--this isn't IHOP with a $5.99 all-you-can-eat Pancake-a-thon, but neither is this bourgeois territory.  Two $$ is entirely appropriate.  The Chef's Mess was $8 while the stack of three Banana & Walnut pancakes was around $7.  Coffee came in at $2 per mug with free refills.

Average of
FOOD: FOUR STARS
ENVIRONMENT/SERVICE: THREE STARS
VALUE: FOUR STARS
================
AVERAGED GRAND TOTAL: FOUR STARS

Estimated price per person (excluding drink):
$9-11

Would I recommend it to others?
Yes.  I think this is a great SF breakfast place for pretty much everyone.

Would I return?
Yes.

excerpts: And I loved the homemade Banana Bread.
This breakfast was a pleasant surprise
and I can't wait to go back for lunch or a milkshake!
banana.author: Barbie L.
banana.review: The Chef's Mess is delicious! And I loved the homemade Banana Bread. This breakfast was a pleasant surprise and I can't wait to go back for lunch or a milkshake!

excerpts: I instantly loved the decor - old fashion soda fountain with booths and a big long counter at which to consume your malted milkshake or your banana split.
Lots of hipsters of course, but lots of other people too.
It feels nice and homey, the staff are always nice if not always super attentive.
I usually go for brunch and it's always pretty damn good.
Weekend brunch specials excite me -
I've also come here late at night to sit at the counter and get a banana split
and I'll admit it
- I felt special.
Be prepared to wait on the weekends - they've recently taken over the space next door to deal with their high weekend volume but its not always in use.
Grab a cup of Philz on the way, write your name down, and enjoy the weekend bustle as you wait for a damn good brunch.
banana.author: Jane F.
banana.review:
This place has totally grown on me.
The first time I tried it, I was kind of, what's all the fuss?  A few more tries and it's deservedly on my list of regular places.  I instantly loved the decor - old fashion soda fountain with booths and a big long counter at which to consume your malted milkshake or your banana split.  Lots of hipsters of course, but lots of other people too.  It feels nice and homey, the staff are always nice if not always super attentive.
I usually go for brunch and it's always pretty damn good.  Weekend brunch specials excite me - The Benedict is really awesome.  I usually avoid anything with bacon as it's always burned almost past recognition.  There's also a lot of vegan options which I'm not interested in but I'm sure many others will be.  
I've come here for lunch and the sandwiches are good, and there are yummy sides like mac and cheese and soup and chilli - true diner style.  I've also come here late at night to sit at the counter and get a banana split and I'll admit it - I felt special.
Be prepared to wait on the weekends - they've recently taken over the space next door to deal with their high weekend volume but its not always in use.  Grab a cup of Philz on the way, write your name down, and enjoy the weekend bustle as you wait for a damn good brunch.

excerpts: Get banana.
banana.author: Kacie O.
banana.review: Unique twist on classic brunch food. A little intensely hipster, but worth braving the scene and the long wait for the food.  Mitchell's ice cream used in the shakes! Get banana.

excerpts: And of course, my boyfriend and I got a Butterscotch Italian soda and a banana shake to share. ^_^
banana.author: Jessica S.
banana.review: It is a quaint restaurant in the Mission and it had a few people waiting outside to eat at this place - it must be good, right? I didn't like the chili cheese fries but I did really enjoy the Macaroni & Cheese, which my boyfriend had and also shared with me. My bacon cheeseburger was yummy but nothing really special. And of course, my boyfriend and I got a Butterscotch Italian soda and a banana shake to share. ^_^

excerpts: but I will be back for the vegan banana walnut pancakes with real maple syrup.
banana.author: Unfriendly V.
banana.review:
Due to the Lunch Rush that never materialized, the waitperson insisted I leave 4 adjacent seats at the counter open (me sitting in the 5th), thus forcing me to sit  next to an all-elbows woman who was hacking up a lung. 

I will never be able to stomach the Devil Burger (seitan sandwich) again... but I will be back for the vegan banana walnut pancakes with real maple syrup.

excerpts: The banana bread and cornbread are delicious, and I love places that serve soyrizo and have vegetarian options.
banana.author: Faith A.
banana.review: Really good breakfast place. Ate here for Sunday brunch and the wait was about fifteen minutes. Good table/coffee service, really nice waiter. The banana bread and cornbread are delicious, and I love places that serve soyrizo and have vegetarian options.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I had an amazing hot fudge sundae banana split.
I am almost salivating just thinking about it !
The only caveat was that the service was somewhat lacking; I don't know if it was just a poor staff to customer ratio, but, the service wasn't all that great, but, not terrible either.
I will definately give it another shot; the positives far outweigh the negatives.
**UPDATE
I went back this afternoon with my boyfriend and had absolutely TERRIFIC service.
Matt (look for him, great guy) was extremely attentive and didn't make me feel like a huge jerk when I accidentally spilled a glass of water all over the table.
AWESOME!
And my sundae was delish; you should totally go give this place a try.
banana.author: Jessica R.
banana.review:
I went here for dinner on a weekeday night with my friends and my boyfriend. It wasn't terribly crowded and it seemed pretty cool. We sit down and order up what turns out to be amazing grub. (Get the potato salad instead of fries, for the love of all which is holy!) My boyfriend and I had an amazing hot fudge sundae banana split. I am almost salivating just thinking about it ! The only caveat was that the service was somewhat lacking; I don't know if it was just a poor staff to customer ratio, but, the service wasn't all that great, but, not terrible either. I will definately give it another shot; the positives far outweigh the negatives.
****UPDATE****
I went back this afternoon with my boyfriend and had absolutely TERRIFIC service. Matt (look for him, great guy) was extremely attentive and didn't make me feel like a huge jerk when I accidentally spilled a glass of water all over the table. AWESOME!  And my sundae was delish; you should totally go give this place a try.

excerpts: I also saw the most adorable plate of pancakes for a little girl next to me, that one of the chefs made into the shape of a bunny with banana and chocolate chip eyes, and a strawberry nose.
banana.author: Best M.
banana.review: awesome milk shakes, super friendly staff, great music playing. A great little treat for a burger/shake stop in the middle of the heart of the 24th street taquerias. Its such a little out of the way treat, and SO NICE to be able to go and get ice cream, and sit down at the counter and be waited on, very old fashioned style.  Not like crowding into a too small icecream shope like bi-rite, which just ruins the experience.... this place is comfy and fun.  I also saw the most adorable plate of pancakes for a little girl next to me, that one of the chefs made into the shape of a bunny with banana and chocolate chip eyes, and a strawberry nose.

excerpts: I couldn't finish my feta & spinach scrambled eggs with banana bread and a side of house fries (all for less than $9) but it wasn't for want of trying.
The decor is also pleasant;
an understated old-school diner style-ee.
I will be back, mayhaps for the Thai scramble if I'm feeling adventurous enough.
banana.author: starla o.
banana.review: I don't know why this place doesn't have 5 stars - it deserves it. I bounced in here this morning, high because I made it out into the sunshine before noon, and was met by a friendly waitress and an extensive menu. Holy gaucamole, you can get Thai style scrambled eggs, a Guinness ice-cream float and delicious house fries. I couldn't finish my feta & spinach scrambled eggs with banana bread and a side of house fries (all for less than $9) but it wasn't for want of trying. The decor is also pleasant; an understated old-school diner style-ee. I will be back, mayhaps for the Thai scramble if I'm feeling adventurous enough.

excerpts: I had a banana Milk Shake with real banana it was awesome!!
banana.author: Miray V.
banana.review: I took my friend from Germany here. I figured would give her a taste of a good old fashioned Diner. She loved it. I explained what a country fried steak was and she got that. I had a banana Milk Shake with real banana it was awesome!!

excerpts: Really great breakfast dishes, and SUPERB banana bread served warm.
Your coffee cup won't ever run dry here either.
banana.author: Jade L.
banana.review: Even though this place is overflowing with hipsters, I still love going here. The wait staff are remarkably friendly, and usually pretty quick. There is usually a wait, but I've never had a problem getting seated within twenty minutes no matter how long the line seems to be. Really great breakfast dishes, and SUPERB banana bread served warm. Your coffee cup won't ever run dry here either.

excerpts:
- you can choose from corn bread, banana bread and biscuits
- lots of veggie and vegan options
- just a ten minute walk from my house in po-hill
- outside seating for those frigid summer days
- won't break the bank
- despite his multiple tattoos (see other reviews), our waiter was friendly and capable.
banana.author: jean w.
banana.review:
praise to st. francis! my friend visiting from boston went away thinking SF was the raddest place ever, and i believe our brunch experience at SF contributed to his delight. i made my party of five wait while i took a picture of our food plates, if that tells you anything. 

additional bonuses include:
- they're not stingy with the avocado in their breakfast burritos. we're talking chunks, people, CHUNKS.
- you can choose from corn bread, banana bread and biscuits
- lots of veggie and vegan options
- just a ten minute walk from my house in po-hill
- outside seating for those frigid summer days
- won't break the bank
- despite his multiple tattoos (see other reviews), our waiter was friendly and capable.

yes!

excerpts: the omlette options abound, and with the option of banana bread instead of toast, it wins over all other breakfast spots I've been to in SF.
and the wait,
yeah, it sucks, but that's cause it's good.
