if there's not a line on the weekends, then it can't be a very good brunch spot!
if you want to go without the crowd, the breakfast is served all day long
(love that!)
banana.author: Sarah X.
banana.review:
you can hate all you want on the hipsters, but don't you go hating on st. francis.

this is the BEST breakfast place ever.  the omlette options abound, and with the option of banana bread instead of toast, it wins over all other breakfast spots I've been to in SF.  and the wait, yeah, it sucks, but that's cause it's good.  if there's not a line on the weekends, then it can't be a very good brunch spot!  if you want to go without the crowd, the breakfast is served all day long (love that!) and the dinners are the best comfort food on a rainy night ever.

and finally, not only is it old school, it makes you sound old school - like you're going to church on sunday morning - only way more satisfying.  yay st. francis!

excerpts: That'll leave more banana bread for me!

(Ha)
One disappointing dish (cause you have to complain huh?): the mac&cheese.
But I read how people love it, must be done right then.
banana.author: Laure b.
banana.review:
I am NOT a hipster.
I have a thick french accent that definitively doesn't sound cool nor local.
Yet Saint Francis is and has been remaining my favorite place for brunch in 4 years now.

I've seen waiters come and go, but the food has stayed immutably good and satisfying. I have tried real hard to find eggs benedict that can top theirs (or at least be comparable), with no succes so far. They have the best hollandaise sauce period. And I make hollandaise, so I know what it should taste like!

If you want fancy (=not much on your plate) don't come here. That'll leave more banana bread for me! (Ha)
One disappointing dish (cause you have to complain huh?): the mac&cheese. But I read how people love it, must be done right then.

excerpts: Great banana splits, malts (with so much malt that you can crunch em) and vegie burgers (made with your choice of faux-meat dammit!).
banana.author: Justin L.
banana.review:
This is the real deal with bonus tracks...

Great banana splits, malts (with so much malt that you can crunch em) and vegie burgers (made with your choice of faux-meat dammit!). 

Best veggie burger I've found in SF so far. Excellent fries, skinny with skins. Knock-out breakfasts. As long as you're coming for soda jerk food you're going to be happy. But don't expect 50's bubble gum music, the closest thing you'll find to the 50's outside the egg cream is the cute rockabilly waitress (does she count?).

excerpts: i got a scramble with soy chorizo and cheese, a side of potatoes (yum) and some banana bread.
Ahhh!
it was one of the best breakfasts i'd ever had.
my friend got the same thing as me except she got biscuits.
those biscuits were so good that they still come up in our conversations.
the scramble was so cheesey and the soy chorizo so delicious omg and with the potatoes and some ketchup
wow.
if you put all of it in your mouth,including a bite of the buscuit, at once you will soon discover it taste like sex in your mouth.
i went back a second time,and things only got better.i got another scramble,
this time with cheese,mushrooms,onions and pesto.and that was an even better combo.my goal is to come here and try every combination possible until i discover the best
one.when
i do i will update this review,expect to hear from me again!
banana.author: Peeta B.
banana.review:
my favorite diner in san francisco! i found it on yelp (ofcourse) and decided to go with a friend. we waited about ten to fifteen minutes.we were seated and as soon as i got a look at that menu i started salivating. so many frikkin options! i got a scramble with soy chorizo and cheese, a side of potatoes (yum) and some banana bread.Ahhh! it was one of the best breakfasts i'd ever had. my friend got the same thing as me except she got biscuits. those biscuits were so good that they still come up in our conversations. the scramble was so cheesey and the soy chorizo so delicious omg and with the potatoes and some ketchup wow. if you put all of it in your mouth,including a bite of the buscuit, at once you will soon discover it taste like sex in your mouth.
i went back a second time,and things only got better.i got another scramble, this time with cheese,mushrooms,onions and pesto.and that was an even better combo.my goal is to come here and try every combination possible until i discover the best one.when i do i will update this review,expect to hear from me again!

excerpts: Generally I think a lot of their food is pretty good, if not somewhat expensive, but when it comes to their comfort food selections (aforementioned chili and cornbread, other baked goods like banana bread and biscuits, milkshakes, soups) they live up to their holy title.
Amen.
banana.author: Hallie R.
banana.review: "Momma said there'd be days like this, there'd be days like this my momma said (momma said, momma said!)"--this is the song that just randomly popped into my head this morning. That should have been warning enough to get back in bed and pull up the covers, but no, I went out into the world. Some allergy is making my eyes look like I've spent the day crying and I didn't notice until after going out into public that in my fitful sleep of the night before I had somehow managed to work a giant upwardly mobile knot into the back of my hair. So why am I telling you this? Other than because I can? Because on days like this I want my Momma to scoop me into her lap and spoon feed me Kraft Macaroni and Cheese.  As this is not an option I can at least search for a culinary equivalent. With its retro stylings and tweaked diner menu, I took my foggyheaded self straight to St Francis. Veggie chili topped with cheddar cheese, sour cream, and green onions with a generous slice of warm, crispy-on-the-outside-soft-and-buttery-on-the-inside corn bread was EXACTLY what I needed. It was a hug from my innards outwards. Generally I think a lot of their food is pretty good, if not somewhat expensive, but when it comes to their comfort food selections (aforementioned chili and cornbread, other baked goods like banana bread and biscuits, milkshakes, soups) they live up to their holy title. Amen.

excerpts: The perfect desert after stuffing my face with a fat plate of chile colorado at Roosevelt's Tamale Parlor, which is just down the block (something about the coolness of the frozen banana and the spicy chile colorado... yummm).
Next time you go in, ask them what the hell happened to making their own ice cream?
A few days after they reopened they told me they were learning how to make their own, not saying that Mitchell's isn't a brilliant choice, but are they going to make their own?
Because that would be cool.
banana.author: Margie N.
banana.review: I'm really glad that they reopened this place... for the one reason, and one reason only: frozen chocolate bananas.  I haven't been in lately, but I really REALLY hope they're selling these bad boys when I get back.  The perfect desert after stuffing my face with a fat plate of chile colorado at Roosevelt's Tamale Parlor, which is just down the block (something about the coolness of the frozen banana and the spicy chile colorado... yummm).  Next time you go in, ask them what the hell happened to making their own ice cream?  A few days after they reopened they told me they were learning how to make their own, not saying that Mitchell's isn't a brilliant choice, but are they going to make their own?  Because that would be cool.

excerpts: And of course, my boyfriend and I got a Butterscotch Italian soda and a banana shake to share. ^_^
butterscotch.author: Jessica S.
butterscotch.review: It is a quaint restaurant in the Mission and it had a few people waiting outside to eat at this place - it must be good, right? I didn't like the chili cheese fries but I did really enjoy the Macaroni & Cheese, which my boyfriend had and also shared with me. My bacon cheeseburger was yummy but nothing really special. And of course, my boyfriend and I got a Butterscotch Italian soda and a banana shake to share. ^_^

excerpts: I also ordered a vegan butterscotch milkshake.
It took a very long time for the shake to come out
so they didn't charge us and I ended up.
Tip: Ask for a couple straws because the straws are cool looking paper ones which end up being useless after a few sips.
I'm really bummed
I didn't find out about this place until the day before we left SF :(
I will definitely come back here!
butterscotch.author: Liane E.
butterscotch.review: I came here after finding it on yelp and decided to give it a try. My friend and I absolutely loved this place! It really is a 50's style diner/malt shop. I decided to come here because of how vegan friendly it seemed to be. The menu is a couple pages and it truly is vegan/vegetarian friendly. My friend had vegetarian chili which she thought was really good. I had the vegan blueberry pancakes which was soooo delicious! I also ordered a vegan butterscotch milkshake. It took a very long time for the shake to come out so they didn't charge us and I ended up. Tip: Ask for a couple straws because the straws are cool looking paper ones which end up being useless after a few sips. I'm really bummed I didn't find out about this place until the day before we left SF :(  I will definitely come back here!

excerpts: mmmm butterscotch milkshakes.
mmm mac'n' cheese.
mmmm french toast!
could there be anything better??
plus!
butterscotch.author: Jaei P.
butterscotch.review:
my favourite place to eat in the city! i would eat there every day if i could! and trust me, living down the street from the St.Francis makes that no easy task! the best parts about it?

- the food! mmmm butterscotch milkshakes. mmm mac'n' cheese. mmmm french toast! could there be anything better?? plus! they just updated their menu to include more vegan/vegetarian options!

- the original staff rocks! their totally cool, friendly, and are damngood! at their job! (i say "original" because they hired a few new girls whom i dont know well enough to say anything) 

- the place is totally authentic. the little candy counter is too cool (my roomates and i collect the vintage playing cards. my favourite so far is the MegaMetal pack). and, outdoor seating on a sunny sunday afternoon makes the food taste even better. genius!

the St.Francis is honestly too good to be true.


but! be warned the place gets pretty busy on weekends. and their freezer is currently broken for the second time this summer. BUMMER. still worth it though!

excerpts: I've only tried the buster brown ($7.25), an ice cream sundae with warm fudge brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry sauce, whipped cream, and walnuts.
The portion size was generous, and it was rich, decadent, and delicious.
There's a cute little park across the street if you want to sit and eat outside.
raspberry.author: Elaine L.
raspberry.review: I've only tried the buster brown ($7.25), an ice cream sundae with warm fudge brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry sauce, whipped cream, and walnuts. The portion size was generous, and it was rich, decadent, and delicious. There's a cute little park across the street if you want to sit and eat outside.

excerpts: The Buster Brown, warm brownie with ice cream, raspberry sauce, walnuts and whipped cream.
raspberry.author: Enzo L.
raspberry.review:
We love to swing by after Roosevelt Tamale Parlour for dessert.  The Buster Brown, warm brownie with ice cream, raspberry sauce, walnuts and whipped cream.  People are crazy about the tofu scrambles, and it's such a great neighborhood.

I'm a married gay man, so this dessert is what porn used to be to me.  Don't miss it.

excerpts: And the Buster Brown (brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry stuff, whipped cream, walnuts) was sinful but delicious.
raspberry.author: Lindsay D.
raspberry.review:
The veggie burger with cheese was very tasty.  The mac and cheese was good but too oniony for my liking.  And the Buster Brown (brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry stuff, whipped cream, walnuts) was sinful but delicious.  The place wasn't busy and the service was fast and friendly.

The cons:
* no lock on bathroom so my friend burst in on some poor kid on the john
* by other yelp reviews I thought I was in for a lot more vegetarian options but, unless you want breakfast (and what breakfast joint doesn't have tons of veggie options?), it's pretty slim pickins for veggies (boca/veggie burger, grilled chz, veggie reuben, veggie chili).

excerpts: Try the pineapple!)
pineapple.author: Keith H.
pineapple.review:
I've visited St. Francis Fountain for a few years now, and it's become a frequent lunch spot when I'm working in the area.  It's my go-to, solid option when I'm looking for diner food.

I usually stick to getting sandwiches or getting breakfast/brunch food.  I've tried both their BLT and chicken club, and both were filling, tasty, and well-made.  I often get the french fries as a side, and they never disappoint.  Most recently, I tried their hotcakes, even though I only got 2, I was beyond stuffed. (It probably didn't help that I got one of their fabulous milkshakes, and I love that they have an option where you can blend fruit into the shake.  Try the pineapple!)

There's definitely a hipster ambience, which may be a bother to some if you think "hipster" is a 4-letter word.  However, I've always found the staff friendly and welcoming, and it has a quaint, old-school diner vibe.  You should definitely visit!

excerpts: From the moment I walked in, I loved this place, with its wooden booths and candy counter and old menu items hung on the wall as decoration (the pineapple and cream cheese salad sign is hilarious!).
pineapple.author: Victoria B.
pineapple.review:
This place is amazing! Super cute and funky. The perfect mix of nostalgia and hipness. From the moment I walked in, I loved this place, with its wooden booths and candy counter and old menu items hung on the wall as decoration (the pineapple and cream cheese salad sign is hilarious!).

The service is super friendly. We walked in and were immediately seated (though that was before 10 am. By the time we left shortly after 10, the place was pretty packed) and given water and coffee. Two servers were handling tables, expediting food, taking orders and checking refills, and they were very attentive. Even when most of the booths were filled, our coffee cups were never empty.

And the food is AMAZING. It's what you only dream diner food can be. The sourdough french toast is absolutely the perfect balance of sweetness tempered by sourdough tartness. The eggs are great and the potatoes are salty and delicious and addicting. My only regret is that I got full and couldn't eat more!

Definitely check this place out!

excerpts: Definitely didn't have room for a parfait but couldn't stop devouring sweet local granola, bananas, pineapple, strawberries, apples and what tasted like nonfat plain yogurt.
pineapple.author: Jason B.
pineapple.review:
Good thing going.

Do not underestimate a small "pile of spuds". Part of the Vegan Thing specialty topped with vegan cheese, salsa, guacamole and onions. Added a side of egg whites.

Perhaps they made a large instead because a massive mound of food was delivered. And consumed because each and every bite was outstanding.

Really didn't have room for a vegan chorizo hash side but couldn't say no to the rich delicious flavor.

Definitely didn't have room for a parfait but couldn't stop devouring sweet local granola, bananas, pineapple, strawberries, apples and what tasted like nonfat plain yogurt.

Also good was the enthusiastic and infectious service. And we were equally happy to be eating outside on a warm February Saturday. Wait was a short 15min.

Reasonable $20/person included my dining companion's much enjoyed dish, orange juice, coffee and being so full we didn't need lunch.

More than good. Five star great.

excerpts:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.
Already all smiles as patrons aged

five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt
there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'
pineapple.author: Michael U.
pineapple.review:
Items Selected:
Dreamsicle - Milk, Orange Juice, Vanilla, Vanilla Ice Cream, Orange Sherbet, Whipped Cream, Cherry on top
Warm Brownie
French Toast Delight - Yogurt, Granola, Apples, Bananas, Strawberries, Pineapple

Exiting east out of Knead and waltzing down 24th Street towards Dynamo Donuts it was with long-held interest that I once again passed by St. Francis Fountain and with daily selections less than inspiring from the small storefront at 2760 I finally decided to quell my curiosity, a short walk back just one block landing me at a two-top in the 1918 soda fountain.  Kitschy in décor with toys and trading cards from my youth available for purchase in a glass case while booths and tables sat tightly spaced juxtaposing the Formica bar it would be mere moments before I was greeted by the diner's lone server and confirming hopes of an 'all-day' menu my order quickly took shape, a duo of childhood favorites readied at the counter along with French Toast arriving less than ten minutes later.  Eschewing coffee in favor of things far sweeter it was in the classic Dreamsicle that my indulgence began and with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream beneath a hefty scoop of orange sherbet plus just enough liquid to make the concoction sippable through a straw memories of meals at Friendly's as a youngster came flooding back, a warm wedge of brownie delivered simultaneously equally worthy of reminiscence in its sheer simplicity - a lack of 'artisan' details oddly satisfying given the setting.  Already all smiles as patrons aged five to seventy-five slowly began to trickle through the doors it was with my drink still half-full but the brownie long gone that my two slices of griddled sourdough next arrived and buried beneath a mountain of granola, fresh fruit, and tangy yogurt there was only one thing to do - a $1 supplement of pure maple syrup quickly flooding the plate adding an exclamation point to my 'delight.'

excerpts: I also got a $3.00 bowl of fruit that has sliced apples, pineapple, strawberries, grapes and cantaloupes to complete my snack on my break.
pineapple.author: Matt G.
pineapple.review:
Have you ever feel imminent and in-demand to try a restaurant, but for some reason your proposed target spot(s) is/are closed and/or crowded with a "long" wait. We all experienced that many times, have we? "Stop lying and admit it that we all been through that!" 

Whenever I've needed to work in the 24th Street area, I've been here nearly a dozen times on my quick break; just for the milkshakes. But when I'm hungry, this 50's-like corner-diner has a long wait. So I ended up eating elsewhere for my lunch intermission. You want to talk about perfect-timing in desires and apathy. Go figure! 

Today and with the recent nice weather, lunchtime at noon was crowded with a long wait. So I, like I aforementioned, ate elsewhere. I did came back like around three o'clock where everybody is working or enjoying the weather elsewhere so I can enjoy the Coffee/Espresso Milkshake. For $5.00, the milkshake is made with coffee ice cream and espresso shots and other dairy mixture with a cloud of whipped cream and a cute maraschino cherry on top for that perfect shake. (I get too overwhelmed by saying "cute maraschino cherry"). 

I also got a $3.00 bowl of fruit that has sliced apples, pineapple, strawberries, grapes and cantaloupes to complete my snack on my break. I actually enjoy the variety of milkshakes made at this diner, but my review is incomplete until I eat something from here. 

Paid my meal in cash and a favorite of Yelp too.

excerpts: When our food finally arrives, the pineapple in the fruit bowl was old, one of the three slices of the side order bacon was nothing but fat, oj was old and gross, too (@4.75/glass).
Pancakes were ok.
Waiter never checked with us to see if we needed anything.
Was rude to other customers when they asked for something.
A new waiter came in with even more attitude.
Nothing of merit here for me to even reconsider another visit.
Shame bc we love divey places.
pineapple.author: Renee F.
pineapple.review: This place must be surviving on nostalgia alone. Our experience there was awful. Got the feeling it was a normal day for them. We arrive around 9:45am with the place less than half full. Waiter came to take our drink order within a few minutes. Five minutes later his buddy walks in so he chats with him  for about 10 minutes about his night and his "girl," etc, then takes HIS food order. We still have not received our drinks. Five minutes after his friend leaves, we get our water and he takes our order.  When our food finally arrives, the pineapple in the fruit bowl was old, one of the three slices of the side order bacon was nothing but fat, oj was old and gross, too (@4.75/glass). Pancakes were ok. Waiter never checked with us to see if we needed anything. Was rude to other customers when they asked for something. A new waiter came in with even more attitude. Nothing of merit here for me to even reconsider another visit. Shame bc we love divey places.

excerpts: I even remember getting a cottage cheese/pineapple wedge salad once.
Since then the ownership has changed from the original family to some folks well versed in the restaurant business.
If you like those cheap and good brunch places in the mission, but have cast them out for the 30-40 minute
wait, St. Francis Fountain is your answer.
pineapple.author: Paul S.
pineapple.review: I used to come here for lunch about 12 years ago. I would get an egg salad sandwich and some ice cream, or maybe just ice cream. I even remember getting a cottage cheese/pineapple wedge salad once.  Since then the ownership has changed from the original family to some folks well versed in the restaurant business.  If you like those cheap and good brunch places in the mission, but have cast them out for the 30-40 minute wait, St. Francis Fountain is your answer. The benedict is excellent and one of the few places in the city where you can get a really good waffle. This place has been around since 1918, and has warmly improved over the years without losing the retro feel.

excerpts: They have Italian Sodas
(I got a pinapple soda) and my husband got a Guiness float.
italian sodas.author: Lizzie D.
italian sodas.review:
This place is really cool. Old school feel and their food is pretty good too. They have Italian Sodas (I got a pinapple soda) and my husband got a Guiness float. The Modesto Pesto sandwich was really good and their fries were awesome. I love the small booths. They have a candy counter which I think kids would really enjoy. 

This is not an awesome place to bring all your friends all at once. Its a small place and they do have bar seating but its more for the small groups and locals.

excerpts: I ordered the Eggs Florentine with home fries, a Poinsettia (Cranberry and champagne) and a coffee-
While the coffee is a great drip of Peerless and the poinsettia was well-balanced, the main dish was decidedly lackluster.

The presentation was certainly acceptable, however, the low quality of the foods meant that my yolks had no taste, the hollandaise shouted out it's powdered origins, the spinach tasted misused or perhaps even canned.
poinsettia.author: Cameo W.
poinsettia.review:
Excellent (albeit 'hip') service- Lackluster food, unremarkable quality.  

This historic soda shop has signs up that remind one of the idyllic 50s in San Francisco- when a Malt was a staple and comfort foods were still worth advertising on hand painted signs.

I ordered the Eggs Florentine with home fries, a Poinsettia (Cranberry and champagne) and a coffee- While the coffee is a great drip of Peerless and the poinsettia was well-balanced, the main dish was decidedly lackluster.  The presentation was certainly acceptable, however, the low quality of the foods meant that my yolks had no taste, the hollandaise shouted out it's powdered origins, the spinach tasted misused or perhaps even canned.  I had a few bites of my meal, and enjoyed the drinks and company instead.

Based on the other recommendations- I'd suggest one stick to foods that rely less on the quality of the original ingredients, and rely more upon preserved foods and spices.  This place has great ambiance, malts, and sandwiches made of meat, relishes, mustards, and bread.

The handsome and trendy staff and patrons range from my middle-aged Precita Eyes volunteer dining companions at the counter to the gaggles of 20-somethings in Valencia-styled capris and ironic t-shirts.  The gorgeous preserved interior is lovely to gaze at and imagine an earlier time.

excerpts: Menu also has four different kind of mimosas, all with creative California flower names ("bougainvillea" == champagne
+ OJ + cranberry juice), and all made with freshly-squeezed orange juice.
Totally unpretentious and yummy food -- this one's a keeper.
bougainvillea.author: Nori H.
bougainvillea.review: A friend told me that this place had "the best tofu scramble in town," and I'm not one to pass up a tip of that nature.  Turns out that this 50's-style diner (authentically so, minus the cheesy revamping that that phrase might make you think of) has not one but *four* tofu scrambles on the menu!  The one I tried (Tofu Mex) was great, and came with more potatoes than God.  Wow.  Menu also has four different kind of mimosas, all with creative California flower names ("bougainvillea" == champagne + OJ + cranberry juice), and all made with freshly-squeezed orange juice.  Totally unpretentious and yummy food -- this one's a keeper.

excerpts: and I'm sure their ice cream sundaes are enjoyable
ice cream sundaes.author: Tay H.
ice cream sundaes.review:
I can't reasonably call this place average - I've had better meals at Denny's.  Hence the two stars.

My first visit was for breakfast.  We had a large spread of different items and they were all pretty lackluster, with the biscuits and gravy being actively bad - extremely hard biscuits and very unpleasant gravy.  

I was ready to write St. Francis Fountain off, but when I saw that they were one of the few places open offering a tuna melt sandwich on the day I was craving it, we went back for a late lunch.

Mistake.

The tuna melt and accompanying fries were awful.  The tuna was super dry and there was hardly enough cheese.  Plus, it was mostly hardened once it reached the table.  Oh, and the tomato slices even managed to be bland.  The french fries were revolting.  See attached photos.  They looked as though they were fried and then refried in old, stanky oil....and then let to sit out for....some time.

My boyfriend's meal was no better.  His french toast tasted totally of salted butter - so much so that it overpowered the maple syrup, which is hard to do.

I realize this review sounds pretty dire, but I think the place is cute and service is quick and I'm sure their ice cream sundaes are enjoyable, so maybe just come here for the dessert...

P.S. They have an inexplicable policy of ending outdoor seating TWO HOURS before they close (maybe three, but definitely no less than two).  This was hugely disappointing to us, as we brought our dog and I was very freaked out to tie him up outside (even though we literally sat on the opposite side of the window).  I really can't explain why anyone would have this type of policy, and even though we didn't make a stink when they informed us that we couldn't sit outside (literally just "oh, ok"), the waiter told us repeatedly and even went so far as to suggest we "remember this for next time." Very bizarre...especially since another couple with a dog was sitting at one of those tables when we arrived, at least an hour after that supposedly ended.

excerpts: The wait took only about 30 min so the smaller the party, the better...my sister and I sat up at the counter space and saw that they made milkshakes, fountain drinks, and ice cream sundaes!
Awesome!
Our server was super busy
so he didn't refill our waters until we asked but more importantly, our food came out hot and in a timely fashion.
As usual, there was the dilemma of sweet or savory?
ice cream sundaes.author: Karen Y.
ice cream sundaes.review:
This has got to be my new favorite brunch place by far! Apparently St. Francis has been around since 1918 and I only JUST found out about it?? This is preposterous! Better late than never I guess! =P It has an old diner feel that really takes you back in time. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=L1r-MnDtTjlARMkBtRruFw). I love the little candy stand as you walk in too! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=oITQEEiugUWwGgcQPI8s5A) There was a mannequin set up there but I wonder if we would have been able to purchase the candies. Definitely has a hipster crowd/vibe.

The wait took only about 30 min so the smaller the party, the better...my sister and I sat up at the counter space and saw that they made milkshakes, fountain drinks, and ice cream sundaes! Awesome! Our server was super busy so he didn't refill our waters until we asked but more importantly, our food came out hot and in a timely fashion. As usual, there was the dilemma of sweet or savory? We opted to share one of each so it worked out perfectly!

Savory:
3 egg white omelette with spinach, mushrooms, and jack cheese ($9.50 plus $1.50 to sub for egg whites) - $11 was worth all the food we got! The omelette tasted amazing...the spinach and mushrooms were on top of the eggs and the cheese was melted inside. A different approach but SO good! The home fries with a drizzle of tabasco sauce was heaven...thick crispy layer on the outside (the way I like it) and didn't need salt or pepper. And to top if off, the corn bread was TO DIE FOR! It was fresh and crumbly with a crunchy crust...not dry at all either. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=lJxtbZmSNZ_5NVLtOrFtdw)

Sweet:
2 chocolate chip pancakes ($6) - Wow I never imagined having that many chocolate chips in each bite from a pancake...until I had the pancakes here. Extremely chocolatey with abundant melted chocolate chips so it may not be for everyone but I really enjoyed it since I loooove chocolate! The pancakes were GIGANTIC so it was an incredible deal. Epitome of perfect pancakes...fluffy and sweet with a nice brown color. Maple syrup not needed in this case unless you have a major sweet tooth!
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=qg70YmosCoEeBZ0QOC6qRA)

In conclusion, a very filling and delicious meal perfect for 2 people! Extra points for having tons of menu options that will keep me coming back for more. I recommend everyone go check it out!

excerpts: The yogurt toppings in my opinion was a terrible pairing.
toppings.author: Lisa L.
toppings.review:
Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon for a quick brunch with my sister. The wait was around 10 minutes, which we utilized to decide what to order. 

We were seated on the other side of the restaurant which didn't have the best ambiance. They definitely skimped on the lighting, making the entire room feel really dull and uninviting. The water served was lukewarm and tasted funky. 

My sister ordered the buttermilk hot cakes that came with salted butter and one slice of orange garnish. In terms of flavor, although fluffy, we both came to a consensus that it was somewhat off-putting? I wasn't sure if it was the flour they used or their over all pancake batter, but there was this grainy floury aftertaste the more you ate it. 

I ordered the French Toast Delight that came with yogurt, granola and fruits. With how it was worded on the menu, I originally assumed the parfait-like portion of this dish would be on the side, INSTEAD it was on TOP of my French toast... Amongst my fruit, I was lucky to get a nice piece of the apple core, which humans can totally just ingest those apple seeds no problem (if you didn't get, sarcasm). Anyway, for $10.50, all I wanted was some good simple French Toast, but got played hard. The yogurt toppings in my opinion was a terrible pairing. The sourness from the yogurt literally overpowered everything and the dryness of the granola ruined the texture I hoped from the fluffy French toast... The selection of fruit was quite sad, just raisins, apple and cantaloupe chunks, strawberries and grapes, which are some odd pairings with yogurt and toast? As for the toast, I was disappointed.... just didn't satisfy those cravings and wished I walked a bit further or something to go to some other brunch place. 

TL;DR: don't recommend the pancakes and French toast Delight. However I'm sure their other brunch items may be better.

excerpts: This place serves up an awesome Weekend Benedict Specials with various toppings--my go to is Bacon (chopped thick cut) and Avocado (fresh and plentiful) which is DELICIOUS--for ~$13.50 (your usual SF prices...).
It comes with your choice of Fruit or Potatoes (the shredded then fried flat kind, not cubed or roasted.)
You can also add bottomless coffee and a Champagne Drink (mimosas!) or Large OJ for $4.
They also have 3-4 other types of champagne "mimosas" and a large menu of Egg breakfasts, omlettes, french toasts, and tons of other carnivous, herbavorious, and vegan options.
toppings.author: Nerissa C.
toppings.review:
Food: WORTH IT.

My friends and I used to go to this other AMAZING brunch spot that experienced a fire and hasn't opened up over 1+ years since :( so we're doing our due diligence to find a comparable "replacement" (in our stomachs, not our hearts) to bring back the brunch bash. All I need in life is eggs bennie and finally, we've found a worthy opponent.

This place serves up an awesome Weekend Benedict Specials with various toppings--my go to is Bacon (chopped thick cut) and Avocado (fresh and plentiful) which is DELICIOUS--for ~$13.50 (your usual SF prices...). It comes with your choice of Fruit or Potatoes (the shredded then fried flat kind, not cubed or roasted.) You can also add bottomless coffee and a Champagne Drink (mimosas!) or Large OJ for $4. They also have 3-4 other types of champagne "mimosas" and a large menu of Egg breakfasts, omlettes, french toasts, and tons of other carnivous, herbavorious, and vegan options. Great for the diverse group of friends!

Came on a Sunday and there was a couple other groups in front of us--someone hunching near the door said they were me and took my table :( but the server was quick to fix that. There's actually 2 food sections and an outdoor section but they might've been short staffed because service was really slow (-1 star) and only half of the inside tables were full.

However, this is the next best thing for my friends and I at the moment so we'll be back for those bennies! Don't you dare leave us hanging!!!

excerpts: The bacon & homefries added nice crunch and flavor, while the toppings kept the scramble moist and gooood.
*drooooooooools
toppings.author: Marti L.
toppings.review:
Thanks to Yelp, new awesome brunch place!! From the pictures posted, I saw the long counter, the wooden booths, the decor in general. An old diner style differing from many brunch places here in the Mission. But what surprised me when I got there was the people! Instead of the moms&pops I was expecting, the place was filled with trendy down-to-earth workers. The atmosphere was hip and vibrant! Awesome!

Must try the Chef's Mess & the Nebulous Potato Thing! http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/XAiTKvUQe9ZV1LqCnV8YMQ/l The Chef's Mess is a scramble with homefries, bacon & mushrooms, topped with cheese, tomato & sour cream. It was sooooooo good! The bacon & homefries added nice crunch and flavor, while the toppings kept the scramble moist and gooood. *drooooooooools* The Nebulous Potato Thing is the hearty filling version with solely homefries, cheese, salsa & sourcream. Personally, not as satisfying, but nonetheless delicious!

There's always a wait for tables, but never too long. And service may get a bit slow. Can't blame them. They get swamped!! 

Fyi, the menu is very vegan and vegetarian friendly, also heart healthy (ie. egg whites option)

excerpts: I am in love with the plates of potatoes that come with guacamole, onions, tomatoes and a variety of other toppings.
Last Friday night, I came here on a "date" and sat at the counter.
My dining partner even ordered a milkshake!
It was a very sweet and 1950s kinda night and there are few things better than sitting at the counter holding hands with a super cute boy while a vegan burger is on its way!
toppings.author: Valerie L.
toppings.review:
St. Francis Fountain feels like a 1950s diner. Upon entering, you are transported to the past (for me it's Back to the Future!). Everything about this place is old school except for some of the food. Unbelievably, there are more than a dozen vegan options! Vegan breakfasts, burgers, and even desserts! 

I've been going to St. Francis at least twice a week for the last few weeks. My coach and gym-mates come here after our 8 AM workout. I am in love with the plates of potatoes that come with guacamole, onions, tomatoes and a variety of other toppings. Last Friday night, I came here on a "date" and sat at the counter. My dining partner even ordered a milkshake! It was a very sweet and 1950s kinda night and there are few things better than sitting at the counter holding hands with a super cute boy while a vegan burger is on its way!

excerpts: I ordered a hot fudge sundae
and it was hardly a sundae more of a hot fudge debacle.
It literally had 1 scoop of vanilla ice cream and was served in a thick glass cup that didn't proportionately do justice to the ice cream.
They serve Mitchell's ice cream which is aright but nothing special to me.
What made it worse was the price for this sundae was $6.00.
hot fudge sundae.author: James H.
hot fudge sundae.review:
I can see the appeal and old school, retro charm to this place being established in 1918. But my recent visit did not leave a smile on my face which is normal after visiting a ice cream establishment.

I ordered a hot fudge sundae and it was hardly a sundae more of a hot fudge debacle. It literally had 1 scoop of vanilla ice cream and was served in a thick glass cup that didn't proportionately do justice to the ice cream. They serve Mitchell's ice cream which is aright but nothing special to me. What made it worse was the price for this sundae was $6.00. I could have gotten just a scoop or two for that price else where. 

I like the feel of St Francis Fountain but not the ice cream. There is something about a place that makes there own ice cream compared to others that don't. But I can't complain, this place has been around for quite some time. My search continues for the third best ice cream spot in S.F. Stay tuned...

excerpts: GET THE HOT FUDGE SUNDAE.
The straws in the milkshakes?
Are made of stripey paper!
Not plastic!

(head explodes)
3.
The marshmallow sauce is also delicious.
The music's a little loud.
hot fudge sundae.author: Anne B.
hot fudge sundae.review:
Went here the other night with the husband and a friend, after catching Eddie Izzard at the (sweeeet!) Brava Theater. 

My husband, who evidently grew up at the St. Francis and has a really annoying photographic memory, says the prices have changed since the 1960's. This is the kind of detail that makes absolutely no difference when you're in a relationship with the hot fudge on the sundae in front of you.

Things to know about the St. Francis Fountain:

1. GET THE HOT FUDGE SUNDAE.
2. The straws in the milkshakes? Are made of stripey paper! Not plastic! (head explodes)
3. The marshmallow sauce is also delicious.
4. The music's a little loud. I think the staff keeps it like that to drown out the ecstatic moans of customers.

Finally, I am engaged to the hot fudge sauce at the St. Francis Fountain. We're thinking a June wedding. 

You can probably guess where we're registered.

excerpts: The things I've had that were ho hum (no bad, just meh), were the macaroni and cheese and the hot fudge sundae.
hot fudge sundae.author: Siobhán K C.
hot fudge sundae.review:
Knowing St. Francis Fountain exists makes battling life's vicissitudes more palatable. 

Ever since I was a kid, I have loved diners. My family is from NYC, but I grew up throughout the country. Wherever I lived I would seek out the best diner and call it my culinary home. In Boston, it was S&S in Inman Square. In NYC, it was too many to choose from (paradise!). In Santa Fe, it was the Plaza Cafe. 

So, when I moved to San Francisco last year and discovered I lived a block away from a diner people raved about, I got nervous. "What if it totally sucks? What if the place I like is miles away at the end of some trolley car, or whatever they drive here, line?" 

To be honest, my worries were not quelled when I saw the hipster crowds hanging outside. My experience is that the "scene" spots in life are not always the best eating. And why should they be? If a scene is what people want to pay for, give them the scene (and cut your expenses on those gourmet cheeses).  

By the time I had my first meal at St. Francis, a BLT and a cup of chicken soup, I was prepared for the worse.  But from the minute I stepped inside to my last slurp of chocolate milkshake, my fears were replaced by admiration for the quality, care and charm of this singular, homestyle, "write home about" worthy establishment. 
Here's why St. Francis excels, in particular: 

1. They have all the diner standards, but they use fresh ingredients and prepare the food with care. The flavors are clear, well balanced, and I find the dishes to be as rich, salty and cheesy as you want them to be, but they go easy on the grease. 
2. The staff is fresh, young and beautiful (ok, put up your hipster shields), but they are also sincere, kind and attentive (put your shields down). 
3. They don't rush you. If they are not busy you are free to leisurely finish your meandering conversation about the New Yorker article you and your friend both skimmed but have strong opinions about. 
4. Going alone feels great, even without a book. If you're a freelancer like me, this is a useful bonus. It's not Cheers where everyone comes rushing over and gives you a hug, but you will be looked in the eye, treated with respect and served amazing food. 

I wish I could recommend lots of menu items, but I'm now stuck in the most satisfying ordering rut, the veggie reuben with spinach salad and a chocolate milkshake. They also make great hamburgers.

The things I've had that were ho hum (no bad, just meh), were the macaroni and cheese and the hot fudge sundae. As in all kitchens, there are things that soar and things that just fly by. 

If you're looking for a place for reliable culinary comfort, this is your spot.

excerpts: So we get a hot fudge sundae.
It comes with 2 scoops vanilla and instead of the 1 scoop chocolate, we substitute for 1 scoop of coffee ice cream.
Thankfully I share this
and it's really delicious.
hot fudge sundae.author: Janet H.
hot fudge sundae.review:
Wandering around the Mission, we stumble into St. Francis Fountain for lunch.  I never knew this diner has been around since 1918, almost 100 years.  It looks a little beat from the outside, but the inside has a huge counter with small tables in the front and booths in the back.

Probably the thing that impressed me most about this place was the many options for food.  Not only do you get your diner style fare, but there are a lot of vegetarian/vegan options available.  This is what make St. Francis Fountain unique.  I order the vegan Reuben on rye which has spinach, mushrooms, vegan chorizo, onions and 1000 island dressing.  I opt out of the sauerkraut.  The sandwich was truly outstanding!  With it, I order a side of mac n cheese which is baked with a bread crumb topping.  Also delicious.

For dessert, we see they serve Mitchells Ice cream.  So we get a hot fudge sundae.  It comes with 2 scoops vanilla and instead of the 1 scoop chocolate, we substitute for 1 scoop of coffee ice cream.  Thankfully I share this and it's really delicious.  Takes me back to being a kid again.

Our waiter was friendly and super awesome.  Thank you very much St. Francis Fountain, you are really 6 stars for me!

excerpts: This is the place to swoon and make "googly-eyes" at each other while sharing a classic hot fudge sundae generously topped with whipped cream nuts and yes a cherry.
AND
They have an all soy shake.
AND
hot fudge sundae.author: Kia B.
hot fudge sundae.review:
Yummmy, yummmy.
Had a wholesome malt-shop date on friday night and I loved it.
This is the place to swoon and make "googly-eyes" at each other while sharing a classic hot fudge sundae generously topped with whipped cream nuts and yes a cherry. 
*AND* They have an all soy shake.
*AND* They serve a Guinness float.
I'm inspired to have a party here poodle-skirts and letterman jackets required. . .

excerpts: It's much more difficult living across the street from a place that will make me a chocolate malt or hot fudge sundae.
hot fudge sundae.author: Ben R.
hot fudge sundae.review:
When I lived at the corner of 24th and York Street a while back, a friend asked me, "Isn't it difficult to, you know, live across the street from a bar?"

I ignored the perceived weaknesses and implied behavioral downfalls. Giving this question much thought, I answered "I can go anywhere and get alcohol. It's much more difficult living across the street from a place that will make me a chocolate malt or hot fudge sundae."

I gained 15 pounds living in that house...

... But it wasn't ONLY because of the ice cream treats. It was the Reuben Sandwich, the decent burger, the GUINESS FLOATS, the breakfasts... The MAC N' CHEESE (best in the city?)... It could have been anything, but the Mitchell's ice cream concoctions certainly didn't hurt. I think I may have eaten several salads here, too, but those weren't immediately suspect in my impending poundage- delicious as I suspect them to have been.

Sitting at that counter on a Saturday morning may have encapsulated some of my favorite moments in this city.

The St. Francis is an old school Soda Fountain restored faithfully to retain its charm. The 'jerks' have been replaced with indie chicks serving the reasonably-priced diner fare, so if 'hipsters' make you feel uncomfortable or self-conscious, you may not enjoy this place AS MUCH.

Enjoy, but don't enjoy too often...

excerpts: I want a hot fudge sundae please, and someone to help me eat it after spending the day wandering all over the Mission.
I love the St. Francis,
though I haven't been in a while, it pleases me to know they're keeping it real.
Contextually, it's like a weird, icecream-and-candy-coated history lesson atop all the great and varied cultural stuff that is 24th street.
The non-ice creamy foodstuff is actually decent, diner fare too.
hot fudge sundae.author: Kamio N.
hot fudge sundae.review:
I want a hot fudge sundae please, and someone to help me eat it after spending the day wandering all over the Mission. I love the St. Francis, though I haven't been in a while, it pleases me to know they're keeping it real. Contextually, it's like a weird, icecream-and-candy-coated history lesson atop all the great and varied cultural stuff that is 24th street. The non-ice creamy foodstuff is actually decent, diner fare too. But I'm more apt to get some tacos and save the Fountain for dessert. 

Hrrr now I'm realizing I forgot to eat dinner, whoops. :D hungrrrry!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I had an amazing hot fudge sundae banana split.
I am almost salivating just thinking about it !
The only caveat was that the service was somewhat lacking; I don't know if it was just a poor staff to customer ratio, but, the service wasn't all that great, but, not terrible either.
I will definately give it another shot; the positives far outweigh the negatives.
**UPDATE
I went back this afternoon with my boyfriend and had absolutely TERRIFIC service.
Matt (look for him, great guy) was extremely attentive and didn't make me feel like a huge jerk when I accidentally spilled a glass of water all over the table.
AWESOME!
And my sundae was delish; you should totally go give this place a try.
hot fudge sundae.author: Jessica R.
hot fudge sundae.review:
I went here for dinner on a weekeday night with my friends and my boyfriend. It wasn't terribly crowded and it seemed pretty cool. We sit down and order up what turns out to be amazing grub. (Get the potato salad instead of fries, for the love of all which is holy!) My boyfriend and I had an amazing hot fudge sundae banana split. I am almost salivating just thinking about it ! The only caveat was that the service was somewhat lacking; I don't know if it was just a poor staff to customer ratio, but, the service wasn't all that great, but, not terrible either. I will definately give it another shot; the positives far outweigh the negatives.
****UPDATE****
I went back this afternoon with my boyfriend and had absolutely TERRIFIC service. Matt (look for him, great guy) was extremely attentive and didn't make me feel like a huge jerk when I accidentally spilled a glass of water all over the table. AWESOME!  And my sundae was delish; you should totally go give this place a try.

excerpts: the hot fudge sundae no different than Baskin-Robbins.
The old St. Francisco would also make their own fudge and chocolate sauce.
The 'candy' portion of the place is a joke and I'm sure the chocolate sauce is Hershey's.
What a shame....
hot fudge sundae.author: David P.
hot fudge sundae.review: St. Francis Fountain USED to make its own ice cream but since they switched ownership, the ice cream is now Mitchell's, good but nothing special.   I went there yesterday and found the sandwich ordinary except way overpriced and the hot fudge sundae no different than Baskin-Robbins.  The old St. Francisco would also make their own fudge and chocolate sauce.  The 'candy' portion of the place is a joke and I'm sure the chocolate sauce is Hershey's.  What a shame....

excerpts: I recommend the "Dusty Road"
dusty road.author: Liz T.
dusty road.review:
It all depends on the waiters that serve you that make your experience more better~ The food is perfect almost every time I go there with a group of friends, I always love to have some dessert from here because their ice cream (Mitchell's-brand of ice cream) is always great to choose from. 
If you like coffee flavors... I recommend the "Dusty Road"
My personal Favorite is the "Buster Brown"!

excerpts: I ordered the Dusty Road and the 2 scoops of ice cream were the sizes of half a tablespoon and there was hardly any whipped cream or fudge on it.
For almost $7 --I expect to get my money's worth.
I guess because the economy is bad and food is so expensive that they are jacking up these prices and making the servings smaller
dusty road.author: alexandria s.
dusty road.review: I hate to have to give this 1 star, but the reason being is that the serving size of my ice cream was tiny and yet so expensive. I ordered the Dusty Road and the 2 scoops of ice cream were the sizes of half a tablespoon and there was hardly any whipped cream or fudge on it. For almost $7 --I expect to get my money's worth. I guess because the economy is bad and food is so expensive that they are jacking up these prices and making the servings smaller

excerpts: I've only tried the buster brown ($7.25), an ice cream sundae with warm fudge brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry sauce, whipped cream, and walnuts.
The portion size was generous, and it was rich, decadent, and delicious.
There's a cute little park across the street if you want to sit and eat outside.
buster brown.author: Elaine L.
buster brown.review: I've only tried the buster brown ($7.25), an ice cream sundae with warm fudge brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry sauce, whipped cream, and walnuts. The portion size was generous, and it was rich, decadent, and delicious. There's a cute little park across the street if you want to sit and eat outside.

excerpts: My personal Favorite is the "Buster Brown"!
buster brown.author: Liz T.
buster brown.review:
It all depends on the waiters that serve you that make your experience more better~ The food is perfect almost every time I go there with a group of friends, I always love to have some dessert from here because their ice cream (Mitchell's-brand of ice cream) is always great to choose from. 
If you like coffee flavors... I recommend the "Dusty Road"
My personal Favorite is the "Buster Brown"!

excerpts: The Buster Brown, warm brownie with ice cream, raspberry sauce, walnuts and whipped cream.
buster brown.author: Enzo L.
buster brown.review:
We love to swing by after Roosevelt Tamale Parlour for dessert.  The Buster Brown, warm brownie with ice cream, raspberry sauce, walnuts and whipped cream.  People are crazy about the tofu scrambles, and it's such a great neighborhood.

I'm a married gay man, so this dessert is what porn used to be to me.  Don't miss it.

excerpts: And the Buster Brown (brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry stuff, whipped cream, walnuts) was sinful but delicious.
buster brown.author: Lindsay D.
buster brown.review:
The veggie burger with cheese was very tasty.  The mac and cheese was good but too oniony for my liking.  And the Buster Brown (brownie, vanilla ice cream, raspberry stuff, whipped cream, walnuts) was sinful but delicious.  The place wasn't busy and the service was fast and friendly.

The cons:
* no lock on bathroom so my friend burst in on some poor kid on the john
* by other yelp reviews I thought I was in for a lot more vegetarian options but, unless you want breakfast (and what breakfast joint doesn't have tons of veggie options?), it's pretty slim pickins for veggies (boca/veggie burger, grilled chz, veggie reuben, veggie chili).

excerpts: We ordered the chilli cheese fries, a vanilla malt and n ice cream dish called the Battleship.
Everything tasted really good.
Although the chilli cheese fries were not spicy at all!
Nt my milkshake tasted really good.
It was creamy, thick n not hard to swallow.
Only bad thing service
it's a lilttle slow.
the battleship.author: Papi R.
the battleship.review: St. Francis Fountain is definitely a neighborhood classic. I cam here with my wife for some ice cream and a snack. We ordered the chilli cheese fries, a vanilla malt and n ice cream dish called the Battleship. Everything tasted really good. Although the chilli cheese fries were not spicy at all! Nt my milkshake tasted really good. It was creamy, thick n not hard to swallow. Only bad thing service it's a lilttle slow.

excerpts: My favorite is the Battleship ice cream.
the battleship.author: JR Kaz K.
the battleship.review:
Long wait but always worth it!!!  This is my favorite brunch joint in the city.   I love their fluffy delicious pancakes (buttermilk or chocolate chip) with a side of fresh fruit and scrambled eggs.    Or their super yummy spinach, jack cheese and mushroom omelet.   Seriously, I was not a fan of omelets but St. Francis has converted my taste buds.  

 I go there all the time with my fiance and we bring our friends.  St. Francis has never let us down.  Their service is great, the staff is very attentive and the general atmosphere is welcoming.   

Ooh, I almost forgot about the dessert.  If you have any room left (which is hard given the large servings) definitely try out their desserts.  My favorite is the Battleship ice cream.   =)

excerpts: We only ordered ice cream ---a Busta Brown and Hot Fudge Banana Split with the bananas on the side (yep...I'm allergic to bananas).
It was a pretty mixed crowd of young to old.
And GOSH darn it!
hot fudge banana split.author: Troy R.
hot fudge banana split.review:
I'm a huge diner/soda shop fan. Saw this place on Saturday when I went to Dynamo Donuts. Wanted ice cream yesterday so we thought we'd give them a try. 


Really cool retro 50's diner look with a very laid back vibe. Got good service by the laid back hipster staff. As soon as we walked in the door, we were acknowledged and pointed to a seat. 

We only ordered ice cream ---a Busta Brown and Hot Fudge Banana Split with the bananas on the side (yep...I'm allergic to bananas). It was a pretty mixed crowd of young to old. And GOSH darn it! If this crew doesn't make a yummy sundae. 

We saw other dishes they brought out which looked pretty good. Unfortunately we already had lunch so ice cream was all we had room for BUT I'm sure we'll be back to try some of their other diner fare.

excerpts: My mouth was watering for the ice cream treats to follow, but my hot fudge banana split did not have enough fudge, yo.
hot fudge banana split.author: Karen W.
hot fudge banana split.review:
S'alright.  I had very high hopes for this place because it's so cute and I just love me some All American Fountain Food, but it fell short.  Very short.

I do have to say the macaroni and cheese was very good, but the sandwiches we tasted were just OK.  My mouth was watering for the ice cream treats to follow, but my hot fudge banana split did not have enough fudge, yo. My dining companion had selected the brownie sundae, but dang- that brownie was hard.

I'm going to stick to Swenson's in SF, and when I'm away from home I'll always be true to Vic's ice cream in Sac-o-Tomatoes; it's truly the best fountain I've found.

excerpts: I really loved The fresh flakes of coconut in my coconut ice cream, and it worked perfectly with The hot fudge and walnuts in my brownie sundae.
coconut.author: Nicole M.
coconut.review:
Stepping into The St. Francis Fountain is like taking a step back in time. The decor probably hasn't changed much in over 50 years. But, that's ok. It's a clean, cheerful space with a counter, glass serving bowls, padded bar stools and quaint wooden booths. It all the servers wern't cute hipsters, and Pat Benetar wasn't playing it would be easy to think the 50's were alive and well.

My friend and I went for The ice cream (courtesy of Mitchell's) and we amply rewarded. They have soy flavors available, but go for The dairy. I really loved The fresh flakes of coconut in my coconut ice cream, and it worked perfectly with The hot fudge and walnuts in my brownie sundae. Now That's The way to break a vegan fast!

Soda's, milkshakes, malts, sundaes, banana splits and egg cremes round out the menu. They have lots of regular menu options (including several vegan ones), but why waste time on those when you can go straight for a good dessert.

excerpts: I elected to go with the chocolate chip and it was very good for about $3 a scoop.
chocolate chip.author: Rod M.
chocolate chip.review:
This place was pretty busy during lunch time and I hopped in just to try some of the mitchell's ice cream. I elected to go with the chocolate chip and it was very good for about $3 a scoop.  

Old school diner feel and the service was very hospitable and took care of me fairly quickly even though I was there during a busy time.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 
I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings.

excerpts: They did mess up a couple of our orders and were a little slow to get them out, but we did end up with a free scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream!
chocolate chip.author: Ziyan C.
chocolate chip.review:
No wait for six of us around 1pm on a Saturday! At first we were split between a booth and a couple seats at the bar. After a few minutes, we were all able to sit together at the bar.

They did mess up a couple of our orders and were a little slow to get them out, but we did end up with a free scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream! You can also personalize whether you want ice cream or cream on top of your floats, and what topping to get on your banana split (caramel, chocolate, etc). 

The ice cream is not my favorite in the city, could be more creamy, but it's still good.

FOUNTAIN CLASSICS
* Dreamsicle (milk, oj, vanilla syrup, vanilla ice cream, orange sherbet, whipped cream, cherry. $5.75) - 4 stars
Tasty, thick, not too sweet! Like an orange soda with vanilla.

* Guiness Float ($7.25) - 4 stars
My boyfriend really liked this!

We also got a banana split in the group. This was a monster of a dish, delicious!

excerpts: Get some vegan chocolate chip or maybe vegan sausage patties up in here
and I'll be here every day.
My omni brother and his vegetarian friend also really enjoyed their dishes and we had a quick walk around Mission afterward to help us digest.
10/10 will go back soon with friends.
PANCAKES
chocolate chip.author: Danica N.
chocolate chip.review: Vegan service industry vet here. Quick, efficient, but still warm and friendly service! I love pancakes but it's so hard to find vegan ones! The strawberry ones were the bees knees. Get some vegan chocolate chip or maybe vegan sausage patties up in here and I'll be here every day. My omni brother and his vegetarian friend also really enjoyed their dishes and we had a quick walk around Mission afterward to help us digest. 10/10 will go back soon with friends. PANCAKES

excerpts:
Sweet:
2 chocolate chip pancakes ($6) -
Wow I never imagined having that many chocolate chips in each bite from a pancake...until I had the pancakes here.
Extremely chocolatey with abundant melted chocolate chips so it may not be for everyone
but I really enjoyed it since I loooove chocolate!
The pancakes were GIGANTIC
so it was an incredible deal.
Epitome of perfect pancakes...fluffy and sweet with a nice brown color.
Maple syrup not needed in this case unless you have a major sweet tooth!
chocolate chip.author: Karen Y.
chocolate chip.review:
This has got to be my new favorite brunch place by far! Apparently St. Francis has been around since 1918 and I only JUST found out about it?? This is preposterous! Better late than never I guess! =P It has an old diner feel that really takes you back in time. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=L1r-MnDtTjlARMkBtRruFw). I love the little candy stand as you walk in too! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=oITQEEiugUWwGgcQPI8s5A) There was a mannequin set up there but I wonder if we would have been able to purchase the candies. Definitely has a hipster crowd/vibe.

The wait took only about 30 min so the smaller the party, the better...my sister and I sat up at the counter space and saw that they made milkshakes, fountain drinks, and ice cream sundaes! Awesome! Our server was super busy so he didn't refill our waters until we asked but more importantly, our food came out hot and in a timely fashion. As usual, there was the dilemma of sweet or savory? We opted to share one of each so it worked out perfectly!

Savory:
3 egg white omelette with spinach, mushrooms, and jack cheese ($9.50 plus $1.50 to sub for egg whites) - $11 was worth all the food we got! The omelette tasted amazing...the spinach and mushrooms were on top of the eggs and the cheese was melted inside. A different approach but SO good! The home fries with a drizzle of tabasco sauce was heaven...thick crispy layer on the outside (the way I like it) and didn't need salt or pepper. And to top if off, the corn bread was TO DIE FOR! It was fresh and crumbly with a crunchy crust...not dry at all either. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=lJxtbZmSNZ_5NVLtOrFtdw)

Sweet:
2 chocolate chip pancakes ($6) - Wow I never imagined having that many chocolate chips in each bite from a pancake...until I had the pancakes here. Extremely chocolatey with abundant melted chocolate chips so it may not be for everyone but I really enjoyed it since I loooove chocolate! The pancakes were GIGANTIC so it was an incredible deal. Epitome of perfect pancakes...fluffy and sweet with a nice brown color. Maple syrup not needed in this case unless you have a major sweet tooth!
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Zx_VDLeaFdnMFkGyorDZtQ?select=qg70YmosCoEeBZ0QOC6qRA)

In conclusion, a very filling and delicious meal perfect for 2 people! Extra points for having tons of menu options that will keep me coming back for more. I recommend everyone go check it out!

excerpts: I have searched far and wide to find a place that sells my beloved chocolate chip ice cream only to discover it right under my nose at classic soda fountain, St Francis.
This seemingly ordinary flavor is surprisingly hard to come by these days, mark my words.
Modern ice cream has so many bells, whistles, and foofy ingredients and not many places stock the frozen perfection that consists of plain vanilla and chocolate chips.
chocolate chip.author: Christina S.
chocolate chip.review:
I have searched far and wide to find a place that sells my beloved chocolate chip ice cream only to discover it right under my nose at classic soda fountain, St Francis. This seemingly ordinary flavor is surprisingly hard to come by these days, mark my words. Modern ice cream has so many bells, whistles, and foofy ingredients and not many places stock the frozen perfection that consists of plain vanilla and chocolate chips. Get it in a milkshake and thank me later.

Other than shakes, brunch is the jam at St Francis. Their soyrizo is da bomb (the menu is very veg and veeg friendly... because we're in SF after all) and the huevos rancheros are nothing to sneeze at either. If you shake a stick at their burger, I'll shake one at YOU. 

In short: greasy spoon grub served up by good-looking hipsters.

excerpts: I went there last weekend, and had the eggs + vegan chorizo scram, and the chocolate chip pancakes.
Everything was fresh and delish!
The chocolate chip pancakes literally put a huge smile on my face-I couldn't even control it.
The place is affordable, the place is cool in an of itself--very old school diner, the food is yummy and it's in one of the coolest neighborhoods in all of SF!
chocolate chip.author: S A.
chocolate chip.review:
I freakin' love this place! 
All day breakfast! Can I say more! It is so hard to find a good place that serves brunch food past 2pm. And its GOOD!
I went there last weekend, and had the eggs + vegan chorizo scram, and the chocolate chip pancakes. Everything was fresh and delish! The chocolate chip pancakes literally put a huge smile on my face-I couldn't even control it. 
The place is affordable, the place is cool in an of itself--very old school diner, the food is yummy and it's in one of the coolest neighborhoods in all of SF!

excerpts:
Must try:

- Corned Beef Hash
- Hot Cakes (chocolate chip & blueberry)

Pros:

- Good service
- Clean

Cons:

- Tables are small
chocolate chip.author: Lisa S.
chocolate chip.review:
I usually don't have an appetite for breakfast/brunch, but since I was visiting SF my friend took me to this diner that's located around the corner from where she lives.

OMG! They're food is sooo good! I never thought breakfast/brunch could taste sooo good! I always thought: eggs are eggs and pancakes are pancakes. Nothing special. But I was wrong! If I lived in SF I would eat breakfast/brunch all the time!

Must try:
- Chef's Mess
- Corned Beef Hash
- Hot Cakes (chocolate chip & blueberry)

Pros:
- Good food!
- Good service
- Clean

Cons:
- Wait is usually long
- Tables are small

excerpts: The last time I went there was last Tuesday, March 1st, I ordered chocolate chip pancakes with blueberries on top.
Here is a picture of my blueberry chocolate chip pancakes.
You can see my friend's burger lurking in the background.

https://mail-attachment.googleusercontent.com/attachment/?ui=2&ik=26b4a113bf&view=att&th=135e6c8bfb50c243&attid=0.1&disp=inline&safe=1&zw&saduie=AG9B_P-oS00HGU7cP9pl2GgTjJpq&sadet=1331016865828&sads=WhKX9KhBxvmOkQrRoEJmNlWVKIo&sadssc=1
chocolate chip.author: Jessica C.
chocolate chip.review:
This restaurant is amazing. Each time I go, I fall more in love with this place. From the coffee, to the waitstaff, to the menu, the ambiance is very nice and settling. The menu offers vegan and vegetarian options as well as meat for the meat loving variety. The last time I went there was last Tuesday, March 1st, I ordered chocolate chip pancakes with blueberries on top. They have vegan pancakes as well. I had the vegan strawberry pancakes there before. The pancakes were hot and ready to be devoured. They tasted like victory. The two flavors, chocolate and blueberry were a great marriage of decadence. The addition of syrup wasn't extremely necessary, but if added, you'd get blasted with a hot and delicious bite of succulence.  Also on the menu are these "potato things" which look amazing, it comes with scrambled eggs and salsa which my sister got. She loved it. My two guy friends loved the burgers that they got and they said "good burgers are hard to find." I highly recommend this place to try. Here is a picture of my blueberry chocolate chip pancakes. You can see my friend's burger lurking in the background.

excerpts: I have tried the blueberry, banana walnut, and chocolate chip pancakes.
The chocolate chip pancakes were my favorite!
chocolate chip.author: Meg P.
chocolate chip.review:
Awesome selection of vegan brunch food!

I have tried the blueberry, banana walnut, and chocolate chip pancakes. The chocolate chip pancakes were my favorite!

The vegan huevos rancheros and the vegan chorizo dishes were also really good.

The service is also great!

excerpts: Their chocolate pancakes are incredible, like big fluffy chocolate chip cookies, and their hashbrowns are perfect - salty, with a little bit of spice.
St. Francisc Fountain is also pretty famed for their milkshakes.
I keep on meaning to try one, but never do....
next time, next time.
chocolate chip.author: Jessica T.
chocolate chip.review: One of the oldest diners in San Francisco, if not the oldest. The breakfast is really great here. Really great. At breakfast places I usually freak out and end up ordering WAY too much food - say two courses - and a side, and can never eat all of it. St Francis is one of those places, where even though there is an obscene amount of food in front of me, I can't help, but stuff it down. It's that good. Their chocolate pancakes are incredible, like big fluffy chocolate chip cookies, and their hashbrowns are perfect - salty, with a little bit of spice.  St. Francisc Fountain is also pretty famed for their milkshakes. I keep on meaning to try one, but never do....next time, next time.

excerpts: I found this place on Yelp while searching for chocolate chip pancakes--and it didn't disappoint!
The menu and atmosphere are similar to Boogaloos, but it's less overrun with hipsters (perhaps owing to its location on the eastern border of the Mission).
As a bonus, Justina was ecstatic to find some Dark Crystal trading cards at the vintage candy/tchotchke counter.
chocolate chip.author: Joe H.
chocolate chip.review: I found this place on Yelp while searching for chocolate chip pancakes--and it didn't disappoint!  The menu and atmosphere are similar to Boogaloos, but it's less overrun with hipsters (perhaps owing to its location on the eastern border of the Mission).  As a bonus, Justina was ecstatic to find some Dark Crystal trading cards at the vintage candy/tchotchke counter.  Oh, and you have to admire a menu that offers you "Nebulous Potato Thing" (their answer to Boogaloos' "Temple of Hash").  St. Francis Fountain is an instant addition to our short list of Sunday brunch haunts.

excerpts: I'll bring the husband for breakfast so he can enjoy the famed chocolate chip pancakes.
chocolate chip.author: Abby W.
chocolate chip.review:
3.5 stars after my first visit earlier today for lunch. The creamsicle ice cream soda is totally delicious and I love the fact that they have Boca burgers on the menu.  I haven't tried breakfast, but I'm sure I will soon.  I like the whole soda fountain thing and totally imagined myself 25 years ago sitting at the counter marvelling at all the shakes and sodas. Okay, who am I kidding? Even in my mid-thirties, I was marvelling!

I do agree with a couple of the previous reviews.  The attitude is a bit much, as is the tragically hip vibe. I've been over that for a LONG time and I'm waiting for the day when it becomes uncool. Normally, I don't really care (I mean, I LOVE Boogaloos), but it was kinda over the top.

All in all, a good place. I'll bring the husband for breakfast so he can enjoy the famed chocolate chip pancakes.

chocolate chip.author: kristin n.
chocolate chip.review:
Yummy mac & cheese, great/super friendly service, and freaking fantastic anything shake.

excerpts: Their seitan burgers and chocolate chip pancakes are awesome!
I haven't tried everything on the menu but the food is good and not too pricey.
Only thing I wasn't a fan of was no paper towels or toilet paper in the restroom.
chocolate chip.author: Christopher L.
chocolate chip.review: Always a must go place to go to whenever I'm in the mission. Their seitan burgers and chocolate chip pancakes are awesome! I haven't tried everything on the menu but the food is good and not too pricey. Only thing I wasn't a fan of was no paper towels or toilet paper in the restroom.

Or their super yummy spinach, jack cheese and mushroom omelet.

Long wait but always worth it!!!  This is my favorite brunch joint in the city.   I love their fluffy delicious pancakes (buttermilk or chocolate chip) with a side of fresh fruit and scrambled eggs.    Or their super yummy spinach, jack cheese and mushroom omelet.  I go there all the time with my fiance and we bring our friends.  St. Francis has never let us down.  Their service is great, the staff is very attentive and the general atmosphere is welcoming.

excerpts: I also saw the most adorable plate of pancakes for a little girl next to me, that one of the chefs made into the shape of a bunny with banana and chocolate chip eyes, and a strawberry nose.
chocolate chip.author: Best M.
chocolate chip.review: awesome milk shakes, super friendly staff, great music playing. A great little treat for a burger/shake stop in the middle of the heart of the 24th street taquerias. Its such a little out of the way treat, and SO NICE to be able to go and get ice cream, and sit down at the counter and be waited on, very old fashioned style.  Not like crowding into a too small icecream shope like bi-rite, which just ruins the experience.... this place is comfy and fun.  I also saw the most adorable plate of pancakes for a little girl next to me, that one of the chefs made into the shape of a bunny with banana and chocolate chip eyes, and a strawberry nose.

excerpts: For a decadent treat try the chocolate chip pancakes....
oh so good!
chocolate chip.author: Allison S.
chocolate chip.review: Best breakfast place in town, hands down. Reasonable prices, friendly staff, and a delicious menu with something for everyone (carnivore to vegan). The owner and staff pour their love into this place, and it shows. For a decadent treat try the chocolate chip pancakes....oh so good!

No wait for six of us around 1pm on a Saturday! At first we were split between a booth and a couple seats at the bar. After a few minutes, we were all able to sit together at the bar.

They did mess up a couple of our orders and were a little slow to get them out, but we did end up with a free scoop of mint chocolate chip ice cream! You can also personalize whether you want ice cream or cream on top of your floats, and what topping to get on your banana split (caramel, chocolate, etc).
